dico de omnibus aliis lineis ductis ab F ad aliquod punctum inter
TM.
nam potentia M e&longs;t ad potentiam I vt IF ad MF;

igitur poten­
tia X e&longs;t ad potentiam M vt MF ad XF; ad potentiam verò I vt IF
ad XF.

Quintò, cùm triangula IF M.HF 4. &longs;int proportionalia, potentia M
e&longs;t ad potentiam I vt HF ad 4. F.

Sextò, &longs;i applicetur potentia, vel in T pellendo per lineam TFE, quæ
cadit perpendiculariter in planum GD, vel &longs;i applicetur in A per lineam
AE trahendo, non poterit retineri globus, quæcunque tandem poten­
tia applicetur;

quia &longs;emper per GD globus rotari poterit nullo cor­
pore impediente;

&longs;uppono enim tùm planum tùm globum e&longs;&longs;e perfectè
politum, quod tamen nobis dee&longs;&longs;e certum e&longs;t ad experimentum, &longs;uppo­
no nullam e&longs;&longs;e partium compre&longs;&longs;ionem, qua vna pars in aliam qua&longs;i pe­
netret;
&longs;i enim totus locus datur ad de&longs;cen&longs;um;

certè non e&longs;t vlla ratio
propter quam non de&longs;cendat;

nec dicas affigi plano GD ab ip&longs;a vi ex­
teriùs affigente;

quia nullo modo impeditur motus, per datam lineam,
ni&longs;i vel aliquod corpus opponatur, vel alius impetus detrahat ab eadem
linea; atqui nihil horum prorsùs e&longs;t in hoc ca&longs;u.

Si potentia applicetur in N per lineam NF, maior e&longs;&longs;e debet quàm in
I, &longs;ed minor quàm in A;
e&longs;t autem ad potentiam in I vt IF ad NF;
quippe re&longs;i&longs;tit planum GD huic potentiæ in N, non tamen re&longs;i&longs;tit in I;

quia cùm pondus po&longs;&longs;it tantùm moueri per EG &longs;eu per
lineam FI potentia NF trahit per FN;

igitur potentia in N &longs;u&longs;tinens
pondus F e&longs;t ad potentiam in I &longs;u&longs;tinentem idem pondus, vt IF ad NF;
&longs;imiliter potentia in K &longs;u&longs;tinens idem pondus F e&longs;t ad potentiam in I vt
IF ad ZF, nam IZ e&longs;t perpendicularis in KF, donec tandem potentia
&longs;it in A applicata per AF in quam IF cadit perpendiculariter, igitur po­
tentia in A debet e&longs;&longs;e infinita.

Octauò, &longs;i pellatur pondus F per omnes lineas contentas &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um
inter FT & FA deor&longs;um faciliùs cadet;

&longs;i verò trahatur per lineas con­
tentas inter TF & FA dextror&longs;um, etiam deor&longs;um cadit;

& perinde e&longs;t &longs;iue pellatur per IF, &longs;iue trahatur
per FV; idem dictum &longs;it de omnibus aliis lineis, quæ per centrum F
hinc inde ducuntur.

Vnum e&longs;t, quod de&longs;iderari videtur ex quo reliqua ferè omnia depen­
dent, quomodo &longs;cilicet potentia in N trahens per FN &longs;it ad potentiam
in I trahentem per FI vt FI e&longs;t ad FN, quod &longs;ic breuiter demon&longs;tro:

&longs;it horizontalis BD, & triangulum ECD; ex centro D ducatur arcus
BE, qui &longs;it v.g. 30.grad.
vt CE &longs;it &longs;ubdupla ED;

certè potentia in B
e&longs;t ad potentiam in E per EC vt BD, vel ED ad CD;

&longs;ed potentia in E
per EA Tangentem e&longs;t æqualis potentiæ in B;

&longs;it autem planum EA, &
connectatur AC;
triangula AEC & ECD &longs;unt proportionalia;

igitur
&longs;it AC verticalis, EC horizontalis, & AE inclinata;

&longs;it potentia in A
per AE trahens pondus E;
&longs;it potentia C trahens per CE;
igitur vtrobique e&longs;t æquale impedimentum;

&longs;ed in
primo ca&longs;u ratione impedimenti ita &longs;e habet potentia in E per EA ad
potentiam in E per EC, vt ED ad CD, vel vt EA ad EC; igitur in &longs;e­
cundo in quo e&longs;t idem impedimentum potentia in A per EA e&longs;t ad po­
tentiam in C per EC, vt ip&longs;a inclinata AE ad EC.

licèt phy&longs;ica fortè aliquid de&longs;iderare po&longs;&longs;it;
adde quod implicatior illa figura infinitis ferè contexta lineis, quam ha­
bet, equidem erudito Geometræ faciet &longs;atis, non tamen rudiori Tyroni,
qui vix in hoc labyrintho tutum &longs;e e&longs;&longs;e putabit.
Theorema 17.
Si globus incumbat plano inclinato rotatur nece&longs;&longs;ariò deor&longs;um;

&longs;it enim
globus F in plano ED;
ducatur FH perpendicularis deor&longs;um;

hæc e&longs;t
linea directionis centri grauitatis, vt con&longs;tat;

adde quod non e&longs;t in æquilibrio, vt patet, ratio autem
inæqualitatis e&longs;t vt GF ad FN, nec vlla e&longs;t difficultas; igitur duplici
qua&longs;i motu de&longs;cendet in prædicto plano ille globus, &longs;cilicet motu centri
propter inclinationem plani, & motu orbis, tùm quia non e&longs;t in æqui­
librio, tùm quia in linea directionis FH non &longs;u&longs;tinetur à plano.
Theorema 18.

&longs;it enim planum inclinatum BC, cui incubet cubus DL, cuius cen­
trum grauitatis &longs;it I;

ducatur RG perpendicularis deor&longs;um per cen­
trum grauitatis I cadit in punctum G intra ba&longs;im BG;

igitur non ro­
tabitur, &longs;ed repet;

Sit quoque parallelipedum EK, centrum grauitatis N, perpendicu­
laris ducta per centrum HNM cadit intra ba&longs;im;

igitur non rotabi­
tur, quia &longs;ubmoto plano BC non &longs;u&longs;tinetur quidem in M, &longs;ed minimè
inclinabitur dextror&longs;um; igitur non rotabitur.

ducatur L
perpendicularis, cadit in E extra ba&longs;im FD;

certè latus DN inclinabi­
tur deor&longs;um; igitur rotabitur, quia eodem modo &longs;e habet, quo &longs;e ha­
beret, &longs;i &longs;ubmoto plano &longs;u&longs;tineretur in linea DX, &longs;ed trapezus DX
PN triangulo FXD præponderat per regulas libræ, de quibus &longs;uo
loco.

Ob&longs;eruabis autem primò &longs;ciri po&longs;&longs;e data plani inclinatione & ba&longs;i
parallelipedi maximam illius altitudinem, qua po&longs;ita non rotetur;
&longs;ecus verò po&longs;ita quacunque alia maiore;

&longs;it enim planum AC, ba­
&longs;is parallelipedi FD;

erigantur FO, DN perpendiculares in
AC;
tùm erigatur perpendicularis DX parallela AB;

connectantur R
M: dico FX e&longs;&longs;e maximam altitudinem, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis.

Secundò, quotie&longs;cunque rectangulum, ita e&longs;t &longs;itum, vt eius
diagonalis &longs;it perpendicularis;
dico e&longs;&longs;e in perfecto æquilibrio;

&longs;it enim rectangulum BE, cuius diagonalis BE perpendicula­
riter cadit in horizontalem AC;
certè erit in æqualibrio;

&longs;it enim
diui&longs;um per lineam BE ita vt FH vel KI &longs;it libra quæ &longs;u&longs;tineatur in ful­
cro BG; &longs;itque totum pondus trianguli BED appen&longs;um brachio GH,
& aliud BET appen&longs;um brachio æquali GF, erit perfectum æquili­
brium per regulas libræ, &longs;ed duo triangula eodem modo &longs;e habent
conjuncta, quo &longs;e haberent &longs;eparata & appen&longs;a, vt patet.

Tertiò, omnia rectangula proportionalia in eodem æquilibrio rema­
nerent v.g. rectangulum BG cum rectangulo BE, idem dico de Rhom­
bo, Rhomboide, &c.
Quartò, inde etiam cogno&longs;citur in qua proportione minuatur pondus.

v. g. &longs;it enim cylindrus AE horizontalis, &longs;u&longs;tineaturque in A immo­
biliter, itemque in E;
certè qui &longs;u&longs;tinet in E æqualiter &longs;u&longs;tinet;

at verò
&longs;i attollatur in AD;

certè potentia quæ in D &longs;u&longs;tinet, e&longs;t ad potentiam
quæ &longs;u&longs;tinet in E, vt AF ad AE, quia pondus grauitaret in D & in E in
eadem ratione per Th. 16. &longs;ed potentia &longs;u&longs;tinens adæquat ponderis ra­
tionem, &longs;u&longs;tinens inquam, per DH;

nam reuerà &longs;u&longs;tinens per DF æqua­
lis e&longs;&longs;e debet potentiæ in E:

Quintò, hinc &longs;i duo ferant parallelipedum in &longs;itu inclinato v.g.vt AD,
ferunt inæqualiter, &longs;cilicet in ratione AD FA, itemque &longs;i ferant in &longs;itu
inclinato AP, vel AC, donec tandem AE attollatur in B, nihil amplius
&longs;u&longs;tinet potentia in B, & potentia in A totum &longs;u&longs;tinet.

Sextò, hinc cùm attollitur cylindrus continuò minùs &longs;entitur pondus
& faciliùs attollitur; &longs;ic qui attollunt pontes illos ver&longs;atiles, initio maxi­
mo ni&longs;u, & modico &longs;ub finem trahunt.

Septimò ob&longs;eruabis, &longs;i circa centrum immobile A attollatur cylindrus
AE fune BE, potentia po&longs;ita in B, vel fune EO, potentia po&longs;ita in O;

hæc deber e&longs;&longs;e minor quàm po&longs;ita in B, vt autem cogno&longs;catur propor­
tio, fiat angulus PAE æqualis angulo OEB;
ducatur PQ;

dico poten­
tiam in O e&longs;&longs;e ad potentiam B, vt AQ ad AP, quia &longs;i anguli OEB &
PAQ &longs;unt æquales etiam anguli APQ & AEB &longs;unt æquales; igitur
perinde e&longs;t &longs;iue trahatur PA circa A per lineam PQ, &longs;iue trahatur EA
circa A per lineam EB.
Idem dictum &longs;it de aliis lincis.
Octauò &longs;i attollendum &longs;it rectangulum non quidem circa axem;

&longs;ed
circa angulum immobilem, etiam decre&longs;cit proportio ponderis, &longs;it enim
v.g. quadratum ACFD, &longs;itque AD horizontalis, AI perpendicularis, duca­
tur diagonalis AF, attollatur circa punctum A, ita vt transferatur in AG,
ducatur GB perpendicularis:

dico potentiam in G e&longs;&longs;e ad potentiam in
in A, vt AB ad AD; quippe res eodem modo &longs;e habet, ac &longs;i AF a&longs;cenderet
per arcum FM, donec vbi AF traducta &longs;it in AM, tunc enim nulla erit
potentia in M propter æquilibrium.

Nonò, hinc initio decre&longs;cit in maiori proportione ratione præpon­
derantiæ;

quia po&longs;ita ba&longs;i KN, angulus KAN e&longs;t omnium maximus; at
verò decre&longs;cit in minori proportione initio ratione &longs;egmenti horizon­
talis AD, in quam cadit perpendicularis.

Decimò, &longs;i &longs;it rectangulum oblongum horizontale vt AE diffici­
liùs attolletur;

quia quadratum AF figuræ prioris debet tantùm attolli
per arcum FM, vt &longs;tatuatur in æquilibro;

at verò rectangulum AE fi­
guræ huius attolli debet per arcum EC longè maiorem;

igitur difficiliùs:
porrò potentia in D e&longs;t ad potentiam in F vt AG ad AF, vt con&longs;tat ex
dictis.

igitur minorem, igitur longè
faciliùs; porrò hæc omnia omnibus experimentis con&longs;entiunt, & ex
principiis facillimis demon&longs;trantur.

Hæc paulò fu&longs;iùs pro&longs;equutus &longs;um,
quia pertinent ad rationem plani inclinati.
Theorema 19.

In plano inclinato acceleratur motus in eadem proportione qua acceleratur
in perpendiculari;

&longs;it enim planum inclinatum AC, perpendicularis A
E, in qua primo tempore &longs;en&longs;ibili percurrat AD;
&longs;ecundò DE;

certè dato
etiam tempore licèt maiore percurret AB;

igitur alio æquali percurret
CB;
nam vt &longs;e habet AE ad AG;

ita &longs;e habet AD ad AB, & DE ad BC;
quæ omnia &longs;unt certa.
Theorema 20.
&longs;ed proportio velocitatis e&longs;t vt AC ad AE:

igitur
eò &longs;patium debet e&longs;&longs;e maius, quò motus erit tardior;

igitur debet percur­
ri AC in inclinata, & AE in perpendiculari, vt &longs;it æqualis velocitas;

&longs;it autem v.g. AC dupla AE, certè motus per AC e&longs;t &longs;ubduplus motus
pes AE;
ducatur EB perpendicularis, certè AB e&longs;t &longs;ubdupla AE;
igitur tempore æquali BC triplam AB;

&longs;ed tem­
poribus æqualibus acquiruntur æqualia velocitatis momenta;

igitur ve­
locitas in C e&longs;t dupla illius, quæ erat in B;

&longs;ed quæ e&longs;t in E e&longs;t dupla il­
lius, quæ e&longs;t in B; igitur quæ e&longs;t in E e&longs;t æqualis illi, quæ e&longs;t in C.

pauciores partes &longs;patij AE augent motum, &longs;ed plùs &longs;ingulæ, & plures
&longs;patij AC augent motum, &longs;ed minùs &longs;ingulæ;

&longs;ed cum &longs;int plures in ea­
dem proportione, in qua minùs augent; certè plures quarum &longs;ingulæ mi­
nùs augent, &longs;imul &longs;umptæ æqualiter augent, v.g. &longs;int AC 4. partes, & AE
2. &longs;ingulæ AE augeant motum vt 4. & &longs;ingulæ AC vt 2. quia in ca pro­
portione minùs augent in qua 2. &longs;unt ad 4. certè 2. &longs;imul &longs;umptæ augent
motum vt 8. & 4. &longs;imul &longs;umptæ etiam vt 8. quæ dicta &longs;unt in gratiam
Geometrarum, &longs;ed meliùs adhuc ex dictis patebit.
Theorema 21.

Hinc aqualis e&longs;&longs;et ictus ab eodem mobili po&longs;t motum per AE. AF. AC.
AG. quia e&longs;&longs;et acqui&longs;itus æqualis impetus; igitur e&longs;&longs;et æqualis ictus,
quod certè mirabile e&longs;t.
Theorema 22.

Hinc pote&longs;t determinari &longs;patij quæcunque petita proportio ad &longs;patium da­
tum;
v. g. &longs;it ictus inflictus à mobili decur&longs;a perpendiculari AE:

vis æ­
qualem ictum &longs;ed confecto &longs;patio duplo;

accipe AC duplam AE: vis æ­
qualem ictum &longs;ed confecto &longs;patio triplo, accipe AG triplam AE.
Theorema 23.

probatur, cùm enim
mobile in C & in E habeat æqualem impetum &longs;eu velocitatem per Th.
20. certè cùm motus in AC &longs;it &longs;ubduplus v.g. motus in AE, e&longs;t enim
vt AE ad AC per Th.6. igitur cum &longs;ubduplo motu æquali tempore ac­
quiritur &longs;ubduplus impetus;
igitur tempore duplo æqualis impetus;
adde quod &longs;i æqualis impetus e&longs;t in C & in E;

igitur æqua­
lis in D & in B, &longs;ed AB e&longs;t ad BC vt AD ad DE;

cùm enim motus &longs;it &longs;ubduplus, tarditas e&longs;t &longs;ub­
dupla;
&longs;ed motus per AC e&longs;t &longs;ubduplus;

igitur &longs;patium AB e&longs;t &longs;ubdu­
plum AE;

&longs;ed tempore æquali conficit BC triplum AB, igitur tota AC
e&longs;t dupla AE;
&longs;ed percurritur tempore duplo;

igitur tempora &longs;unt vt
longitudines planorum;
&longs;ed clariùs, & breuiùs illud demon&longs;tro;

&longs;i enim motus per AF e&longs;&longs;et ad motum per
AE vt AF ad AE, certè æquali tempore AF & AE percurrerentur;

igitur
qua proportione motus per AF e&longs;t minor, tempus e&longs;t maius;

tantundem
enim additur tempori, quantum detrahitur motui; igitur tempora &longs;unt
vt lineæ.

Hinc acquiritur velocitas æqualis, vt dictum e&longs;t Th. 20. quia
&longs;i tantùm addit tempus per AF &longs;upra tempus per AE, quantum addit
motus per AE &longs;upra motum per AF, haud dubiè e&longs;t æqualitas.
Theorema 24.

Hinc pote&longs;t determinari longitudo plani, quæ dato tempore percurratur, v.
g. perpendicularis 3. pedum percurritur 30‴.

igitur &longs;i a&longs;&longs;umas planum
inclinatum 6. pedum, percurretur 1″.
&longs;i 12. 2′.
&longs;i 24. 4″.

atque ita dein­
ceps;

hinc po&longs;&longs;et dari planum inclinatum quod tantùm 100. annis per­
curretur, &longs;cilicet &longs;i longitudo plani a&longs;&longs;umpti &longs;it æque multiplex longitu­
dinis 12. pedum atque 100. anni vnius &longs;ecundi; quod facilè e&longs;t, imò da­
to plano cuiu&longs;cunque longitudinis, pote&longs;t dari tempus quodcunque quo
percurratur, de quo infrà.
Theorema 25.

Determinari pote&longs;t quantum &longs;patium conficiat mobile in plano inclinato;
dum conficit perpendicularem;
&longs;it enim perpendiculum AE, inclinata AC;
ducatus, EB perpendicularis in AC;

dico quod eodem tempore percur­
ret AE & AB, quod demon&longs;tro;

quia triangula EAB, EAC &longs;unt pro­
portionalia:
igitur AB e&longs;t ad AE vt AE ad AC;

igitur motus in AB
e&longs;t ad motum in DE vt AB ad AE;

igitur &longs;i tempora a&longs;&longs;umantur æqua­
lia &longs;patia erunt vt motus, vt patet, id e&longs;t motu &longs;ubduplo acquiritur &longs;pa­
tium &longs;ubduplum:

nec alia e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t regula tarditatis, igitur &longs;patia
erunt vt AB ad AE, id e&longs;t in ratione motuum;

licèt enim motus veloci­
tas cre&longs;cat, attamen &longs;i accipiatur velocitas compo&longs;ita ex &longs;ubdupla maxi­
mæ & minimæ, percurretur AE motu æquabili æquali tempore; &longs;ed
compo&longs;ita ex &longs;ubdupla maximæ & minimæ per AB habet eandem ra­
tionem ad priorem compo&longs;itam, quàm motus per AB ad motum per AE.
& hic quam habet AB ad AE.
Sed hæc &longs;unt clara.
Theorema 26.

Hinc æquali tempore de&longs;cendit per inclinatam BE, &longs;it enim inclinata
AG, perpendicularis AE; &longs;it quoque FC perpendicularis in AG, & FD,
in CF.

Dico quòd eo tempore, quo conficit CD perpendicularem
conficit CF inclinatam per Th.24. e&longs;t enim DF perpendicularis in IC.
&longs;icut FC in AG, &longs;ed CD e&longs;t æqualis AF, vt patet.
Theorema 27.

Hinc cognito &longs;patio quod percurritur in plano inclinato, cogno&longs;citur &longs;pa­
tium quod conficeretur tempore æquali in perpendiculari, &longs;it enim tempus
quo percurritur AC; ducatur ex C perpendicularis CF.

Dico confici AF
in perpendiculari eo tempore, quo percurritur AC:

vel &longs;it inclinata C
F, ducatur ex F perpendicularis FD; percurretur CD eo tempore, quo
percurritur CF, quæ probantur per Th.24.& 25.
Theorema 28.

Hinc per omnes chordas in&longs;criptas circulo ad alteram extremitatem,
diametri perpendicularis terminatas de&longs;cendit mobile æquali tempore;

a &longs;it
enim circulus centro B;
&longs;it diameter AE perpendicularis deor&longs;um;

du­
catur AC inclinata, tùm CE;

e&longs;t enim eadem omnibus ratio; hinc non pote&longs;t da­
ri planum tam paruæ longitudinis, quo non po&longs;&longs;it dari minus, quod dato
tempore percurratur.

Hæc e&longs;t illa propo&longs;itio toties à Galileo enuncia­
ta;

cum enim motus per BE &longs;it ad motum per GE vt GE ad BE, & tem­
pus per BE ad tempus per GE vt BE ad GE;

cumque &longs;it vt BE ad GE
rita GE ad AE;

certè motus per AE e&longs;t ad motum per GE vt AE ad G
E;

igitur tantùm addit AE &longs;upra GE ratione &longs;patij, quantum ratione
motus: igitur tempore æquali per AE. & GE fiet motus, idem dico de
aliis chordis.
Theorema 29.

Hinc datis duabus inclinatis æqualibus pote&longs;t determinari ratio tempo­
rum, in quibus percurruntur;

&longs;int enim AG.AH æquales, &longs;ed diuer&longs;æ incli­
nationis; haud dubiè cum æquali tempore AG. AF percurrantur per
Th. 27. tempora quibus percurruntur AGAH erunt vt tempora quibus
percurruntur AF AH, & hæc vt tempora quibus percurruntur AE. A
K, & hæc vt radices quadratæ illorum &longs;patiorum AE. AK, cum autem
&longs;patia &longs;int vt quadrata temporum, vel in duplicata ratione, &longs;i inter AE
& AK &longs;it media proportionalis AN. v. g. tempus quo percurretur AE
erit ad tempus, quo percurretur AK vt AE ad AN, vel AN ad AK.
Theorema 30.

Hinc cognito tempore quo percurritur data portio linea cogno&longs;ci potest
tempus, quo percurritur aliud &longs;patium vel alia portio, v. g. cogno&longs;co tem­
pus quo percurritur AK, & volo cogno&longs;cere tempus quo percurritur K
E, con&longs;equenti motu ex AK, &longs;cio tempus quo percurritur &longs;ola AE, quod
e&longs;t ad tempus quo percurritur AK vt AE ad AN per Th. 28. igitur
tempus quo percurritur KE con&longs;equenti motu ex AK e&longs;t ad tempus,
quo percurritur AK vt EN ad NA, vel vt NK, ad NA.
Theorema 30.

Hinc in planis inæqualibus tùm in longitudine, tùns in inclinatione,
pote&longs;t &longs;ciri ratio temporum, quibus percurruntur;

&longs;int enim AC AR duo pla­
na;
&longs;it autem AE perpendicularis indefinita;

diuidatur AC bifariam
in V ducta perpendiculari VB;

ex B fiat circulus, &longs;ecabit puncta
ACE;
&longs;ecat etiam AR;

in D igitur AC, & AD percurruntur æquali
tempore per Th. 27. &longs;imiliter fiat circulus ART eodem modos certè A
R & AT percurruntur æqualibus temporibus per Th. 27. igitur tempus,
quo per curritur AR, vel AD e&longs;t ad tempus, quo percurritur AR vt
tempus, quo percurritur AE ad tempus, quo percurritur AT;

&longs;ed hæc
&longs;unt vt radices AEAT, id e&longs;t tempus quo percurritur AE e&longs;t ad tem­
pus, quo percurritur AT, vt AE ad mediam proportionalem inter AE
AT, vel vt AD ad mediam proportionalem inter AD AR; quippe AD
e&longs;t ad AR vt AE ad AT.

Galileus verò demon&longs;trat rationem i&longs;torum temporum e&longs;&longs;e compo&longs;i­
tam ex ratione longitudinem planorum & ex ratione &longs;ubduplicata al­
titudinum eorumdem permutatim accepta: pro quo ob&longs;erua à Galileo
rationem duplicatam appellari duplam, & &longs;ubduplicatam appellari &longs;ub­
duplam.

Ob&longs;eruabis denique plurima ex his colligi po&longs;&longs;e præ&longs;ertim ex Th. 27.
quæ quia &longs;unt purè geometrica, certè phy&longs;ic&etail; minimè competunt; aliqua
tamen omittere non po&longs;&longs;um.

ducatur B
G indefinita perpendicularis in ba&longs;im AE;

tùm FA perpendicularis in
AB;
tùm FC perpendicularis in BE;
tùm denique GE in BE;

Secundò, &longs;i planum &longs;u&longs;tinens angulum rectum non &longs;it parallelum
horizonti 6. res &longs;imiliter determinari poterit;

&longs;it enim triangulum or­
thogonium ABC ex B, ducatur perpendicularis deor&longs;um indefinitè BF,
tùm EA in AB, tùm DC in CB, tùm EH parallela DC, tùm GC in A
C;

denique AG parallela BF; dico quod BABEHE AE percurren­
tur æqualibus temporibus item BCCDBD.

Tertiò, &longs;iue de&longs;cendat ex B in C per lineam perpendicularem BC,
&longs;iue ex A per inclinatam AC, eodem modo de&longs;cendet &longs;iue per CD, &longs;iue
per CE; ratio e&longs;t clara, quia acquirit æqualem velocitatem &longs;iue ex A &longs;i­
ue ex B de&longs;cendat pet Th. 20. erit autem tempus per CE ad tempus per
CD, vt CE ad CD per Th.23.& motus per CE ad motum per CD, vt
CD ad CE per Th.6. po&longs;ito initio motus in C.
&longs;i enim BC conficiet dato tempore;
igitur CF triplum CB conficiet tempore æquali;

&longs;it autem planum ho­
rizontale EDK ad quod ex C ducendum &longs;it planum inclinatum, quod
eodem tempore percurratur, quo CF, diuidatur CF bifariam in H, & ex
puncto H fiat arcus CK, ducaturque CK:

Dico CF & CK æquali tem­
pore confici per Th. 27. modò ex quiete C procedat motus:

&longs;imiliter a&longs;­
&longs;umi pote&longs;t alia horizontalis LM ducto arcu LF ex centro H;

nam CL
& CF æquali tempore percurruntur;

alioqui CE & CI eodem præuio motu &longs;uppo
&longs;ito æquali tempore percurrerentur, quod fal&longs;um e&longs;t;

nam &longs;it AC ad A
N vt AN ad AE;
&longs;itque BC ad BO vt BO ad BI;

certè tempus, quo
percurritur BC e&longs;t ad tempus, quo percurritur CI vt CB ad CO, &
tempus quo percurritur BC e&longs;t ad tempus quo percurritur CE vt BC ad
CN;

&longs;ed CN e&longs;t minor quàm CO, vt con&longs;tat ex Geometria, quod bre­
uiter in tironum gratiam in terminis rationabilibus o&longs;tendo, &longs;it planum
inclinatum AE 9. &longs;itque AE id e&longs;t 9. ad AD. 6. vt AD ad AC 4. ex
centro C a&longs;&longs;umpta CH 3. ducatur arcus HB & ex A ad prædictum ar­
cum Tangens AB, tùm ex BC G indefinitè & ex E, EG perpendicularis
in EA;
haud dubiè triangula CGE, CAB &longs;unt proportionalia;

igitur vt
CB;.ad CA. 4.ita CE 5. ad CG 6. 2/3;

igitur tota BG e&longs;t 9. 2/3; &longs;itque B
G ad BF, vt BF ad DC, quod vt fiat BG 9. 2/3 in BC 3. productum erit
29. igitur BF e&longs;t Rad.
quad.

29.igitur e&longs;t maior 5. &longs;ed &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et maior 5. C
M & CD e&longs;&longs;ent æquales;
igitur CF e&longs;t maior CD;

e&longs;t enim BF ferè 3.
1/2 paulò minùs:

haud
dubiè percurret CN æquali tempore, quo BC;

vt verò habeatur pun­
ctum in horizontali, &longs;it AF perpendicularis bifariam diui&longs;a in K, &longs;it K
F diui&longs;a in 4. partes æquales, quibus addatur FP 1/4 KFEK V dupla FA,
& producatur in X;
ita vt EX &longs;it 1/4 EK:

dico quod præuio motu ex A in
K, & deinde deflexo per KX conficietur KX æquali tempore cum AK;

igitur tertio tempore æquali KX 5/4 VK; nam eo­
dem modo &longs;e habet in k &longs;iue de&longs;cendat ex V, &longs;iue ex A per Th.20.
Porrò vt habeatur in horizontali FS;
&longs;it FR æqualis KF;

&longs;it FT æ­
qualis KR;
&longs;it arcus TS ex k:
Dico quod ks e&longs;t linea quæ&longs;ita;

nam &longs;i &longs;it
vt BS ad BZ, ita BZ ad BK, kz erit æqualis KF, vel AK;

&longs;ed tempus
quo percurritur AK e&longs;t ad tempus quo percurritur Dk vt BK ad AK
per Th.23.& ad tempus, quo percurritur BS, vt Bk ad BZ, & ad tem­
pus quo percurritur ks vt Bk ad kz; ergo Ak & ks percurruntur æ­
quali tempore, &longs;i kz &longs;it æqualis KF, quod &longs;ic breuiter demon&longs;tro, cùm
figura apud Galileum de&longs;ideretur.
&longs;int AFFE æquales;

&longs;it autem AG ad AH vt A
H ad AI:
Dico GH e&longs;&longs;e æqualem AF;

&longs;it enim quadratum HD mediæ
proportionalis:

Dico e&longs;&longs;e æquale rectangulo IC, dùm AC &longs;it æqualis A
G;

igitur quadratum PR cuius latus e&longs;t æquale FG, &longs;eu AE continet
duo quadrata RDSN;

ergo GH e&longs;t æqualis VN; igitur GH quod erat
demon&longs;trandum.

Quintò, hinc nunquam ks vel kx pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e tripla Ak donec tan­
dem perueniatur ad perpendiculum kH;

nam &longs;ecundo tempore percur­
ritur kH triplum Ak, &longs;i primo percurritur Ak;

nunquam etiam ks vel
vlla alia inclinata pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e dupla tantùm Ak;

igitur cum impetu acqui&longs;ito in de&longs;­
cen&longs;u AK, conficiet motu æquabili KY duplum AK per Th.42.l.3. po&longs;ito
quòd non de&longs;truatur; atque ex his &longs;atis facilè intelligentur, quæcumque
habes apud Galileum in dialog.3.à propo&longs;itione 3.ad 23.

Sextò non probat Galileus, &longs;ed tantùm &longs;upponit mobile ad eandem alti­
tudinem a&longs;cendere po&longs;&longs;e motu reflexo ex qua de&longs;cendit, quod examinabi­
mus lib. &longs;equenti, hinc non laborabimus in examinandis prop. 24.25.26.27.

Septimò, cognito tempore, quo percurrit mobile perpendiculum EC
quod &longs;it diameter circuli;

&longs;ciri pote&longs;t quo tempore percurrat duas chor­
das &longs;imul EGGC;

&longs;it enim Tangens EF, &longs;itque vt FG ad FD, ita FD ad
FC;

cum EG & EC de&longs;cendat æquali tempore per Th.27. cum in G &longs;it
idem motus, &longs;iue ex E, &longs;iue ex F de&longs;cendat per Th.20. certè &longs;i de&longs;cendit
per EG dato tempore, quod &longs;it vt EG, de&longs;cendit per GC tempore, quod
e&longs;t vt GD; igitur tempus, quo de&longs;cendit per EC e&longs;t ad tempus, quo de&longs;­
cendit per EGC, vt EG ad EGD.
Ob&longs;eruabis autem GF e&longs;&longs;e ad EF vt EF ad FC;

igitur FD e&longs;t media
inter FC GF, & e&longs;t æqualis FE, igitur anguli FDE.FED æquales;

&longs;ed FD
E e&longs;t æqualis duobus DCE.DEC, & FEG, e&longs;t æqualis DCE; igitur duo G
DE DEC &longs;unt æquales.

Octauò, &longs;i accipiantur æquales horizontalis, & perpendicularis, v.g.
BA AC, ducaturque BC:

&longs;it enim vt BC ad
BI ita BI ad BH, e&longs;t autem BI æqualis BA, igitur &longs;i BA, &longs;it 4.BC e&longs;t v.g.
32. & BH radix q.8.igitur HI e&longs;t ferè I paulò plùs; igitur cum BH percur­
ratur æquali tempore cum AC, e&longs;t tempus, quo percurritur BH ad tem­
pus quo percurritur HC vt BH ad HI.
Sit autem BR dupla AR, &longs;itque perpendicularis AK in BR;

certè KR
e&longs;t &longs;ubquadrupla BR;

igitur percurritur BL æqualis KR eo tempore quo
percurritur AR;
igitur BL &longs;it ad BV vt BV ad BR;

igitur temporibus æ­
qualibus percurruntur BL LR;

igitur &longs;i tempus quo percurritur BL &longs;it vt
BH, tempus quo percurretur LR erit etiam vt BH;

igitur BC breuiori tempore per­
curritur quàm BR; &longs;it etiam vt BP ad BX ita BX ad BM, &longs;i BO e&longs;t 4. OP 2.
certè BP e&longs;t rad.q.

12.id e&longs;t ferè 3.1/2 paulò minùs, BM verò e&longs;t dupla BA
vel BO;

igitur e&longs;t 8. ducatur ergo 8. in 4. 1/3 productum erit 28. cuius radix
e&longs;t ferè 5.1/3 paulò minùs;
igitur BX e&longs;t 5.1/3 paulò minùs;

cum autem BH
&longs;it 2.q.8.e&longs;t ferè 2.5/6, paulò minùs;

igitur &longs;it vt BP 3.1/2 ad BX 5.1/3, ita BH
2.5/6 ad aliam;
certè erit 144. id e&longs;t 4.(26/63), licèt minùs acceptum &longs;it;

igitur
126.e&longs;t maior BI, quæ e&longs;t tantùm 4; igitur BE breuiori tempore percur­
ritur, quàm BM.

Nonò, per duas chordas quadrantis de&longs;cendit breuiori tempore mo­
bile, quàm per alteram tantùm inferiorem &longs;cilicet &longs;it enim tantùm
quadrans ABG in quo &longs;int duæ chordæ GC, CB:

Dico quòd per vtram­
que ex G breuiori tempore de&longs;cendit, quàm per inferiorem CB;

&longs;it enim GD perpendicularis
parallela AB;

&longs;it ED perpendicularis in CG, & per 3. puncta GCD
ducatur circulus:

his po&longs;itis, GH & GC eodem tempore percurrentur,
& in C idem erit motus, &longs;iue ex G per GE, &longs;iue ex E per EC de&longs;cen­
dat mobile per Th.27.& 20. &longs;it autem EB ad EK vt EK ad EC, &longs;itque
BE v.g, dupla BE vel BA:
dico EK e&longs;&longs;e æqualem BG;

e&longs;t autem BH
maior BC vel AB, vel HG minor CK;

&longs;it etiam GH ad GI, ita GI
ad GB:

dico tempus, quo de&longs;cendit per GCB e&longs;&longs;e ad tempus quo de­
&longs;cendit per GB vt GCK ad compo&longs;itam ex GC, HI;

&longs;ed hæc e&longs;t ma­
ior illa, vt patet ex Geometria, & analytica;

igitur breuiori tempore de­
&longs;cendit per GCB, quàm per GB; &longs;ed de hoc aliàs.
Sit enim EB 8. dupla &longs;cilicet AB;

&longs;it autem EE &longs;ubdupla EB ad
EK vt EK ad EB;

a&longs;&longs;umatur GE, &longs;itque tempus, quo continetur GC.
vt GC, & quo conficitur BC vt CK;

igitur quo conficitur GCB vt
GCK:

&longs;imiliter &longs;it &longs;ecunda linea GB, &longs;itque tempus, quo percurritur
GH vt GC, vel NO æqualis GC, &longs;itque vt GH ad GN, ita GN ad
GB certè &longs;i GH decurratur tempore GH, AB decurretur tempore
HN;
&longs;ed HN maior e&longs;t MB, vel CG, vt con&longs;tat ex analytica;

adde quod
in figura prima &longs;it GI ad GM vt GM ad GB;

certè &longs;i tempore GI
percurratur GI, percurretur GB tempore GM;

e&longs;t autem GM æqua­
lis AB, vel EC;

&longs;imiliter &longs;it EC ad EK vt EK ad EB, &longs;i percurratur
EC tempore EC, percurretur EB tempore EK;

&longs;ed GC percurretur
tempore GC &longs;ed GCK minor e&longs;t GIM;

&longs;it enim GM. 4. EK R. que
32. id e&longs;t, 5 7/8 paulò minùs, quibus &longs;i &longs;ubtrahas CE 4. & &longs;ub&longs;tituas CG
2. paulò plùs habebis 3 7/8; igitur GCK minor e&longs;t GIM.

in quo ta­
men opere duo de&longs;iderari videntur, alterum à Philo&longs;ophis, quod ita phy&longs;i­
cæ partes omnes neglexerit, vt ferè vni Geometriæ &longs;atisfaceret; alterum
ab Geometris quod Geometriam equidem accuratè tractarit.

Sed minùs
ad captum Tyronum: atque hæc de his &longs;int &longs;atis, vt tandem no&longs;trorum
Theorematum &longs;eriem interruptam repetamus.
Theorema 31.

Ex dictis &longs;equitur pondus centum librarum po&longs;&longs;e habere tantùm grauitatio­
nem vnius libræ;

&longs;it enim planum inclinatum centuplum horizontalis, id
e&longs;t, &longs;ecans centupla Tangentis; haud dubiè grauitatio in prædictum pla­
num erit tantùm &longs;ubcentupla per Th.16.
Theorema 32.

Ex duobus ferentibus idem parallelipedum in &longs;itu inclinato pote&longs;t alter fer­
re tantùm vnam libram, licèt pendat centum libras;

&longs;it enim ita inclina-
tum, vt linea inclinationis &longs;it centupla horizontalis oppo&longs;itæ; certè qui
&longs;u&longs;tinet in altera extremitate eleuata (1/100) tantùm &longs;u&longs;tinet ponderis par­
tem per Th. 18. alius verò &longs;u&longs;tinet in altera extremitate, quæ deor&longs;um
e&longs;t (93/100).
Theorema 33.

Qui pote&longs;t tantùm datum pondus &longs;ur&longs;um attollere per lineam verticalem,
centuplum per inclinatum planum ad eandem altitudinem attollet;

&longs;i enim &longs;it
inclinata ad perpendiculum in ratione centupla; haud dubiè qui attollit
datum pondus per ip&longs;um perpendiculum &longs;ine viribus auctis per inclina­
tum planum, pondus centuplò maius attollet, quia potentia per inclina­
tam e&longs;t ad potentiam per ip&longs;um perpendiculum vel altitudo ad inclina­
tam per Theor. 6. igitur &longs;i æqualis vtrobique applicetur potentia, pon­
dus centuplò maius attollet per inclinatam, &longs;eu pellendo, &longs;eu tra­
hendo.
Theorema 34.

Hinc ratio plani inclinati demon&longs;trat cochleæ vires. v.g. pellitur &longs;ur&longs;um
per DE inclinatam faciliùs quàm verticalem DH in ratione DE ad
DH, quæ &longs;i e&longs;t tripla, eadem potentia quæ datum pondus attollit per
DH, triplò maius attollet per DE, vel &longs;i attollat per DA verticalem,
triplò maius attollet per &longs;piras vel Helices DE EC, CF, &c.

v&longs;que ad
A; hinc quò Helix erit inclinatior, potentia maius pondus illius operâ
attollet.
Theorema 35.

quia &longs;patium DE e&longs;t triplum DH; igitur motus triplus, &longs;cilicet in
duratione, (loquor enim de motu æquabili quo &longs;ur&longs;um corpus, vel tra­
hitur, vel continuò pellitur.)
Theorema 36.

Hinc nullus mons e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t quantumuis arduus, ad cuius apicem via faci­
li in modum cochleæ &longs;trata pertingi non po&longs;&longs;it; & quò plures erunt &longs;piræ, eo
facilior erit & minùs decliuis via.
Theorema 37.

Quando de&longs;cendit mobile per multas &longs;piras, &longs;eu volutas, pote&longs;t determinari
altitudo perpendicularis, ex qua eodem tempore de&longs;cenderet;

&longs;it enim &longs;pira
&longs;eu cochlea AFCHD, & perpendiculum AD;

certè eodem tempore
de&longs;cendit per AFC, quo de&longs;cenderet per AG duplam AF;
&longs;it autem dupla:

&longs;imiliter eodem tempore conficit
AFG vel AFG, quo conficit AE duplam AG; denique eo tempore,
quo conficit AF CHD, vel AGD, conficit duplam AE.

Sic etiam eo tempore, quo in perpendiculo conficit AD conficit &longs;ub­
duplam &longs;cilicet AF, &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt clara.
Theorema 38.

Quando proiicitur mobile per planum inclinatum &longs;ur&longs;um in ea proportione
proiicitur longiùs, quò inclinata ip&longs;a longior e&longs;t perpendiculari. v.g. &longs;i proii­
citur per BA in verticali, illa eadem potentia quæ proiicit in A ex B, pro­
iiciet quoque ex F in A, ex M in A, atque ita deinceps ex &longs;ingulis punctis
horizontalis BM;

ratio e&longs;t, quia in ea proportione de&longs;truitur impetus
per BA, in qua motus per AB de&longs;cendit;

nam impetus innatus deor­
&longs;um qua&longs;i trahit mobile graue;
impetus verò impre&longs;&longs;us &longs;ur&longs;um attollit;
igitur pugnant pro rata, vt &longs;æpè diximus in tertio libro, & alibi:

igitur re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia per BA erit dupla re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ per FA;

igitur &longs;patium per FA
erit duplum;

igitur ex F a&longs;cendet in A, quo cum eo impetu ex B a&longs;cendet
in A, &longs;uppo&longs;ita eadem potentia;

idem etiam dicendum de aliis punctis
horizontalis BM:

præterea ille impetus &longs;ufficit ad motum &longs;ur&longs;um per
FA, qui accipitur in de&longs;cen&longs;u AF, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis;

itemque &longs;ufficit
ad motum &longs;ur&longs;um per BA qui acquiritur in de&longs;cen&longs;u AB; &longs;ed æqualis ve­
locitas, vel impetus acquiritur in vtroque de&longs;cen&longs;u AB AF per Th. 20.
igitur idem impetus &longs;ufficit ad de&longs;cen&longs;um BA FA.
Theorema 39.

Hinc dicendum e&longs;t impetum naturalem per inclinatam FA vel MA non
&longs;ur&longs;um intendi, &longs;eu cre&longs;cere;

alioqui ex A mobile de&longs;cenderet citiùs in F,
po&longs;tquàm ex F proiectum e&longs;&longs;et in A, quàm &longs;i tantùm ex A in F demit­
teretur, quod e&longs;t contra experientiam; adde quòd impetus naturalis &longs;ur­
&longs;um non cre&longs;cit, vt iam &longs;æpè dictum e&longs;t.
Theorema 40.

Destruitur aliquid impetus impre&longs;&longs;i in mobili per planum inclinatum.
Probatur, quia tandem quie&longs;cit mobile;
igitur ce&longs;&longs;at motus;

igitur & im­
petus:
nec dicas id fieri ab aëre, vel plani &longs;cabritie;

nam, &longs;i hoc e&longs;&longs;et,
æquale &longs;patium conficeret in FA & LA;

quippe æqualis portio plani
æqualiter re&longs;i&longs;tit; Idem dico de aëre; igitur de&longs;truitur impetus impre&longs;­
&longs;us ab impetu naturali.
Theorema 41.

Destruitur tantùm pro rata, hoc e&longs;t in ratione, quam habet perpendiculum
ad inclinatam. v.g. &longs;it perpendiculum FCA;

igitur eo
tempore de&longs;truitur totus impetus;
&longs;i verò proiiciatur per LC;

certè im­
petus totus non de&longs;truitur per LC, eo tempore, quo ex F a&longs;cenderet in
C, &longs;ed pro rata, id e&longs;t in ratione FC ad LC, quæ &longs;it &longs;ubdupla v.g. igitur
impetus de&longs;truitur tantùm &longs;ubduplus;

igitur eo tempore, quo ex F a&longs;cen­
dit in C, ex L a&longs;cendet in K, ita vt LM æquali FC addatur MK æqua­
lis EB; e&longs;t autem EB &longs;ubdupla CA vel EF.

Similiter &longs;it perpendicu­
lum FG, & inclinata HF tripla FG;

a&longs;&longs;umatur FC æqualis FG, item­
que HO æqualis GF;

certè eo tempore, quo perpendiculari detrahitur
totus impetus, detrahitur tantùm &longs;ubtriplum per inclinatam HF;

igitur
a&longs;&longs;umatur ER &longs;ubtripla EF;
& addatur OP æqualis FR:

dico quod eo
tempore, quo ex G a&longs;cendit in F, ex H a&longs;cendit in P;

quippe a&longs;cenderet
in O, &longs;i eo tempore totus impetus de&longs;trueretur, & in S &longs;i nullus;

atqui de­
&longs;truitur tantùm ab impetu innato, quæ omnia certi&longs;&longs;imè con&longs;tant; Ex
quo habes tempora e&longs;&longs;e vt lineas.
Theorema 42.

igitur mobile proiectum ex
L in C percurrit LC eodem tempore a&longs;cendendo, quo percurrit EL de­
&longs;cendendo; &longs;ed percurrit EL de&longs;cendendo eodem tempore, quo percur­
rit perpendicularem quadruplam CF, vt &longs;uprà diximus.
Theorema 43.

Hinc nunquam in inclinata &longs;ur&longs;um proiectum mobile acquirit duplum &longs;pa­
tium illius quod acquirit idem proiectum in verticali &longs;ur&longs;um, v. g. ex H pro­
iectum nunquam acquiret in HF duplum &longs;patium GF, po&longs;ito quòd ex
G proiiciatur tantùm in F dato tempore, &longs;itque eadem potentia per HF.
Probatur, quia &longs;emper de&longs;truitur aliquid impetus iuxta proportionem
FG ad FH per Th.40. &longs;ed &longs;i nullus de&longs;truitur impetus, duplum &longs;patium
conficit;

igitur &longs;i aliquid de&longs;truitur, duplum &longs;patium non conficitur: po­
te&longs;t tamen propiùs in infinitum ad duplum accedere.
Theorema 44.

Hinc erecta perpendiculari FC, ductaque horizontali FL, productaque
in infinitum, &longs;i ex quolibet illius puncto eleuetur planum inclinatum termina­
tum ad C, eadem potentia que ex F in C mobile proiiciet, etiam ex quolibet
puncto de&longs;ignato in horizontali proiiciet in C per planum inclinatum; quod
probatur per Th. 38.
Theorema 45.

Ex his etiam probatur proiici ex L in C ab ea potentia, quæ ex F proiicit in
C;

cum enim primo tempore proiiciat ex L in K (&longs;uppono enim LC
e&longs;&longs;e quadruplam KC) certè &longs;ecundo conficit tantùm KC;

e&longs;t enim mo­
tus violentus &longs;ur&longs;um retardatus inuer&longs;us motus deor&longs;um accelerati;

at-
qui motu naturaliter accelerato &longs;i primo tempore conficit KC, &longs;ecun­
do conficit KL triplum CK; igitur &longs;i motu retardato primo tempore
conficit LK, &longs;ecundo conficit KC &longs;ubtriplum LK.
Theorema 46.
Si proiiciatur in horizontali motus per &longs;e e&longs;t æqualis in &longs;patio modico:

Pro­
batur, quia in nulla proportione de&longs;truitur, vt patet;

dixi per &longs;e, quia re­
uera nullum e&longs;t planum perfectè l&etail;uigatum, nec etiam mobile:

vnde cum
a&longs;peritas plani re&longs;i&longs;tat, inde maximè motus retardatur; dixi in &longs;patio
modico, nam planum horizontale rectilineum longius, e&longs;t planum incli­
natum, de quo infrà, vnde vt motus &longs;it æqualis, debet proiici in &longs;uperfi­
cie curua æqualiter di&longs;tante à centro mundi.
Theorema 47.

haud dubiè primo tempore
ratione vtriu&longs;que impetus percurrit AC, &longs;cilicet, duo &longs;patia;

&longs;ecundo
CD, id e&longs;t 4. &longs;patia;

tertio DE, id e&longs;t 6. &longs;patia; atque ita deinceps: vn­
de vides proportionem arithmeticam, quæ na&longs;citur ex acce&longs;&longs;ione quan­
tumuis modica noui impetus.
Theorema 48.

In plano inclinato non de&longs;truitur impetus impre&longs;&longs;us, quia non e&longs;t frustrà;
igitur non de&longs;truitur per Sch. Th.152.lib.1. &longs;ic diximus in Theoremate
68. l.4. in proiecto deor&longs;um per lineam perpendicularem deor&longs;um non
de&longs;trui quidquam impetus impre&longs;&longs;i, licèt de&longs;truatur in proiecto per in­
clinatam deor&longs;um in libero medio, vt diximus in Th.67. lib.4. vide Th.
68.lib.4.
Theorema 49.

Pote&longs;t determinari quantus impetus imprimi debeat mobili per planum in­
clinatum, vt æquali velocitate moueatur quo mouetur in perpendiculari &longs;uæ
&longs;ponte, hoc e&longs;t vt æquali tempore æquale &longs;patium vtrimque acquiratur,
a&longs;&longs;umpto &longs;cilicet &longs;patio totali, quod toti motui competit, non verò eius
tantùm parte; debet enim a&longs;&longs;umi impetus iuxta proportionem differen­
tiæ &longs;patij, quod acquiritur in perpendiculari, & alterius &longs;patij, quod ac­
quiritur in perpendiculari, & alterius &longs;patij, quod acquiritur in inclina­
ta.
v.g. &longs;it planum inclinatum AH, perpendiculum verò AE;
a&longs;&longs;umatur AC æqualis AE;
&longs;i imprimatur impetus, qui &longs;it ad acqui&longs;itum in &longs;patio AB vt BC ad AB:
dico quod mobile eodem tempore percurret AE, & AC, vt con&longs;tat;
quia impetus in C e&longs;t æqualis impetui in E;

vt verò percurrat in incli­
nata AH æquale &longs;patium AG, æquali tempore, quo percurrit AG;

a&longs;-
&longs;umatur AF æqualis AH, addaturque impetus, qui &longs;it ad acqui&longs;itum in
H, vt GF ad FA, vel AH, & habebitur intentum:

dixi totum &longs;patium re­
&longs;pondens &longs;cilicet toti motui;

alioqui &longs;i pars tantùm accipiatur tùm &longs;pa­
tij, tùm motus, res procul dubio &longs;ecus accidet; &longs;it enim impetus impre&longs;­
&longs;us vt BC ad AB.

Equidem primò tempore, quo in perpendiculari con­
citur AE, conficitur AC æqualis;
igitur non &longs;unt æqualia &longs;patia; &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt &longs;atis facilia.
Theorema 50.

Si planum horizontale &longs;it perfectè læuigatum in vne tantùm illius puncto &longs;i­
&longs;tere pote&longs;t mobile graue;

&longs;it enim globus terræ centro A &longs;emidiametro
AE;

&longs;itque planum horizontale FEGN læuigati&longs;&longs;imum: dico quòd in
puncto contactus E quie&longs;cet mobile.

Probatur, quia ex omni alio puncto
mobile pote&longs;t de&longs;cendere;

&longs;it enim in G. v.g. haud dubiè GA maior e&longs;t
AE;

igitur GE planum e&longs;t inclinatum, id e&longs;t, E propiùs accedet ad cen­
trum terræ A; &longs;ed per planum inclinatum mobile de&longs;cendit per hyp.

1.
idem dico de omni alio plani puncto, excepto puncto E, ex quo non
pote&longs;t moueri, ni&longs;i a&longs;cendat, id e&longs;t à centro A recedat; igitur in eo
quie&longs;cet.
Theorema 51.

Hinc in men&longs;a lauigati&longs;&longs;ima globus vel eburneus, vel cry&longs;tallinus vix vn­
quam &longs;istit, ni&longs;i in eius centro, quod multis experimentis comprobatum
e&longs;t, & ratio luce meridianâ clarior à rudioribus etiam primo &longs;tatim ob­
tutu cernitur.
Theorema 52.
&longs;i enim alter ex G in E;
alter verò ex E in F tenderet;

hic
certè a&longs;cenderet, quia recederet à terræ centro A;

ille verò de&longs;cende­
ret, quia ad centrum accederet; & &longs;i in partes oppo&longs;itas ambulent, in
hoc eodem plano vterque &longs;imul a&longs;cendere, vel &longs;imul de&longs;cendere pote&longs;t.
Theorema 53.

E&longs;t etiam aliud paradoxon, &longs;cilicet in eodem puncto E duo plana eadem li­
neâ contenta hinc inde a&longs;cendere;

vel duos montes alti&longs;&longs;imos in eadem recta
linea contineri;

vel mediam vallem, & gemines montes linea recti&longs;&longs;ima &longs;imul
connecti; hæc porrò &longs;unt &longs;atis facilia, & vix &longs;upra vulgi captum.
Theorema 54.

Adde aliud paradoxon &longs;cilicet idem mobile per duo plana parallela inæ­
quali motu de&longs;cendere. v.g. per plana XFB, VEA, nam VEA e&longs;t per­
pendiculum; at verò XFB e&longs;t horizontale, vt clarum e&longs;t.
Theorema 55.
Pote&longs;t determinari motus proportio cuiu&longs;libet puncti a&longs;&longs;ignati in plano EN;
&longs;it enim punctum G;
ducatur à centro A recta AGH;

haud dubiè e&longs;t per­
pendicularis;
ducatur IGK &longs;ecans GH; ad angulos rectos;

hæc e&longs;t ho­
rizontalis, quæ ad hanc perpendicularem pertinet;

ducatur HI parallela
EG;
hæc e&longs;t inclinata, vt patet ex dictis; immò per ip&longs;am deff.

1. &longs;ed mo­
tus in inclinata e&longs;t vt ip&longs;um perpendiculum ad inclinatam per Th. 6.
igitur motus per HI in ip&longs;o puncto H, vel per GE in ip&longs;o puncto G e&longs;t
ad motum per HG, vt HG ad HI.
Aliter ducatur HZ perpendicularis IH;

dico motum in G vel ex G
initio e&longs;&longs;e ad motum per VE vel GL vt GH ad GZ; &longs;unt enim duo
triangula IGH, ZGH proportionalia.
Aliter ducatur LK parallela GG;

triangula GKL, GHI &longs;unt propor­
tionalia; igitur motus per GE e&longs;t ad motum per HG, vt LG ad LK.
Aliter ducatur QL, triangula QLA, LGK &longs;unt proportionalia;

igi­
tur motus per GE e&longs;t ad motum per HG vt QL ad AL; igitur vt &longs;inus
rectus anguli QAL ad totum.

Idem dico de puncto O, & omnibus alia
in quibus e&longs;t eadem praxis.
Theorema 56.
In &longs;ingulis punctis plani EN e&longs;t diuer&longs;us motus;

nam in puncto E nullus
e&longs;t motus per Th. 50.atqui in puncto G e&longs;t motus;

igitur initio e&longs;t maior
motus in O quàm in G; igitur quâ proportione horizontalis EN erit
longior, puncta, quæ longiùs di&longs;tabunt, habebunt rationem plani ma­
gis inclinati.
Theorema 57.
Pote&longs;t determinari grauitatio in &longs;ingulis punctis plani EN;

cum enim
grauitatio in plano inclinato &longs;it ad grauitationem in horizontali vt
Tangens ad &longs;ecantem, vel vt horizontalis, in quam &longs;cilicet cadit perpen­
lum ad inclinatam per Th. 16. &longs;it punctum, G grauitatio in eo puncto
e&longs;t ad grauitationem in puncto E, vt QA ad AL, & in puncto O ve YA
ad AP: idem dico de aliis punctis.
Theorema 58.
Hinc eò minor e&longs;t grauitatio, quò maior e&longs;t di&longs;tantia ab E;

atque ita ab E
ver&longs;us N cre&longs;cit motus, & decre&longs;cit grauitatio; at verò ab N ver&longs;us B
cre&longs;cit grauitatio, & decre&longs;cit motus.
Theorema 59.
Globus ab O ver&longs;us E rotatus &longs;emper acceleraret &longs;uum motum.

&longs;uppono enim planum E
N e&longs;&longs;e læuigati&longs;&longs;imum;
igitur nihil e&longs;&longs;et, à quo de&longs;trueretur:

adde quòd
&longs;emper haberet &longs;uum effectum;

igitur non e&longs;&longs;et fru&longs;trà; igitur per Schol.
Th.152.l.1.
Theorema 60.
Ille motus acceleratur per partes inæquales;

quia &longs;cilicet motus additus
in O minor e&longs;&longs;et quàm in N, & in G quàm in O per Th. 56. igitur per
partes inæquales acceleraretur, immò pote&longs;t determinari proportio cre­
menti motus in &longs;ingulis;

cum enim in O &longs;it vt YP, in QL. in Yvt T d
ad AC; certè cre&longs;cit in proportione &longs;inuum rectorum ad &longs;inum totum.
Theorema 61.

Mobile de&longs;cendens ex O in E tran&longs;it per tot plana inclinata diuer&longs;a, quot
&longs;unt puncta in tota EO vt con&longs;tat, vel potiùs quot po&longs;&longs;unt duci Tangentes di­
uer&longs;æ in toto arcu PE; quippe Tangens puncti P e&longs;&longs;et parallela IG, idem
dico de omnibus aliis punctis arcus PE.
Theorema 62.

Motus funependuli in quolibet puncto arcus, per quem de&longs;cendit, e&longs;t ad mo­
tum in perpendiculari, vt &longs;inus re&longs;idui arcus ad &longs;emidiametrum;

v.g. &longs;it fune­
pendulum AD in perpendiculari, quod vibrari po&longs;&longs;it circa punctum im­
mobile A, eleuetur in Ab, ducatur Tangens b V motus funependiculi in
puncto b &longs;cilicet initio, idem e&longs;t, qui e&longs;&longs;et in plano inclinato bV vt patet,
atqui motus in inclinato plano b V e&longs;t ad motum in perpendiculari vt a V.
ad b V, &longs;ed aV e&longs;t ad bV vt ab ad Ab, &longs;unt enim triangula proportionalia;
igitur motus initio &longs;cilicet in puncto arcus putà B e&longs;t ad motum in per­
pendiculari etiam initio con&longs;ideratum, vt &longs;inus rectus re&longs;idui arcus, putà
b D ad &longs;emidiametrum, vel &longs;inum totum, id e&longs;t a b ad A b, idem dico de
omnibus aliis punctis.
Theorema 63.

Hinc proportio accelerationis motus in de&longs;cen&longs;u funependuli &longs;eu incremen­
ti in &longs;ingulis punctis additi e&longs;t in proportione huiu&longs;modi &longs;inuum minorum &longs;em­
per & minorum; v.g. motus in puncto B e&longs;t vt BA &longs;emidiameter in t vt t
m in b vt b a, id e&longs;t licèt maior &longs;it motus in t quàm in B, cum &longs;cilicet
de&longs;cendit ex B in t, vt illa portio crementi quæ in ip&longs;o puncto t addi­
tur e&longs;t ad primam in B vt t m ad BA.
Theorema 64.

&longs;imiliter pote&longs;t
comparari acqui&longs;ita tantùm in arcu BT, cum acqui&longs;ita in arcu t b vel b
D, quod probatur; quia motus, qui re&longs;pondet &longs;ingulis punctis arcus initio
e&longs;t in proportione &longs;inuum &longs;eu tran&longs;uer&longs;arum BA, t m, b a, &c.

haùd dubiè prædictam aream qua&longs;i occupabunt; igitur acqui&longs;ita
in vno puncto e&longs;t ad acqui&longs;itam in alio puncto vt linea tran&longs;uer&longs;a ad
tran&longs;uer&longs;am v. g. acqui&longs;ita in &longs;olo puncto t nulla habita ratione &longs;upe­
riorum ad acqui&longs;itam in &longs;olo puncto b vt tm ad ba ita acqui&longs;ita in arcu
B t e&longs;t ad acqui&longs;itam in arcu t b, vt area &longs;inuum B t a, ad aream &longs;inum
arcus t b.
Scholium.

&longs;emper enim accidet trapezus mixtus, v.
g. &longs;it trapezus A t a&longs;&longs;umatur recta æqualia arcui B t & duæ rectæ æqua­
les duabus BA t m, quarta erit curua; igitur erit trapezus mixtus, quæ cer­
tè cautio adhibenda e&longs;t, alioquin fal&longs;um e&longs;&longs;et &longs;uperius Theorema, &longs;ed de
funependulis infrà.
Theorema 65.

In plano horizontali E O motus incrementa in diuer&longs;is punctis habent
eandem proportionem quam habent in motu funependuli per arcum &longs;uum v. g.
fit planum EO ducatur AP O, motus in O e&longs;t ad motum in perpendicu­
lari vt PX ad AE, &longs;it funependulum AP cuius centrum;

cui affixa e&longs;t im­
mobiliter extremitas funis, &longs;it A & punctum quietis &longs;it E, motus illius in
puncto P e&longs;t ad motum in puncto C vt PX ad AB:

&longs;imiliter motus in G
puncto plani e&longs;t ad motum in perpendiculari vt LQ ad AE per Th.55.
itemque &longs;it funependulum in L, motus in L e&longs;t ad motum in C vt LQ
ad AE, idem dico de punctis T & Y & omnibus aliis; igitur crementa
motus tùm in motu tùm in arcu &longs;unt in eadem proportione.
Theorema 66.

Determinari pote&longs;t velocitas acqui&longs;ita in de&longs;cen&longs;u OE, e&longs;t enim vt trian­
gulum mixtum cuius alterum latus rectum &longs;it ad OE, alterum ad angulos
rectos PX, tertium curua connectens &longs;inus rectos infra PX ver&longs;us vt E
vides in figura EO 4. e&longs;t autem hæc velocitas ad velocitatem acqui&longs;i­
tam in perpendiculari æquali OE vt prædictum triangulum EO 4. ad
rectangulum &longs;ub OEA.
Theorema 67.

Non de&longs;cendit mobile per per OE & GE æquali tempore vt patet, quia
hæc Tangens EO pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e longior in infinitum; &longs;ed has proportiones
demon&longs;trabimus Tom, &longs;equenti, quia multam Geometriam de&longs;ide­
rant.
Theorema 68.

Omne planum quod ad aliquod punctum circumferentiæ globi terre&longs;tris
terminatur, & productum vlterius non &longs;ecat centrum pote&longs;t plænum inclina­
tum e&longs;&longs;e, v.g. in planum LD vel YD, immò nullum e&longs;t planum quod non
&longs;it horizontale, id e&longs;t quod non cadat perpendiculariter in aliquem ra­
dium vel in aliquod perpendiculum v.g. LD e&longs;t horizontalis quia ca-
dit perpendiculariter in perpendiculum AD, idem dico de plano YD,
cuius perpendiculum vt inueniatur, ex centro A adducatur perpendicu­
laris in YD:

hinc non pote&longs;t de&longs;cendere corpus ad centrum terræ per
planum inclinatum rectilineum quia linea recta quæ ducitur ad cen­
trum e&longs;t perpendiculum; igitur non e&longs;t planum inclinatum.
Theorema 69.

Pote&longs;t determinari motus duorum planorum inclinatorum quorum idem
est perpendiculum, &longs;it enim arcus terræ GFC centro A;

&longs;int duo plana
FK GFL quorum idem e&longs;t perpendiculum LA;

motus in K per KF initio
e&longs;t ad motum per K vt DC ad DCA;

dico motum in L e&longs;&longs;e vt PC ad CA: &longs;ed
hæc &longs;unt facilia.
Theorema 70.
Nullus gradus impetus de&longs;truitur in de&longs;cen&longs;u KF vel MF per &longs;e;

quia nihil
e&longs;t à quo de&longs;truatur, dixi per &longs;e; nam per accidens aliquid de&longs;trui pote&longs;t
tùm ratione plani &longs;cabri tùm etiam ratione aëris.
Theorema 71.

Omnes gradus acqui&longs;iti in de&longs;cen&longs;u concurrunt ad de&longs;cen&longs;um præter vnum
&longs;cilicet præter acqui&longs;itum vltimo instanti de&longs;cen&longs;us; quia impetus non con­
currit ad motum primo in&longs;tanti quo e&longs;t, per Th. 34. lib.1. de omnibus
aliis certum e&longs;t quod concurrant, quia non impediuntur, igitur concur­
runt per Ax.12. lib.1.
Theorema 72.

Omnes gradus impetus qui concurrunt ad de&longs;cen&longs;um, concurrunt ad a&longs;cen­
&longs;um præter vnum;

probatur, quia &longs;i omnes concurrerent, maior e&longs;&longs;et a&longs;­
cen&longs;us de&longs;cen&longs;u quod e&longs;t ab&longs;urdum: adde quod impetus innatus ad li­
neam &longs;ur&longs;um determinari non pote&longs;t per Th.12. &longs;ed impetus innatus
concurrit ad de&longs;cen&longs;um, vt patet.
Theorema 73.
Hinc tot concurrunt ad a&longs;cen&longs;um quot ad de&longs;cen&longs;um;

nam ad a&longs;cen&longs;um
omnes præter vltimum, ad de&longs;cen&longs;um omnes præter primum; igitur tot
concurrunt ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, quot ad de&longs;cen&longs;um.
Dices, primo in&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us aliquis gradus de&longs;truitur.

Re&longs;ponderet
aliquis, tran&longs;eat antecedens, quia cùm in&longs;tanti vltimo de&longs;cen&longs;us omnes
gradus præter innatum exigant motus pro &longs;equenti in&longs;tanti, quod e&longs;t pri­
mum in&longs;tans a&longs;cen&longs;us; certè tot concurrunt ad primum in&longs;tans a&longs;cen&longs;us,
quot ad vltimum de&longs;cen&longs;us, licèt aliquis gradus de&longs;truatur pro primo in­
&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us.

Re&longs;ponderet alius, cùm primo in&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us gradus
ille qui vltimo de&longs;cen&longs;us productus e&longs;t concurrat ad motum, igitur illo
in&longs;tanti fru&longs;trà non e&longs;&longs;e, igitur non debere de&longs;trui, cùm eo tantùm no­
mine de&longs;truatur impetus;

igitur nullo in&longs;tanti præteri­
to exigebat motum oppo&longs;itum: adde quod vltimo in&longs;tanti de&longs;cen&longs;us quo
mobile ponitur in F impetus naturalis non exigit ampliùs motum, cur
enim potius ver&longs;us M quàm ver&longs;us N, igitur primo tantùm in&longs;tanti a&longs;­
cen&longs;us quo mobile fertur ver&longs;us N, impetus naturalis exigit mobile re­
dire in F.

Dices, &longs;i primo in&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us nullus gradus impetus de&longs;truitur; igi­
tur nec &longs;ecundo neque tertio, non e&longs;t enim potior ratio pro vno quàm
pro altero.

Re&longs;ponderet negando, nam ideo, vt iam indicaui, primo in&longs;tan­
ti a&longs;cen&longs;us nullus gradus de&longs;truitur, quia in&longs;tanti immediatè antecedenti,
quod erat vltimum de&longs;cen&longs;us, impetus innatus non exigebat quidquam
ampliùs, igitur nullus gradus e&longs;t fru&longs;trà, igitur nullus de&longs;truitur, at verò
in&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us impetus innatus exigit pro &longs;equente, quod e&longs;t &longs;ecun­
dum a&longs;cen&longs;us mobile redire in F, igitur ex illa pugna &longs;ecundi in&longs;tantis
de&longs;truitur aliquid impetus;
igitur aliquis impetus e&longs;t fru&longs;trà:

non tamen hoc facit, quin omnes
gradus in de&longs;cen&longs;u acqui&longs;iti concurrant ad a&longs;cen&longs;um; igitur tot concur­
runt ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, quot ad de&longs;cen&longs;um, cum hac tamen differentia, quod
impetus innatus, qui concurrit ad de&longs;cen&longs;um, non ad a&longs;cen&longs;um &longs;it longè
velocior vltimo in&longs;tanti motus acqui&longs;ito, qui concurrit ad de&longs;cen&longs;um,
non ad a&longs;cen&longs;um,
Theorema 74.

Hinc in ea proportione cre&longs;cit impetus in de&longs;cen&longs;u, qua decre&longs;cit in a&longs;cen&longs;u,
& in eadem cre&longs;cit, & decre&longs;cit motus in eadem cre&longs;cunt, & decre&longs;cunt &longs;pa­
tia, v.g. &longs;int &longs;ex in&longs;tantia de&longs;cen&longs;us iuxta proportionem &longs;cilicet in&longs;tan­
tium, in qua res i&longs;ta faciliùs explicatur:

primo in&longs;tanti motus &longs;unt duo
gradus impetus, quorum alter tantùm concurrit, &longs;cilicet qui præextitit;

&longs;ecundo verò in&longs;tanti &longs;unt tres gradus
impetus quorum vnus non concurrit, 2. gradus motus, 2.&longs;patia, atque ita
deinceps; donec tandem &longs;exto eo vltimo in&longs;tanti de&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;int 7. gra­
dus impetus, quorum vnus non concurrit, 6. gradus motus, & 6.
&longs;patia.

Similiter primo in&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;unt 7. gradus impetus, quorum
vnus non concurrit &longs;cilicet innatus, 6. gradus motus, 6. &longs;patia; &longs;ecundo
6.gradus impetus, quorum vnus non concurrit &longs;cilicet innatus, 5.gradus
motus, 5.&longs;patia, atque ita deinceps.
Theorema 35.

Hinc æqualia ferè vtrimque &longs;unt &longs;patia de&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;cilicet, & a&longs;cen&longs;us; v.g.
MF æquale FN, quia e&longs;t &longs;umma eorumdem terminorum per Th. 74.
igitur ex F mobile a&longs;cendit ad altitudinem FN æqualem altitudini FM,
ex qua priùs de&longs;cenderat dixi ferè, quia cum innatus &longs;it perfectior vlti­
mo acqui&longs;ito paulò plùs &longs;patij acquiritur in de&longs;cen&longs;u, quàm in a&longs;cen&longs;u,
&longs;ed minimum e&longs;t &longs;en&longs;ibile.
Theorema 76.

Hinc æqualibus temporibus a&longs;cendit ferè ab F in N, & de&longs;cendit ex M
in F, quia numerus terminorum æqualis e&longs;t numero in&longs;tantium.
Theorema 77.

Hinc motum haberet ferè perpetuum ab M in F ab F in N, ab N ite­
rum in F, &c. &longs;i enim de&longs;cendens ex M in F a&longs;cendit ad æqualem altitu­
dinem FN, ita & de&longs;cendens ex N in F a&longs;cendet ad æqualem altitudi­
nem FM, atque ita deinceps;
igitur motus erit ferè perpetuus;

&longs;ed pro­
fectò nullum e&longs;t corpus tàm læuigatum, quod motum non impediat: dixi
ferè, quia de&longs;cen&longs;us tantillùm &longs;uperat a&longs;cen&longs;um, &longs;ed vix intra mille an­
nos &longs;en&longs;u id percipi po&longs;&longs;et.
Theorema 78.
quod nece&longs;&longs;ariò &longs;equitur ex dictis;

quia omnes gradus qui concurrent ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, etiam concurrerent ad
de&longs;cen&longs;um, præter vnum, &longs;cilicet vltimo in&longs;tanti de&longs;cen&longs;us acqui&longs;itum;

& omnes, qui concurrerent ad de&longs;cen&longs;um, concurrerent etiam ad a&longs;cen­
&longs;um præter vnum, &longs;cilicet primum vel innatum;

igitur æquale &longs;patium
æquali tempore percurreretur;

quod certè dictum &longs;it ab&longs;trahendo à re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia aëris, quæ fortè modica e&longs;&longs;et;

Ex hac perpetua vibrationum &longs;e­
rie aliquando explicabimus cau&longs;as phy&longs;icas apogæi & perigæi Solis, &
aliorum planetarum; adhibe eandem cautionem, de qua &longs;uprà.
Theorema 79.

Si duo plana inclinata faciunt angulum e&longs;t ferè æqualis a&longs;cen&longs;us de&longs;cen&longs;ui.
v.

nihil e&longs;t tamen quod de&longs;truat
impetum; nam in reflexione &longs;eu noua determinatione non perit aliquid
impetus nece&longs;&longs;ariò vt lib. &longs;equenti demon&longs;trabimus.
Theorema 80.

E&longs;t tamen alia ratio de motu funependuli quâ euincemus a&longs;cen&longs;um e&longs;&longs;e mi­
norem de&longs;cen&longs;u, de qua infrà.
Theorema 81.

Initio a&longs;cen&longs;us per FN de&longs;truuntur gradus impetus producti &longs;ub finem de­
&longs;cen&longs;us, & &longs;ub finem a&longs;cen&longs;us destruuntur producti initio de&longs;cen&longs;us: ratio e&longs;t
clara, quia producti &longs;ub finem de&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;unt imperfectiores, cùm plùs
recedant à perpendiculari, per Th. 55. &longs;imiliter initio a&longs;cen&longs;us longiùs
recedit linea à verticali;

igitur minùs de&longs;truetur impetus, vt &longs;æpè incul-
cauimus; nam idem de&longs;truitur in dato puncto a&longs;cen&longs;us, qui producere­
tur in eodem puncto de&longs;cen&longs;us.

Dices, gradus productus vltimo in&longs;tanti de&longs;cen&longs;us non de&longs;truitur pri­
mo a&longs;cen&longs;us.
Re&longs;pondeo de&longs;trui;

hinc eadem cau&longs;a idem de&longs;truit primo
in&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us quod produxit vltimo in&longs;tanti de&longs;cen&longs;us; de&longs;truit in­
quam mediatè.

Hîc ob&longs;eruabis &longs;ingulare di&longs;crimen, quod intercedit inter cau&longs;am
producentem, & exigentem;

nam producens verè agit, exigens verò tan­
tùm exigit;
illa con&longs;equitur effectum eo in&longs;tanti quo agit;

hæc verò non
habet effectum eo in&longs;tanti, quo exigit, &longs;ed pro &longs;equenti;

e&longs;t tamen cau&longs;a
eo in&longs;tanti, quo exigit, non certè agens, &longs;ed exigens:

igitur e&longs;t cau&longs;a motus antequàm &longs;it motus, non
agens &longs;ed exigens; at verò cum impetus alium impetum producit e&longs;t
tantùm cau&longs;a illius cum agit.
Theorema 82.

Vltimo in&longs;tanti a&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;unt duo gradus impetus, &longs;cilicet productus primo
in&longs;tanti de&longs;cen&longs;us cum innato;

igitur in&longs;tanti &longs;equenti erit motus, id e&longs;t,
de&longs;cen&longs;us, quia præualet innatus qui perfectior e&longs;t, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis;

igitur nullum erit in&longs;tans quietis; quæ omnia explicari debent eodem
modo, quo iam explicuimus in motu violento, lib.3. e&longs;t enim eadem ra­
tio, &c.
quæ omitto ne multa hîc repetere cogar.
Theorema 83.

Ictus e&longs;&longs;ent ferè æquales in &longs;egmentis æqualibus a&longs;cen&longs;us & de&longs;cen&longs;us, quia
motus e&longs;&longs;et æqualis in illis; igitur ictus æquales, quod facilè e&longs;t.
Theorema 84.

&longs;ed AF e&longs;t ad AE vt AG ad AD, vt AH ad AO; &longs;unt enim triangula
proportionalia.

Hinc reiice quorumdam recentiorum &longs;ententiam, qui volunt corpus,
quod propiùs ad centrum terræ accedit, e&longs;&longs;e minùs graue, & grauius quod
longiùs à centro recedit, quod de grauitate corporis ab&longs;olutè &longs;umpti nul­
latenus dici pote&longs;t vt con&longs;tat, vtrum verò &longs;i cum alio in eadem libra &longs;ta­
tuatur hinc inde, videbimus &longs;uo loco.
Diceret fortè aliquis in ip&longs;o centro &longs;poliari &longs;ua tota grauitate;

igitur
quo propiùs accedit ad centrum maiori grauitatis portione multatur;

&longs;ed
nego con&longs;equentiam;

nec enim &longs;equitur priuari parte grauitatis dum
abe&longs;t à centro, licèt tota priuetur cum e&longs;t in centro &longs;ed de hac quæ&longs;tione
plura aliàs; nec enim huius loci e&longs;t.

Sed ne hoc fortè excidat &longs;i Globus CGLH de&longs;cendat ex A ad cen­
trum mundi &longs;eu grauium E, quæri pote&longs;t vtrum omnes partes mouean­
tur &longs;ua &longs;ponte ver&longs;us L etiam illæ quæ vltra centrum E proce&longs;&longs;erunt, &longs;eu
quod idem e&longs;t, vtrum globus CGLH, cuius centrum E e&longs;t coniun­
ctum cum centro grauium E tran&longs;latus in IFKB eiu&longs;dem &longs;it ponderis,
cuius e&longs;&longs;et in A. v.g. Re&longs;p. primò globum prædictum, cuius centrum e&longs;t in E, nullius e&longs;&longs;e
ponderis, vt con&longs;tat; nec enim potiùs in vnam partem, quàm in aliam
inclinat.

quia grauitat per
&longs;uam entitatem quatenus coniuncta e&longs;t cum inclinatione;
Dices grauitare grauitatione communi.

Re&longs;pondeo ad extra conce­
do, &longs;cilicet ad producendum impetum in corpore quod impedit motum,
&longs;ecus verò grauitatione intrin&longs;ecâ; vnde &longs;i &longs;u&longs;tineretur globus in F non
&longs;u&longs;tineretur totus, &longs;ed fortè detraheretur de toto pondere, primò &longs;ectio
MFNE, quæ non grauitat ver&longs;us F & altera æqualis quæ ab ea &longs;u&longs;tine­
retur.

v.g. &longs;i &longs;ectio OCPD immediatè incumberet &longs;ectioni MFNE,
ita vt corda OP iungeretur cordæ MN;

certè vtraque con&longs;i&longs;teret; dixi
fortè, quia non e&longs;t ita certum, vt videbimus alias.

Dices igitur &longs;i globus
ille e&longs;&longs;et in centro, minima vi adhibita amoueretur;

igitur idem timen­
dum e&longs;&longs;et de toto terre&longs;tri globo;

&longs;ed noli timere quæ&longs;o tàm facilè terræ
motum;

immò &longs;i globus ille &longs;emel occuparet centrum E., cum non tan­
tum hemi&longs;pherium GLH contra nitatur GCH;

verùm etiam CGL,
CHL, & infinita alia;

certè vt moueatur vbi &longs;emel centrum E occupat,
debent tot ferè produci gradus impetus, quot produci deberent vt mo­
ueretur extra centrum, vt probabimus cum de grauitate &longs;cilicet in tra­
ctatu &longs;equenti phy&longs;icæ &longs;ingulari: Interim dicendum e&longs;t &longs;ingulas partes
huius globi &longs;eor&longs;im grauitare, cum centrum occupat, excepto illo puncto
quod in centro e&longs;t.
Theorema 85.

Pote&longs;t, corpus graue de&longs;cendere ad centrum terræ per planum conuexum
quadrantis, &longs;it enim globus terræ GBCK, centrum A; de&longs;cribatur ex
K &longs;emidiametro KA quadrans KLA.

Dico quòd corpus graue de&longs;cen­
det per conuexum arcum LVA, non tamen per concauum.

igitur per illam de&longs;cendet, quia nulla e&longs;t alia linea minor
dextror&longs;um;
&longs;i enim e&longs;&longs;et aliqua, e&longs;&longs;et LCA;

quia po&longs;&longs;unt tantùm duci
duæ illæ rectæ breui&longs;&longs;imæ, quæ terminentur ad puncta LC vt patet;

&longs;ed
LCA e&longs;t maior arcu LVA:

Probatur &longs;ecunda pars, quia ab L in A in-
tror&longs;um pote&longs;t duci linea LA breuior arcu LVA; igitur per concauum
LVA non de&longs;cenderet mobile.
Theorema 86.
Motus puncti L initio e&longs;&longs;et minor motu puncti V initio;

id e&longs;t po&longs;ito quod
demittatur ex V ver&longs;us A;

demon&longs;tro, quia eodem modo &longs;e habet in L,
atque &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et in puncto L Tangentis LC, vt pater;

&longs;ed motus per LC ini­
tio e&longs;t ad motum per LA vt ND ad NA vel vt LC ad LA per Th.55.
at verò motus in V vel in F initio per FE Tangentem e&longs;t ad motum per­
pendiculi FA vt FE ad FA;

&longs;ed e&longs;t maior ratio FE ad FA, quàm LE
ad LA, vt con&longs;tat; igitur motus initio in V e&longs;t minor quàm in L
initio.
Theorema 87.

Hinc e&longs;t inuer&longs;a ratio motus funependuli vulgaris & plani inclinati recti,
in quibus motus &longs;upremi puncti e&longs;t maior motu cuiu&longs;libet alterius pun­
cti, vnde inciperet motus, cum tamen hic &longs;it minor: porrò po&longs;&longs;et e&longs;&longs;e
funependulum KLA dum vel LVA e&longs;&longs;et orbis durus quem media di­
uideret rima qua&longs;i ecliptica globi penduli ex K fune exten&longs;o, & per ri­
mam incerto KL, vel quod faciliùs e&longs;&longs;et &longs;i KL e&longs;&longs;et pri&longs;ma durum, quod
circa K immobile moueri &longs;eu volui po&longs;&longs;et.
Theorema 88.

Alia via facilior occurrit, quæ mihi videtur non e&longs;&longs;e omittenda qua propor­
tiones illæ diuer&longs;i motus demonstrari po&longs;&longs;ent, &longs;it.
v.g. punctum L;

a&longs;&longs;umatur
arcus LQ æqualis arcui LA;

ducatur recta AQ, in quam ducatur LK
perpendicularis:

dico motum in L per arcum LVA initio e&longs;&longs;e ad motum
per LA vt KA ad LA:
&longs;imiliter &longs;it punctum V;

a&longs;&longs;umatur VL æqualis
arcui VA;
idem dico de omnibus aliis:

Ratio e&longs;t, quia Tangens, quæ ducere­
tur in V e&longs;&longs;et parallela AX; igitur triangula vtrimque e&longs;&longs;ent æqualia.

v.g. FEA & FYA: item motus in P e&longs;t ad motum per ip&longs;um perpen­
diculum, vt Tangens PM ad PA, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis.
Theorema 89.

Hinc totus motus per LA perpendiculum e&longs;t ad totum motum per arcum
LVA, vt omnes chordæ ductæ ab A ad omnia puncta quadrantis AVL
&longs;imul &longs;umptæ ad totidem &longs;ubduplas chordarum ductarum ab A ad alterna
puncta totius &longs;emicirculi ALQ vel ad totidem Tangentes &longs;imul &longs;umptas:

cum
enim motus in L per arcum LVA &longs;it ad motum in L por ip&longs;um perpen­
diculum LA vt &longs;ubdupla AQ ad LA, & motus in V per arcum in A
&longs;it ad motum in V per rectam VA, vt &longs;ubdupla chordæ AL ad rectam
VA, atque ita deinceps per Th.88. certè omnia antecedentis &longs;imul &longs;um­
pta habent illam rationem ad omnia con&longs;equentia &longs;imul &longs;umpta, vt con­
&longs;tat; igitur totus motus, &c.
Theorema 90.

Globus de&longs;cendens B per conuexum arcum LVA in quo A e&longs;t centrum
terræ a&longs;cenderet denuò per quadrantem oppo&longs;itum AFS;

patet, quia totus
impetus non de&longs;trueretur in centro A, qui &longs;cilicet e&longs;&longs;et inten&longs;ior pro­
pter accelerationem de&longs;cen&longs;us, quàm vt in momento de&longs;truatur; quod
probatur ex aliis funependulis, & reflexis.
Theorema 91.
Non a&longs;cenderet per totum arcum AFS;

hoc Theorema probabitur cum
de motu funependuli, e&longs;t enim eadem pro vtroque ratio; quæ in eo po­
&longs;ita e&longs;t, quòd in a&longs;cen&longs;u aliquid impetus de&longs;truatur.
Theorema 92.
Velociùs de&longs;cenderet per arcum maiorem LVA quam per minorem XA;
velociùs, inquam, pro rata;
nam arcum XA citiùs percurreret;

ratio e&longs;t,
quia modicus XA e&longs;t magis curuus, vt patet;

igitur determinatio­
nis mutatio maior e&longs;t: adde quod maior arcus accedit propiùs ad
rectam.
Theorema 93.

Non modo per quadrantem circuli de&longs;cendere pote&longs;t in centrum terræ, &longs;ed
etiam per &longs;emicirculum;

certè de&longs;cenderet v&longs;que ad A per conuexum &longs;emicir­
culi QLA; per conuexum, inquam, non per concauum, vt dictum e&longs;t
de quadrante LVA.

Ratio e&longs;t, quia accederet &longs;emper propiùs ad cen­
trum A;

igitur e&longs;&longs;et planum inclinatum per Th. 2. igitur per illud de­
&longs;cenderet, nec vlla e&longs;&longs;et difficultas;

quod autem accedat &longs;emper propiùs
ad A per &longs;emicirculum QLA, certum e&longs;t;

quia PA minor e&longs;t QA; nam
diameter e&longs;t maxima &longs;ubten&longs;arum in circulo.

Immò per alium &longs;emi­
circulum ASQ a&longs;cenderet denuóque de&longs;cenderet repetitis pluribus vi­
brationibus; nunquam tamen a&longs;cenderet v&longs;que ad punctum Q propter
tamdem rationem, quam in Theoremate 92. adduximus.

Ob&longs;eruabis præterea non tantùm corpus graue po&longs;&longs;e de&longs;cendere per
&longs;emicirculum, qui &longs;ecet centrum mundi A, &longs;ed etiam per plures alios.

v.g. per &longs;emicirculum ROB, quia &longs;cilicet ab R ver&longs;us BO & ab O
ver&longs;us B &longs;emper de&longs;cendit, a&longs;cenditque propiùs ad A, cùm nulla linea in­
ter AOB duci po&longs;&longs;it ad punctum A, quæ non &longs;it maior BA, vt
con&longs;tat.

Vt autem habeas i&longs;tos circulos; accipe centrum &longs;uprà A ver&longs;us K, mo­
do radius &longs;eu &longs;emidiameter de&longs;cendat infrà A. v.g. IB vel KB, &c.
Theorema 94.

Hinc pote&longs;t aliquis dimidium globum terre&longs;trem percurrere, licèt &longs;emper
de&longs;cendat;

vt&longs;i conficiat &longs;emicirculum ROB, & licet &longs;emper a&longs;cendat,
vt &longs;i conficiat &longs;emicirculum BIIR; hæc ita clara &longs;unt, vt oculis tantùm
indigeant.
Theorema 59.

Hinc pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e mons per quem aliquis a&longs;cendat, licèt &longs;ub planum horizon­
tale de&longs;cendat. v.g. &longs;it Tangens in puncto B;
de&longs;cenderet tamen infra Tangentem in B;

igi­
tur mons e&longs;&longs;et infra horizontale planum; montem enim appello tractum
arduum, in quo dum aliquis ambulat, a&longs;cendit, hoc e&longs;t recedit à terræ
centro.
Theorema 96.
Diuer&longs;æ e&longs;&longs;ent rationes motus in de&longs;cen&longs;u per &longs;emicirculum QLA;

pote&longs;t autem haberi hæc proportio ductis Tangentibus, vt &longs;æpè
iam dixi;

at verò in &longs;emicirculo ROB in puncto T e&longs;&longs;et veloci&longs;&longs;imus mo­
tus initio, quia angulus ITA e&longs;t maximus eorum omnium, qui po&longs;&longs;unt
fieri ductis duabus rectis ab A & I coëuntibus in &longs;emicirculo ROB, igi­
tur & illi oppo&longs;itus;

igitur perpendiculum AT accedit propiùs ad Tan­
gentem;
igitur planum inclinatius e&longs;t;

igitur in puncto T e&longs;t velocior mo­
tus initio quàm in aliis; igitur acceleratur motus ab R in T per cre­
menta &longs;emper maiora, & ab ip&longs;o T ad B per crementa minora.
Theorema 97.

Pote&longs;t de&longs;cendere corpus graue v.g. globus v&longs;que ad centrum terræ per He­
licem;
&longs;it enim globus terræ AEQO, centrum K;

diuidatur QK in 4.
partes æquales QR.RP.PS.SK;

a&longs;&longs;umatur EH æqualis QR, & AC æqua­
lis QP, & OM æqualis QS;

tùm per &longs;ignata puncta de&longs;cribatur helix Q
HCZMK:

dico quod per eius conuexum globus de&longs;cenderet ex Q, ad
centrum terræ;
quia &longs;emper accedit propiùs ad centrum;

immò per plura
volumina de&longs;cendere pote&longs;t; &longs;it enim QK diui&longs;a in 8. partes æquales Q
TTR, &c.

tùm a&longs;&longs;umatur EF æqualis QT, AB æqualis QR, ON æqualis
QV tùm QR in ip&longs;a QK, & æqualis QY, ED, a qualis QS, & OL æqualis
QX; & per puncta a&longs;&longs;ignata de&longs;cribatur Helix QFBNPIDLK, per cam
de&longs;cenderet globus ad centrum terræ K po&longs;t duas circumuolutiones.

Per aliam quoque &longs;piralem compo&longs;itam ex &longs;emicirculis de&longs;cendere
pote&longs;t ad centrum terræ B;

&longs;it enim centrum terræ F & globus terræ A
CMD;
accipiantur duo puncta hinc inde HK ad libitum;

tunc ex H
fiat &longs;emicirculus MB;

haud dubiè globus po&longs;itus in M de&longs;cendet in B per
conuexum &longs;emicirculi in B;

quia B inter omnia illius puncta accedit pro­
ximè ad F;
tùm ex K ducatur &longs;emicirculus BI;

certè ex B de&longs;cenderet in I
propter eandem rationem, tùm ex H de&longs;cribatur &longs;emicirculus IF;

certè
ex I de&longs;cendet in F, quæ omnia patent ex dictis;

po&longs;&longs;unt autem multipli­
cari i&longs;tæ &longs;piræ in infinitum: Hinc licèt globus &longs;ingulis horis 100000. leu­
cas conficeret in de&longs;cen&longs;u, non tamen attingeret centrum ni&longs;i po&longs;t 1000.
annos, immò plures &longs;ecundùm numerum &longs;pirarum.

&longs;iue non perpendiculariter, modò DL &longs;it maior C
K, EM maior DL, at que ita deinceps; attamen vltimum planum TB non
erit inclinatum, &longs;ed perpendiculum, vt patet.
Theorema 98.

Po&longs;&longs;unt e&longs;&longs;e infinita plana inter orbem terræ, & horizontale per quæ globus
&longs;eu corpus graue non de&longs;cendet;

&longs;it enim centrum terræ C, ex quo de&longs;cri­
batur arcus QMH ducta diametro MCA in M;

ducatur Tangens NM
L;
hæc erit horizontale planum, vt con&longs;tat;

tùm ex aliquo puncto infra C
putà ex A de&longs;cribatur arcus SMK;

cercè &longs;i ponatur globus in M non
de&longs;cendet per arcum MG, quia potiùs a&longs;cenderet;

igitur potentia illa, quæ per
horizontalem pellit non e&longs;t omnium minima, quæ per arcum MQ pel­
lit; quia in eo nullo modo globus a&longs;cendit, &longs;ed &longs;emper à centro C æqui­
di&longs;tat.

Si verò a&longs;&longs;umas quæcumque centra &longs;upra B putà D, & E, & ducas
arcus TMGPOMF;

certè globus de&longs;cendet per MO, & MP, vt manife­
&longs;tum e&longs;t ex dictis, & hoc fortè ludicrum cuiquam videbitur;

&longs;i enim col­
locetur globus in T, de&longs;cendit ver&longs;us M;

&longs;i verò in Y de&longs;cendet ver&longs;us
P;
licèt V & T non di&longs;tét pollice;

po&longs;&longs;unt enim accipi minima illa &longs;patia
ver&longs;us M, vbi e&longs;t angulus contingentiæ;

nulla tamen pote&longs;t duci recta ab
M infra MN, per quam globus non de&longs;cendat velociùs initio, quàm per
vllum arcum, &longs;iue MP, &longs;iue MO, &longs;iue quemcumque alium quamtumuis
maximè incuruatum vel inclinatum;

quia &longs;cilicet recta illa ducta ex M
infra MN &longs;ecat omnes illos arcus, vt patet;

igitur initio facit planum
inclinatius: dixi initio, quia deinde in arcu multùm inuale&longs;cit motus,
cum &longs;emper deficiat in recta, vt diximus abundè &longs;uprà.
Theorema 99.

Si quadrans ita di&longs;tet à centro mundi, vt tùm alter eius radius, tùm Tan­
gens ip&longs;i parallela cen&longs;eantur perpendiculares, globus de&longs;cendet ex eius vertice
per arcum:

Sit enim quadrans ATE erectus &longs;upra horizontem, ita vt
AE &longs;it horizontalis, & tùm TA, tùm 3. A perpendiculares;
quippe motus in T nullus e&longs;t per arcum TE;

5.verò motus per arcum 5.E, initio &longs;cilicet, vt &longs;æpè dictum e&longs;t, e&longs;t ad mo­
tum per ip&longs;am perpendicularem vt A 7.ad A 5.in 4.vt A 7.ad A 4. in B
vt A d ad AB, in D vt AH ad AD in X vt AF ad AX, in E, vt AE ad A
E;
vides autem tran&longs;ire motum hunc ferè per omnes gradus tarditatis:

di­
co ferè, quia reuerâ non tran&longs;it per omnes; quippe &longs;i fieret maior qua­
drans tangens i&longs;tum in T, motus e&longs;&longs;et iuxta initium præ&longs;ertim tar­
dior.

Ob&longs;erua&longs;ti iam vt puto motum per Arcum TBE e&longs;&longs;e inuer&longs;um vul­
garis funependuli;

quippe in illo motuum incrementa initio &longs;unt mino­
ra, & &longs;emper cre&longs;cunt; at verò in hoc initio &longs;unt maiora, & &longs;emper de­
cre&longs;cunt.
Theorema 100.

Po&longs;&longs;unt determinari vires, quæ &longs;u&longs;tinere po&longs;&longs;unt datum pondus collocatu&mtail;
in arcu erecto ATE:

quippe ad &longs;u&longs;tinendum pondus in T nullæ vires
requiruntur, ad &longs;u&longs;tinendum in E æqualis potentia ponderi requiritur;

denique in E vt AE ad AE; ratio e&longs;t, quia potentia debet e&longs;&longs;e pro­
portionata momento ponderis, &longs;eu motus, &longs;ed motus in B.v.g.per BE e&longs;t
ad motum qui fit per perpendicularem vt Ad ad AB vel AE, igitur po­
tentia quæ impedit hunc motum, id e&longs;t quæ &longs;u&longs;tinet pondus in B e&longs;t ad
illam quæ &longs;u&longs;tinet in E vt A d ad AE.

Debet autem &longs;u&longs;tineri pondus vel per Tangentem ductam ad punctum
B vel ip&longs;i parallelam in certo dumtaxat funiculo, vt fit in trochleis; vnde
&longs;i &longs;emicirculus A 2.E &longs;it trochlea, & pondus pendeat ex E, adhibeaturque
potentia trahens in A, debet e&longs;&longs;e æqualis ponderi, &longs;ed de trochleis fusè
lib. 11.

Hinc etiam facilè determinari pote&longs;t quomodo de&longs;truatur impetus,
&longs;i proiiciatur globus per arcum EBT &longs;ur&longs;um;

nam in eadem proportione
de&longs;truetur in a&longs;cendendo, qua acceleratur de&longs;cendendo;

neque e&longs;t hîc
&longs;ingularis difficultas;

quemadmodum enim in de&longs;cen&longs;u &longs;emper accele­
ratur per incrementa inæqualia iuxta rationem explicatam;

ita in a&longs;cen­
&longs;u &longs;emper retardatur per detractiones inæquales;

in de&longs;cen&longs;u quidem per
incrementa initio minora, & maiora &longs;ub finem; in a&longs;cen&longs;u è contrario
per detractiones initio maiores &longs;ub finem minores.

Hinc denique determinari pote&longs;t quantùm corpus grauitet in toto
arcu TBE;

in E nihil grauitat, in T totum grauitat; igitur grauitatio in
T, &longs;eu tota e&longs;t ad grauitationem in E, vt TA ad nihil, in 5. verò vt AT
ad AT, in 4. vt AT ad AA, in B vt AT ad AS, atque ita deinceps, quæ
con&longs;tant ex dictis.

In&longs;uper ob&longs;erua corpus graue incumbens arcui TBE, per varias lineas
po&longs;&longs;e pelli, vel trahi, de quibus idem pror&longs;us dicendum e&longs;t, quod dictum
e&longs;t in Th.5. & Sch.Th.16.

Adde quod omi&longs;imus, &longs;ed facilè ex dictis lib. 1. intelligi pote&longs;t, im­
petum qui producitur in acceleratione motus per planum inclinatum
e&longs;&longs;e imperfectiorem ex duplici capite; primò ratione minoris temporis,
quo producitur ex ratione maioris vel minoris inclinationis, &longs;eu longi­
tudinis.
v.g. &longs;it planum inclinatum AC;

certè cum po&longs;t motum per A
E, & per AB &longs;it æqualis ictus vel impetus;

& cùm tempus quo de&longs;cendit
per AE &longs;it duplum temporis, quo de&longs;cendit per AB;
