certè &longs;ingulis in&longs;tan­
tibus, quibus durat motus per AC, producitur impetus &longs;ubduplus tan-
tùm in perfectione illius, qui producitur per AB; &longs;i enim æqualis perfe­
ctionis;

igitur impetus po&longs;t de&longs;cen&longs;um per AC e&longs;&longs;et duplus illius qui ha­
betur in B po&longs;t de&longs;cen&longs;um per AB;
&longs;i autem e&longs;&longs;et minor &longs;ubduplo;

igitur
in C, vel impetus e&longs;&longs;et minor quam in B contra hypothe&longs;im;

igitur debet
&longs;ubduplus;

igitur duplò plures &longs;unt gradus impetus in C quàm in B, cùm
&longs;cilicet &longs;inguli gradus impetus in B æquiualeant duobus impetus in A:
his adde aliqua breuia Corollaria, quæ qui&longs;que ex dictis facilè colligere
poterit.
Corollarium 1.

Ex his primò vides perfectam analogiam impetus in omni motu, qui
reuera explicari non pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i detur impetus alio imperfectior:

Porrò
multa hîc de&longs;iderantur, quæ ad motum in planis inclinatis pertinent, que
in Tomum &longs;equentem remittimus; quia potiori iure ad Mathematicam
&longs;pectant, quàm ad Phy&longs;icam.
Corollarium 2.

Secundò, impetus po&longs;&longs;e in infinitum decre&longs;cere perfectionem quod
primò con&longs;tat ex eo, quòd infra horizontalem po&longs;&longs;int duci lineæ minùs
& minùs inclinatæ: &longs;ecundò ex eo, quòd po&longs;&longs;int inter quamlibet inclina­
tam deor&longs;um rectam, & &longs;uperficiem orbis terræ de&longs;cribi infiniti orbes,
quorum centrum &longs;it &longs;upra centrum terræ, quorum arcus initio faciunt
minorem, & minorem inclinationem.
Corollarium 3.

Tertiò, hinc colliges impetum qui producitur in primo puncto de&longs;­
cen&longs;us illorum arcuum e&longs;&longs;e pror&longs;us alogum cum illo, qui producitur in
primo puncto de&longs;cen&longs;us cuiu&longs;libet rectæ inclinatæ, & illum qui à pro­
ximo puncto ver&longs;us punctum contactus in Tangente producitur
e&longs;&longs;e etiam alogum cum illo, qui in proximo puncto ver&longs;us idem pun­
ctum contactus producitur in circumferentia circuli, cuius centrum &longs;it
infra centrum terræ, id e&longs;t cuius radius &longs;it longior radio orbis terræ,
Corollarium. 4.

Quartò, quid mirabilius quam ad idem punctum contactus po&longs;&longs;e du­
ci infinitos circulos quorum arcus omnes in ea&longs;dem partes incuruan­
tur, licèt &longs;int infiniti?

quia &longs;umpto termino in eodem puncto contactus
omninò a&longs;cendant &longs;cilicet ij, qui maiores &longs;unt orbe terræ, & infiniti, qui
de&longs;cendunt, ij &longs;cilicet qui minores &longs;unt; & vnicus tantùm medius, qui
nec a&longs;cendat nec de&longs;cendat, qui e&longs;t orbis terræ.
Corollarium 5.

Quintò, non po&longs;&longs;e faciliùs globum moueri, quàm in &longs;uperficie terræ,
&longs;i probè læuigata e&longs;&longs;et;

nullum enim e&longs;t planum &longs;upra &longs;iue rectum, &longs;iue
curuum, quod non a&longs;cendat;

nullum infrà quod non de&longs;cendat: hinc mo­
tus e&longs;&longs;et æquabilis.
Corollarium 6.
quia pauciores partes plani fricantur à globo;

&longs;ed hæc ra­
tio non valet, ni&longs;i &longs;upponatur planum non e&longs;&longs;e perfectè læuigatum;

igi­
tur e&longs;t alia ratio: an quia cubus mouetur motu centri?

globus verò motu
centri & orbis;
&longs;ed motus orbis iuuat motum centri;

igitur alia ratio e&longs;t, &longs;cilicet non tantùm globum de&longs;­
cendere in plano inclinato per grauitatem ab&longs;olutam, &longs;ed etiam per re&longs;­
pectiuam, e&longs;tque veluti potentia Mechanica admota, &longs;cilicet vectis, cu­
jus qua&longs;i vicem gerit &longs;emidiameter circuli:

porrò vectis centrum e&longs;t
punctum contactus;
dixi &longs;emidiametrum, non verò diametrum;

quia to­
tum pondus globi non e&longs;t appen&longs;um extremæ diametro, &longs;ed extremæ &longs;e­
midiametro in hoc ca&longs;u; illa autem extremitas e&longs;t centrum grauitatis
globi.
Corollarium 7.

nam ideo e&longs;t imperfectior, qui producitur ver&longs;us
centrum vectis, quia temporibus æqualibus partes mobiles vectis, quæ
&longs;unt ver&longs;us centrum acquirunt &longs;patia inæqualia &longs;cilicet, minora, & mi­
nora in infinitum;

ita pror&longs;us in planis inclinatis cum acquirantur tem­
poribus æqualibus &longs;patia inæqualia;

minora certè in longioribus, &longs;up­
po&longs;ita dumtaxat eadem perpendiculi altitudine debet produci impetus
imperfectior; nam ex imperfectione effectus id e&longs;t motus, benè colligitur
imperfectio cau&longs;æ id e&longs;t impetus.
Collorarium 8.

Octauò denique, mirabile e&longs;t, quî fieri po&longs;&longs;it, vt eadem potentia quæ
totas &longs;uas vires exerens globum proiicit per lineam verticalem ad al­
titudinem vnius pollicis, id e&longs;t quæ proiicere tantùm pote&longs;t per &longs;patium
digitale, per omnes tamen inclinatas, quæ ad extremitatem huius per­
pendiculi duci po&longs;&longs;unt, cuiu&longs;cunque &longs;int longitudinis, non auctis viri­
bus proiiciat; quis hoc crederet?

ni&longs;i manife&longs;ta cogeret demon&longs;tratio,
quam habes in Th.20.27. &c.

LIBER SEXTVS,
DE MOTV REFLEXO.

DE motu reflexo agendum e&longs;&longs;e videtur hoc
loco; præmittendu&longs;que e&longs;t motui circula­
ri, qui fortè &longs;ine motu reflexo nunquam fit,
vt dicemus infrà.
DEPINITIO 1.

MOtus reflexus e&longs;t reditus mobilis ratione corporis impedientis primam
lineam motus.
Hæc definitio e&longs;t clara;

dicitur reditus, quia reuerâ mobile, quod re­
percutitur, &longs;eu reflectitur, qua&longs;i redit, &longs;eu retrò agitur;

&longs;iue id fiat per
eandem lineam, quâ appul&longs;um fuit; &longs;iue per aliam:

&longs;ic pila in murum
impacta reflecti dicitur, ita vt eius linea frangatur in ip&longs;a muri &longs;uperfi­
cie, quod duobus tantùm modis fieri pote&longs;t: primò &longs;ine angulo, vt cum
redit mobile per eandem lineam, per quam priùs acce&longs;&longs;erat, &longs;icque linea
reflexionis opponi videtur ex diametro lineæ incidentiæ.

Secundò cum
angulo, quòd &longs;cilicet in puncto reflexionis linea reflexionis cum linea
incidentiæ faciat angulum.
Definitio 2.

Corpus reflectens e&longs;t, quod motum liberum alterius corporis impacti non
permittit vlteriùs per eandem lineam propagari, &longs;ed illius lineam frangit, &
inflectit, &c.

huius corporis conditiones in &longs;equentibus Theorematis
definiemus.
Definitio 3.

Punctum reflexionis e&longs;t punctum illud plani reflectentis, in quo linea refle­
xionis, & linea incidentiæ coëunt.
Definitio 4.
Linea incidentiæ e&longs;t illa linea motus.

per quam mobile ante reflexionem ap­
pellitur ad planum reflectens.
Definitio 5.

Linea reflexionis e&longs;t illa linea motus, per quam mobile po&longs;t reflexionem re­
cedit à plano inclinato; hinc vides punctum reflexionis e&longs;&longs;e terminum ad
quem illius lineæ, & terminum à quo huius.
Definitio 6.

Angulus incidentiæ e&longs;t, quem facit cum plano reflectente linea inci­
dentiæ.
Definitio 7.
Angulus reflexionis e&longs;t, quem facit linea reflexionis cum eodem plano.
Definitio 8.

Cathetus e&longs;t linea perpendiculariter cadens in planum reflectens ducta ab
aliquo puncto linea incidentia;
& tunc dicitur Cathetus incidentiæ;

vel
ab aliquo lineæ reflexionis, & tunc dicitur Cathetus reflexionis; hæc
omnia &longs;unt facilia, quæ in gratiam Tyronum breuiter in figura
propono.
Sit FB linea plani reflectentis;

&longs;it D punctum reflexionis; &longs;it AD
linea incidentiæ, DH linea reflexionis, AB Cathetus incidentiæ, HF
Cathetus reflexionis, ADB angulus incidentiæ, EDF oppo&longs;itus,
HDF angulus reflexionis, CDB oppo&longs;itus, ADH angulus aperturæ
vel pyramidis reflexionis, EDC oppo&longs;itus, ADE angulus &longs;upplementi
anguli incidentiæ, HDG angulus complementi anguli reflexionis, re­
ctangulum BH &longs;uperficies reflexionis, BF &longs;ectio plani reflectentis, &
prædictæ &longs;uperficiei.
Hypothe&longs;is 1.

Aliquod corpus in aliud cum impetu impaction reflectitur, hæc hypothe­
&longs;is certa e&longs;t.
Hypothe&longs;is 2.

Corpus reflexum in aliud impactum aliquando illud mouet; &longs;ic pila ab
aliquo corpore reflexa in aliam incidens mouet illam.
Hypothe&longs;is 3.

Quo motus directus, &longs;cilicet qui &longs;is per lineam incidentia, e&longs;t maior, maior
e&longs;t quoque motus reflexus; &longs;i enim maiore vi pila appellitur in parietem
maiore vi etiam retorquctur.
Axioma 1.
Idem impetus ad plures lineas determinari pere&longs;t &longs;eor&longs;um;

hoc Axima
certum e&longs;t; probatum e&longs;t in libro 1. Th.113.114. &c.

dixi &longs;eor&longs;im, nam
plures &longs;imul lineas habere non pote&longs;t per Th.115.l.1.
Axioma 2.

Vbi e&longs;t effectus, ibi e&longs;t cau&longs;a, effectus inquam formalis, v. g. vbi e&longs;t album,
ibi e&longs;t id, quod exigit motum, &longs;eu præ&longs;tat illum motum in mobili;

id e&longs;t
impetus: quippe omnis motus e&longs;t ab impetu, quod &longs;æpiùs in toto libro
primo demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t.
Axioma 3.

Impetus destruitur tantùm ne &longs;it frustra per Sch. Theor.152.& alia multa
libro primò, &longs;i enim impetus &longs;uum po&longs;&longs;et habere effectum reuerâ non de­
&longs;trueretur.
Axioma 4.

Tunc dici non pote&longs;t tota cau&longs;a destructa (cau&longs;a inquam formalis) cum
tuus effectus non e&longs;t de&longs;tructus; &longs;eu tunc non debet dici de&longs;tructus totus
impetus cum totus motus non e&longs;t de&longs;tructus.
Theorema 1.
Datur motus reflexus;
nemo dubitat:

igitur certum e&longs;t de motu reflexo quod &longs;it; infrà verò videbi­
mus propter quid &longs;it.
Theorema 2.

In motu reflexo e&longs;t impetus; probatur, quia vbi e&longs;t motus, ibi e&longs;t impe­
tus per Axioma 2.
Theorema 3.
Hinc cau&longs;a motus reflexi e&longs;t impetus qui ine&longs;t corpori reflexo;

igitur nihil extrin&longs;e­
cum pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e cau&longs;a huius motus;

igitur aliquod intrin&longs;ecum, voco
impetum;

hîc diutiùs non hæreo, quia &longs;imile argumentum habes in ter­
tio libro, in quo fusè probaui requiri impetum ad motum violentum,
atqui nullus motus reflexus e&longs;t naturalis; igitur violentus vel mixtus,
igitur requirit nece&longs;&longs;ariò impetum.
Theorema 4.

Ille impetus vel producitur nouus, vel con&longs;eruatur prauius; clarum e&longs;t,
nec aliud excogitari pote&longs;t.
Theorema 5.
Ille impetus non producitur à corpore reflectente:

probatur primò, quia
omnis impetus producitur ad extra ab alio impetu per Theor. 42. lib.1.
Secundò probatur, quia corpus reflectens &longs;emper produceret impetum
in alio corpore applicato;
e&longs;&longs;et enim cau&longs;a nece&longs;&longs;aria;

igitur nece&longs;&longs;ariò
ageret per Ax.12. lib.1. nec e&longs;t quod dicas agere tantùm po&longs;ita tali con­
ditione:

hoc e&longs;t po&longs;ito motu præuio, quod &longs;atis ridiculum e&longs;t, vt iam
aliàs monui;

quia conditio nihil aliud præ&longs;tat in cau&longs;a quàm applicatio­
nem &longs;ubiecti apti, in quo agat, & &longs;ubtractionem omnis impedimenti;

atqui cum proximè pila parieti adhæret, e&longs;t omninò applicata, & abe&longs;t
omne impedimentum:
præterea &longs;i corpus reflectens ageret;

haud dubiè
&longs;i maius e&longs;t maiorem impetum produceret;

nec enim agit tantùm pars,
quæ tangitur;

alioqui globus qui tangit tantùm in puncto minimè re­
flecteretur; quid enim punctum agere pote&longs;t?

Igitur &longs;i tantùm agit, quo
maius e&longs;t plùs agit; quæ omnia &longs;unt perab&longs;urda; Igitur non producitur
ille impetus à corpore reflectente.
Vide Th. 40.lib.1.&c.
Theorema 6.
Non producitur ab vllo alio extrin&longs;eco;

non ab aëre, qui motui ob&longs;i­
&longs;tit;
&longs;ed nihil e&longs;t aliud extrin&longs;ecum applicatum;

Igitur non producitur
ab vlla cau&longs;a extrin&longs;eca:

adde &longs;i vis rationem euidenti&longs;&longs;imam, quæ Theo­
rema &longs;uperius mirificè confirmat;

quia &longs;cilicet maximè applicatur mo­
bile corpori reflectenti per lineam perpendicularem;

igitur per illam
maximè deberet agere:

quippè per lineam obliquam qua&longs;i tantùm allam­
bitur corpus reflectens;
cùm tamen deberet e&longs;&longs;e maxima;

igitur impetus non
producitur in mobili reflexo, nec ab ip&longs;o corpore reflectente, nec ab vllo
alio extrin&longs;eco; quia nihil pror&longs;us aliud applicatum e&longs;t, à quo produci
po&longs;&longs;it.

Re&longs;pondent aliqui produci à generante; &longs;ed quodnam e&longs;t illud
generans?
non cau&longs;a &longs;ecunda, vt patet; an verò prima?

&longs;ed quis dicat
moueri tantùm à Deo pilam à muro repercu&longs;&longs;am?

&longs;ed quidquid moue­
tur, inquies, ab alio mouetur, vt vult Philo&longs;ophus.

Re&longs;pondeo mediatè
&longs;cilicet, vel immediatè;

quippe illa pila à &longs;e ip&longs;a non mouetur, &longs;ed ab
impul&longs;ore mediante, &longs;cilicet, impetu impre&longs;&longs;o; &longs;ed hæc alibi iam indi­
cauimus.
Theorema 7.

Non producitur ille impetus ab ip&longs;o mobili, vt con&longs;tat nec enim exigit
moueri illo motu;
adde quod e&longs;t cau&longs;a nece&longs;&longs;aria;

igitur nulla e&longs;&longs;et ra­
tio, cur modò maiorem, modò minorem effectum, hoc e&longs;t impetum pro­
duceret; quod tamen accidit; &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt facilia.
Theorema 8.

Non producitur nouus impetus in reflectione pura: probatur, quia produ­
ceretur ab aliqua cau&longs;a:
illa autem e&longs;&longs;et vel extrin&longs;eca, vel intrin&longs;eca;

non producitur ab vlla causâ extrin&longs;ecà per Theor.6.nec ab vlla intrin­
&longs;ecâ per Th.7. igitur à nulla;
igitur nullus producitur;

vt cum duo globi mutuò colliduntur, vel vt &longs;it aliqua com­
pre&longs;&longs;io, quâ po&longs;itâ nouus impetus producetur;

non e&longs;t tamen quòd ali­
quis dicat motum reflexum e&longs;&longs;e tantùm à compre&longs;&longs;ione;

quia quò corpus
durius e&longs;t;

& minùs redit, meliùs reflectitur; &longs;ic marmor à marmore fa­
cilè reflectitur.
Theorema 9.

Hinc impetus ille, qui e&longs;t cau&longs;a motus reflexi, e&longs;t idem cum præuio con&longs;er-
uato; quia vel e&longs;t productus de nouo, vel præuius, per Th. 4. non pri­
mum per Th.8.igitur e&longs;t præuius.
Theorema 10.

Hinc potentia motrix, quæ priùs impegit mobile in corpus reflectens e&longs;t cau­
&longs;a huius motus reflexi;

quia &longs;cilicet e&longs;t cau&longs;a impetus, vi cuius mobile
mouetur etiam motu reflexo; hinc qui ludit pilá, verè dicitur cau&longs;a re­
flexionis pilæ, cau&longs;a inquam, &longs;ed mouens.
Theorema 11.

Corpus reflectens dici pote&longs;t aliquo modo cau&longs;a reflexionis, id e&longs;t, cau&longs;a no­
uæ determinationis lineæ motus; ni&longs;i enim occurreret paries.

v.g. non re­
flecteretur pila; quamquam dici debet potiùs occa&longs;io, immò impedi­
mentum prioris lineæ, ex quo nece&longs;&longs;ariò &longs;equitur noua linea, ve dicam
infrà.
Theorema 12.
Hinc habetur veri&longs;&longs;ima cau&longs;a reflexionis;

certè debet &longs;uum motum vlte­
riùs propagare;

igitur per aliquam lineam; quomodo verò determine­
tur linea reflexionis, dicemus infrà.
Theorema 13.
Hinc non destruitur totus impetus in puncto reflexionis.

Probatur primò,
quia motus reflexus e&longs;t ab impetu per Th. 3. &longs;ed non producitur nouus
impetus per Theorema 8. igitur e&longs;t impetus, qui erat ante reflexionem
per Th.9. igitur non de&longs;truitur totus, &longs;altem per &longs;e, in puncto reflexio­
nis.
Probatur &longs;ecundò à priori;

igitur &longs;i ad aliquam determi­
nari pote&longs;t, impetus non erit fru&longs;trà: ad quam autem determinari de­
beat, dicemus infrà.
Dixi, non de&longs;truitur totus impetus;

quia fortè aliqua pars illius de­
&longs;truitur in reflexione vt demon&longs;trabo, &longs;cilicet per accidens: dixi præterea
per &longs;e, quia per accidens pote&longs;t accidere vt totus impetus de&longs;truatur pro­
pter mollitiem vel corporis reflexi, vel propter aliam cau&longs;am, de quo
aliàs.
Theorema 14.

Ex hoc etiam habetur impetum non e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuum &longs;ed qualitatem perma­
nentem eamque durare, licèt à cau&longs;a primò producente non con&longs;eruetur &longs;ed ab
alia; vt iam alias demon&longs;trauimus.
Theorema 15.
In omni reflexione determinatur noua linea motus;

clarum e&longs;t, quia
non e&longs;t motus &longs;ine linea determinata, vt patet;

&longs;ed non remanet prior
linea;

igitur e&longs;t noua, igitur illa determinatur; cur enim potiùs, quàm
alia, ni&longs;i determinaretur vna.
Theorema 16.
Non determinatur à puncto contactus tantum;

quia ab eodem puncto
plures lineæ reflexionis procedere po&longs;&longs;unt;

non à linea incidentiæ tan­
tùm;

quia &longs;i tantillùm inclinetur planum eadem linea incidentiæ pote&longs;t
habere diuer&longs;as lineas reflexionis;

non determinatur denique ab ip&longs;o plano
inclinato quod diuer&longs;as lineas reflectit;

non determinatur, inquam, ab
his omnibus &longs;eor&longs;im &longs;umptis, vt patet, &longs;ed ab omnibus coniunctim:

quippe ab his determinatur linea motus, ex quibus po&longs;itis, & applicatis
nece&longs;&longs;ariò &longs;equitur;

&longs;ed ex applicatione i&longs;torum omnium &longs;eor&longs;im non &longs;e­
quitur talis linea;

quæ tamen &longs;equitur ex applicatione omnium coniun­
ctim, vt patet; igitur ab his coniunctim &longs;umptis determinatur linea.

Dices, linea incidentiæ non e&longs;t ampliùs, quando linea reflexionis
determinatur; igitur non pote&longs;t illam determinare.

atqui angulus inci­
dentiæ non modò dicit lineam incidentiæ, &longs;ed lineam plani, atque adeo
apicem anguli qui e&longs;t in puncto contactus; igitur po&longs;ito illo angulo
incidentiæ impetus determinatur ad lineam reflexionis.

Porrò quod impediatur omnis alia linea, patet ex eo, quod primo ip&longs;a
linea incidentiæ impeditur ne vlteriùs producatur ab impenetrabilita­
te; & duritie plani reflectentis; immò & omnes aliæ impediuntur, quæ
per ip&longs;um planum duci po&longs;&longs;unt.

Secundò, quod &longs;pectat ad alias, quæ citra planum reflectens à pun­
cto contactus duci quoque po&longs;&longs;unt, omnes præter vnam impediuntur,
quæ &longs;cilicet facit angulum cum plano æqualem angulo incidentiæ, vt
demon&longs;trabimus infrà.
Theorema 17.

Ideo determinatur impetus ad omnem lineam, quia impeditur prior linea;
clarum e&longs;t; ni&longs;i enim impediretur prior;

certè non determinaretur ad
nouam, quod certum e&longs;t:

impelleret autem per lineam perpendicularem in puncto
contactus erectam; &longs;ed propter priorem determinationem fit noua linea
mixta, de qua infrà.
Theorema 18.
Corpus reflectens impedit motum;

quia e&longs;t impenetrabile, durum, den­
&longs;um; &longs;ed de his infrà, quando con&longs;iderabimus impedimenta ratione
materiæ.
Theorema 19.

Corpus reflectens plùs, vel minùs impedit motum ratione diuer&longs;æ appul&longs;io­
nis: probatur, quia motus reflexus aliquando e&longs;t maior, aliquando e&longs;t
minor, de quo infrà.
Theorema 20.

Si corpus reflectens impingeretur in mobile, cui nullus prius ine&longs;&longs;et impetus,
punctum contactus determinaret lineam motus; vt demon&longs;trauimus lib.10.
moueretque globum, v.g. per lineam perpendicularem ductam à puncto
contactus per centrum globi per Th.120.& 121. lib.1.
Theorema 21.

Quò maiorem ictum infligit mobile per lineam incidentiæ corpori refle­
ctenti, e&longs;t maius impedimentum;

cum enim impetus agat tantùm ad extra,
vt tollat impedimentum;
certè quò maior e&longs;t ictus, plùs agit impetus;

igitur quò maior e&longs;t ictus, e&longs;t maius impedimentum, & vici&longs;&longs;im quò
maius e&longs;t impedimentum e&longs;t maior ictus; & contrà, quò minor e&longs;t ictus,
e&longs;t minus impedimentum, & vici&longs;&longs;im &longs;uppo&longs;ita &longs;cilicet eadem potentiâ
impellente, vt demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t libro primo.
Theorema 22.

Quando linea incidentiæ cadit perpendiculariter in planum reflectens e&longs;t
maximum impedimentum; quia &longs;cilicet e&longs;t maximus ictus, vt probauimus
lib.1.
Theorema 23.

Quò linea incidentiæ cadit obliquiùs in planum, e&longs;t minùs impedimentum, quia
e&longs;t minor ictus.
v.g.in fig.

Definitione.8. ictus per lineam GD e&longs;t ad
ictum per lineam AD, vt AD ad AB;

nec in his immoror, quæ lib.1.
& aliis &longs;ufficienter demon&longs;trata &longs;unt;

præ&longs;ertim cum de planis inclina­
tis;

nam perinde &longs;e habet inflictus ictus, atque grauitatio in ip&longs;um pla­
num;

nam BD e&longs;t qua&longs;i perpendicu­
laris; igitur ictus &longs;unt, vt &longs;inus anguli incidentiæ ad &longs;inum totum.

v. g.
vt AB, ad AD hinc per lineam, AD, e&longs;t minùs impedimentum quàm
per GD immò eadem e&longs;t ratio impedimentorum & ictuum; igitur im­
pedimentum in linea, GD e&longs;t ad impedimentum per lineam, AD, vt
AD, ad AB.
Theorema 24.
Hinc plùs, vel minùs determinat nouam lineam motus planum reflectens;

&longs;ed plùs vel minùs impeditur per Th.
23. igitur plùs vel minùs determinatur impetus;

igitur plùs vel minùs
determinat planum reflectens: porrò planum BD, determinat mobile
quod reflectit per lineam DG, & ni&longs;i e&longs;&longs;et alia determinatio per DG
reflecteretur mobile, vt reuerâ fit, cum linea incidentiæ e&longs;t perpen­
dicularis.
Theorema 25.

Hinc planum reflectens maximè determinat impetum ad nouam lineam
cum linea incidentiæ e&longs;t perpendicularis;

quia tunc e&longs;t maximum impedi­
mentum per Th.22.igitur maximè determinat per Th.24. & contrà, quò
linea incidentiæ e&longs;t obliquior, minor e&longs;t determinatio ad lineam no­
uam; igitur hæc tria &longs;unt in eadem proportione, &longs;cilicet ictus, impedi­
mentum, determinatio noua.
Theorema 26.

&longs;i enim planum ip&longs;um mobile impelleret à puncto contactus D;
certè impelleret tantùm per lineam perpendicularem, &longs;eu per lineam
ductam à puncto D per centrum globi, &longs;i v. g. e&longs;&longs;et globus, vt demon­
&longs;trauimus in primo lib.1. Igitur maxima determinatio, quæ po&longs;&longs;it inferri
à plano e&longs;t in ip&longs;a perpendiculari.
Theorema 27.

Hinc, &longs;i linea incidentiæ e&longs;t perpendicularis GD, linea quoque reflexionis
e&longs;t eadem DG;

quia huic e&longs;t maximum impedimentum, quia &longs;cilicet e&longs;t
maximus ictus; igitur maxima determinatio per Th. 25. &longs;ed maxima e&longs;t
illa, quâ mobile per ip&longs;am perpendicularem DG à puncto contactus D
retorquetur per Th.26. Igitur &longs;i linea incidentiæ, &c.

quod erat proban­
dum.

Probatur præterea, quia &longs;i linea incidentiæ e&longs;t perpendicularis
GD, non e&longs;t potior ratio, cur linea reflexionis inclinet dextror&longs;um ver­
&longs;us A, quàm &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um ver&longs;us H; igitur debet e&longs;&longs;e perpendicu­
laris.
Theorema 28.

Si linea incidentiæ cadat obliquè in planum, linea reflexionis non erit per­
pendicularis v. g. &longs;it linea incidentia AD, linea reflexionis non e&longs;t per­
pendicularis DG; quia tunc non e&longs;t maximus ictus, nec maximum im­
pedimentum per Th.23.igitur nec maxima determinatio per Theor.24.
igitur non fit per ip&longs;am perpendicularem DG per Th. 26.
Theorema 29.

Hinc linea reflexionis, quæ &longs;equitur lineam incidentiæ obliquè cadentem in
planum non tantùm determinatur à plane reflectente &longs;ed participat aliquid de
priori determinatione. v. g. &longs;it linea incidentiæ AD, linea reflexionis
DH;

non tantùm determinatur hæc linea à plano FB, alioqui e&longs;&longs;et DG,
nec e&longs;t eadem cum prima; alioqui e&longs;&longs;et DE, &longs;ed partim determinatur à
plano FB per DG partimque reti nec aliquid primæ determinationis, &
ex vtraque fit DH, vt con&longs;tat, quia quò linea incidentiæ e&longs;t obliquior,
planum minùs determinat per Th. 25.
Theorema 30.

Hinc quâ proportione planum minùs confert ad nouam determinationem,
plùs remanet prioris determinationis;

quò verò plùs illud confert, huius minùs
restat;

hinc, cum planum totam confert nouam determinationem vt in per­
pendiculari DD, nihil prioris remanet;

hinc &longs;i linea incidentiæ &longs;it pa­
rallela plano BF nulla fiet noua determinatio, tota priore intacta;

&longs;i ve­
rò &longs;it perpendicularis GD, tota determinatio e&longs;t noua, & nihil prioris
remanet; &longs;i demum lineæ incidentiæ &longs;int aliæ, confert vtrumque ad no­
uam determinationem pro rata.
Theorema 31.

Si pellatur mobile per AD in planum FB, determinatio lineæ reflexionis
erit qua&longs;i mixta &longs;inistror&longs;um;

&longs;i enim ex D propagaretur motus in E rectè
&longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um acquireret DF in linea BF, vt patet;

igitur &longs;i &longs;it linea inci­
dentiæ AD, noua determinatio per DH con&longs;tabit partim ex eo, quòd
planum reflectens confert partim ex eo, quod remanet prioris determi­
nationis, quod re&longs;pondet DF, & ex eo quod confert planum FB, quod
re&longs;pondet DP;

quia ictus per AD e&longs;t ad ictum per GD, vt PD ad DP
vel DG;

&longs;ed e&longs;t eadem ratio impedimenti eademque determinationis
per Theoremata &longs;uperiora; atqui ex DPDF fit DHGO. igitur deter­
minatio lineæ reflexæ e&longs;t mixta, quod erat probandum.
Theorema 32.

Hinc decre&longs;cit determinatio, quam confert planum iuxta rationem &longs;inuum
ver&longs;orum in GD. v. g. &longs;i &longs;it linea incidentiæ AD;

ducatur APH paral­
lela FB, determinatio quam confert planum, decre&longs;cit &longs;inu ver&longs;o PG;

&longs;i
verò &longs;it linea incidentiæ ID, decre&longs;cit &longs;inu ver&longs;o LG; atque ita dein­
ceps; at verò cre&longs;cit portio prioris determinationis lineæ incidentiæ
iuxta rationem &longs;inuum rectorum in DB v. g. &longs;i &longs;it linea incidentiæ AD,
cre&longs;cit &longs;inu recto AP æquali BD &longs;i &longs;it IL cre&longs;cit &longs;inu recto IL vel RD.
Theorema 33.
certè DF & DB &longs;unt æquales APPH;

item­
que ABPDHF &longs;unt æquales;

atqui determinatio lineæ reflexionis
e&longs;t mixta ex DFH;
igitur erit DH;

&longs;ed triangula DFH, DAB &longs;unt
æqualia & anguli HDFADB &longs;unt æquales:

&longs;imiliter &longs;it linea inciden­
tiæ ID, ducatur IN parallela AHIRNM;

certè duo anguli IDR,
NDM &longs;unt æquales;

idem dico de omnibus aliis lineis incidentiæ, &
hæc e&longs;t vera ratio po&longs;itiua à priori, de qua plura infrà;
certè per illum fieri debet;

quippe quod vnum
e&longs;t, determinatum e&longs;t, vt &longs;æpè diximus aliàs;

nec vlli fallaciæ &longs;ubiiciatur, non tamen &longs;olitariam e&longs;&longs;e
oportuit; quippe effectus po&longs;itiuus per principium po&longs;itiuum ad &longs;uam
cau&longs;am reducendus e&longs;t.
Theorema 34.

Hinc vides e&longs;&longs;e &longs;emper quatuor angulos æquales, &longs;cilicet, angulum inci­
dentiæ, angulum reflexionis & duos his oppo&longs;itos; allos verò quatuor
etiam inter &longs;e æquales, &longs;cilicet duos angulos complementi & duos his
oppo&longs;itos.
Theorema 35.

Hinc quoque reiicies illos, qui nolunt in reflexione impetum produci in mo­
bili à plano reflectente; quod reuerâ, &longs;i fieret nulla e&longs;&longs;et ratio æqualitatis
angulorum incidentiæ, & reflexionis, reiicies quoque aliquos apud Mer­
&longs;ennum in phænom.

alioqui etiam &longs;ine motu præ­
uio repellerent: vtrum verò in magnete admittendæ &longs;int, fusè di&longs;puta­
bimus &longs;uo loco.
Theorema 36.

Ex hac angulorum æqualitate tùm Captotrica infinita ferè Theoremata de­
monstrat in radiis vi&longs;ilibus, in &longs;peculis v&longs;toriis, tùm Echometria in reflexione
&longs;onorum.

vel Sphæricis concauis, à quibus mi&longs;&longs;ilia projecta per plures
lineas decu&longs;&longs;atas in eodem puncto ad idem punctum reflectuntur; vel
Sphæricis conuexis, à quibus mi&longs;&longs;ile proiectum à quolibet puncto dato
ad quodlibet aliud datum reflectitur.

Ratio e&longs;t, quia in circulo &longs;unt om­
nia plana;

quælibet enim Tangens planum e&longs;t; &longs;iue denique in Cylin­
dricis, Conicis, &c.

quæ omnia ex principiis Catoptricis demon&longs;trari
po&longs;&longs;unt:

adde &longs;i vis in hac Catoptrica ver&longs;atos e&longs;&longs;e debere, qui pilâ lu­
dunt, quos nunquam falleret ictus, &longs;i hanc rationem angulorum non mo­
dò perfectè callerent, verùm etiam ad praxim reducerent: immò po&longs;&longs;et
e&longs;&longs;e aliqua portio muri talis figuræ, vt &longs;emper inde reflexa pila per da­
tum cuniculum rectà traiiceretur.
Theorema 37.

In reflexione destruitur aliquid impetus, &longs;i talis &longs;it vtriu&longs;que determina­
tionis pugna, vt aliquid impetus &longs;it frustrà;

vt con&longs;tat ex his, quæ diximus
libro primo;

con&longs;tat autem in reflexione e&longs;&longs;e determinationum pugnam
per Th 31. & 32. pugnat enim &longs;uo modo prior determinatio per GD
cum &longs;ecunda oppo&longs;ita per DG; igitur aliquid impetus de&longs;truitur, &longs;i ex
tali pugna aliquid &longs;it fru&longs;trà.

Ob&longs;eruabis autem eundem impetum in eo­
dem mobili cum duplici determinatione perinde &longs;e habere in ordine
ad nouam, vt patet, lineam, atque &longs;i e&longs;&longs;ent duo impetus in ratione deter­
minationum: vtrùm autem aliquid impetus &longs;it fru&longs;trà per &longs;e, determina­
bimus infrà.
Theorema 38.
Si totus impetus destrueretur nulla e&longs;&longs;et reflexio;

quod maximè e&longs;&longs;et ab­
&longs;urdum & incommodum toti naturæ;

&longs;i verò nullus impetus de&longs;truere­
tur, &longs;eu per &longs;e, &longs;eu per accidens, daretur motus perpetuus;

quippe mo­
bile ad eandem altitudinem a&longs;cenderet po&longs;t reflexionem, iterumque de­
&longs;cendens ad eandem a&longs;cenderet atque ita deinceps; igitur motus e&longs;&longs;et
perpetuus, & nunquam corpus illud quie&longs;ceret, quod e&longs;t contra in&longs;titu­
tum naturæ.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;erua primò ex hypothe&longs;i certa haberi, dari motum reflexum, ex
qua colligo totum impetum non de&longs;trui.

Secundò ex hypothe&longs;i certa
haberi, motum reflexum e&longs;&longs;e minorem directo vlteriùs propagato, vt
con&longs;tat experientiâ, ex qua colligo aliquam portionem impetus de&longs;trui,
&longs;altem per accidens propter compre&longs;&longs;ionem, & alli&longs;ionem partium.
Theorema 39.

Maior e&longs;t determinatio, quæ confertur à plano mobili per lineam perpendi­
cularem incidenti, quàm prior, quæ inerat mobili;

probatur, quia nec e&longs;t
minor, nec æqualis, non minor;
alioquin prior vinceret;

non æqualis,
quia neutra præualeret;
igitur e&longs;t maior;

&longs;i vtraque determinatio e&longs;&longs;et
aqualis totus impetus de&longs;trui deberet;

igitur eadem e&longs;t proportio impe­
tus remanentis, quæ e&longs;t mixtæ determinationis ex priori, & noua;

nul­
lus enim impetus e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t &longs;ine determinatione;

igitur &longs;i tota perit de­
terminatio, totus etiam perit impetus, qui illi re&longs;pondet;

& &longs;i remanet
aliquid determinationis mixtæ, aliquid etiam impetus remanet, qui e&longs;t
ad priorem impetum, vt hæc determinatio re&longs;idua ad priorem determi­
nationem; quantum verò remaneat prioris impetus, dicam infrà.
Theorema 40.

Determinatio per DG à plano e&longs;t dupla determinationis prioris per lineam
incidentiæ GD; quod &longs;ic demon&longs;tro;
tùm ID producatur in O, denique ducatur NG:

prima determinatio
lineæ incidentiæ ID, e&longs;t per DO, determinatio plani e&longs;t per DG;

&longs;ed
DO e&longs;t æqualis DG;
nam DON, DNG &longs;unt æquilatera æqualia;

hinc determinatio mixta e&longs;t per DN, diuidens angulum GDO bifa­
riam;

igitur &longs;i &longs;it linea incidentiæ ID & angulus ID B. 30. graduum,
æqualis e&longs;t determinatio plani determinationi prioris lineæ;

hinc angu­
lus diuiditur æqualiter bifariam;

&longs;it verò linea incidentiæ AD produ­
cta v&longs;que ad E, linea reflexionis DH;
ducatur HE;

a&longs;&longs;umatur DT
æqualis EH:

dico determinationem plani e&longs;&longs;e ad determinationem
prioris lineæ AD vel DE, vt DT ad DE;

cum enim determinatio mix­
ta &longs;it per DH;
certè DH accedit propiùs ADDG, quàm ad DE;

igi­
tur determinatio per DG e&longs;t ad determinationem, per DE vt DT
æqualis HE ad DE; nam perinde &longs;e habent, atque &longs;i e&longs;&longs;ent duo impe­
tus determinati ad duas lineas, de quibus hoc ip&longs;um demon&longs;trauimus
tùm libro 1. Th.137. 138. 139. &c.

tùm lib.4. à Th. 1. ad Th.14.quippe
linea determinationis mixtæ e&longs;t diagonalis, vt &longs;æpè probauimus:

deinde
&longs;it linea incidentiæ per KD;
&longs;it DX linea reflexionis;

igitur quò
linea incidentiæ accedit propiùs ad perpendicularem GD, determinatio
plani e&longs;t maior, e&longs;tque vt chordæ NO, HE, Xque igitur &longs;i tandem li­
nea incidentiæ &longs;it perpendicularis GD, determinatio plani e&longs;t ad deter­
minationem lineæ incidentiæ, vt DY æqualis GS ad DG:

&longs;ed cum ex
Th.4. multa lux reliquis con&longs;equentibus immò & antecedentibus afful­
gere po&longs;&longs;it, paulò fu&longs;iùs explicandum, & demon&longs;trandum e&longs;&longs;e videtur:

itaque duobus modis, primò ex hypothe&longs;i anguli reflexionis æqualis an­
gulo incidentiæ, quod iam reuerâ præ&longs;titum e&longs;t; &longs;ed cum ex hoc Theo­
remate prædicta æqualitas angulorum reflexionis tanquam per princi­
pium immediatum po&longs;itiuum demon&longs;trari po&longs;&longs;it, ne &longs;it aliqua circuli
&longs;pecies, quo determinatio noua dupla prioris po&longs;ita linea incidentiæ
perpendiculari per æqualitatem anguli reflexionis, & hæc æqualitas per
illam eandem determinationem duplam demon&longs;tretur, aliam viam inire
oportet, vnde intima totius reflexionis principia eruantur, quod vt
fiat.

Primò certum e&longs;t, corpus reflectens in perpendiculari, (quæ e&longs;t cum
linea incidentiæ terminata ad punctum contactus ducitur per centrum
grauitatis globi reflexi) certum e&longs;t inquam corpus reflectens in prædi­
cta linea aliquando cedere, aliquando non cedere;

cedere autem dici­
tur cùm vel amouetur à corpore impacto, vel &longs;altem concutitur:
tunc autem nullo modo cedere dicitur, cum ab ictu nullo modo mo­
uetur.

Secundò, ce&longs;&longs;io, & re&longs;i&longs;tentia ita po&longs;&longs;unt comparari, vt vel ce&longs;&longs;io &longs;it
æqualis re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, vel ce&longs;&longs;io &longs;ine re&longs;i&longs;tentia, vel re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;ine ce&longs;&longs;ione:

porrò tunc e&longs;t ce&longs;&longs;io tota, cum nulla e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quod tantum accide­
ret, &longs;i corpus moueretur in vacuo;

quippe nullum e&longs;t medium quamtum-
uis rarum, & tenue, quod aliquantulum non re&longs;i&longs;tat, vt clarum e&longs;t;
id e&longs;t nullo modo mouetur ab ictu;

neque
enim excogitari pote&longs;t maior re&longs;i&longs;tentia;
cedit autem per motum;

igitur
&longs;i reflectenti imprimitur æqualis motus ab impacto reflectens æqualiter
cedit, & re&longs;i&longs;tit, &longs;i minor minùs cedit, & plùs re&longs;i&longs;tit, &longs;i nullus nullo mo­
do cedit, &longs;ed tantùm re&longs;i&longs;tit; &longs;i maior plùs cedit, & minùs re&longs;i&longs;tit, &longs;cili­
cet in infinitum, donec tandem in vacuo &longs;it tantum ce&longs;&longs;io, nulla re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia.

Tertiò, tunc impactum motum æqualem imprimit reflectenti, cum
impactum æquale e&longs;t reflectenti, tùm mole, tùm pondere v.g. globus A
impactus in globum B eiu&longs;dem materiæ, & diametri, modo nullus fiat
attritus partium, &longs;eu compre&longs;&longs;io, &longs;itque linea directionis connectens
centra per punctum contactus, quod in primo libro iam demon&longs;tratum
e&longs;t;
cum enim totus impetus globi A agat, & quantum pote&longs;t;

certè pro­
ducit æqualem;

nec enim aliunde determinari pote&longs;t æqualitas effectus
quàm ab æqualitate cau&longs;æ po&longs;itis ii&longs;dem circum&longs;tantiis, & cum impetus
in B impre&longs;&longs;us di&longs;tribuatur tot partibus quot producens æqualis in A,
vterque impetus e&longs;t æquè inten&longs;us;
igitur æquè velox motus per &longs;e;

cum
per accidens aliquando &longs;ecus accidat;

&longs;i verò reflectens &longs;it minor, idem
impetus paucioribus partibus di&longs;tribuitur;
igitur inten&longs;ior e&longs;t;

igitur
velocior motus, &longs;ecus verò cum maior e&longs;t, donec tandem tanta &longs;it moles,
vt plura &longs;int puncta in reflectente, quàm &longs;int in impacto puncta impe­
tus; tunc enim nullus imprimitur impetus, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis lib. 1.

Quartò, quod autem &longs;it æqualis re&longs;i&longs;tentia, & ce&longs;&longs;io globi B æqualis
globo A etiam certum e&longs;t;

tùm quia, &longs;i æqualiter mouetur, æqualiter ce­
dit, vt iam dixi &longs;i æqualiter cedit, æqualiter re&longs;i&longs;tit;

nam quâ proportio­
ne minùs cedit, plùs re&longs;i&longs;tit;

igitur qua proportione ce&longs;&longs;io augetur, re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia imminuitur: præterea cum re&longs;i&longs;tat per &longs;uam entitatem impene­
trabilem, duram &c.
certè &longs;i e&longs;t æqualis entitas, e&longs;t æqualis re&longs;i&longs;tentia;

quod etiam videmus in corporibus immer&longs;is eiu&longs;dem grauitatis cum
medio, ita vt tot &longs;int partes impellentes, quot impul&longs;æ;

nam
ideo &longs;i&longs;tit, quia e&longs;t æqualis determinatio noua priori;

nam vt &longs;e habet
re&longs;i&longs;tentia reflectentis, ita &longs;e habet noua determinatio, quam &longs;uo modo
confert impacto, vt &longs;uprà demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t:

Quintò, certum e&longs;t determinationem nouam e&longs;&longs;e iuxta proportionem
re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, & hanc iuxta proportionem minoris ce&longs;&longs;ionis;

vnde cum
nulla e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia, &longs;ed tantùm ce&longs;sio, nulla pror&longs;us e&longs;t noua determina­
tio igitur à termino nullius re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, & totius ce&longs;sionis ad terminum
æqualis ce&longs;&longs;ionis, & re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, acquiritur tantùm noua determinatio
æqualis priori:

&longs;ed qua proportione cre&longs;cit ce&longs;&longs;io, imminuitur re&longs;i&longs;tentia, & vi­
ci&longs;sim;
igitur cum æqualis ce&longs;sio, & re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;int in communi medio;

& cum à nulla
re&longs;i&longs;tentia ad æqualem acquiritur noua determinatio æqualis priori;

cer­
tè ab æquali ad totam acquiretur tantundem determinationis nouæ; igi­
tur tunc erit dupla prioris, quod erat demon&longs;trandum.

Sextò, præterea globus A impactus &longs;ine acce&longs;sione noui impetus non
pote&longs;t velociùs moueri, quàm antè moueretur;

&longs;ed per reflexionem non
acquirit maiorem impetum, vt con&longs;tat;

igitur velociùs, quàm antè non
mouetur;
igitur &longs;i con&longs;ideretur globus A impactus;

&longs;i e&longs;t æqualis re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia, nullo modo mouetur;
&longs;i e&longs;t maior re&longs;i&longs;tentia, &longs;ed non tota;

mo­
uetur quidem motu reflexo;

&longs;i verò &longs;it minor
re&longs;i&longs;tentia ce&longs;sione, mouetur quidem per eandem lineam, &longs;ed tardiore
motu, &longs;i adhuc minor mouetur quoque, &longs;ed velociore motu, donec tan­
dem in nulla re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;it totus prior motus;

&longs;i vero &longs;it minor re&longs;i&longs;tentia mouetur motu velo­
ciore, atque ita deinceps; &longs;i nulla qua&longs;i infinito:

dico qua&longs;i, quia &longs;i va­
cuum moueri po&longs;&longs;et per impo&longs;sibile, certè cum non re&longs;i&longs;tat, infinitè ce­
deret; igitur infinito motu qua&longs;i moueretur.

Septimò, vnde vides ab illo communi medio ver&longs;us vtrumque extre­
mum cre&longs;cere &longs;emper motum globi impacti;

at verò globi reflectentis ver&longs;us extremum nullius ce&longs;sionis im­
minui motum, donec tandem in illo extremo nullus &longs;it;

cre&longs;cere vero
ver&longs;us aliud extremum, donec tandem in illo infinitus &longs;it, eo modo, quo
diximus, id e&longs;t infinita ce&longs;sio, quam accipio ad in&longs;tar motus infinitæ ve­
locitatis; quemadmodum accipi pote&longs;t nulla ce&longs;sio, &longs;eu tota re&longs;i&longs;tentia
ad in&longs;tar motus infinitæ tarditatis.

Octauò, globus impactus imprimit &longs;emper æqualem impetum refle­
ctenti, qui pro diuer&longs;a huius mole diuer&longs;um modum præ&longs;tat;

&longs;i refle­
ctens æqualis e&longs;t æqualem, &longs;i maior minorem, &longs;i minor maiorem;

quippe
idem impetus in paucioribus partibus facit maiorem motum, in totidem
æqualem, in pluribus minorem, donec tandem &longs;i plures &longs;int partes &longs;ub­
jecti quàm partes impetus, nullus &longs;it motus; igitur nullus impetus, vt
con&longs;tat ex his, quæ diximus lib.1.

Nonò, hinc motus reflexus in perpendiculari minor e&longs;t ea parte mo­
tus, quæ reflectenti imprimitur;

vel enim imprimitur motus æqualis,
vel inæqualis, &longs;i æqualis, certè toto motu multatur globus impactus;

&longs;i
inæqualis, vel minor, vel maior;

tunc enim reflexus e&longs;t priori æqua­
lis; &longs;i verò maior imprimitur, fortè nullus e&longs;t reflexus po&longs;ito &longs;cilicet ra­
dio incidentiæ perpendiculari, minor tamen erit idem motus globi im­
pacti vlteriùs per eandem lineam propagati.

v.g.&longs;i &longs;it duplus detrahitur
priori motui 1/2, &longs;i triplus 1/3, &longs;i quadruplus 1/4, atque ita deinceps; &longs;i de­
nique infinities velocior ex &longs;uppo&longs;itione impo&longs;sibili detrahitur aliquid,
quod habet ad priorem motum proportionem minoris inæqualitatis in­
finitam.

Decimò, ex his rectè concludi pote&longs;t non produci infinita puncta im­
petus, nec e&longs;&longs;e infinitas partes &longs;ubjecti actu;

alioqui punctum mouere­
tur motu infinito, qui repugnat:

licèt enim dato quocunque motu
po&longs;sit dari velocior, non tamen cum dato impetu finito determinato &longs;i­
ne acce&longs;sione alterius; &longs;ed iam interruptam no&longs;trorum Theorematum &longs;e­
riem pro&longs;equamur.
Theorema 41.

Determinatio noua cuiu&longs;libet alterius anguli incidentiæ obliqui, vel acuti,
e&longs;t ad priorem, vt duplum &longs;inus recti eiu&longs;dem anguli ad &longs;inum totum. v. g.
&longs;it radius incidentiæ AD in planum immobile BDF:

ictus enim habent eam proportionem, quam ha­
bent grauitationes;

&longs;ed grauitatio in inclinatam AD e&longs;t ad grauitatio­
nem in horizontalem DB, vt DB ad DA;

nam ictus in planum AD per GD
idem e&longs;t cum ictu in DB per AD:
&longs;unt enim GDI, KDR æquales;

&longs;ed ictus in ID e&longs;t, vt
grauitatio in eandem ID;

hæc autem in inclinatam DI, ad aliam in
horizontalem DR vt DR ad DI;

igitur ictus in DI per GD e&longs;t ad
ictum in DR per GD, vt DR vel LI ad ID;
&longs;ed K b e&longs;t æqualis IL;
nam arcus KG & IR &longs;unt æquales;

igitur ictus per GD in DR e&longs;t ad
ictum in DR per KD e&longs;t vt DK ad K b; &longs;ed impedimentum e&longs;t vt ictus.
re&longs;i&longs;tentia vt impedimentum, determinatio noua, vt re&longs;i&longs;tentia;

igitur
determinatio noua in linea incidentiæ GD e&longs;t ad nouam in linea inci­
dentiæ KD, vt GD vel KD ad K b, & in linea incidentiæ AD vt AD
ad AB;
igitur vt &longs;inus totus ad &longs;inum rectum dati anguli incidentiæ;
igitur vt G d ad GD;

ergo noua per KD e&longs;t
ad nouam per DG, vt K q, ad G d;

nam vt e&longs;t K b ad GD ita K q ad
G d;

ergo noua per KD e&longs;t ad priorem vt K q ad KD, & noua per
AD, vt AC ad AD, atque ita deinceps; ergo determinatio noua per
lineam incidentiæ obliquam e&longs;t ad priorem, vt duplum &longs;inus recti an­
guli incidentiæ ad &longs;inum totum, quod erat demon&longs;trandum.
Theorema 42.

Hinc in ip&longs;o angulo 60. determinatio noua e&longs;t æqualis priori, id e&longs;t in an­
gulo incidentiæ 30. &longs;it enim prædictus angulus IDR;

certè RI e&longs;t &longs;ubdu­
pla ID, vt con&longs;tat;

&longs;ed determinatio noua per ID e&longs;t ad priorem, vt
dupla IR ad ID; ergo vt æqualis ad æqualem.
Theorema 43.

Hinc &longs;upra angulum 30.v&longs;que ad 90. noua determinatio e&longs;t maior priore,
donec tandem in ip&longs;a GD vel in ip&longs;o angulo GDR 90. &longs;it dupla prio­
ris, infrà verò angulum 30. e&longs;t minor priore, donec tandem in ip&longs;a &longs;e­
ctione plani FDB nulla &longs;it noua.
Theorema 44.

Ex his demonstratur acurati&longs;&longs;imè æqualitas anguli reflexionis cum &longs;uo an­
gulo incidentiæ;

&longs;ed quotie&longs;cumque &longs;unt duæ determi­
nationes, fit mixta per diagonalem Parallelo grammatis;

&longs;ed QZ e&longs;t pa­
rallelogramma, & DX diagonalis;

igitur determinatio mixta ex vtra­
que e&longs;t per DX;

&longs;ed angulus XDG e&longs;t æqualis KDG, vt patet, nam
XDG e&longs;t æqualis DXQ, & hic DQX, & hic QD d, & hic QDK;

igitur KDR, qui e&longs;t angulus incidentiæ e&longs;t æqualis angulo XDF, qui
e&longs;t angulus reflexionis: idem dico de omni alio.

Ob&longs;erua&longs;ti iam ni fallor primò determinationes nouas e&longs;&longs;e vt chor­
das arcus &longs;ubdupli incidentiæ.

Secundò planum reflectens qua&longs;i repelle­
re omnes ictus per DG, id e&longs;t per lineam, quæ à puncto contactus duci­
tur per centrum grauitatis, vt demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t lib.1. Th.120.121.
Theorema 45.
Nullus impetus de&longs;truitur per &longs;e in pura reflexione;

nam per accidens vt
plurimùm de&longs;truitur, vt dicemus infrà:
dixi in pura reflexione;
demon&longs;tratur Th. quia nihil impetus e&longs;t fru&longs;trà;
igitur nihil de&longs;truitur:

con&longs;equentia patet ex dictis; probatur antece­
dens, quia linea determinationis mixtæ e&longs;t &longs;emper æqualis lineæ prioris
determinationis, &longs;i remoto obice fui&longs;&longs;et propagata.

v.g. &longs;it linea inciden-
tiæ AD, quæ vlteriùs producta &longs;ine reflexione &longs;it, vt DE;

certè deter­
minatio, &longs;eu motus e&longs;t vt DE, vt patet:

iam reflectatur in D à plano
BF;

noua determinatio per DG e&longs;t ad priorem, vt DT æqualis HE ad
DE;

igitur determinatio mixta per DH e&longs;t vt DH, &longs;ed DH e&longs;t æqua­
lis DE;
igitur determinatio mixta e&longs;t æqualis priori;

igitur nihil im­
petus e&longs;t fru&longs;trà;
igitur nihil illius de&longs;truitur, quod erat demon&longs;trandum:

Idem demon&longs;trari pote&longs;t in quacunque lineâ; in perpendiculo verò
GD;

cùm noua per DG &longs;it dupla prioris per D d, id e&longs;t, vt DY æqua­
lis GD, ad DA; certè mixta erit DG æqualis DA.
Theorema 46.

Hinc omnes lineæ reflexæ per &longs;e &longs;unt æquales, quia &longs;unt &longs;emidiametri eiu&longs;­
dem circuli;
dico per &longs;e;
nam per accidens &longs;ecùs accidit;

hinc malè di­
citur reflexam perpendicularem e&longs;&longs;e omnium reflexarum breui&longs;&longs;imam
per &longs;e; quod licèt ita e&longs;&longs;e videatur, illud reuerâ e&longs;t per accidens.

Obiiceret fortè aliquis pilam reflexam nunquam ad eam a&longs;cendere &longs;ubli­
mitatem ex qua priùs demi&longs;&longs;a fuerat.

vnde pila eò altiùs a&longs;cendit, quò durior, &
leuigatior e&longs;t illa materia, ex qua con&longs;tat, planumque ip&longs;um leuigatius,
durius & ad libellam acuratius ita compo&longs;itum, vt &longs;it omninò horizonti
parallelum:

adde quod planum debet e&longs;&longs;e pror&longs;us immobile; &longs;i enim mo­
bile &longs;it, multus impetus de&longs;truitur.
Theorema 47.

Hinc licèt non po&longs;&longs;it e&longs;&longs;e motus mixtus ex duplici impetu ad diuer&longs;as lineas
determinato, ni&longs;i aliquid impetus destruatur, vt constat ex dictis;

pote&longs;t ta­
men e&longs;&longs;e linea motus qua&longs;i mixta ex duabus cum eodem &longs;cilicet impetu licèt
nihil impetus destruatur; e&longs;t enim maximum di&longs;crimen vtriu&longs;que, vt
patet.
Theorema 48.

Ideo perpendicularis reflexa e&longs;t reflexarum minima, non quidem per &longs;e,
&longs;ed per accidens;

quia cum perpendicularis maximum ictum infligat, fit
maior compre&longs;&longs;io partium, attritus, diui&longs;io; ex quibus nece&longs;&longs;ariò &longs;equi­
tur plùs impetus de&longs;trui.
Theorema 49.
Motus reflexus non e&longs;t mixtus ex motu plani pellentis & alio;

&longs;ed e&longs;t veluti occa&longs;io, ex qua re&longs;ultat noua determinatio mix­
ta, ratione &longs;cilicet impedimenti, eo modo, quo diximus; &longs;i enim pla­
num ip&longs;um nouum impetum imprimeret mobili, non e&longs;&longs;et pura reflexio.
de qua modo agimus, &longs;ed alia, de qua infrà.
Theorema 50.
Non datur quies vlla in puncto reflexionis;

appello puram reflexionem,
in qua nullus &longs;it attritus nec compre&longs;&longs;io, vel in mobili impacto, vel in pla­
no reflectente; prob.
quia mobile vno tantùm in&longs;tanti tangit planum;

igitur
nullo in&longs;tanti quie&longs;cit;

antecedens certum e&longs;t, quia eo in&longs;tanti, quo primò
tangit, habet impetum;

nec enim de&longs;truitur totus per Th.38.igitur in&longs;tanti
&longs;equenti habebit &longs;uum effectum, ergo motum;

ergo vno tantùm in&longs;tanti
tangit;
nec dicas impetum illum impediri;

nam ideo impediretur motus
pro &longs;equenti in&longs;tanti, quia tangitur planum primo in&longs;tanti;

igitur &longs;imi­
liter, non moueretur tertio in&longs;tanti, quia priori, id e&longs;t &longs;ecundo planum
tangeretur; idem dico de quarto, quinto &c.

ergo mobile omninò quie­
&longs;ceret, nec reflecteretur, quod e&longs;t contra Th.1.igitur vno tantùm in&longs;tanti
tangit mobile planum, quod erat antecedens propo&longs;itum: Iam verò pro­
batur con&longs;equentia;
&longs;i quie&longs;cit in puncto reflexionis mobile;

igitur eo
in&longs;tanti, quo tangit illud punctum;

&longs;ed eo in&longs;tanti non quie&longs;cit, quo reue­
râ mouetur;

atqui eo in&longs;tanti quo tangit reuerâ mouetur; quia moueri, e&longs;t
nouum locum primò acquirere per def.1. l.1.

Obiicies, primo in&longs;tanti contactus mobile tangit planum quie&longs;cens,
ergo non mouetur.

Re&longs;pondeo negando con&longs;equens, nam reuerâ pote&longs;t
mobile in plano immobili moueri.

Obiicies &longs;ecundò, mobile in puncto non mouetur; igitur in puncto
reflexionis non mouetur.

Re&longs;pondeo primò negando antecedens; qui
enim admittunt puncta phy&longs;ica, dicent acquiri po&longs;&longs;e motu punctum phy­
&longs;icum &longs;patij.

Re&longs;pondeo &longs;ecundò eandem e&longs;&longs;e difficultatem pro motu &longs;e­
quentis in&longs;tantis, quidquid &longs;it, &longs;iue dentur puncta &longs;iue non, cuius di&longs;cu&longs;­
&longs;io pertinet ad Metaphy&longs;icam, ne.no negabit motum reuerâ e&longs;&longs;e, cum pri­
mo nouus locus acquiritur, in quo non e&longs;t difficultas.
Obiicies tertiò, in puncto nulla e&longs;t &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;io; igitur neque motus.
Re&longs;pondeo primò, nulla e&longs;t &longs;ucce&longs;sio actu, concedo, potentia, nego;

Re­
&longs;pondeo &longs;ecundò, concedo antecedens, di&longs;tinguo con&longs;equens;

nullus e&longs;t
motus &longs;ucce&longs;siuus, concedo; in&longs;tantaneus, nego.
Obiicies quartò, nullus datur motus in&longs;tantaneus.

Re&longs;pondeo, nullus
datur in&longs;tantaneus actu nego, potentiâ concedo; quia quocunque dato
motu pote&longs;t dari minor.

Obiicies quintò, igitur motus in eo puncto non pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e tardior, &
velocior.

Re&longs;pondeo primo negando; nam vno motu in&longs;tantaneo actu
pote&longs;t dari velocior, vel tardior, quæ omnia facilè in Metaphy&longs;icis expli­
cantur, & demon&longs;trantur, ex quibus certè res i&longs;ta phy&longs;ica minimè de­
pendet.
Obiicies &longs;extò, authoritatem Ari&longs;totelis.

Re&longs;pondeo Ari&longs;totelem in­
telligendum e&longs;&longs;e de corpore projecto &longs;ur&longs;um motu violento, quod ante­
quam de&longs;cendat vno in&longs;tanti quie&longs;cit; quod etiam demon&longs;traui lib. 3.Im­
mò plerique &longs;unt inter Peripateticos qui tenent in puncto reflexionis
non dari quietem, in hoc &longs;cilicet reflexionis genere, de quo hîc agimus,
qui fusè hanc quæ&longs;tionem di&longs;cutiunt, nos breuiore methodo v&longs;i rem
ip&longs;am, ni fallor ex no&longs;tris principiis demon&longs;trauimus.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;erua primò, &longs;i planum reflectens cedit, vel mobile ip&longs;um, rem
aliter e&longs;&longs;e explicandam.

Secundò tribus modis planum cedere, primò per diui&longs;ionem partium &longs;i fran
gantur; 2°ree; per diui&longs;ionem &longs;ine fractione propriè &longs;umpta, &longs;ed cum ce&longs;sione.
Tertiò, &longs;ine diui&longs;ione, &longs;ed non &longs;ine compre&longs;sione.

Exemplum primi generis habes in charta, &longs;eu vitro, quæ dum reflectit fran­
gitur:
exemplum &longs;ecundi in cera molli, vel pingui terrâ;

tertii denique in men­
brana ten&longs;a, vel fune ten&longs;o:

&longs;imiliter mobile ip&longs;um tribus modis cedere
pote&longs;t 1°ree; cum diui&longs;ione partium, & fractione, &longs;ic dum vitrum à marmore refle­
ctitur in mille partes abit.2°ree; &longs;ine fractione, &longs;ed non &longs;ine depre&longs;sione; &longs;ic
plumbum deprimitur in corpus durum impactum, aut cera mollis.

3°ree; &longs;ine
diui&longs;ione, &longs;ed non &longs;ine aliqua compre&longs;sione, &longs;ic ve&longs;icca inflata reflectitur.
Itaque duo &longs;unt planorum genera.

Primum e&longs;t eorum, quæ non cedunt
præ duritie.

Secundum eorum, quæ cedunt vel per fractionem, vel per de­
pre&longs;sionem, vel per compre&longs;sionem:
per fractionem dupliciter;

primò &longs;i
alterantur tantùm aliquæ partes minutiores, vt fit in molliori lapide;

Secundò &longs;i per fractionem corpus diuidatur in partes notabiles, vt fit in
vitro, glacie; adde totidem genera mobilium.
Ob&longs;erua tertiò e&longs;&longs;e tres alias combinationes;

vel enim mobile reflecti­
tur à mobili, &longs;ed non pellitur à plano, & hæc e&longs;t pura reflexio; vel pellitur
à plano &longs;ine motu præuio, vel &longs;imul reflectitur, & pellitur à plano, quod
&longs;imul mouetur.

Ob&longs;erua 4°ree; cum mouetur corpus reflectens à mobili im­
pacto tres e&longs;&longs;e quoque combinationes, vel enim cum mouetur corpus refle­
ctens, reflectitur, &longs;eu retroagitur mobile impactum, vel con&longs;i&longs;tit, &longs;eu quie­
&longs;cit, vel non retroagitur, &longs;ed idem iter pro&longs;equitur.

Ob&longs;erua 5°ree; cum &longs;int
quinque veluti &longs;tatus corporis reflectentis;

nam vel e&longs;t molle, vel pre&longs;si­
bile, vel durum vel fragile, vel friabile, & totidem &longs;tatus mobilis, e&longs;&longs;e 25.
combinationes, vt patet ex regula combinationum, in quo non e&longs;t diffi­
cultas; igitur deinceps con&longs;iderabo reflexionem ratione potiùs materiæ
corporis, tùm reflexi, tùm reflectentis, &longs;it ergo.
Theorema 51.

De&longs;truitur impetus in reflexione ex multis capitibus: primò, ratione diuer­
&longs;æ determinationis, &longs;i talis e&longs;t vt aliquid impetus &longs;it fru&longs;trà, &longs;uppo&longs;ita
etiam perfecta duritie mobilis, & plani & figura apta.

Secundò, ratione
diui&longs;ionis partium vel plani, vel mobilis, vel vtriu&longs;que;

&longs;i enim alteran­
tur partes, fit qua&longs;i fo&longs;&longs;ula, quam &longs;en&longs;im &longs;ubit mobile, cumque &longs;ingulis
in&longs;tantibus &longs;it noua difficultas &longs;uperanda, &longs;emper inde imminuitur impe­
tus:
adde quod minor e&longs;t determinatio plani quod cadit;

igitur minor
e&longs;t motus reflexus;
igitur plùs impetus e&longs;t fru&longs;trà;
igitur plùs de&longs;truitur;

&longs;i autem planum vel ip&longs;um mobile propter fragilitatem in partes di&longs;si­
liat, etiam de&longs;truitur aliquid impetus; Tertio ratione impre&longs;sionis;
Quarto ratione compre&longs;sionis; Quintò ratione repul&longs;ionis; Sextò ra­
tione liberioris ce&longs;sionis; &longs;ed hæc omnia minutiùs videntur e&longs;&longs;e ex­
plicanda.
Theorema 52.

at certè minùs quàm par &longs;it, vt
&longs;i&longs;tat mobile;

de&longs;truitur tamen aliquid impetus, quia impeditur tantil­
lùm &longs;altem prima illa determinatio;

Secunda &longs;uperficies re&longs;i&longs;tit etiam in
maiori &longs;cilicet proportione, tùm quia impetus eua&longs;it infirmior ex primo
qua&longs;i conflictu, tùm quia paulò durior e&longs;t &longs;ecunda &longs;uperficies quàm pri­
ma, quod &longs;cilicet aliquæ partes qua&longs;i intrudantur in vacuitates interce­
ptas;
&longs;ic pila lignea multis ictibus confu&longs;a durior e&longs;t;

atque ita deinceps, donec tandem, vel totus impetus vincatur, vel
determinatio prior &longs;uperetur:

hinc &longs;i alterantur partes plani tantùm, mi­
nùs impetus de&longs;truetur, quàm &longs;i atterantur partes mobilis; quia impetus
partium mobilis attritarum totus de&longs;init, nec vllam vim ampliùs facit,
quod potiori iure dicendum e&longs;t, &longs;i atterantur partes vtriu&longs;que.
Theorema 53.

Hinc pluribus licèt in&longs;tantibus mobile tangat planum, non tamen vllo quie­
&longs;cit; alioqui &longs;emper quie&longs;ceret per Th.50.
Theorema 54.
Hinc cum atteruntur partes plani ab impactione mobilis, minor e&longs;t reflexio;

quia minor e&longs;t cau&longs;a, &longs;cilicet impetus, quæ minor e&longs;t adhuc &longs;i atterantur
partes mobilis, & minor adhuc, &longs;i partes vtriu&longs;que; quæ omnia con&longs;tant
ex dictis.
Theorema 55.

Cum re&longs;iliunt partes mobilis, destruitur impetus pen &longs;e, quia &longs;cilicet illa di­
ui&longs;io, vel &longs;olutio continuitatis &longs;eu plexus re&longs;i&longs;tit;

igitur impedit, &longs;ed omne im­
pedimentum detrahit aliquid impetus:

dixi per &longs;e, nam per accidens fieri
pote&longs;t, vt aliqua particula re&longs;iliens maiore cum impetu moueatur, vt pa­
tet aliquando experientiâ; quia præter priorem impetum, qui cum aliis
partibus illi communis erat, additur alius propter nouam alli&longs;ionem, &longs;eu,
quod mirabilius e&longs;t, cum aliqua particula ex maiore ma&longs;sâ diuellitur, im­
petus totius mobilis qua&longs;i migrat in particulam illam, perinde qua&longs;i ab
eo emitteretur, id e&longs;t cum antè totum mobile veloci&longs;&longs;imo motu ferretur,
particula auul&longs;a, eodem deinde mouetur.
Theorema 56.

Porrò re&longs;iliunt particulæ mobilis per omnes ferè lineas, quæ determinantur
per accidens à forma vel &longs;ectione diui&longs;ionis;

quæ enim dextror&longs;um &longs;eparan­
tur, dextror&longs;um eunt;
atque ita in omnem partem &longs;ine alia regula;

cur
verò ab ictu diuellantur partes, non e&longs;t huius loci di&longs;cutere;

&longs;ic enim
qua&longs;i finditur &longs;axum ex colli&longs;ione;

tùm quia ex illo omnium partium
&longs;uccu&longs;&longs;u &longs;oluitur illarum nexus;

tùm quia intruduntur aliquæ partes,
qua&longs;i ad in&longs;tar cunei, quæ aliàs diuidunt;

tùm denique, quia e&longs;t aliqua
compre&longs;&longs;io, cuius vires certè maximæ &longs;unt, vt dicemus alibi:

Exemplum
habes tùm in corpore duro, quale e&longs;t vitrum, cuius modicam laminam &longs;i
duriori pauimento impingas, hinc inde mille particulæ tumultuatim re­
&longs;ilient; tùm in corpore liquido, vt in aqua, quæ etiam ad corpus durum
alli&longs;a in mille guttulas di&longs;pergitur, quia eius partes facilè &longs;eparantur.
Theorema 57.

&longs;it enim v.g.pila ex molliori cera, haud dubiè ex impactione non
comprimitur quidem, &longs;ed deprimitur, nec amplius figuram &longs;phæræ, &longs;ed
portionis habet:

in qua reuerâ depre&longs;&longs;ione multus e&longs;t conflictus, nec &longs;uf­
ficienter prima &longs;uperficies re&longs;i&longs;tit, licèt aliquid impetus de&longs;truat, nec
etiam &longs;ecunda, nec tertia, quæ tamen re&longs;i&longs;tunt &longs;emper in maiori propor­
tione;

donec tandem vel totus ictus qua&longs;i extinguatur, vel determinatio
prior &longs;uperetur;
ex quo &longs;equitur reflexio, &longs;ed minor:

porrò minor refle­
xio re&longs;ultat ex mollitie mobilis, quam plani, cæteris paribus, & minor
adhuc ex mollitie vtriu&longs;que; in quo verò con&longs;i&longs;tat mollities corpo­
rum, & quomodo deprimantur &longs;ine compre&longs;&longs;ione, explicabimus tra­
ctatu &longs;equenti.
Theorema 58.

hinc cum in molliorem terram pila alliditur, qua&longs;i
emoritur eius &longs;altus;

hinc, &longs;i grauior ictus e&longs;t, qualis e&longs;t maioris vel mi­
noris pilæ è tormento explo&longs;æ, & mollior terra, qualis e&longs;t illa quâ vulgò
aggeres munitionum farciuntur, pila terram ip&longs;am facto foramine pene­
trat, cùm facilè cedat materia; nec inde amplius re&longs;ultat, cuius rei ratio
e&longs;t clari&longs;&longs;ima quia &longs;en&longs;im extinguitur impetus, nec angu&longs;tiæ foraminis
reditum patiuntur.
Hinc multâ lanâ muniuntur latera nauium contra maiora tormenta;

quippe globi vis &longs;en&longs;im emoritur in lana, quia &longs;inguli pili re&longs;i&longs;tunt; &
quia facilè cedunt difficiliùs diuiduntur, &longs;ed fallenti illa ce&longs;&longs;ione ictum
quoque fallunt, in quo non e&longs;t difficultas.
Theorema 59.
Quando fit aliqua compre&longs;&longs;io, distribuitur etiam impetus;

e&longs;t enim con­
flictus, & pugna partium inter &longs;e;
vides pugnam;

igitur de­
&longs;truitur impetus:

&longs;ed re&longs;tituitur &longs;tatim à potentia motrice media, quâ
&longs;cilicet corpus omne compre&longs;&longs;um plùs æquo, vt &longs;e&longs;e in pri&longs;tinum exten­
&longs;ionis &longs;tatum re&longs;tituat, producit in &longs;e impetum: porrò de hac potentiâ
agemus fusè tractatu &longs;equenti lib.2. porrò vel comprimitur tantum mo­
bile, vel tantùm ip&longs;um planum, vel &longs;imul vtrumque.
Theorema 60.
Ex hac compre&longs;&longs;ione &longs;equitur aliqua reflexio;

&longs;iue tantùm mobile com­
primatur, vt ve&longs;icca inflata vel pila;

igitur maior e&longs;t motus qui reuerâ impetus maior e&longs;t, quò
maior e&longs;t compre&longs;&longs;io, quæ maior e&longs;t, quò maior e&longs;t ictus;

hinc maximè
apta e&longs;t ad reflexionem pila, & ve&longs;icca;

&longs;i tamen excipias mobile duri&longs;­
&longs;imum in planum duri&longs;&longs;imum impactum;

tunc enim maxima e&longs;t reflexio,
experientiâ te&longs;te;

&longs;i verò planum ip&longs;um comprimatur, ex illa quoque
compre&longs;&longs;ione &longs;equitur noui impetus acce&longs;&longs;io:

Exemplum habes in fune
ten&longs;o, vel in membrana timpani bellici, in qua pi&longs;a tam facilè &longs;ub&longs;ultant;
emoritur tamen ferè totus prior impetus propter ce&longs;&longs;ionem plani;

&longs;ed ma­
xima fit etiam prioris impetus imminutio ex duplici etiam capite, nem­
pè ex compre&longs;&longs;ione, eaque duplici, & noua determinatione; &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt
facilia.
Theorema 61.
Si corpus in aliud impactum repellatur per productionem impetus.

v.g. &longs;i
duo globi mutuò impellantur, de&longs;truitur etiam impetus ex hoc capite, vt patet
experientia:

immò &longs;i globus in æqualem globum impingatur de&longs;truitur
totus impetus prior;
vt dictum e&longs;t alibi, de quo etiam infrà:

Ratio huius
Theorematis e&longs;t, quia aliqua impetus portio e&longs;t fru&longs;trà;

quia non pote&longs;t
habere &longs;uum effectum; igitur de&longs;trui debet.
Theorema 62.

Si globus in alium æqualem impingitur, ita vt punctum contactus, & cen­
trum vtriu&longs;que &longs;int in eadem linea, multa &longs;equuntur phænomena, quæ iam atti­
gimus lib.1.à Th.60.Primò, æqualis impetus in globo, in quem impactus
e&longs;t, producitur per Th.60.lib.1. Secundò, æqualis e&longs;t determinatio noua
priori;

probatur per Th.127.lib.1. Tertiò, de&longs;truitur totus impetus prior
per Th.128. hinc quie&longs;cit globus impactus;

cuius rei non pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e alia
cau&longs;a;

igitur tota ratio, cur de&longs;truatur totus impetus, duci tantùm
pote&longs;t ex eo, quod &longs;it fru&longs;trà;
vtraque certè æqualis e&longs;t;
igitur neutra præualet;

igitur globus
con&longs;i&longs;tit;
&longs;i quis enim diceret non e&longs;&longs;e æquales;
igitur altera maior e&longs;t;
igitur debet præualere;

igitur &longs;i prior e&longs;t, debet vlteriùs propagari motus
in eadem linea;

&longs;i noua, igitur debet tantillùm reflecti; igitur cum nec
vlteriùs producatur motus, nec retrò agatur mobile, vtraque determi­
natio nece&longs;&longs;ariò æqualis e&longs;t.

Quænam verò &longs;it huius æqualitatis ratio à
priori, difficilè dictu e&longs;t;

dico tamen petendam e&longs;&longs;e ab æqualitate glo­
borum;

cum enim determinatio noua &longs;it duplò maior à plano immobili
& duro;
certè à plano mobili minor e&longs;t, vt con&longs;tat, quia cedit;

igitur
quâ proportione plùs, vel minùs cedit, e&longs;t minor dupla;

&longs;ed maior glo­
bus minùs cedit, quàm æqualis;
quia ce&longs;&longs;io e&longs;t minor impul&longs;ione;

igitur
quando ce&longs;&longs;io e&longs;t æqualis impul&longs;ioni, æquales &longs;unt determinationes;

at­
qui cum producitur æqualis impetus, & imprimitur æqualis motus,
æqualis e&longs;t ce&longs;&longs;iò impul&longs;ioni, id e&longs;t æquè cedit, ac impellitur; cum tamen,
&longs;i maior &longs;it globus, non æquè citò cedat, quia tardior motus imprimitur,
& hæc e&longs;t, ni fallor, vera ratio huius æqualitatis determinationum, &
hæc vera cau&longs;a quietis globi impacti, de qua iam &longs;uprà Th. 40.
Theorema 63.

Cum verò globus impellitur in globum æqualem per lineam obliquam, num­
quam quie&longs;cit;
quod demon&longs;tratur, quia &longs;emper e&longs;t determinatio mixta;

fit autem primò linea
incidentiæ connectens centra FBA;

&longs;it EB linea incidentiæ faciens angulum EBC cum Tangente
NC;

determinatio noua e&longs;t ad determinationem priorem vt BG vel
ER ad BE, & &longs;i &longs;it linea incidentiæ DB vt BH, vel SD ad BD;

vides e&longs;&longs;e eandem viam proportio­
num quæ fuit &longs;uprà;

determinatio prior per EB e&longs;t ad
nouam per BF, vt BE ad BG;
igitur ducantur EP PL;

a&longs;&longs;umatur LI
æqualis BG, & GI, BL æqualis BE;

denique ducatur BI: dico BI e&longs;&longs;e
lineam reflexionis &longs;eu determinationem mixtam ex BG BL per Th.
137.lib.1.&c.

Similiter &longs;i &longs;it linea incidentiæ DBN, ducanturque DO.
OM, & a&longs;&longs;umatur MK æqualis BH, vel SD, dico lineam BK e&longs;&longs;e de­
terminationem mixtam ex BH BM, ex quibus etiam longitudo omnium
reflexarum facilè determinari pote&longs;t; quippe longitudo e&longs;t vt linea de­
terminationis mixtæ.
v.g. BI, BK;

&longs;ed determinatio noua
in perpendiculo FB e&longs;t ad priorem, vt FB ad BF per Th.62. igitur noua
determinatio per EB e&longs;t ad priorem vt ER &longs;eu &longs;inus rectus anguli EBC
ad &longs;inum totum EB, & per DB vt DS ad DB: idem dico de aliis.

Hinc colligo primò, omnes determinationes nouas in hypothe&longs;i glo­
borum æqualium e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ubduplas in ei&longs;dem angulis priorum determina­
tionum in hypothe&longs;i corporis reflectentis immobilis.

Colligo &longs;ecundò, omnes reflexiones fieri nece&longs;&longs;ariò per eandem li­
neam, quæ &longs;cilicet e&longs;t Tangens puncti contactus globi reflectentis, quod
valdè mirificum e&longs;t, & facilè ob&longs;eruabunt, qui Tudicula minore ludunt.

Colligo &longs;exto, cum angulus incidentiæ e&longs;t 60. lineam reflexam e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ub­
duplam directæ quæ vlteriùs produceretur; infrà verò &longs;exto e&longs;&longs;e maio­
rem, &longs;uprà verò e&longs;&longs;e minorem, e&longs;t autem longitudo lineæ &longs;inus comple­
menti anguli incidentiæ.

v.g. &longs;i linea incidentiæ &longs;it EB e&longs;t EG, &longs;i DB
e&longs;t DH, &longs;i VB e&longs;t VX.
Theorema 64.

Si globus minor in maiorem impingatur, qui ab eo tamen moueatur per li­
neam connectentem centra vtriu&longs;que impactus, reflectitur;

ratio e&longs;t, quia ma­
ior globus e&longs;t maius impedimentum, vt iam diximus Th. 131.lib.1.id
e&longs;t, vt clariùs hic explicetur, quæ ibidem tantùm obiter indicauimus,
noua determinatio maior e&longs;t priore, quia ce&longs;sio e&longs;t minor impul&longs;ione; &longs;it
autem.
v.g. globus reflectens duplus impacto;

igitur motus e&longs;t &longs;ubduplus,
quia &longs;cilicet impetus di&longs;tribuitur pluribus partibus &longs;ubjecti;

igitur &longs;in­
gulæ minùs habent;
igitur impetus e&longs;t remi&longs;sior;
igitur motus tardior;
igitur ce&longs;sio minor &longs;ubduplo;

igitur determinatio noua e&longs;t maior æqua­
li 1/2 hinc debet nece&longs;&longs;ariò reflecti, quia quotie&longs;cunque ad lineas op­
po&longs;itas ex diametro determinatur impetus, maior determinatio præua­
let pro rata per Th.134.lib.1. nam perinde &longs;e habet, atque &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et duplex
impetus;
quanta porrò e&longs;&longs;e debeat linea reflexa, determinari pote&longs;t;

diuidatur BF in duas partes æquales in u,
determinatio noua e&longs;t ad priorem vt 3. ad 2. a&longs;&longs;umatur Fb æqualis Bu;

igitur propter determinationem priorem oppo&longs;itam &longs;cilicet BA detra­
hi debent duæ partes toti Bb &longs;cilicet bu æqualis BA;

igitur linea re­
flexa erit Bu dupla totius BF;

&longs;it etiam globus reflectens, qui mouetur
ab impacto, quadruplus, determinatio noua erit ad priorem vt 7. ad 4.
fit Bd ad BA vt 7. ad 4. ex Bd detrahatur DH æqualis BA, &longs;upere&longs;t
HB id e&longs;t 3/4 totius BF; non pote&longs;t autem e&longs;&longs;e maior determinatio no­
ua priore quàm in ratione dupla, vt diximus &longs;uprà.
igitur tantum detrahitur duplæ, quantum additur motus;

&longs;i
motus e&longs;t æqualis, detrahitur duplæ æqualis priori;

igitur &longs;upere&longs;t æqua­
lis;
&longs;i motus e&longs;t &longs;ubduplus, detrahitur duplæ &longs;ubdupla prioris;

igitur
priori detrahitur 1/2 de quo infrà;

quod autem &longs;pectat ad longitudi­
nes linearum non e&longs;t difficultas; quippe determinatio minor detrahi
deber maiori.
Theorema 65.

Si globus minor in maiorem impingatur per lineam obliquam incidentiæ,
&longs;emper reflectitur;

quippè &longs;it determinatio mixta ex priore, & noua, quæ
determinari pote&longs;t, &longs;i aliquid à nouæ figuræ de&longs;cribatur;

&longs;it circulus
FQCD;
&longs;int diametri QD, FC;

&longs;it AI dupla AF, &longs;itque determi­
natio prior vt FA, &longs;i &longs;ecunda &longs;it vt AI, erit dupla prioris;

igitur corpus
reflectens erit immobile;

igitur &longs;i linea incidentiæ &longs;it EA, reflexa erit
AT, ita vt anguli TAF, EAF &longs;int æquales;

&longs;i autem determinatio no­
ua &longs;it ad priorem vt AH ad AF, id e&longs;t, v.g. vt 3. ad 2. po&longs;itâ &longs;cilicet li­
neâ incidentiæ perpendiculari FA in planum reflectens QD, quod certè
mouebitur per Th. 64. aliter procedendum e&longs;t vt inueniatur linea re­
flexa re&longs;pondens lineæ incidentiæ obliquæ;

diuidatur FAMK ita vt
KN &longs;it ad AF vt 3.ad 2. ac proinde AH &longs;it diui&longs;a bifariam in K;

de­
&longs;cribatur circulus KMNR, &longs;it linea quælibet incidentiæ obliqua EA;
producatur in B;
ducantur OX BT parallelæ AH;

a&longs;&longs;umatur AG æqua­
lis OX, & GS æqualis AB;
certè BS erit æqualis OX vel AG;

duca­
tur AS, hæc erit reflexa quæ&longs;ita:

idem dico de omnibus aliis lineis in­
cidentiæ; demon&longs;tratur eodem modo quo &longs;uprà in Th. 30. 31. 32. quæ
con&longs;ule, ne hic repetere cogar.
Theorema 66.

Si globus maior impingatur in minorem, per lineam incidentiæ connecten­
tem centra nullo modo reflectitur &longs;ed per eandem lineam primum motum pro­
pagat licèt tardiùs per Th.132. lib.1. in qua verò proportione retardetur
motus non ita facilè dictu e&longs;t; dici tamen pote&longs;t & explicari in fig.

Th.
63. &longs;i enim globi &longs;unt æquales, ce&longs;&longs;io æqualis e&longs;t impul&longs;ioni;

&longs;i globus
impactus &longs;it maior, ce&longs;&longs;io e&longs;t maior impul&longs;ione, vt con&longs;tat;

igitur, &longs;i globus
e&longs;t ad globum vt FB ad FB;

determinatio noua erit ad priorem vt FB
ad FB;

igitur quie&longs;cet globus impactus per Th. 62. &longs;i verò globus impa­
ctus &longs;it ad alium vt EB ad ER;

determinatio noua erit ad priorem, vt
BG ad BF;

igitur motus retardatus globi impacti e&longs;t ad non retardatum
vt FG ad FB;

quod &longs;i globus impactus e&longs;t ad alium vt DB ad DS, deter­
minatio noua e&longs;t ad priorem vt BH ad BF;

&longs;i &longs;it vt TV, ad VB, deter­
minatio noua erit ad priorem vt BX ad BF, donec tandem nullus &longs;it
globus re&longs;i&longs;tens; neque res aliter e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t.

Hinc vides duos terminos oppo&longs;itos, qui &longs;unt, nulla re&longs;i&longs;tentia, & infi­
nita re&longs;i&longs;tentia;

nulla e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia, cum globus impactus in nullum in­
cidit, &longs;ed e&longs;t veluti infinita ce&longs;&longs;io;

cum verò globus in corpus immobile
impingitur, e&longs;t veluti infinita re&longs;i&longs;tentia ratione huius motus;

cum verò
globus in alium globum, quem mouet, impingitur, &longs;i vterque æqualis e&longs;t;
e&longs;t etiam æqualis ce&longs;&longs;io re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ;
media e&longs;t æqualis ce&longs;&longs;io;

& inter nul­
lam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam & infinitam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam media e&longs;t æqualis re&longs;i&longs;tentia;
re&longs;i&longs;tentia autem con&longs;ideratur in globo impacto, cuius re&longs;i&longs;titur motui;
ce&longs;&longs;io verò in alio, qui motui cedit;

appello autem infinitam re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiam cui nulla re&longs;pondet ce&longs;&longs;io;
nihil enim aliud præ&longs;taret infinita;
igitur nihil prioris remanet;

cum verò nulla e&longs;t re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia, tota prior remanet, & nulla e&longs;t noua:

denique cum ce&longs;&longs;io æqua­
lis e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, tantùm remanet prioris quantùm e&longs;t nouæ;

igitur
vtraque æqualis e&longs;t: Vnde vides, ni fallor, perfectam analogiam, &c.

Ob­
&longs;erua&longs;ti ni fallor, quod in hac re poti&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;t.

Primò, tunc e&longs;&longs;e infini­
tam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, cum nulla e&longs;t ce&longs;&longs;io: vt in corpore reflectente pror&longs;us
immobili.

Secundò, tunc e&longs;&longs;e infinitam ce&longs;&longs;ionem, cum nulla e&longs;t re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia vt in vacuo.

Tertiò, æqualitatem ce&longs;&longs;ionis, & re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ æquali­
ter ab vtroque di&longs;tare; tantùm enim e&longs;t inter æqualitatem illam, & in­
finitam ce&longs;&longs;ionem quantum inter eandem æqualitatem, & infinitam re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiam.

Quartò ab infinita ce&longs;&longs;ione ad æqualitatem accedere nouam
determinationem æqualem priori.

Quintò, ab eadem æqualitate ad in­
finitam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam tantundem accedere, ac proinde nouam determi­
nationem e&longs;&longs;e duplam prioris; ex quo etiam probatur æqualitas angulo­
rum incidentiæ, & reflexionis.
Theorema 67.

Si globus maior impingatur in minorem per lineam obliquam &longs;emper re­
flectitur, licèt aliquando in&longs;en&longs;ibiliter, quia fit determinatio mixta ex noua &
priore, cuius proportio determinari pote&longs;t; &longs;it enim determinatio noua ad
priorem in linea incidentiæ perpendiculari vt Cd ad CA fig.

Th. 65.
vel vt AZ ad AF, &longs;it linea incidentiæ obliqua EA producta in B;

certè &longs;i determinatio noua per lineam incidentiæ obliquam EA e&longs;t ad
priorem, vt AZ ad AF;
&longs;umatur Bu æqualis AY;

ducantur Yu Au
dico Au e&longs;&longs;e lineam reflexionis, quia e&longs;t mixta ex AY & AB, vt con­
&longs;tat ex dictis; Idem dico de aliis incidentiæ.
Theorema 68.

Si globus in æqualem globum impingatur, qui æquali impetu in eum etiam
impingitur per lineam connectentem centra;

vterque retro agitur æquali
pœnitus motu, quo &longs;uam lineam vlteriùs propaga&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i in alterum glo­
bum non incidi&longs;&longs;et per Th.137.lib.1.&longs;i autem inæquali impetu mouean­
tur, non e&longs;t determinatum &longs;uprà; pote&longs;t autem &longs;it determinari, fig.

1.
Tab.1.&longs;it globus A impactus in alium B motu vt 4. eodem tempore, quo
globus B impingitur in A motu vt 2. certè globus B retrò agetur motu vt
4. quippè &longs;iue moueatur æquali motu, &longs;iue minori, &longs;iue etiam quie&longs;cat,
&longs;emper æquali motu à globo A impelletur; quod certè mirabile e&longs;t; pri­
mum con&longs;tat per Th. 135.lib. tertium con&longs;tat per Theor.128.lib.1.

Igi­
tur &longs;ecundum con&longs;tat, &longs;i enim impellitur motu vt 4.dum in contrariam
partem mouetur vt 4. multò magis &longs;i tantùm mouetur vt 2. & &longs;i tantùm
impellitur motu vt 4. dum quie&longs;cit multò magis motu vt 4. dum in
contrariam partem mouetur motu vt 2. at verò globus A non retro age­
tur:
motu vt 4. &longs;ed tantùm motu vt 2. vt patet;

quippe omninò con&longs;i&longs;teret,
&longs;i globus B nullum præuium impetum habui&longs;&longs;et; &longs;i verò habui&longs;&longs;et mo­
tum vt 4. tùm etiam A retroageretur motu vt 4. igitur motu vt duo, &longs;i
B impre&longs;&longs;it impetum vt duo.
Theorema 69.

certum e&longs;t, fit enim determinatio mixta ex noua, &
priore;
igitur e&longs;t motus, quod duobus modis fieri pote&longs;t;

igitur
ex vtraque fit BI;

certè determina­
tio noua e&longs;t dupla BG;

quippe ratione reflexionis e&longs;t vt BG, ratione
impul&longs;ionis vt BG;
igitur compo&longs;ita ex vtraque vt Bd dupla BG;

a&longs;&longs;u­
matur LP æqualis;

haud dubiè Bd, & Pd BL; certè determinatio mix­
ta ex Bd, BL erit BP, quæ erit linea reflexionis.

quippe
angulus PBF e&longs;t æqualis angulo EBF: alterum etiam deduco, omnes li­
neas reflexionis ad quo&longs;cunque angulos &longs;iue rectos, &longs;iue obliquos dum
vterque globus mutuo impetu ab æquali potentia in &longs;e&longs;e inuicem impin­
guntur, e&longs;&longs;e æquales, quod certè mirabile e&longs;t.

Secundò, &longs;i non &longs;it æqualis
vtriu&longs;que motus, &longs;ed motus globi DB &longs;it ad motum globi A vt AZ ad
AF fig.
Th.65. res ferè eodem modo determinari pote&longs;t;

quippè mo­
tus impre&longs;&longs;us à globo B per lineam perpendicularem e&longs;t ad motum im­
pre&longs;&longs;um A per inclinatam EA vt AZ ad AY; &longs;it autem linea inci­
dentiæ DB fig.
Th. 63. eiu&longs;dem incidentiæ cum EA fig.

Th. 65. igitur
globus A incidat per DB, & globus B per MB, ita vt punctum conta­
ctus &longs;it B, & linea connectens centra FA; determinatio noua ratione in­
cidentiæ e&longs;t vt BH, cui addatur HF æqualis AY fig.

alterius ratione
motus impre&longs;&longs;i à globo B;
tota determinatio erit BF;

a&longs;&longs;umatur MT
æqualis BF: dico nouam lineam quæ&longs;itam e&longs;&longs;e Bq mixtam &longs;cilicet ex
BF BM, quod probatur vt &longs;uprà.
Theorema 70.

Si duo globi inæquales inuicem impingantur per lineam connectentem cen­
tra diuer&longs;imodè po&longs;sunt reflecti;

Primò, &longs;i motus vtriu&longs;que e&longs;t æqualis, minor
globus retroagetur;

accipit enim totum impetum maioris globi, id e&longs;t,
impetum æqualem;

igitur retro agitur velociore motu in eadem propor­
tione qua alter globus maior e&longs;t altero, v.g. &longs;i maior e&longs;t duplus, retroa­
getur motu duplo illius, quo &longs;uum iter pro&longs;equeretur, ni&longs;i maior globus
occurreret;

at verò globus maior duplus &longs;cilicet alterius non retroage­
tur;

quippè &longs;i minor globus con&longs;i&longs;teret in puncto contactus, maior glo­
bus &longs;uum iter pro&longs;equeretur motu &longs;ubduplo;

quippe determinatio noua
e&longs;&longs;et &longs;ubdupla prioris, vt patet ex Th.66. &longs;ed accipit etiam impetum &longs;ub­
duplum illius, quem habet, igitur determinatio noua e&longs;t compo&longs;ita ex
duabus &longs;ubduplis;
igitur e&longs;t æqualis priori;

igitur non retroagetur, &longs;ed con­
&longs;i&longs;tet &longs;i duplus e&longs;t; &longs;i verò maior duplo &longs;uum iter pro&longs;equetur &longs;ed minore
motu pro rata, &longs;i minor duplo retroagetur.

&longs;i maior duplo &longs;uum iter pro&longs;equetur; &longs;i mi­
nor reflectetur;

quod &longs;i motu inæquali mouentur, vel maior mouetur
maiori motu, vel minor;

&longs;i maior, minor retroagetur, maior verò vel re­
troagetur, vel con&longs;i&longs;tet, vel eadem via mouebitur;

retroagetur quidem, &longs;i
noua determinatio compo&longs;ita &longs;cilicet ex impetu impre&longs;&longs;o à minore glo­
