bo, & determinatione reflexionis quam conferet globus minor, etiam&longs;i
quie&longs;ceret;
&longs;i noua inquam determinatio &longs;it maior priore;

con&longs;i&longs;tet verò,
&longs;i fit æqualis;

&longs;uum denique iter pro&longs;equetur, &longs;i &longs;it minor: quæ omnia ex
dictis facilè determinari po&longs;&longs;unt.
Theorema 71.

Si verò duo globi inæquales in &longs;e&longs;e inuicem impingantur per lineas obliquas,
&longs;unt quoque tres combinationes;

vel enim vterque impingitur motu æquali,
vel maior globus maiore motu, vel minor; vt autem habeatur linea, &longs;eu
determinatio cuiu&longs;libet globi, &longs;upponi debet primò linea incidentiæ al­
terius v.g. maioris.
Secundò &longs;upponi debet minor quie&longs;cere.

Tertiò, inue­
niri noua determinatio, quæ confertur maiori à minore quie&longs;cente, quæ
facilè inueniri pote&longs;t cognita determinatione noua, quam conferret &longs;i
linea incidentiæ e&longs;&longs;et perpendicularis; Quartò, debet inueniri determi­
natio noua quæ confertur à minore maiori ratione impetus, quæ facilè
inueniri pote&longs;t cognita determinatione huius impetus per lineam per­
pendicularem.
Quintò, debet componi determinatio noua ex vtraque.

Sextò denique, ex his habebitur determinatio mixta ex hac compo&longs;ita, &
linea incidentiæ producta, quod facilè ex dictis intelligitur; &longs;imiliter, vt
habeatur reflexo minoris, debent eadem præ&longs;upponi in maiore.

Obiiceret hic &longs;ortè aliquis mirari &longs;e quamobrem duo globi æquales
in &longs;e&longs;e inuicem æquali motu impinguntur vterque retroagatur, cùm po­
tiùs vterque con&longs;i&longs;tere deberet: quemadmodum quie&longs;cit globus cui im­
primuntur duo impetus contrarij, hoc e&longs;t ad lineas oppo&longs;itas determi­
nati.

Re&longs;pondeo cum eodem in&longs;tanti eidem globo duplex ille impetus
imprimitur, non videri vllam rationem, cur alter præualeat;

at verò vbi
iam impetus e&longs;t productus, pote&longs;t ad aliam lineam determinari, vt patet;
igitur ratione determinationis nouæ, quæ e&longs;t æqualis priori de&longs;truitur;

igitur, &longs;i nihil aliud e&longs;&longs;et, globus quie&longs;ceret; at verò ratione impetus
noui producti ab alio globo, vel eius impetu, retroagitur.
Theorema 72.

Pote&longs;t globus retroagi, licèt in aliud corpus non incidat: hoc e&longs;t vulgare,
mirificum tamen experimentum, &longs;it enim globus ECBL incubans
plano horizontali MLG, in quem de&longs;cendat planum, quod ni&longs;i globi
re&longs;i&longs;teret materies, re&longs;ecaret &longs;ectionem DHE.

Dico quod ab i&longs;to ictu
globus determinabitur ad duos motus, alterum centri K ver&longs;us A, alte­
rum orbis puncti D &longs;cilicet, vel C ver&longs;us E, ita vt initio motus centri
præualeat ver&longs;us A, qui citò de&longs;truitur propter affrictum partium plani;
vnde remanet tantùm motus orbis, quo &longs;cilicet globus rotatur ver&longs;us F;

nec e&longs;t alia ratio huius experimenti, in quo habetur quædam reflexio &longs;i­
ne corpore reflectente: pro quo ob&longs;erua fore vt experimentum meliùs
&longs;uccedat, &longs;i cadat ictus propiùs ad punctum C, quia diutiùs voluitur
orbis.
Theorema 73.

Hinc etiam ratio euidenti&longs;&longs;ima alterius experimenti, quod valdè familiare
e&longs;t iis, qui breuioribus globulis ludunt;

&longs;i enim ita proiiciatur per medium
aëra globulus, vt eius hemi&longs;phærium &longs;uperiùs moueatur contrario motu
motui centri, vel vt A&longs;tronomi loquuntur in Antecedentia, vbi globulus
terræ planum attingit, vel illico con&longs;i&longs;tit, vel retroagitur, ni&longs;i aliqua
portio plani inæqualis aliò reflectat;

cuius rei ratio e&longs;t duplex ille mo­
tus, quorum &longs;i determinatio æqualis e&longs;t, con&longs;i&longs;tit globus;

&longs;i verò determi­
natio motus orbis &longs;it maior, quod &longs;emper accidit in breuiore ictu; certè
cum præualeat, globum retroire nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t.
Theorema 74.
Globulus eburneus in alium impactus con&longs;istit quidem &longs;i centrum respicias;

at verò &longs;æpè accidit globulum circa centrum &longs;uum immobile motu cir­
culari & horizontali ad in&longs;tar vorticis conuolui;

cuius effectus ratio e&longs;t,
quia cùm prior impetus ideo tantùm de&longs;truatur, quia e&longs;t fru&longs;trà, & fru­
&longs;trà e&longs;t, quia æqualis e&longs;t determinatio vtraque per lineas oppo&longs;itas, de­
terminatio inquam motus centri;

&longs;i tamen globi deficiat æquilibrium, vt
&longs;emper reuerâ tantillùm deficit, in partem illam globus voluitur, vt vide­
mus in corpore oblongo, cuius dum vna extremitas pellitur circa cen­
trum aliquod voluitur;

&longs;ed de motu circulari infrà; &longs;ed tanti&longs;per &longs;phæ­
ri&longs;terium ingredi placuit, vt alios effectus motus reflexi demon­
&longs;tremus.
Theorema 75.

Cum pila coniicitur in parietem ad latus, re&longs;ilit in pauimentum, vnde ite­
rum repercutitur fallente &longs;altu;

ratio e&longs;t clara, quia quadruplici qua&longs;i
motu mouetur pila in vltimo &longs;altu;
Primus e&longs;t motus centri bis reflexus;

Secundus primus motus orbis, quo &longs;cilicet primum in parietem illi&longs;a e&longs;t,
Tertius motus orbus mixtus, quo ex pariete re&longs;i&longs;tit;

Quartus denique
motus orbis, quo mouetur po&longs;t quàm à pauimento repercu&longs;&longs;a e&longs;t, exem­
plum habes in pila rotata per planum horizontale, quæ obliquè in aduer­
&longs;um planum impingitur;

&longs;tatim enim ob&longs;eruas nouum motum orbis mix­
tum ex priori & nouo, in quo e&longs;t quidem maxima difficultas; &longs;ed de his
motibus mixtis agemus infrà lib. 9.
Theorema 76.

Cum pila emittitur rotato &longs;ur&longs;um pilari reticulo &longs;altus vt plurimùm fallit,
&longs;ecus verò &longs;i emittatur reticulo deor&longs;um acto;

ratio e&longs;t, quia in primo ca&longs;u
motus orbis pilæ e&longs;t contrarius motui centri, vt patet; inde fraus &longs;altus,
&longs;ecus verò in &longs;ecundo ca&longs;u.
Theorema 77.

Cum pila veloci&longs;&longs;imè ita emittitur, vt linea incidentiæ faciat angulum acu­
ti&longs;&longs;imum cum pauimento, nullus ferè e&longs;t &longs;altus;

quia cum parùm valeat vis
reflexiua ad angulum acuti&longs;&longs;imum;

quia prior determinatio ferè præua­
let, & remanet tota, non quidem intacta, &longs;ed vix &longs;aucia;

determinatio
motus orbis, qui promouet motum centri, iuuat priorem determina­
tionem motus centri; igitur vel nullus, vel modicus, i&longs;que celerrimus
fit &longs;altus.
Theorema 78.

Cum pila cadit obliqua linea in pauimentum non longo à pariete interuallo,
in quem linea &longs;ur&longs;um inclinata po&longs;t &longs;altum &longs;tatim impingitur longè altiùs
a&longs;cendit pilæ &longs;altus, ratio petitur à noua reflexione, quod facilè e&longs;t.
Theorema 79.

Cum pila obliquè cadit in iuncturam parietis & pauimenti, non reflectitur,
& tunc maximè fallit &longs;altus;

ratio e&longs;t, quia e&longs;t duplex punctum conta­
ctus;
igitur determinationum nouarum conflictus;

quippè paries ver&longs;us
pauimentum;

hoc verò ver&longs;us parietem repellit; igitur tantùm &longs;upere&longs;t,
vt in pauimento rotetur &longs;ine &longs;altu, quod accidit ad omnem angulum in­
cidentiæ obliquum, vt patet experientiâ, cuius ratio communis e&longs;t.
Theorema 80.

Cum leniore affrictu pilæ funis perstringitur vel, vt aiunt, crispatur, &longs;altus
etiam ludentis manum frustratur; quia motus orbis mutatur in illo funis
incu&longs;&longs;u, vt patet.
Theorema 81.

Denique, cum reticulo motus orbis is a intorquetur, vt vel circulo horizon­
tali, vel alteri inclinato &longs;it parallelus, &longs;altus pilæ fallaciæ &longs;ube&longs;t;

quippe à
priori determinatione motus orbis tuebatur;

omitto inæqualitatem pa­
uimenti, quæ &longs;altum pilæ &longs;æpi&longs;&longs;imè à &longs;ua linea detorquet; &longs;ed fortè &longs;atis
lu&longs;um e&longs;t.
Theorema 82.

Cum planus lapis per lineam incidentiæ valdè obliquam in &longs;uperficiem
aquæ proijcitur, qua&longs;i repit lapis in ip&longs;a &longs;uperficie &longs;eu plurimo &longs;altu di&longs;currit;

quia &longs;cilicet modica re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;ufficit ad reflexionem, cum angulus in­
cidentiæ e&longs;t obliquior, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis;

immò tantillùm portio anthica attollatur: cur autem, &
quomodo re&longs;i&longs;tat &longs;uperficies aquæ, dicemus &longs;uo loco.
Theorema 83.

Immò &longs;æpiùs accidit maiorum tormentorum pilas ab aqua reflecti aliquo­
ties, vt multis experimentis comprobatum e&longs;t;

nec enim ab interiore maris
fundo reflecti po&longs;&longs;unt, &longs;ed lineam incidentiæ valdè obliquam e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;­
&longs;e e&longs;t; habes egregium experimentum apud Mercennum in phœn.

Balli&longs;t propo&longs;itione 25. ab illu&longs;tri viro petro Petito ob&longs;eruatum, quo
duntaxat a&longs;&longs;erit pilam è tormento ferreo 10 pedes longo, & horizontali
parallelo emi&longs;&longs;am, quinquies à &longs;uperficie Oceani reflexam fui&longs;&longs;e; &longs;ed de
hoc paulò pò&longs;t.
Theorema 84.

Addo vnum, quod &longs;æpiùs ob&longs;eruatum e&longs;t in illo iactu planorum lapidum,
quòd &longs;cilicet &longs;ub finem iactus qua&longs;i in orbem dextror&longs;um reflectantur;

quia faciliùs de&longs;truitur motus centri, quàm
motus orbis;

vnde &longs;ub finem hic illum in &longs;uas partes trahit, dextror&longs;um
&longs;cilicet, &longs;i dextra proiiciatur lapis;

quia duobus primis digitis po&longs;terior
lapidis portio &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um inflectitur; igitur anterior dextror&longs;um, in
quo non e&longs;t difficultas.
Theorema 85.

Cum proiicitur globus in aquam per lineam incidentiæ obliquam, &longs;i non re­
flectitur ab ip&longs;a &longs;uperficie aquæ;

incuruatur eius linea producta per mediam
aquam, v.g. &longs;it vas ABD G, &longs;olidum aquæ va&longs;e contentum CBDF;

li­
nea obliqua incidentiæ globi projecti IH, producta HD:

dico quod
frangetur in H, & qua&longs;i refringetur in HE;
experientia certi&longs;&longs;ima e&longs;t;

quod autem &longs;it aliquid determinationis nouæ
in H, patet ex eo quod angulus incidentiæ &longs;it valdè obliquus, reflectitur
globus; igitur in altero angulo incidentiæ debet e&longs;&longs;e aliquid nouæ de­
terminationis.
Secundò, quia plùs re&longs;i&longs;tit aqua, quàm aër;

Et fortè dici po&longs;&longs;et refractio motus, quæ pror&longs;us e&longs;t
contraria refractioni luminis;

quippe refractio luminis talis e&longs;t, vt radius
primo medio raro in den&longs;um incidens incuruetur ad perpendicularem,
cum tamen linea motus obliquè incidens è medio raro in den&longs;um incur-
uetur à perpendiculari:

quippe lumen qualitas e&longs;t, vt impetus; quod
tamen ad rem præ&longs;entem nihil pror&longs;us facit.
Theorema 86.

Ob&longs;eruabis tamen primò, vix hoc di&longs;cerni po&longs;&longs;e, ni&longs;i &longs;it maxima vis
motus;

quippe grauitas corporis defert corpus deor&longs;um; vnde vis illa
grauitationis impedit, ne corpus reflectat &longs;eu re&longs;iliat &longs;ur&longs;um Secundò, &longs;i
corpus in aquam projectum &longs;it leuius aqua, non modò hæc refractio &longs;en­
&longs;ibilis e&longs;t, verùm etiam illa perpetua refractionum &longs;eries, quia aqua &longs;em­
per attollit &longs;ur&longs;um corpus leuius.

Tertiò, in corpore oblongo hoc expe­
rimentum maximè probatur, quia plures partes aquæ &longs;imul reflectunt.
Theorema 87.
Linea motus refracti non e&longs;t recta, prob.

quia cum in &longs;ingulis punctis
aquæ ferè mutetur, curuam e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t.
Theorema 88.

Hinc optima ratio ducitur, cur globus ex tormento excu&longs;&longs;us ad angulum
incidentiæ valdè acutum &longs;uperficiem aquæ penetret;

ex qua denuò emergit
qua&longs;i per arcum primum deor&longs;um;

tùm demum &longs;ur&longs;um inflexum immò
plures accidunt huiu&longs;modi repetitæ emer&longs;iones:

hinc valdè falluntur,
qui credunt ab ip&longs;o fundo maris globum repercuti; quod plu&longs;quàm ri­
diculum e&longs;t; hoc quoque experimentum in projectis &longs;axis &longs;æpiùs ob&longs;eruaui.
Theorema 89.

Hinc cum &longs;axa planiora &longs;unt in medio aëre &longs;imile ob&longs;eruari pote&longs;t experi­
mentum;

nam po&longs;t aliquem de&longs;cen&longs;um iterum a&longs;cendit &longs;axum; nec e&longs;t
quod aliquis vento flanti cau&longs;am huius effectus tribuat, qui &longs;emper acci­
dit etiam valdè &longs;ereno cœlo.
Theorema 90.

Hinc cau&longs;a euidens illius a&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;agittæ quamtumuis per lineam horizon­
ti parallelam emitatur;

quippè ab aëre inferiori qua&longs;i repercutitur, ali­
quid &longs;imile coniicio in glandibus ex tormento explo&longs;is;

e&longs;t enim aliquis
quamuis in&longs;en&longs;ibilis a&longs;cen&longs;us;

hinc fortè ratio, cur in &longs;copum lineas di­
rectionis horizonti parallelæ re&longs;pondentem globus incidat, cùm infra
&longs;copum cadere deberet, vt reuerâ fit in notabili di&longs;tantia propter mo­
tum mixtum;

exemplum huius effectus clari&longs;&longs;imum video in illis auicu­
lis, quæ per &longs;altus, vel arcus huiu&longs;modi volant; primò enim de&longs;cendere
videntur, &longs;ed vix a&longs;cendunt.
Theorema 91.

Pote&longs;t determinari proportio anguli huius refractionis motus, &longs;i cogno&longs;catur
re&longs;i&longs;tentia, qua medium re&longs;istit perpendiculari;

quippe frangitur ab ip&longs;a den&longs;itate aquæ
vis primi impetus, quo &longs;cilicet per liberiorem aëra priùs ferebatur:

vnde
&longs;i habeatur proportio re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ aquæ po&longs;ita linea incidentiæ perpendi­
culari, non e&longs;t dubium, quin habeatur etiam re&longs;i&longs;tentia po&longs;ita linea in­
cidentiæ obliqua; nam eodem modo hoc determinandum e&longs;t, quo &longs;uprà
determinatum fuit Th. 66. 67. v. g. in fig.

Th. 65. determinatio noua
po&longs;ita perpendiculari &longs;it ad priorem vt AZ ad AF, ita vt per mediam
aquam conficiat tantùm &longs;patium Ad v. g. eo tempore, quo in libero aë­
re conficit AC;

certè &longs;i linea incidentiæ &longs;it inclinata EA, determinatio
noua erit ad priorem, vt AY ad AE, vel AB;

igitur fiet mixta ex AY
AB, &longs;cilicet Au;

non tamen eo tempore conficiet Au, quo conficiet
Ad;
quia &longs;cilicet omnes partes aquæ re&longs;i&longs;tunt, vt con&longs;tat;

igitur con­

LIBER SEPTIMVS,
DE MOTV CIRCVLARI.
