cularis, eius affectiones breuiter in hoc libro
demon&longs;trantur.
DEFINITIO 1.

MOtus circularis e&longs;t, cuius linea æqualiter in omnibus &longs;uis punctis à com­
muni centro distat. v. g. &longs;i punctum in periphæria circuli moue­
retur.
Definitio 2.

Radius motus e&longs;t linea recta ducta ab illo communi centro ad periphæ­
riam.
Definitio 3.
Arcus e&longs;t pars periphæria maior, vel minor.
Definitio 4.

Tangens e&longs;t linea, quæ tangit periphæriam in vnico puncto, quam tamen
non &longs;ecat; hæc omnia clara &longs;unt, immò vulgaria.
Hypothe&longs;is 1.

Si dum rota vertitur imponatur eius &longs;umma &longs;uperficiei aliquod mobile,
proijcitur à rota, &longs;eu potiùs amouetur; res clara e&longs;t in molari lapide, in
funda, &c.
Axioma 1.

Illa mouentur æqualiter, quæ temporibus æqualibus aqualia &longs;patia percur­
runt; inæqualiter verò qua inæqualia; qua maiora, celeriùs; tardiùs, qua
minora.
Axioma 2.
Qua &longs;imul incipiunt moueri, & de&longs;inunt, aquali tempore mouentur.
Theorema 1.
Datur motus circularis.

Probatur infinitis ferè experimentis; primò in
librâ cuius brachia motu tantùm circulari de&longs;cendunt.

Secundò in ve­
cte, qui etiam mouetur circulari motu;

Tertiò in turbine, rota molari,
liquore contento intra vas &longs;phæricum; Quartò in funependulo vibrato.
Probatur &longs;ecundò;

quia pote&longs;t imprimi impetus vtrique extremitati ci­
lindri in partes oppo&longs;itas, &longs;it enim cilindrus, vel parallelipedum LC,
cuius extremitati imprimatur impetus, per lineam CP, itemque extre­
mitati L æqualis per lineam LG oppo&longs;itam CP. Dico, quod mouebitur
circulariter circa centrum K, ita vt extremitas L conficiat arcum LB &
C arcum CE;
nec enim C moueri pote&longs;t per CP neque L per LM;
quippe cùm &longs;it æqualis impetus, neutra extremitas præualere pote&longs;t:

non
vtraque, quia MP e&longs;t maior LC;

nec dici pote&longs;t neutram moueri, cum
moueri po&longs;&longs;it L per arcum LT, & C per arcum CS;

quippe impetus
e&longs;t indifferens ad omnem lineam; & hæc e&longs;t ratio à priori circularis
motus de qua fusè infrà.

Ob&longs;eruabis motum circularem ab iis negari, qui ex punctis mathema­
ticis continuum componunt;

quia ex eo &longs;equeretur non po&longs;&longs;e dari mo­
tum continuum velociorem, vel tardiorem, quod ridiculum e&longs;t;

&longs;i enim
punctum Q æquali tempore moueatur cum puncto C certè arcus QR
quem percurrit eo tempore, quo C percurrit arcum CS, e&longs;&longs;et æqualis
arcui CS, quod e&longs;t ab&longs;urdum;

quod certè ne admittere cogantur, mo­
tum circularem negant, quod æquè ab&longs;urdum e&longs;t;

præ&longs;ertim eum ad vi­
tandum motum circularem infinita quoque ab&longs;urda deglutiant, ma­
nife&longs;tis experimentis contradicant, oculos ip&longs;os intuentium præ&longs;tigiis
illudi a&longs;&longs;erant, ferreum vectem dum mouetur in mille partes diffringi
etiam iurent; &longs;ed hæc omitto.
Theorema 2.

haud dubiè non mouere­
tur per arcum LB, &longs;ed per rectam LM; igitur ille motus non e&longs;&longs;et cir­
cularis.
Theorema 3.
Hinc motus circularis oritur ex recto impedito in &longs;ingulis punctis:

dixi in
&longs;ingulis punctis;

quia licèt in puncto L impediretur, non tamen in &longs;e­
quenti;

e&longs;&longs;et quidem noua linea determinationis, non tamen curua; &longs;i
tamen in &longs;ingulis punctis impediatur æquali &longs;emper radio, haud dubiè
e&longs;t circularis.

Ob&longs;eruabis dictum e&longs;&longs;e &longs;upra in &longs;ublunaribus quia corpora cœle&longs;tia
mouentur motu circulari non habita vlla ratione motus recti, de quo
&longs;uo loco.
Theorema 4.

Hinc &longs;ingulis instantibus punctum dum mouetur circa centrum K deter­
minatur ad nouam lineam;
quia &longs;cilicet &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus impeditur;

igitur &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus nouam determinationem accipit; e&longs;t enim ea­
dem ratio pro &longs;ecundo in&longs;tanti, quæ e&longs;t pro primo, itemque pro tertio,
quarto, &c.
Theorema 5.

Hinc tot &longs;unt determinationes &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus re&longs;pondentes, quot &longs;unt
Tangentes in circulo;

quippè in &longs;ingulis punctis determinatur ad Tan­
gentem;
&longs;ed impeditur denuò pro &longs;equenti in&longs;tanti;

igitur ad nouam
Tangentem determinatur;

e&longs;t autem hæc veri&longs;&longs;ima motus circularis ra­
tio;

quod &longs;cilicet cum &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus æqualiter impediatur motus
rectus;

quia altera mobilis extremitas accedere non pote&longs;t, &longs;ingulis quo­
que in&longs;tantibus ad nouam Tangentem determinatur æquali &longs;emper ra­
dio; vnde nece&longs;&longs;ariò &longs;equitur motus circularis.
Theorema 6.

Hinc reiicies aliquem recentiorem, qui vult motum circularem e&longs;&longs;e mixtum
ex duobus rectis, quorum alter &longs;it vt &longs;inus recti, alter verò vt &longs;inus ver&longs;i, &longs;it
enim quadrans KCE; &longs;it impetus per EK, & per EO, vel duplex, vel
idem determinatus ad duas i&longs;tas lineas, ita vt determinatio per EK &longs;it
ad determinationem EO, vt &longs;inus ver&longs;i ad rectos.

v. g. a&longs;&longs;umpto arcu
EM, vt EN ad NM; certè hoc po&longs;ito debet moueri punctum E per li­
neam circularem EMC.

&longs;icut rectus pote&longs;t ex duobus circularibus ori­
ri, vt dicemus aliàs;

non tamen inde &longs;equitur omnem motum circula­
rem e&longs;&longs;e mixtum ex duobus rectis, quod nemo non videt:

quippe po&longs;ito
quòd radius KE &longs;it affixus immobiliter centro K, licèt pellatur tantùm,
per Tangentem EO etiam cum valido impetu, nihilo tamen minus mo­
tu circulari mouebitur:

nec enim motus illi recti, ex quibus circularis qua&longs;i
na&longs;ceretur, æquales e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;unt;

igitur &longs;ufficit vnius impetus ad vnam
tantùm lineam primo in&longs;tanti determinatus v.g. ad Tangentem EO, qui
ratione impedimenti in K &longs;uum effectum habere non pote&longs;t, &longs;ed reduci­
tur continuò ver&longs;us K æquali &longs;emper di&longs;tantia;

ex quo &longs;equitur nece&longs;&longs;a­
riò motus circularis, &longs;cilicet ex illa qua&longs;i funis adductione;

&longs;i enim ex
puncto K laxaretur habena &longs;egmentis æqualibus;

differentiæ &longs;inus totius
& &longs;ecantis v. g. &longs;egmento VO in arcu EP; certè E moueretur per
rectam EO.
Theorema 7.
Hinc optimè intelligitur ratio hypothe&longs;eos primæ;

&longs;i enim punctum E &longs;epara-
retur à recta EK eo in&longs;tanti, quo imprimitur impetus;

haud dubiè per
rectam EO moueretur;

quia &longs;cilicet impetus puncti E determinatus e&longs;t
in puncto E ad motum per Tangentem EO;

& &longs;i nullum e&longs;&longs;et impedi­
mentum per rectam EO, moueretur;

atqui &longs;i &longs;eparetur punctum E, ce&longs;­
&longs;at impedimentum, vt patet;
nec enim amplius retinetur ex puncto K;
igitur ce&longs;&longs;at ratio motus circularis;

igitur motu recto per rectam EO
mouebitur;

&longs;ic lapis impo&longs;itus rotæ dum maximo cum impetu vertitur,
per Tangentem proiicitur;

&longs;ic gutta aquæ, quæ cadit in volubilem tro­
chum etiam di&longs;pergitur;

&longs;ic rota ip&longs;a, cuius aliqua pars præ nimia vi
motus diffringitur, illam qua&longs;i proiicit per rectam;

hinc ratio vnica
proiectionis quæ fit operâ fundarum;

&longs;it enim funda KE vel KL, quæ
moueatur per arcum LE;

certè, &longs;i lapis demittatur in puncto E, lapis
proiicietur per rectam LO;

nec enim ad aliam lineam lapis, dum e&longs;t in
puncto E, e&longs;t determinatus, ni&longs;i ad Tangentem EO, ad quam dumtaxat
impetus puncti EA e&longs;t determinatus; in hoc igitur Fundibularij tan­
tùm in&longs;i&longs;tit indu&longs;tria, quâ &longs;cilicet &longs;axum in funda rotatum &longs;copum cui
de&longs;tinatur, attingat, vt illam Tangentem inueniat quæ à prædicto &longs;copo
in circulum, quem &longs;uo motu de&longs;cribit, funda ducitur.

v.g. &longs;it radius fun­
dæ KL hypomoclium K, circulus quem de&longs;cribit funda LEC;

&longs;it &longs;co­
pus O, ducatur tangens EO;

certè, &longs;i vbi funda peruenit in E, dimit­
tat lapidem, prædictum &longs;copum non illicò feriet;

hinc etiam ratio, cur in
naui dum motu recto mouetur facilè con&longs;i&longs;tamus; cum tamen (quod in
longioribus illis nauiculis facilè contingere pote&longs;t) &longs;i circa centrum
&longs;uum nauis vertatur, quod accidit cum vtraque extremitas in partes op­
po&longs;itas, vel remo, vel pertica pellitur, nec in ca con&longs;i&longs;tamus.
Theorema 8.

Si rota plana in circulo horizontali voluatur, &longs;itque pondus plano rotæ incu­
bans, in eo producetur impetus; vt certum e&longs;t;

an verò pondus retroagi de­
beat, præ&longs;ertim &longs;i &longs;it globus, vel aqua;

an verò per Tangentem proiici,
dubium e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t;

videntur enim pro vtraque hypothe&longs;i facere expe­
rientiæ;

pro prima quidem, &longs;i rotetur rota concaua &longs;eu &longs;cutella plena
aqua;

aqua enim in partem contrariam volui videbitur; &, &longs;i plano
quod in circulo horizontali voluitur imponatur globus leuigati&longs;&longs;imus,
certè in partem oppo&longs;itam ibit.

Secundæ hypothe&longs;i alia videntur fauere
experimenta;

&longs;i enim trochus volubilis, vel aqua, vel puluere a&longs;perga­
tur, &longs;tatim aqua re&longs;ilit per Tangentem, idem dico de puluere, &longs;i funda in
circulo horizontali voluatur, lapis demi&longs;&longs;us per Tangentem ibit: &longs;ed
hæc omnia, quæ ad proiectiones pertinent, licèt illæ &longs;equantur ex motu
circulari, examinabimus & demon&longs;trabimus lib. 10. cum de proiectis.
Theorema 9.
Cau&longs;a motus circularis e&longs;t ea, quæ cum tali impedimento coniuncta e&longs;t;

ex
quo accidit diametrum mobilis in aliquo &longs;ui puncto retineri immobi­
lem; &longs;unt autem varij modi huius applicationis.

Primus e&longs;t ille, quem
indicauimus &longs;uprà Th.1.cum &longs;cilicet vtraque extremitas cylindri æquali
impetu in partes oppo&longs;itas pellitur.

v.g. C per CP, L per LG. Secundus
e&longs;t, cum affigitur altera extremitas.

v.g. punctum K affigitur, ita vt tamen
propter flexibilitatem radij KL, idem radius moueri po&longs;&longs;it circa cen­
trum K, vt videmus in funependulis.

Tertius e&longs;t, &longs;i diameter fulcro K
in&longs;eratur, vt in obelis ferri, vel magnetica acu: huc reuoca rotas omnes,
quæ in circulo horizontali, & verticali voluuntur.

Quartus, &longs;i cum ali­
qua explo&longs;ione digitorum motus imprimatur, vel globo, vel trocho, vel
iis cubis, quibus in&longs;cripti numeri po&longs;t girationem &longs;ortem indicant.
Quintus, &longs;i cum flagello trochus agatur;

cum enim implicetur flagel­
lum trocho, vbi retrahitur, in gyros agitur trochus;

huc reuoca funem
illum plicatilem, quibus armatus ferro trochus voluitur:

adde his refle­
xionem variam ex qua &longs;æpè oritur hæc turbinatio;

tùm etiam figuram
va&longs;is;
&longs;ic aqua intra vas &longs;phæricum voluitur;

&longs;ic in vorticibus voluitur
aqua propter præruptum de&longs;cen&longs;um aluei;

&longs;ic etiam turbinatim de&longs;cen­
dit aqua per tubum infundibuli; cætera omitto, quæ ex his facilè intel­
ligi po&longs;&longs;unt.
Theorema 10.
Datur impetus in motu circulari;

probatur facilè, quia etiam ab&longs;ente
potentia motrice durat motus;

igitur ade&longs;&longs;e debet illius cau&longs;a; igitur
impetus, clarum e&longs;t;

debet autem e&longs;&longs;e hic impetus ita determinatus, vt
determinatio vnius puncti impediat determinationem alteriùs; &longs;ed aliam
permittat, alioqui de&longs;trueretur totus impetus, & hæc vici&longs;&longs;im illam.
Theorema 11.
Subjectum huius impetus e&longs;t omne mobile;

non e&longs;t difficultas pro mobili
corporeo, quod pluribus partibus con&longs;tat;

quippe impetus vnius partis
pote&longs;t impedire impetum alterius;

at difficilius e&longs;t dictu, an punctum,
&longs;i detur, moueri po&longs;&longs;it circulariter: de puncto phy&longs;ico loquor?

cui cer­
tè non repugnat motus circularis; quippè licèt careat partibus actu, non
tamen caret partibus potentiâ.
Dices, non mutat locum;

igitur non mo­
uetur:
antecedens con&longs;tare videtur, quia &longs;emper remanet in eodem loco:

con&longs;equentia etiam videtur e&longs;&longs;e clara per Def.1. lib. 1. Re&longs;pondeo pri­
mò mutare locum re&longs;pectiuum;

quippe licèt punctum phy&longs;icum non ha­
beat partes, habet tamen facies;

vnde facies conuertuntur per motum
circularem;

igitur non habent ampliùs eundem re&longs;pectum; igitur nec
eundem locum re&longs;pectiuum.

Re&longs;pondeo &longs;ecundò, punctum phy&longs;icum ha­
bere partes potentiâ, non actu;
vnde mutat locum, dum voluitur;

quia
quælibet pars potentiâ diuer&longs;æ parti &longs;patij potentiâ re&longs;pondet;

&longs;ed hîc
non di&longs;cutio quæ&longs;tionem illam, an dentur puncta phy&longs;ica;

&longs;ed tantùm
a&longs;&longs;ero, ex &longs;uppo&longs;itione quòd detur punctum phy&longs;icum moueri po&longs;&longs;e mo­
tu circulari:

Idem de Angelo dici pote&longs;t, non tamen de puncto mathe­
matico, cuius motus concipi non pote&longs;t;

vnde optimè negat Ari&longs;toteles
punctum mathematicum moueri po&longs;&longs;e;

immò nos aliquando repugnare
dari punctum mathematicum o&longs;tendemus; igitur ex dictis patet, omne
mobile, quod &longs;cilicet moueri pote&longs;t motu recto, motu circulari etiam
moueri po&longs;&longs;e.
Theorema 12.

Finis huius motus varius e&longs;t in naturâ, & multiplex v&longs;us; primò enim
ex motu circulari fit, vt impetus qui e&longs;t ad omnem lineam indifferens
habeat &longs;uum effectum, cum omnes lineæ impediuntur præter vnam, &
hoc e&longs;t vera ratio à priori huius motus.

Secundò nulla libratio, &longs;eu vi­
bratio e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;et, ni&longs;i motus circularis e&longs;&longs;et; hinc nullus libræ v&longs;us, ve­
ctis, trochleæ, aliorumque organorum mechanicorum quorum opera
inutilis e&longs;&longs;et &longs;ine motu circulari.
Theorema 13.
Motus circularis pote&longs;t appellari &longs;implex;

non minùs quàm rectus pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e
mixtus ex duobus circularibus;

non e&longs;t tamen propterea dicendum om­
nem circularem e&longs;&longs;e mixtum;

cum &longs;cilicet in mobili, quod circulari mo­
tu mouetur, non fit duplex impetus; quis autem dicat motum funepen­
duli &longs;ur&longs;um vibrati e&longs;&longs;e mixtum?

Vnde fortè vel eo nomine mixtus dici po&longs;&longs;et, &longs;ed propter ean­
dem rationem motus reflexus mixtus dici po&longs;&longs;et;

quidquid &longs;it, dum rem
intelligas, loquere vt voles;

dixi in &longs;ublunaribus, quia corpora cœle&longs;tia
ita &longs;unt à natura in&longs;tituta, vt circulari motu rotari po&longs;tulent; de quo &longs;uo
loco:

ex quo etiam motu tanquam ex natiua proprietate quintam cœlo­
rum e&longs;&longs;entiam concludit; denique nulla videtur e&longs;&longs;e repugnantia, nul­
lumque ab&longs;urdum, &longs;i motus circularis alicui corpori competat.

pro &longs;ub­
lunaribus aliquod fortè dubium e&longs;&longs;et; &longs;ed quæ&longs;o te cum funependulum
&longs;ua &longs;ponte vibratum de&longs;cendit, quo nomine motum illum appellas?

Nun­
quid e&longs;t à principio intrin&longs;eco?
cur igitur naturalem appellare detrectas?
rem intelligis, loquere vt voles.
Theorema 14.
Omnia puncta eiu&longs;dem circuli mouentur æquali motu.

Probatur quia
æqualibus temporibus æquales arcus percurrunt, vt con&longs;tat; igitur mo­
uentur æquali motu, id e&longs;t æquè velociter per Axioma 1.
Theorema 15.
Puncta diuer&longs;orum circulorum mouentur inæquali motu;

quia tempori­
bus æqualibus inæquales percurrunt arcus;

igitur inæquali motu per
Axio. 1. v.g. puncta L & C quæ di&longs;tant æqualiter à centro K, mouentur
æquali motu, quia æquali tempore conficiunt æquales arcus CS, LT; at
verò puncta CQ inæquali motu mouentur, quia æquali tempore arcus
inæquales percurrunt, &longs;cilicet CS, QX.
Theorema 16.

CSQ tardiùs, quia æquali tempore conficit arcum minorem
QR &longs;unt autem arcus &longs;imiles, vt radij, id e&longs;t QR e&longs;t ad CS, vt radius
KQ ad QC, &longs;ed motus &longs;unt vt arcus; igitur motus, vt radij, vel di&longs;tantiæ
à centro communi.
Theorema 17.

quia
ex inæqualitate motus cogno&longs;ci tantùm pote&longs;t inæqualitas impetus;

fit
autem hæc diffu&longs;io, &longs;eu propagatio in ratione longitudinum v. g. impe­
tus in Q e&longs;t ad impetum in C, vt longitudo KQ ad KC, vt con&longs;tat ex
dictis;

accipio autem omnes partes impetus, quæ &longs;unt in Q, & compa­
ro omnes illas cum omnibus illis, quæ in&longs;unt puncto C;

nam certum e&longs;t
ex his quæ fusè diximus lib.1.non produci plures partes impetus in C, quam
in que &longs;ed perfectiorem impetum produci in C, quàm in Q:

&longs;iue applicetur po­
tentia centro, id e&longs;t iuxta centrum; &longs;iue circumferentiæ.
Theorema 18.
Motus puncti C non e&longs;t velocior motu puncti Q ratione temporis, &longs;ed &longs;patij;

quia vtrumque mouetur &longs;emper æquali tempore, quia &longs;unt in eodem ra­
dio;
certè æquali tempore mouentur;

&longs;ed motus
e&longs;t inæqualis; igitur non ratione temporis, quod æquale e&longs;t, &longs;ed
&longs;patij.

Hic fortè aliquis de&longs;ideraret &longs;olutionem illius argumenti, quod vul­
gò ducitur ex motu circulari contra puncta phy&longs;ica, quod &longs;ic breuiter
proponi pote&longs;t.

Sit punctum Q, quod acquirat punctum &longs;patij ver&longs;us R
vno in&longs;tanti;

certe punctum C, quod mouetur ver&longs;us S, acquiret eodem
illo in&longs;tanti plu&longs;quam punctum &longs;patij;

igitur eodem in&longs;tanti erit in
duobus loris, quod e&longs;t ab&longs;urdum;

nec pote&longs;t dici punctum C moueri
duobus in&longs;tantibus, &longs;ed minoribus, quæ &longs;cilicet re&longs;pondeant in&longs;tanti, quo
mouetur punctum que quia &longs;i po&longs;t primum in&longs;tans C &longs;i&longs;teret, Q mouere­
tur adhuc, quod e&longs;t ab&longs;urdum; nam &longs;imul incipit, & de&longs;init moueri,
cum puncto C.

Equidem non pote&longs;t explicari maior velocitas motus C
per in&longs;tantia minora, vt patet; igitur per &longs;patia maiora.

Itaque re&longs;pon­
deo &longs;i C & Q mouentur in eodem radio conjunctim non po&longs;&longs;e pun­
ctum K acquirere punctum &longs;patij nullo modo participans cum priori,
&longs;ed participans;

licèt enim punctum &longs;patij careat partibus actu, habet
tamen partes potentia, vt explicabimus fusè &longs;uo loco;

&longs;unt enim vbica­
tiones communicantes, & non communicantes, quod explico in Ange­
lo &longs;it enim Angelus coëxten&longs;us quadrato FC, (quam hypothe&longs;im
nemo negabit;) &longs;it alius æqualis exten&longs;ionis coëxten&longs;us quadrato HE,
qui con&longs;i&longs;tat dum primus Angelus mouetur;

quippè vnico in&longs;tanti locum &longs;ibi adæquatum occupare po­
te&longs;t;

vel ita moueri pote&longs;t, vt primo in&longs;tanti occupet &longs;patium GD, &
coëxtendatur quidem alteri Angelo &longs;ed inadæquatè:

his po&longs;itis, &longs;patium
HE comparatum cum &longs;patio FC e&longs;t non communicans;

&longs;patium verò
GD communicans, tum cum HE, tum cum HA, po&longs;&longs;unt autem dari
huiu&longs;modi &longs;patia in infinitum plùs vel minùs participantia v. g. LM
plus participat de AC quam BD, & BD plu&longs;quam NO;

nec pote&longs;t motus e&longs;&longs;e velocior ratione
&longs;patij, licèt po&longs;&longs;it e&longs;&longs;e ratione temporis; quia &longs;patium HE acquirere po­
te&longs;t minore in&longs;tanti.

Quod dicitur de Angelo, dicatur de puncto phy&longs;i­
co; cuius exten&longs;io e&longs;t quidem indiui&longs;ibilis actu vt exten&longs;io Angeli diui­
&longs;ibilis tamen potentia in infinitum.

His po&longs;itis, motus extremitatis radij dirigit motum aliorum puncto­
rum ver&longs;us centrum; &longs;ed punctum extremitatis radij non pote&longs;t
dato in&longs;tanti moueri velociùs quàm &longs;i punctum &longs;patij non communi­
cans acquirat, quo po&longs;ito nullum aliud punctum radij acquirit eodem
in&longs;tanti &longs;patium non communicans.

Dices, ponamus punctum extremitatis facta acce&longs;&longs;ione noui &longs;egmenti
moueri eadem velocitate, quâ priùs mouebatur, cum terminabat radium;

igitur acquirit punctum &longs;patij non participans; igitur extremitas noua
illo in&longs;tanti acquirit plu&longs;quam punctum.

certè noua ex­
tremitas velociùs mouebitur priore, vt con&longs;tat;

igitur in&longs;tanti minore
acquiret &longs;patium non communicans; igitur hoc in&longs;tanti minore prior
extremitas acquirit &longs;patium communicans.

at verò velocitatem motus recti per
in&longs;tantia maiora, & minora:
Sed hæc fusè in Metaphy&longs;ica explicabimus;
neque hîc contendimus dari vel puncta, vel in&longs;tantia;

&longs;ed tantùm po&longs;ito
quod dentur, ita &longs;olui po&longs;&longs;e argumentum illud, quod vulgò ducitur ex
motu circulari, quo reuerâ puncta Mathematica non tamen phy&longs;ica pro­
fligantur:

&longs;imiliter &longs;olues argumentum illud vix triobolare, quo dicuntur
e&longs;&longs;e tot puncta in minore circulo, quot in maiore, eo quod iidem radij
vtrumque &longs;ecent, quia &longs;i duo radij ad duo puncta immediata maioris
terminentur, penetrantur inadæquatè in &longs;ectione minoris circuli; &longs;ed
de hoc aliàs.
Theorema 19.
Motus circularis pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e velocior, & tardior in infinitum;

quia quocun­
que dato radio pote&longs;t dari maior, & minor;

immò pote&longs;t compen&longs;ari
motus;
&longs;it enim radius EC diui&longs;us bifariam in H;

certè &longs;i moueatur
EC circa centrum E;

C mouebitur duplo velociùs quàm H, quia arcus
CN e&longs;t duplus HT;
&longs;i tamen &longs;it radius AH;

quia
arcus CN & H m &longs;unt æquales, vt con&longs;tat:

pote&longs;t etiam vectis longio­
ris extremitas moueri motu æquali cum extremitate minoris;

certè &longs;i C conficiat CN co­
dem tempore, vtraque extremitas C & H æquè velociter mouebitur;

&longs;i
autem duplicetur adhuc longitudo radij, diuidatur HT bifariam in X,
ducaturque linea, atque ita deinceps; quæ omnia &longs;unt trita.
Ex his habes principium motus tardioris, & velocioris in infinitum;

&longs;i
enim punctum H &longs;emper æquali tempore conficiat arcum H m;

certè
punctum C conficiet arcum C b duplum prioris;

quia EC e&longs;t dupla
EH;
&longs;i verò accipiatur tripla, conficiet triplum, atque ita deinceps;

&longs;ed
pote&longs;t vectis e&longs;&longs;e longior, & longior in infinitum;

igitur motus velo­
cior, & velocior;

&longs;i verò punctum C conficiat tantùm arcum CN æqua­
lem H m; haud dubiè punctum H mouebitur duplò tardiùs, & &longs;i acci­
piatur vectis duplus CE, cuius extremitas percurrat arcum æqualem
CN, punctum H mouebitur quadruplò tardiùs, atque ita deinceps.
Theorema 20.
Motus circularis non e&longs;t naturaliter acceleratus.

Probatur, quia in infi­
nitum intenderetur, quod e&longs;&longs;et ab&longs;urdum in natura;
caret enim termino:

non e&longs;t difficultas pro motu circulari violento quo v.g. vertitur rota in
circulo verticali, vel mixto, quo &longs;cilicet lapis &longs;phæricus ita de&longs;cendit, vt
circa &longs;uum centrum etiam voluatur, vel indifferenti, quo recta vertitur
in circulo horizontali;

quia nullum e&longs;t principium accelerationis i&longs;to­
rum motuum;

igitur e&longs;t tantùm difficultas pro naturali circulari, quo
fortè &longs;ydera rotantur; qui tamen non e&longs;t acceleratus per &longs;e, propter ra­
tionem prædictam.
Obiiceret fortè aliquis;

eadem ratio quæ probat motum naturalem
deor&longs;um accelerari, eadem probat circularem naturalem etiam intendi:
quippè &longs;emper ade&longs;t principium intrin&longs;ecum applicatum.

Re&longs;pondeo
negandam e&longs;&longs;e paritatem;

quia naturalis motus grauium non accelera­
tur fru&longs;trà;
Nunquam enim recedit à &longs;uo fine;

at verò, &longs;i motus circula­
ris &longs;yderum acceleraretur, tandem abiret in infinitum, quod reuerâ e&longs;&longs;et
contra finem à natura in&longs;titutum; quippè carerent &longs;uo fine, & v&longs;u corpo­
ra cœle&longs;tia, &longs;i longè celeriori motu rotarentur.

Obiiceret alius, motus circularis naturalis non acceleraretur, igitur
tardi&longs;&longs;imus e&longs;&longs;et, qualis reuerâ motus naturalis grauium deor&longs;um, quod
e&longs;t contra experientiam.

Re&longs;pondeo, vel determinatum impetus gradum,
eumque valdè intentum produxi&longs;&longs;e iuxta in&longs;titutum &longs;uæ naturæ, vel per
aliquot minuta &longs;e&longs;e moui&longs;&longs;e motu recto naturaliter accelerato; &longs;ed de
hoc motu &longs;yderum agemus fusè aliquando, cum de cau&longs;is corporum cœ­
le&longs;tium.

Obiicies de&longs;cen&longs;um funependuli, qui e&longs;t naturaliter acceleratus; &longs;ed
profectò ille motus e&longs;t tantùm per accidens circularis.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis ex dictis &longs;atis con&longs;tare, quàm temerè mirentur aliqui tan­
tam motuum cœle&longs;tium celeritatem, cum motus circularis velocitas in
infinitum augeri po&longs;&longs;it: Ob&longs;eruabis præterea, &longs;i fortè motus rectus corpo­
rum cœle&longs;tium præce&longs;&longs;it per aliquot minuta, motum illum, qui deinde
&longs;ucce&longs;&longs;it, non e&longs;&longs;e perfectè circularem, &longs;ed mixtum, quem aliquando ex­
plicabimus, & ex eo cau&longs;as Apogæi, Perigæi, declinationis, &c.

omné&longs;­
que anomalias deducemus &longs;uo loco.
Theorema 21.

Rota circulo verticali parallela circa axem mobilis addito minimo im­
petu per &longs;e moueri pote&longs;t;

&longs;it enim ABCD plano verticali parallela circa
centrum E volubilis;

nam cùm non
po&longs;&longs;it volui circa centrum E, ni&longs;i vel cum mobili axe duobus hinc inde
lunatis fulcris &longs;u&longs;tentato, vel facto foramine circa axem immobilem, vel
circa geminos apices conicos immi&longs;&longs;os iu&longs;tis apothecis in plano rotæ
excauatis, quales videmus in acu magnetica; atqui non pote&longs;t volui rota
&longs;iue primo, &longs;iue &longs;ecundo, &longs;iue tertio modo voluatur &longs;ine multa compre&longs;­
&longs;ione partium, id e&longs;t, &longs;ine aliquo affrictu, in quo multæ particulæ vnius
plani cum particulis alterius qua&longs;i pectinatim commi&longs;&longs;æ, motum & im­
petunt &longs;i&longs;tunt.
Theorèma 22.

Rota minor in eodem &longs;itu de quo &longs;uprà æquè facilè moueri pote&longs;t, ac maior
per &longs;e.

Probatur primò, quia vtraque minimo impetu moueri pote&longs;t per
Th. 21. Secundò, quia addita minima vi impetus in F, & minima in A
tàm facilè maior rota de&longs;cendit, quàm minor, quia æqualiter tollitur
æquilibrium vtriu&longs;que: dixi per &longs;e, quia maior rota propter maius pon­
dus maiore affrictu motum impedit.
Theorema 23.

Pote&longs;t vis aliqua applicata rotæ in A v.g. rotam mouere in eodem &longs;itu ver­
ticali; licèt nullum impetum producat.

nec enim producere po­
te&longs;t, ni&longs;i in tota rota producat per Th.33. lib. primo; &longs;ed vis minima im­
petus tot partes impetus, producere non pote&longs;t, quot e&longs;&longs;ent nece&longs;&longs;ariæ, vt
omnibus partibus rotæ di&longs;tribuerentur.
Theorema 24.
Hinc egregium paradoxum;

pote&longs;t aliquid mouere rotam, & non agere in
rotam;

quia vis mouens non pote&longs;t in rotam agere, ni&longs;i impetum in ea
producat, vt patet;

&longs;ed pote&longs;t illa vis rotam mouere licèt impetum in ea
non producat per Th.23. igitur mouere, & non agere:

quod quomodo
fiat facilè explicari pote&longs;t; quippè illa vis ponderis.

quia &longs;cilicet
maior e&longs;t; &longs;ic pondus vnius &longs;crupuli &longs;uperpo&longs;itum ingenti rupi non pro­
ducit in rupe impetum, &longs;ed &longs;i fortè appendatur rupes, &longs;imul cum illa gra­
uitat, quod facilè concipi pote&longs;t.
Theorema 25.

Cum de&longs;cendit deor&longs;um &longs;emicirculus BA DE, attollitur &longs;ur&longs;um &longs;emicir­
culus oppo&longs;itus;

quia &longs;cilicet impetus illius producit in i&longs;to alium impe­
tum;

nec enim corpus graue a&longs;cendit &longs;ur&longs;um &longs;ua &longs;ponte in medio leuio­
re; igitur ab extrin&longs;eco;

&longs;ed nulla e&longs;t alia cau&longs;a applicata præter impe­
tum &longs;emicirculi de&longs;cendentis;

igitur ab eo producitur hic impetus,
i&longs;que omninò æqualis; quia &longs;cilicet vterque mouetur motu æquali.
Theorema 26.

Hinc impetus deor&longs;um producere pote&longs;t impetum &longs;ur&longs;um; quippe
ad aliam lineam determinare non pote&longs;t, quod valdè paradoxum e&longs;t.
Theorema 27.

Hinc impetus vnius partis mobilis continui pote&longs;t impetum &longs;imilem produ­
cere in alia parte eiu&longs;dem mobilis; vt patet ex dictis, quod tantùm locum
habet in motu circulari.

Diceret aliquis, igitur in motu recto etiam lo­
cum habebit.

Re&longs;pondeo negando, alioqui minima potentia quodlibet
pondus motu recto moueret etiam nullo adhibito mechanico organo;

quia modo produceretur tantulus impetus in aliqua parte, hic produce­
ret alium, & hic alium, immò vterque &longs;ecundo in&longs;tanti alium produce-
ret:
e&longs;&longs;et enim cau&longs;a nece&longs;&longs;aria;

&longs;ed hoc e&longs;t ab&longs;urdum: ratio verò di&longs;pa­
ritatis e&longs;t, quia mobile, quod motu circulari voluitur circa centrum,
quod e&longs;t in ip&longs;o mobili duplicis mobilis vicem gerit, quorum vnum im­
pedit motum alterius, nec moueri po&longs;&longs;unt, ni&longs;i motibus oppo&longs;itis.
Theorema 28.

Si applicetur pondus in K, minus erit illiusa momentum, quàm in A, erit­
que ad momentum in A, vt LE ad AE;

quod &longs;æpiùs iam &longs;uprà dictum
e&longs;t;

præ&longs;ertim lib.4. Inde tamen egregium deduco paradoxum, &longs;cilicet
minimam vim &longs;ufficere ad deprimendum &longs;emicirculum BA DE &longs;iue &longs;it
applicata in A &longs;iue in K; faciliùs tamen id præ&longs;tare in C, quàm in K,
id e&longs;t velociore motu.
Theorema 29.

Potentia in C applicata etiam minima per lineam CN, mouebit &longs;emicir­
culum DE BE &longs;ur&longs;um; vt patet;

nullum tamen producet impetum, &longs;i
minima &longs;it;
igitur oppo&longs;itus &longs;emicirculus BA DE præualere debet;

vnde
ideo a&longs;cendit ille, quia de&longs;cendit i&longs;te;

qui ideo de&longs;cendit, quia vel de­
trahitur aliquid de momento alterius, vel impeditur;

atqui impedire
tantùm pote&longs;t, vel per productionem impetus, vel per applicationem po­
tentiæ per CN, quæ actione communi cum toto impetu &longs;emicirculi
BA DE iuuat eius de&longs;cen&longs;um;

nam perinde &longs;e habet potentia, &longs;iue &longs;it,
applicata in A per lineam AO &longs;iue in C per CN: quod certè manife­
&longs;tum e&longs;t.
Theorema 30.
Hinc etiam habes duo paradoxa;

primum e&longs;t, potentiam immediatè
concurrere ad motum &longs;emicirculi, cui non e&longs;t applicata, & mediatè tan­
tùm ad motum illius, cui applicata e&longs;t; nam potentia applicata in C per
CN concurrit immediatè ad motum A deor&longs;um, & &longs;imul cum A ad mo­
tum Cur&longs;um.

Secundum e&longs;t, &longs;olam negationem e&longs;&longs;e cau&longs;am motus, &longs;ci­
licet detractionem partis momenti, quod clarum e&longs;t.
Theorema 31.
Hinc etiam alia deduco paradoxa.

Primum e&longs;t, faciliùs &longs;u&longs;tineri maius
pondus, quàm minus.

Secundum plùs addi ponderis, quò plùs detrahi­
tur.

& quò maior portio detrahetur po­
tentiæ, maius pondus incumbet; quò minor, minus.

Sed hæc clara
&longs;unt.
Theorema 32.
Impetus productus in rota con&longs;eruatur aliquamdiu.

Duplex impetus con­
&longs;iderari pote&longs;t in rota;

hic autem impe­
tus primò durat in toto de&longs;cen&longs;u quadrantis AD;
&longs;ed de hoc cur&longs;u, & recur&longs;u agemus fusè lib. &longs;equenti;

alter impetus e&longs;t
productus ab extrin&longs;eco, applicata &longs;cilicet valida potentiá, qui rotam
agit velociore motu, vt patet, cùm præter impetum ad intra &longs;it etiam im­
petus productus ab extrin&longs;eca cau&longs;a;

igitur maior e&longs;t impetus; igitur
maior motus:

porrò hic impetus aliquandiu con&longs;eruatur, vt patet expe­
rientiâ; nec e&longs;t vlla cau&longs;a &longs;ufficiens applicata, à qua tam citò de­
&longs;truatur.
Theorema 33.

Quando voluitur rota ab applicata valida potentia in A. v.g. per AO,
non modo producitur impetus in &longs;emicirculo BA DE, &longs;ed etiam in oppo&longs;ito;
cùm vtrique mediatè vel immediatè &longs;it applicata &longs;ufficienter, exemplo
vectis.
Theorema 34.
Non destruitur per &longs;e impetus productus in rota ab extrin&longs;eco.

nam per &longs;e impetus in hoc motu e&longs;t determinatus ad lineam re­
ctam;
nullus tamen impetus e&longs;t fru&longs;trà:

quemadmodum enim in reflexione, quæ fit à plano immobili, nul­
lus de&longs;truitur impetus;

ita nullus hîc de&longs;truitur; tàm enim centrum il­
lud immobile ad &longs;e qua&longs;i mobile trahit, quàm planum immobile ad &longs;e re­
pellit.

Quæreret fortè aliquis, vtrum in &longs;emicirculo a&longs;cendente impetus de­
&longs;truatur ab impetu naturali grauitationis.

Re&longs;pondeo negando, quia
nunquam a&longs;cendit C, ni&longs;i de&longs;cendat A;

nunquam verò de&longs;cendit A, ni&longs;i
&longs;it maior vis in A quam in C, quod certum e&longs;t;

quod &longs;i æquale &longs;it vtrinque mo­
mentum; certè totus motus vtrinque impeditur, & hæc e&longs;t vera ratio
æquilibrij, de quo aliàs.
Theorema 35.

Hinc &longs;i nullus &longs;it partium affrictus, e&longs;&longs;et motus ille perpetuus; quia nul­
lus de&longs;truitur impetus per Th. 34. igitur ille motus e&longs;&longs;et perpetuus.
Theorema 36.

In maiore rota e&longs;t maior affrictus partium, & impetus citiùs destruitur.
Secunda pars &longs;equitur ex prima; hæc autem ex maiore ponderis grauita­
tione, vel in axem, vel in &longs;ubjectum planum.
Theorema 37.

Licèt impetus non destruatur in motu rotæ, & impediatur determinatio
prima, vt patet;
attamen impedimentum non pote&longs;t minus excogitari;
fit enim ratione anguli contingentiæ;

igitur determi­
natio noua proximè accedit ad priorem; igitur e&longs;t minimum impedi­
mentum.
Theorema 38.
Hinc in maiori rota minus e&longs;t impedimentum;

quia &longs;cilicet minor e&longs;t
angulus contingentiæ;
maius verò in minori rota:

porrò minor rota à
maiore &longs;eparata citiùs &longs;uos gyros ab&longs;oluit;

quia &longs;unt minores, (&longs;uppono
æqualem impetum in extremo orbe rotæ vtriu&longs;que productum,) idque
pro rata; &longs;i enim minor &longs;it &longs;ubdupla maioris, maior vnum tantum gyrum
aget eo tempore, quo minor duos percurret.

Ob&longs;erua primò, pondus applicatum in A non modò producere impe­
tum in toto radio AE;
&longs;ed etiam in toto radio oppo&longs;ito EC;

ratio e&longs;t,
quia &longs;i impetus radij AE producit impetum in radio EC;

certè pondus
additum radio AE cen&longs;etur pars eiu&longs;dem radij;

igitur impetus illius
ponderis immediatè producit impetum in radio EC;

quia impedit hic
radius oppo&longs;itus motum alterius AE;

igitur, vt tollat impedimentum,
producit AE impetum in EC;

&longs;i autem produceretur tantùm impetus in
EC ab impetu radij AE;

&longs;it enim radius FE, in quo producatur quilibet impetus, &longs;it­
que radius oppo&longs;itus maior duplo EC;

igitur remi&longs;&longs;io­
rem, quia pluribus partibus &longs;ubjecti di&longs;tribuitur;

igitur vel motus e&longs;&longs;et
remi&longs;&longs;ior radij EC quàm radij FE, quod dici non pote&longs;t;

vel aliquid
impetus radij FE e&longs;&longs;et fru&longs;trà, quod etiam dici non pote&longs;t; itaque poten­
tia applicata in F, mediante &longs;cilicet organo, quodcumque tandem illud
&longs;it.v.g.

pugno, producit impetum in ip&longs;o organo, impetus verò organi,
&longs;eu pugni producit impetum primò in toto radio FE, tùm in toto radio
EC, id e&longs;t totus impetus tùm pugni, tùm radij FC, &longs;cilicet innatus pro­
ducit impetum in alio radio EC;

nec tantùm ab impetu pugni, vel organi admo­
ti;

quia etiam&longs;i nullus accederet nouus impetus radio AE, &longs;ed tantùm
minimum pondus;
haud dubiè attolleret radium EC:

Adde quod ra­
dius EC impedit motum radij FE;

igitur ab impetu huius producitur
etiam in illo impetus; igitur tùm ab impetu pugni, vel organi, tùm ab
impetu radij FE producitur impetus in radio EC.
Theorema 39.

quod ab omnibus facilè ob&longs;eruari pote&longs;t &longs;it enim cylin­
drus ED libratus per arcum AD, &longs;tatimque demittatur;

quia tamen e&longs;t minor impetus in I, quàm in D, &
minor adhuc in E;
certè D debet moueri velociùs quàm I, & I quam E;
igitur motu recto moueri non pote&longs;t prædictus cylindrus ED;

moueri
motu recto, id e&longs;t in &longs;itu parallelo ED;

igitur extremitas D gyros aget,
quia retinetur ab aliis punctis, quorum tardior e&longs;t motus;

hîc tantùm &longs;ufficiat dixi&longs;&longs;e cau&longs;am legitimam illius circuitionis
e&longs;&longs;e tantùm inæqualem illam di&longs;tributionem impetus in cylindro ED;
a&longs;&longs;ignauimus autem ibidem lineam, quam &longs;uo motu de&longs;cribit extremitas
D, & centrum, circa quod &longs;uos gyros agit.
Theorema 40.

Diu durat motus impre&longs;&longs;us rotæ in circulo verticali, &longs;i vel modicus &longs;it par­
tium affrictus;
igitur diu durat impetus;

igitur diu durat motus: nec e&longs;t alia
ratio vulgaris illius experimenti, quo videmus perforatam acum circa
cylindrum leuigati&longs;&longs;imum diu rotari.
Theorema 41.

Cum rota voluitur in circulo horizontali, non pote&longs;t moueri applicata mini­
ma potentia;

Probatur, quia nullo modo rotatur ad intra, id e&longs;t non pro­
ducit in &longs;e impetum, vt patet;

igitur debet produci impetus in illa à po­
tentia applicata; igitur tot partes impetus, quot &longs;unt &longs;altem in tota rota,
cum &longs;ingulæ partes moueantur.
Theorema 42.

Hinc difficiliùs mouetur in circulo horizontali quàm in verticali; patet,
quia in hoc à minima potentia applicata pote&longs;t moueri per Th.21. &longs;ecus
verò in illo per Th.41. igitur in horizontali difficiliùs moueri pote&longs;t,
quàm in verticali.

Ob&longs;eruabis autem tribus modis volui po&longs;&longs;e huiu&longs;modi
rotam.
Primò &longs;i in plano horizontali leuigati&longs;&longs;imo voluatur.

Secundò, &longs;i
circa cylindrum immobilem, qui aperto foramini in&longs;eritur.

Tertiò, &longs;i
vno concauo vnius axis ducatur per centrum rotæ, in&longs;eratur vnus &longs;oli­
dus, quo fulcitus orbis con&longs;i&longs;tat in æquilibrio, difficiliùs voluitur primo
modo rota propter affrictum plurimarum partium; &longs;ecundo faciliùs, &longs;ed
longè faciliùs tertio &longs;ic autem voluitur acus magnetica.
Theorema 43.
Potentia applicata talis e&longs;&longs;e debet, vt po&longs;&longs;it imprimere impetum toti rota;
cum enim non po&longs;&longs;it moueri vna pars rotæ &longs;ine alia;

certè, vel impetus
imprimitur omnibus, vel nulli per Th.37. lib.1.præ&longs;ertim cùm totus im­
petus, qui rotæ imprimitur, &longs;it ab extrin&longs;eco; nec enim accidit huic rotæ,
quod alteri, quæ &longs;itum verticalem habet, cuius &longs;emicirculus, cui admoue­
tur potentia per lineam deor&longs;um motu naturali ex parte deor&longs;um fertur,
vt &longs;upra explicatum e&longs;t.

Hinc totus impetus in rota horizontali produ­
citur ab extrin&longs;eco; hinc ab ea tantùm potentia volui pote&longs;t, quæ tot
partes impetus pote&longs;t producere, quot &longs;unt nece&longs;&longs;ariæ, vt omnibus parti­
bus plani illius circularis di&longs;tribuantur, iuxta propagationem, quæ motui
circulari competit.
Theorema 44.

impedit autem radius EC eo primo
in&longs;tanti;

igitur debet &longs;imul tolli impedimentum, & produci impetus in
AE;
&longs;ed non pote&longs;t tolli impedimentum, ni&longs;i per impetum;

igitur non
modò producitur impetus in AE, &longs;ed etiam in EC;

atqui impetus in
EC non producitur ab impetu producto in EA;

applicetur enim poten­
tia in F;

certè minùs impetus producetur in FE, quàm in EC, vt con­
&longs;tat;

igitur impetus in EC producitur ab ip&longs;a potentia applicata in A,
vel in F; &longs;i verò rota &longs;it verticalis, ab eadem potentia, & impetu innato
radij AE. vel &longs;emicirculi DA BE.
Theorema 45.
Hinc faciliùs mouetur rota motu illo circulari, quàm recto;

quia &longs;it dia­
meter AC, vt moueatur motu recto per &longs;e debet produci impetus eiu&longs;­
dem perfectionis in omnibus partibus AC, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis lib. 1. &longs;i
enim motus omnium partium e&longs;t æqualis;

certè impetus qui producitur in A,
& in C, e&longs;t minor impetu producto in F, & in H;

haud dubiè totus impetus productus in
AC ad motum rectum e&longs;t perfectior toto impetu producto ad circula­
rem; igitur difficiliùs ille, hic faciliùs producitur.
Theorema 46.

Si applicetur potentia in F, difficiliùs mouebit rotam, quàm &longs;i applicetur in
A;

ratio clara e&longs;t, quia producet in F impetum eiu&longs;dem perfectionis,
quem produceret in A, vt certum e&longs;t;

igitur maior erit impetus in to­
ta AC;

igitur difficiliùs mouebitur rota: adde quod longitudo vectis
iuuat motum EC.
Theorema 47.

Facilè cogno&longs;citur, in qua proportione potentia applicata puncte A faciliùs
vertat rotam, quàm applicata puncto F in circulo &longs;cilicet horizontali;

&longs;it enim
&longs;olus vectis FC, cuius centrum &longs;it E;

certè &longs;i vertatur in circulo hori­
zontali, potentia applicata extremitati C faciliùs ver&longs;abit, quàm appli­
cata puncto F, iuxta proportionem CE ad EF, vel ad HE; igitur po­
tentia applicata puncto H, vectis CF e&longs;t eiu&longs;dem momenti, cuius e&longs;t ea­
dem applicata puncto F, quia æqualem pror&longs;us effectum, &longs;cilicet impe­
tum, debet producere in vecte CF, vt moueatur in circulo horizontali
circa centrum E.

Probatur vlteriùs, quia motus, æquabiles &longs;cilicet, &longs;unt
vt &longs;patia, impetus vt motus, vires vt impetus;

&longs;egmentum
verò FE &longs;ectorem FEV;

haud dubiè punctum F percurret arcum FG eo tem­
pore, quo C priore motu percurrebat CS, vt patet;

quia arcus CS e&longs;t
æqualis quadranti FG; igitur &longs;egmentum FE quadrantem FEG, & &longs;eg­
mentum EC quadrantem CED.
Theorema 48.
Ex his determinantur omnes aliæ proportiones;

&longs;i enim fit vectis AC
(quem &longs;uppono æqualem in omnibus &longs;uis partibus & volubilem circa
centrum E in plano horizontali) & applicetur potentia in puncto A, in
quo producat minimum impetum, quem pote&longs;t immediatè producere ex
hypothe&longs;i toties repetita, ita vt dato tempore percurrat A arcum AK, &longs;i
&longs;it vectis AH, & applicetur potentia in A, mouebit faciliùs, quàm AC
iuxta proportionem 8/5;
igitur & impetus;

&longs;ed quò minor e&longs;t impetus, e&longs;t maior
facilitas; igitur facilitas vltimi motus e&longs;t ad facilitatem primi, vt 8. ad 5.
idem dico, &longs;i applicetur potentia in H.

Si verò retento &longs;emper eodem vecte AC applicetur potentia tùm in
A, tùm in F, facilitas motus potentiæ applicatæ in A e&longs;t ad facilitatem
motus potentiæ applicatæ in F, vt AE ad FE, vel vt AB ad AK, vel
vt AEB ad AEK, quæ omnia con&longs;tant ex dictis; igitur applicata in F
in vecte AC e&longs;t ad applicatam in F in vecte FE vt 5. ad 8. &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt
&longs;atis clara, nec vlteriore explicatione indigent.
Theorema 49.

Hinc quò propiùs ad centrum applicatur potentia, eò maior e&longs;t difficultas
motus;

igitur &longs;i applicetur ip&longs;i centro mathematicè con&longs;iderato e&longs;t infi­
nita difficultas;
igitur nulla potentia &longs;uperare po&longs;&longs;et hanc difficultatem;

hinc vt artifices &longs;uas ver&longs;ent rotas faciliùs, vel maximè curuum manu­
brium adhibent, vel affixo ver&longs;us circumferentiam in plano rotæ clauo
rotam agunt in orbes; quæ omnia clarè &longs;equuntur ex dictis.
Theorema 50.
Minor rota faciliùs vertitur in circulo horizontali;

quàm maior. v. g.ro­
ta FGHI, quàm AB CD;

quia &longs;cilicet producitur minùs impetus in
minore, quàm in maiore, vt patet;

&longs;unt enim pauciores partes in mino­
re, plures in maiore;

mouetur autem faciliùs minor, quàm maior iuxta
rationem diametrorum, permutando;

Probatur, quia producatur impe­
tus in A maioris rotæ, ita vt dato tempore conficiat AK;

tùm æqualis
impetus in F minoris rotæ;

certè eodem tempore conficiet punctum F
arcum FG æqualem AK;

&longs;ed quadrans FEG e&longs;t ad &longs;ectorem AEK, vt
FE ad AE, vt con&longs;tat;

igitur facilitas motus minoris rotæ e&longs;t ad facili­
tatem motus maioris, vt FE ad AE;

igitur & impetus; &longs;ed quò minor
e&longs;t impetus, e&longs;t maior facilitas, &c.
Theorema 51.

Hinc tantæ molis po&longs;&longs;et e&longs;&longs;e rota in &longs;itu horizontali, vt à potentia etiam ve­
geta minimè verti po&longs;&longs;es, vt clarum e&longs;t;

quò enim &longs;unt plures &longs;ubjecti partes, plures etiam partes impetus de­
&longs;iderantur, vt &longs;æpè dictum e&longs;t; igitur maior potentia.
Theorema 52.

Destruitur impetus productus in hac rotæ horizontali, &longs;ed &longs;en&longs;im &longs;ine &longs;en&longs;u
propter affrictum, vt &longs;uprà dictum e&longs;t:

hinc e&longs;&longs;et motus perpetuus, &longs;i nul­
lus e&longs;&longs;et affrictus;

minùs impetus de&longs;truitur in maiore rota, quàm in mi­
nore: hinc gyrus minoris citiùs peragitur, & de&longs;init minor citiùs
moueri.
Theorema 53.

Minor rota citiùs &longs;uum gyrum ab&longs;oluit, quàm maior, vt dictum e&longs;t &longs;uprà,
&longs;iue &longs;it in &longs;itu verticali, &longs;iue in &longs;itu horizontali;

&longs;ed non e&longs;t determinata
proportio, quàm hîc de&longs;ideramus; dico enim tempora motuum e&longs;&longs;e, vt
radios.

quia &longs;it impetus æqualis impre&longs;&longs;us puncto A ma­
ioris rotæ puncto F minoris, ita vt A & F moueantur æquali motu;

mi­
nor rota conficit duos orbes eo tempore, quo maior vnum conficit, vt
con&longs;tat ex dictis; quia &longs;uppono.
v. g. circulum minoris e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ubduplum;

igitur tempus, quo peragitur maior e&longs;t ad tempus, quo peragitur minor
in ratione dupla;

igitur vt radius AE ad radium FE, quod erat demon­
&longs;trandum.
Theorema 54.

&longs;i enim A dato
tempore percurrit AK;
certè F percurret FG;

&longs;ed quadrans FEG e&longs;t
&longs;ubduplus &longs;ectoris AEK, vt con&longs;tat;

igitur faciliùs vertitur FE, quàm
AE in proportione AE, ad FE:

quia opera maioris mouetur
motu vt QT;

operâ verò minoris motu vt QY, igitur difficiliùs opera
minoris in proportione QY ad QT;

quia arcus FV erit
æqualis arcui d Y;

hîc autem nullomodo con&longs;ideratur vectis re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tia;

&longs;i verò producatur tantundem impetus in toto vecte AE quamtum
in FE;
certè pro rata &longs;ingulæ partes FE duplum habent;

igitur tempo­
ra gyrorum erunt in ratione duplicata radiorum;
ergo F 4. orbes, dum A vnicum: &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt facilia.
Theorema 55.

Si vectis BH ita pellatur in B in plano horizontali, in quo liberè moueri
po&longs;&longs;it v.g. dum aquæ &longs;upernatat, nulli centro immobili affixus, &longs;it que aqualis
den&longs;itatis in omnibus &longs;uis partibus; mouebitur circa aliquod centrum, etiam&longs;i
nulli centro affigatur.

Probatur, quia punctum B velociùs mouebitur, quàm
A vel H, vt patet experientiâ:

porrò
ratio à priori e&longs;t, quia cùm impetus producatur tantùm ad extra, vt tol­
latur impedimentum motus, vt fusè o&longs;tendimus lib. 1. certè in tantùm
amouetur impedimentum, in quantum amouetur corpus impediens mo­
tum alterius;
atqui amoueri tantùm pote&longs;t per motum;

igitur eo motu
amouetur, quo faciliùs amoueri pote&longs;t, & minore &longs;umptu, vt ita dicam,
id e&longs;t minore impetu:

&longs;it igitur potentia
applicata in A, &longs;cilicet in centro grauitatis cylindri BH;

certè producit
maximum impetum, quem pote&longs;t producere in cylindro BH (&longs;uppono
enim e&longs;&longs;e cau&longs;am nece&longs;&longs;ariam, & producere perfecti&longs;&longs;imum impetum,
quem producere po&longs;&longs;it) producit inquam maximum ratione numeri;
cùm in toto cylindro BH producat impetum eiu&longs;dem perfectionis;

igi­
tur mouetur motu recto;
igitur æquali in omnibus partibus;

igitur æqua­
lis e&longs;t impetus in omnibus partibus, id e&longs;t, æquè inten&longs;us;

&longs;it autem po-
tentia applicata in B, ita vt in puncto B producatur impetus eiu&longs;dem
perfectionis, de quo &longs;uprà:

&longs;i mouetur motu circulari circa aliquod cen­
trum v. g. circa centrum H, & punctum B conficiat arcum BD æqua­
lem rectæ b I, vel BL quam æquali tempore B vel A antè percurrebant
motu recto;

certè totus cylindrus BH acquiret tantùm &longs;patium BHD
motu circulari circa centrum H;

&longs;ed motu recto acqui&longs;iuit &longs;patium re­
ctanguli BK, quod maius e&longs;t, vt patet;

igitur motus circularis circa H
cylindri BH e&longs;t ad rectum, vt &longs;ector BHD ad rectangulum BK;

igitur cum cylindrus impul&longs;us in B faciliùs moueri po&longs;&longs;it motu
circulari, quàm recto, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis;

& cùm eo motu moueatur,
quo faciliùs moueri pote&longs;t;

modò po&longs;&longs;it ad illum determinari, non mirum
e&longs;t &longs;i eo moueatur, & minor impetus producatur in eodem cylindro
BH; debet autem e&longs;&longs;e aliquod centrum huius motus, quod determina­
bimus paulò pò&longs;t, po&longs;tquam breuiter exilem quamdam objectionem de
impetu refutauerimus.
Itaque obiiciunt aliqui, impetum non produci ad extra ab impetu;
quia &longs;cilicet impetus habet iam effectum &longs;cilicet motum;

igitur aliud
munus non e&longs;t illi imponendum;

igitur non producit alium effectum;
igitur non e&longs;t cau&longs;a impetus.
Re&longs;pondeo primò, calor e&longs;t cau&longs;a rarefactionis;

igitur non producit
alium calorem, quia habet iam vnum effectum; &longs;i tuum argumentum
concludit, meum quoque concludet.

Re&longs;pondeo &longs;ecundò, anima produ­
cit vi&longs;ionem, ergo auditionem producere non pote&longs;t, cùm iam habeat
vnum effectum:

Dices, eandem cau&longs;am po&longs;&longs;e habere plures effectus; cur
igitur negas de impetu?

Re&longs;pondeo tertiò directè, motum e&longs;&longs;e effectum impetus ad intra, quem
præ&longs;tat in &longs;uo &longs;ubjecto;
igitur e&longs;t effectus formalis &longs;ecundarius;

nec
alius e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t, vt lib.1. demon&longs;trauimus;

at verò impetus e&longs;t effectus
alterius impetus ad extra;

igitur impetus e&longs;t cau&longs;a efficiens impetus, id­
que ad extra & cau&longs;a formalis, vel exigitiua motus ad intra;
igitur impetus e&longs;t cau&longs;a alterius impetus;

quia phy&longs;icè loquendo il­
lud vocamus cau&longs;am, ex cuius applicatione &longs;equitur nece&longs;&longs;ariò effectus;

atqui applicato corpore &longs;olo &longs;ine impetu nullus impetus producitur ad
extra, vt patet;

applicato verò cum impetu, producitur &longs;tatim alius im­
petus;
igitur ip&longs;e impetus e&longs;t cau&longs;a:
nec dicas requiri, vt conditionem;

quia primò, nullum e&longs;&longs;et munus huius conditionis; nec enim applica­
ret cau&longs;am &longs;ubjecto, nec remoueret vllum impedimentum.

Secundò di­
cam &longs;imiliter calorem e&longs;&longs;e conditionem.

Tertiò, dicerem etiam e&longs;&longs;e con­
ditionem ad motum.

Quartò, quis dicat corpus graue producere impe-
tum &longs;ur&longs;um immediatè per &longs;e; &longs;ed hæc omittamus, quæ leuia &longs;unt, præ­
&longs;ertim cùm demon&longs;trauerimus luculenter lib.1.impetum produci ab im­
petu, vt &longs;cilicet tollatur impedimentum.
Theorema 56.

Quando pellitur cylindrus innatans in puncto L non vertitur circa cen­
trum A.

Probatur, quia vertatur circa centrum A. v.g. & percurrat B
arcum BC, & totus cylindrus duos &longs;ectores BAC, GAH;
hoc po&longs;ito, &longs;patium totius cylindri erit, vt quadrans;

igi­
tur motus; igitur impetus:

iam verò vertatur circa centrum H, ita vt B
percurrat arcum BD æqualem BC (erit autem BD &longs;ubquadruplus qua­
drantis BF;) igitur totus cylindrus circa centrum H percurret &longs;patium
&longs;ectoris BHD æqualis quadranti BAE;

igitur motus circa centrum H
e&longs;t æqualis motui circa centrum A;

igitur e&longs;t eadem difficultas motus;
igitur non vertitur potiùs circa centrum A, quàm circa centrum H.
Theorema 57.

Pote&longs;t determinari centrum, circa quod vertitur cylindrus BH innatans
humido, modo &longs;upponatur æqualis den&longs;itatis, & cra&longs;&longs;itudinis;

diuidatur enim
AH bifariam in M:

Dico vertiginem futuram circa centrum M, quod
demon&longs;tro;

quia vertatur circa M, & extremitas B moueatur æquali
motu, quo priùs moueri &longs;upponebatur circa A, vel circa H;

totum autem &longs;patium
confectum hoc motu erit conflatum ex &longs;ectoribus BMN, & HMO, vt
patet:

igitur conflatum ex &longs;ectore BMN, & &longs;ectore HMO e&longs;t ad
quadrantem BAE, vel conflatum ex geminis &longs;ectoribus BAC, HAG
vt 3 1/3 ad 4. &longs;i autem accipiatur centrum, vel inter MA, vel MH, maius
erit &longs;patium, vt con&longs;tat ex Geometria;

igitur circa centrum M e&longs;t mini­
mum &longs;patium;
igitur minimus motus;

igitur minimus impetus; igitur
maxima facilitas; igitur &longs;i pellatur in B, vertetur circa M, quod hactenus
non explicatum modò ab aliquo, quod &longs;ciam, verùm etiam ne propo&longs;itum
quidem fuit.
Theorema 58.

Hinc facilè dictu e&longs;t, cur naues ita impul&longs;æ ab altera extremitate circa al­
teram extremitatem non vertantur, vt patet experientiâ;

quia hæc tendit
in partem oppo&longs;itam;

nec etiam circa centrum grauitatis nauis, quod
etiam manife&longs;tis experientiis confirmatur, cùm &longs;cilicet impul&longs;a extremi­
tas maiorem arcum de&longs;cribat, &longs;ed circa medium centrum inter vtrum­
que, ex quo principio tota remigationis ratio pendet:

e&longs;t autem aliquod punctum inter TA, ex quo &longs;i
pellatur, mouebitur circa punctum H;

pul&longs;a ex A per rectam
AL; pul&longs;a denique ex punctis, quæ &longs;unt inter BA, per arcus maiorum
circulorum, eò &longs;anè maiorum, quò propiùs punctum, ex quo pellitur, ac­
cedit ad A.
Theorema 59.

Si pellatur nauis, vel cylindrus BH in puncto T, difficiliùs mouebitur, etiam
ex &longs;uppo&longs;itione, quòd circa centrum M moueatur;

quod eodem modo de­
mon&longs;tratur, quo &longs;uprà;
accipiatur TZ æqualis BC;

&longs;it autem BT æqua­
lis TA;
certè arcus TS erit æqualis arcui BE;

igitur &longs;ector VMB erit
&longs;ubduplus quadrantis BMR:

&longs;imiliter &longs;ector HMX erit &longs;ubduplus qua­
drantis HMP;

igitur motus erit, vt aggregatum ex his duobus &longs;ectori­
bus;

&longs;ed cum applicatur potentia in B, motus e&longs;t vt aggregatum ex duo­
bus &longs;ectoribus BMN, HNO;

&longs;it autem quadrans BMR, vt 9. & qua­
drans HMP vt 1. igitur cum applicatur potentia in B, motus e&longs;t ad mo­
tum cum applicatur in T vt 3 1/3 ad 5. igitur & impetus; igitur facilitas
primi motus e&longs;t ad facilitatem &longs;ecundi, vt 5. ad 3 1/3 igitur in T diffici­
liùs pellitur, quàm in B.
Theorema 60.

Hinc maxima difficultas e&longs;t ad minimam, vt rectangulum BK ad aggre­
tum ex duobus &longs;ectoribus BMN & HMO, id e&longs;t vt 6. 2/7 ad 2. (13/21):

hinc
nauis, quæ pellitur è lateris puncto, quod re&longs;pondet centro A, difficiliùs
longè mouetur; &longs;uppono enim nauim e&longs;&longs;e eiu&longs;dem latitudinis, & den&longs;i­
tatis, nec &longs;abulo adhærere.
Theorema 61.

Si &longs;uperponatur corpus plano rotæ, quæ voluitur in circulo horizontali, pro­
iicietur per Tangentem extremam. v.g. &longs;it rota ABCD horizontali pa­
rallela quæ vertatur ab A ver&longs;us B celeri motu, &longs;itque planum eius le­
uigati&longs;&longs;imum;
imponatur globus etiam leuigati&longs;&longs;imus puncto A:

&longs;ed non impe­
ditur, quominus habeat &longs;uum motum;

nec enim globus prædictus ita
affigitur plano rotæ, quin liberè &longs;eor&longs;im moueri po&longs;&longs;it:

dixi per Tangen­
tem extremam, quia &longs;i imponatur globus puncto F;

certè non impelle­
tur per Tangentem F u, vt patebit ex &longs;equenti propo&longs;itione; quod à nul­
lo hactenus, quod &longs;ciam, ob&longs;eruatum fuit.
Theorema 62.

Si imponatur globus puncto F plani horizontalis rotæ ABCD, non proii­
cietur per Tangentem F u quod primò manife&longs;tis experimentis comproba­
tum e&longs;t.

cum autem circuli maiores rotæ moueantur velociùs, quàm FGH, po­
tiori iure mutari debet determinatio currentis globi in prædicto plano;

quænam verò &longs;it hæc linea motus, difficilè dictu e&longs;t; dicemus tamen
Tomo &longs;equenti, cum de lineis motus.
Scholium.

quia &longs;cilicet tunc angulus contingentiæ
e&longs;t maior;

hinc &longs;i terra moueretur (licèt reuerâ, quie&longs;cat) non e&longs;&longs;et pe­
riculum, ne proiicerentur lapides per Tangentem, quæ vix di&longs;taret per
longum &longs;patij tractum ab ip&longs;o arcu terræ, vt ob&longs;eruat Galileus, & res
ip&longs;a facilis e&longs;t; vnde miror nonnullos Philo&longs;ophos, alioquin docti&longs;&longs;i­
mos, id argumenti contra motum terræ áttuli&longs;&longs;e, cuius nulla penitus
vis e&longs;t, vt nonnemo in elementis Geometricis etiam mediocriter tinctus
facilè demon&longs;trabit.

Ob&longs;erua &longs;ecundò, ex his peti rationes projectionis fundæ, quæ in quo­
cunque circulo &longs;uos gyros habet; e&longs;t enim eadem ratio.

quià non mutatur determinatio impetus împre&longs;&longs;i corpori
incubanti; & cùm æqualis &longs;it impetus tùm in plano, tùm in globo.

v.g.
&longs;uperimpo&longs;ito, vtrumque æquali motu nece&longs;&longs;ario mouetur;

igitur &longs;ine
projectione;

&longs;ic dum nauis recto cur&longs;u mouetur &longs;ecundo flumine, omnia
quæ naui in&longs;unt, æqualiter cum ip&longs;a naui mouentur; at verò &longs;i planum
mouetur motu circulari, mutatur determinatio &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus, vnde
&longs;equitur projectio, vt dictum e&longs;t &longs;uprà.

Ob&longs;erua quartò, globum impo&longs;itum rotæ ABCD initio tardiùs, tùm
deinde velociùs moueri, quò &longs;cilicet plùs recedit à centro E, quia à pun­
ctis plani, in quibus rotatur, & quæ maiore motu vertuntur, maiorem
quoque impetus vim accipit.

quia accipit à &longs;ingulis punctis æqualem impetum ip&longs;i
impetui, qui ip&longs;is ine&longs;t; qui cum priori conjunctus diagonalem facit, vt
&longs;uprà dictum e&longs;t, cum de motu mixto & lib. 1. cum de determinatione
motus.

Ob&longs;eruabis &longs;extò, moueri motu accelerato maiori & maiori, quod
certè mirum e&longs;t;

cum tamen rota in cuius plano horizontali rotatur,
motu æquali moueatur;

maximè autem cre&longs;cit ille motus, quia priorem
&longs;emper impetum &longs;eruat, cui nouus &longs;emper accedit, exceptis paucis
gradibus, qui ob conflictum determinationum, & impetuum excidunt;
quia quotie&longs;cunque nouus impetus ad nouam lineam determinatus ac­
cedit priori, non e&longs;t dubium, quin de&longs;truatur aliquid impetus, quia ali­
quid fru&longs;trà e&longs;t, vt lib. 1. demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t.

Ob&longs;erua &longs;eptimò, aliud mirabilius, &longs;cilicet impetum po&longs;&longs;e produci in
eo mobili, cui iam ine&longs;t maior impetus, quàm in&longs;it alteri, à quo nouus
imprimitur; quod certè nunquam fieri pote&longs;t, cum nouus impetus ad
eandem lineam e&longs;t determinatus, ad quam prior impetus, qui mobili
ine&longs;t, iam determinatus e&longs;t.
Ob&longs;eruabis octauò;
hoc ip&longs;um vidimus in naui:

ratio
clara e&longs;t; quia prior impetus in globo productus, qui manet intactus,
&longs;uum effectum habet.

Ob&longs;eruabis nonò, &longs;i terra moueretur ex hypothe&longs;i Copernici, quæ
tamen fal&longs;i&longs;&longs;ima e&longs;t, idem Parallelus terre&longs;tris globi inæquali motu mo­
ueretur.

v. g. idem punctum Æquatoris, dum Soli directè re&longs;pondet de
meridie tardiore motu;

oppo&longs;itum verò de media nocte velociùs moue­
retur;

ex qua tamen inæqualitate motus aliqui malè &longs;u&longs;picantur æ&longs;tum
maris oriri;

quippe licèt fortè aliquis æ&longs;tus maris ex illa hypothe&longs;i &longs;e­
queretur, longè tamen diuer&longs;us ab eo, qui nunc e&longs;t; nam primò, iis omni­
bus qui eidem Meridiano &longs;ub&longs;unt eodem tempore accideret æ&longs;tus &longs;cili­
cet de meridie.

Secundò his, qui propiùs accedunt ad polos longè minor
æ&longs;tus e&longs;&longs;et; vtrumque autem fal&longs;um e&longs;&longs;e con&longs;tat.

Tertiò, eadem &longs;emper
hora in &longs;ingulis punctis eiu&longs;dem Paralleli &longs;eor&longs;im ferueret æ&longs;tus; &longs;ed de
his aliàs plura.

Ob&longs;eruabis decimò, quò diutius potentia motrix manet applicata, ac­
cedente continenter maiore ni&longs;u, maior quoque impetus producitur in
rota, quod clarum e&longs;t; vnde diutiùs deinde rota ver&longs;atur.

Ob&longs;eruabis vndecimò, trochum in gyros actum ita aliquando ver&longs;ari,
vt &longs;tare pror&longs;us immobilis videatur; quia ferreum fulcrum, cui ligneus
conus innititur vel excauato &longs;ibi foramine excurrere vltrà non pote&longs;t,
vel motu centri penitus quie&longs;cente &longs;upere&longs;t tantùm motus orbis.

&longs;ed quia hæc pertinent ad motum mixtum ex
circularibus in libro 9. remitto: & verò multa &longs;unt in hoc trochi motu,
quæ&longs;i attentè con&longs;iderentur, maximam admirationem mouere po&longs;&longs;int.

nulla e&longs;&longs;et inclinata vertigo, antequam impetus extinguere­
tur; cur enim potiùs in vnam partem, quàm in aliam.

Ob&longs;eruabis decimoquarto aquam in vorticibus facilè circulari motu
conuolui, & aëra, vel halitum in turbinibus;

quia &longs;cilicet vel nullus, vel
modicus e&longs;t obex: idem dico de nube, fumo, acu magnetica, trocho, vel
&longs;phæra læuigata in plano leuigato.

Ob&longs;eruabis decimoquintò, &longs;i in eadem parte plani diu vertatur Tro­
chus, qua&longs;i excauat &longs;ibi foramen;

arrodit enim plani partes &longs;uis denti­
culis; etiam pelitum ferrum:

inde etiam impetum de&longs;trui certum e&longs;t;
nec enim &longs;ine re&longs;i&longs;tentia id fieri pote&longs;t.

Ob&longs;eruabis decimo&longs;extò, impetum eundem habere po&longs;&longs;e motum cir­
cularem, & rectum in &longs;ublunaribus, & per accidens determinari tantùm
ad motum circularem, ratione &longs;cilicet impedimenti, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis.

Ob&longs;eruabis decimo&longs;eptimò, motum rectum accelerari, &longs;ed diu non
durare;
retardari verò violentum, ac æquè diu durare;

circularem
verò non accelerari, &longs;ed minùs retardari, atque adeo
longè diutiùs durare; quia tantùm per accidens
retardatur, &longs;ed de his
&longs;atis.

LIBER OCTAVVS,
DE MOTV FVNEPENDVLORVM.

NIHIL inuenio apud antiquos, quod ad
hoc genus motus pertineat;

&longs;unt tamen
plerique recentiores qui fusè de illo di­
&longs;putarunt, quorum haud dubiè princi­
pem locum obtinet Galileus, qui &longs;anè
mirabiles aliquas huius motus affectiones explicat
tùm in gemino Sy&longs;themate; tùm in Dialogis, cui ac­
cedunt Balianus Mercennus, & nonnulli alij.

Ego verò in hoc libro omnium vibrationum cau­
&longs;as inquiram, quæ &longs;unt duplicis generis:

Primum e&longs;t
earum, quibus vibrata hinc inde funependula agun­
tur, quæ titulum huic libro fecerunt; &longs;unt autem tres
funependulorum &longs;pecies.

Prima e&longs;t eorum, quæ in al­
tera extremitate fune appen&longs;a vibrantur in circulo
verticali.

Secunda e&longs;t eorum, quæ ab altera etiam ex­
tremitate appen&longs;a fune priùs obtorto in circulo ho­
rizontali &longs;uos agunt gyros.

Tertia e&longs;t chordarum,
quarum vtraque extremitas clauo immobili affigi­
tur.

Secundum genus vibrationum e&longs;t earum, quibus
aguntur grauia cum à &longs;uo centro grauitatis remouen­
tur, vt &longs;e&longs;e reducant, quarum &longs;unt duæ &longs;pecies; prima
e&longs;t earum, quibus vibratur in circulo verticali corpus
aliquod circa alteram extremitatem, vt campana.

Secunda e&longs;t earum, quibus vibrantur grauia circa
punctum proximum &longs;uo centro grauitatis, &longs;ic v. g.
trabs trabi &longs;uperimpo&longs;ita libratur, & vibratur.
DEFINITIO I.

VIbratio funependuli primæ &longs;peciei e&longs;t motus circularis, quo a&longs;cendit, &
de&longs;cendit funependulum;
&longs;unt autem aliæ æquales, aliæ inæquales:
æquales &longs;unt, quæ &longs;unt eiu&longs;dem radij, inæquales è contrario:

aliæ &longs;imi­
les, quæ &longs;imiles arcus complectuntur; di&longs;&longs;imiles è contrario:

aliæ æquè
diuturnæ, quæ temporibus æqualibus perficiuntur:
portio vetò vibrationis e&longs;t arcus; &longs;ed hæc omnia in propo&longs;ito.

Sche­
mate explicamus;

&longs;it enim plumbeus globus E appen&longs;us fune EA ex
puncto A immobili, AE e&longs;t radius, vel longitudo funependuli E, NEC
e&longs;t vibratio integra, LER non integra, LE portio vibrationis NEC,
NL & MF portiones &longs;imiles, MDB, NEC vibrationes inæquales: ex
his reliqua facilè intelligi poterunt.
Definitio 2.

Momentum e&longs;t exce&longs;&longs;us virtutis mouentis &longs;upra re&longs;istentiam alterius. v. g.
&longs;int brachia vectis inæqualia, momentum e&longs;t in longiore ea vis, qua de­
&longs;cendens deor&longs;um &longs;ur&longs;um attollit minus &longs;eu breuius.
Definitio 3.
Ten&longs;io e&longs;t vis allata ab extrin&longs;eco corpore, qua augetur eius exten&longs;io;

res
e&longs;t clara in ten&longs;o fune, quomodocunque id fiat, quod hîc non di&longs;cutio;
compre&longs;&longs;io verò e&longs;t vis illata ab extrin&longs;eco corpori, qua contrahitur eius
exten&longs;io v.g. in intorto fune.

Ob&longs;eruabis autem ad ten&longs;ionem, & compre&longs;&longs;ionem requiri, vt &longs;ubla­
ta illa vi extrin&longs;eca, vel impedimento admoto corpus ten&longs;um, vel com­
pre&longs;&longs;um ad pri&longs;tinam exten&longs;ionem &longs;e&longs;e reducat; neque di&longs;puto de mo­
do, quo id fieri po&longs;&longs;it, qui alterius loci e&longs;t.
Hypothe&longs;is 1.

Corpus graue funependulum à &longs;uæ quiete, vel è &longs;uo centro grauitatis remo­
tum de&longs;cendit &longs;uâ &longs;ponte, iterumque a&longs;cendit, id e&longs;t vibratur; cer­
tum e&longs;t.
Hypothe&longs;is 2.

Funependula longiora maiore tempore &longs;uam vibrationam conficiunt, bre­
uiora minore; quod etiam certum e&longs;t.
Hypothe&longs;is 3.

Motus naturalis e&longs;t acceleratus in tempore &longs;en&longs;ibili in proportione nume­
rorum 1.3.5.7. &c. quod multis explicatum e&longs;t lib. 2. &longs;i verò acceleratio
a&longs;&longs;umatur in &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus finitis, e&longs;t iuxta &longs;eriem &longs;implicem nu­
merorum 1. 2. 3. 4. &c.
Hypothe&longs;is 4.

Motus in plano inclinato e&longs;t ad motum in perpendiculari, vt perpendicula­
ris ad inclinatam;

quod etiam lib.5.fusè explicatum e&longs;t; e&longs;t autem &longs;em­
per in plano inclinato motus prioris grauis.
Hypothe&longs;is 5.

In quadrante incubante perpendiculariter plano horizontali, tot &longs;unt di­
uer&longs;a plana inclinata, quot &longs;unt puncta, &longs;eu Tangentes; hoc etiam certum
e&longs;t, & angulus contingentiæ maior e&longs;t in minore circulo, minor in
maiore.
Hypothe&longs;is 6.

Nullus arcus circuli e&longs;t vt linea recta, nec &longs;ine errore accipi pote&longs;t vt recta,
contrariam hypothe&longs;im aliqui &longs;upponunt, quam tamen fal&longs;am e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ciunt;
licèt enim quoad &longs;en&longs;um error &longs;ube&longs;&longs;e non po&longs;&longs;it;

attamen repugnat
Geometriæ:

hinc &longs;uppo&longs;itio no&longs;tra Geometricè vera e&longs;t; &longs;ed de hoc in­
frà fusè.
Axioma 1.

Tamdiu durat motus, quandiu durat impetus; hic autem tandiu durat,
quamdiu non e&longs;t frustrà.
Axioma 2.

Noua determinatio impotus cum priore facit mixtum &longs;i determinatio mixta
facit nouam lineam.
Axioma 3.

Quotie&longs;cunque fit mixta determinatio per acce&longs;&longs;ionem noni impetus, de­
&longs;truitur aliquid impetus prioris, patet.
Axioma 4.
Impetus innatus non concurrit ad motum &longs;ur&longs;um.
Axioma 5.

In inclinata minùs destruitur impetus dato tempore, quàm in perpendicu­
lari &longs;ur&longs;um, plùs verò destruitur, quò propiùs accedit ad verticalem; hæc
omnia quæ loco Axiomatum hîc propo&longs;ui, in &longs;uperioribus libris, præ­
&longs;ertim in Quinto abundè demon&longs;traui.
Theorema 1.
Funependulum de&longs;cendit motu accelerato;

&longs;cilicet impetus nouus &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus
producitur, cùm &longs;it &longs;emper eadem cau&longs;a applicata;

corpus enim graue
&longs;ua &longs;ponte de&longs;cendit;
quod autem impetui priori accedat, patet;

nec
enim de&longs;truitur &longs;altem totus alioqui fru&longs;trà produceretur, contra Axio­
ma primum, adde quòd in plano inclinato deor&longs;um graue de&longs;cendit motu
naturaliter accelerato;
igitur impetus maior;

igitur
cre&longs;cit impetus;
igitur motus e&longs;t acceleratus;

deinde maior vibratio, &
minor eiu&longs;dem penduli fiunt ferè temporibus æqualibus;

igitur nece&longs;&longs;a­
riò acceleratur motus:

Denique probatur euidenter non de&longs;trui totum
priorem impetum;

quia &longs;cilicet idem e&longs;t impedimentum, &longs;i quod e&longs;t ad
productionem noui, quod e&longs;t ad con&longs;eruationem prioris;

quia &longs;cilicet in omni plano in­
clinato corpus graue mouetur per hypoth.4. igitur non impedit con&longs;er­
uationem prioris, &longs;altem totam, licèt fortè aliquid de&longs;trueretur, de quo
paulò pò&longs;t;
igitur acceleratur nece&longs;&longs;ariò ille motus:

Et hæc e&longs;t ratio à
priori huius effectus, quòd &longs;cilicet plùs addatur impetus, quàm tollatur;
igitur remanet maior;

igitur velocior motus; in qua verò ratione minùs
de&longs;truatur quàm producatur, vel nouus &longs;it minor priore, dicemus
infrà.
Theorema 2.
In motu funependuli decre&longs;cunt &longs;emper incrementa motus.

Probatur faci­
lè;

quia cùm in &longs;ingulis punctis de&longs;cen&longs;us arcus NE mutetur ratio plani
inclinati diuer&longs;a ab ea, quæ e&longs;t in puncto que &longs;unt enim vt Tangentes;

at qui motus in planis,
quæ accedunt propiùs ad horizontalem, minor e&longs;t;

igitur incrementa
motus quæ in de&longs;cen&longs;u NE accedunt, minora &longs;unt ver&longs;us E, maiora ver­
&longs;us N; igitur decre&longs;cunt, quod erat demon&longs;trandum.

Ob&longs;eruabis iam demon&longs;tratum lib.5. Th.62.63. hæc incrementa e&longs;&longs;e,
vt &longs;inus arcus re&longs;idui, quæ tu con&longs;ule, ne hic repetere cogar.
Theorema 3.

Hinc &longs;emper cre&longs;cit motus funependuli in de&longs;cen&longs;u arcus NE, &longs;ed minori­
bus &longs;en&longs;im incrementis;
quod etiam aliàs ob&longs;eruatum e&longs;t;

vnde nece&longs;&longs;ariò
concludo minùs accelerari in quadrante NE, quàm in perpendiculari
NS, quod demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t, & minus &longs;patium percurri in arcu NE
æquali &longs;cilicet tempore, quàm in perpendiculari NS, quod nece&longs;&longs;arium
e&longs;t:

Nec e&longs;t quod aliquis &longs;ua experimenta opponat, &longs;cilicet quadrantem
NE percurri tempore vnius &longs;ecundi, &longs;i radius AE &longs;it tripedalis, cùm
alioqui perpendiculum AE graue corpus percurrat eodem tempore,
quorum alterum, vel potiùs vtrumque fal&longs;um e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t;

nam primò
quadrans NE e&longs;t maior radio AE;

igitur percurrit citiùs AE quàm
NE: &longs;ecundò, minora &longs;unt motus incrementa in quadrante, quia &longs;in­
gula puncta illius habent rationem plani inclinati, quis autem tam ac­
curatè in tripedali pendulo iu&longs;tum tempus ob&longs;eruare po&longs;&longs;it?

nec accuratæ
illæ ob&longs;eruationes e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;unt, quæ &longs;en&longs;ibiles non &longs;unt, &longs;iue aures con­
&longs;ulas, quæ &longs;onum excipiunt, &longs;iue oculos, qui motum ip&longs;um ob&longs;eruant.

Tertiò, &longs;i oculos con&longs;ulis; num ip&longs;i potiùs vident motum vibrati pendu­
li e&longs;&longs;e tardiorem, quàm demi&longs;&longs;i per lineam perpendicularem?

nec alius
nodus hic &longs;oluendus e&longs;t, nec aër &longs;en&longs;ibiliter pilæ plumbeæ re&longs;i&longs;tit, nec
minùs re&longs;i&longs;tit motui circulari quàm recto.

Denique compertum e&longs;t à me
in longiore pendulo motum in arcu e&longs;&longs;e tardiorem, quàm in perpendi­
culo:

tùm demi&longs;&longs;o ex A globulo plum­
beo &longs;imulque alio æquali pendulo &longs;cilicet circa A ex N per NE;

ex quo
accidit citiùs auditum e&longs;&longs;e ictum globi cadentis perpendiculariter, quàm
vibrati per arcum NE: quis autem hoc non videat, &longs;iue &longs;en&longs;um ip&longs;um,
&longs;iue rationem con&longs;ulat?
fuit meum pendulum 12. pedes longum.

Quæreret aliquis primò quanta fuerit differentia temporum Secundò,
quanto tempore globus pendulus ex N in E peruenerit.

Re&longs;pondeo inu­
tilem e&longs;&longs;e quæ&longs;tionem;

nec enim minimas illas temporum differentias
&longs;en&longs;u metiri po&longs;&longs;umus;

&longs;i enim affirmarem cum nonnullis corpus graue
per medium liberum 12. &longs;patij pedes conficere vno temporis &longs;ecundo;

certè &longs;i quis contenderet vel dee&longs;&longs;e, vel &longs;upere&longs;&longs;e 1000. in&longs;tantia; quonam
argumento, vel experimento contrarium euincere po&longs;&longs;em?

quod certè
dictum e&longs;&longs;e velim, vt vel inde o&longs;tendatur in ca&longs;&longs;um laborare eos, qui
hanc &longs;cientiam his tantùm experimentis confirmant, quæ circa in&longs;en&longs;i­
bilia ver&longs;antur.

Equidem magnifacio in rebus phy&longs;icis experimentum,
&longs;ine quo nulla hypothe&longs;is e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t;

at modo &longs;en&longs;ibile &longs;it, alioqui cer­
tum e&longs;&longs;e non pote&longs;t;

&longs;i autem &longs;en&longs;ibile e&longs;t, omnibus commune e&longs;&longs;e debet,
sum &longs;en&longs;us applicent;

igitur nunquam vir prudens &longs;e&longs;e accinget ad in­
dagandam rationem alicuius experimenti, quod certum e&longs;&longs;e non pote&longs;t:

vnde &longs;i quis omnes ob&longs;eruationes, tùm à Plinio, tùm à Cardano, tùm à
Fraca&longs;torio, tùm à Porta, tùm ab aliis propo&longs;itas ad principia phy&longs;ica re­
ducere velit, per me &longs;tat, non contradico; numquam tamen illa mihi
mens erit, cui &longs;atis e&longs;t rationes, & cau&longs;as phy&longs;icas illorum tantùm expe­
rimentorum explicare, quæ mihi certa &longs;unt, &longs;untque omnibus commu­
nia, vel e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;unt.
Theorema 4.
In motu funependuli &longs;ingulis instantibus e&longs;t noua determinatio motus.

Pro­
batur, quia &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus e&longs;t qua&longs;i nouum planum;

atqui in &longs;ingulis nouis planis
mutatur determinatio;

igitur in &longs;ingulis punctis; igitur in &longs;ingulis in­
&longs;tantibus.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis e&longs;&longs;e aliqua Lemmata præmittenda antequam proportio­
nes motus per arcum NE demon&longs;trentur.
Lemma 1.

Pote&longs;t determinari tempus, quo percurruntur duo &longs;patia æqualia motu na­
turaliter accelerato inæquali. &longs;it v.g. tempus AF;

&longs;it velocitas EF ac­
qui&longs;ita tempore AF motu &longs;cilicet naturaliter accelerato minore;

&longs;it
etiam velocitas FD acqui&longs;ita alio motu maiore eodem tempore AF;

&longs;patium verò acqui&longs;itum tempo­
re AF primo motu, &longs;cilicet minore, idque v.g. in ratione &longs;ubdupla erit
ad &longs;patium acqui&longs;itum &longs;ecundo motu maiore tempore &longs;ubduplo AI, vt
triangulum EAF ad triangulum BAI, &longs;ed BAI, e&longs;t &longs;ubduplum EAF,
id e&longs;t, vt FA ad IA, vt patet:

vt autem inueniantur tempora, quæ re­
&longs;pondent &longs;patiis inæqualibus;

&longs;it AH media proportionalis inter AI &
AF;
haud dubiè triangulum CHA e&longs;t &longs;ubduplum DAF;

igitur æquale
EAF;

nore;
acqui&longs;ita verò tempore AH motu maiore &longs;it HC;

certè &longs;patia
erunt vt CHA & DAF:

&longs;ed hæc &longs;unt æqualia; igitur motu maiore con­
ficitur æquale &longs;patium tempore AH & motu minore tempore AF.
Lemma 2.

Si accipiantur tempora æqualia cum motibus inæqualibus, &longs;patia &longs;unt vt
ba&longs;es triangulorum;

locitas IB, & minore IK;
certè &longs;patia &longs;unt vt triangula BAI, KAI;

&longs;ed hæc &longs;unt vt ba&longs;es BI, KI, immò &longs;unt vt rectangula BA KA; nec
in his e&longs;t quidquam difficultatis.
Lemma 3.

&longs;it motus per ip&longs;am perpendicula­
rem AP, vel DI;
&longs;it motus etiam per chordam inclinatam DP;

velo­
citas primi e&longs;t ad velocitatem &longs;ecundi in tempore DI, vt DP ad DI,

DP, quæ omnia con&longs;tant;

æqualibus, &longs;ique eo tempore quo percurritur DP, percurritur DT, &
eo quo percurritur FP, percurritur.

F d; certè DT & F d &longs;unt
quales.

media proportionalis inter duas primas & media inter duas posteriores, &longs;itque

quàm EB;
