minima longitudine cogno&longs;citur maxima v.g.&longs;it funependulum tripeda­
le, cuius integra vibratio tempore vnius &longs;ecundi minuti peragitur, vt
aliqui volunt (quod tantùm exempli gratia a&longs;&longs;umptum &longs;it) numerentur.

v.g. 10. vibrationes huius tripedalis funependuli eo tempore, quo duæ
æntùm vibrationes alterius maioris numerantur; &longs;int quadrati 100. &
4. certè longitudo maioris e&longs;t ad longitudinem maioris vt 4. ad 100.igi­
tur &longs;i 4. dant 100. quid dabunt 3. habeo 75. igitur longitudo maioris
funependuli e&longs;t 75. pedum.

Tertiò, pote&longs;t cogno&longs;ci altitudo putei quan­
tumuis alti&longs;&longs;imi, vel alterius loci editi, ex quo demittitur corpus graue;

&longs;i enim toto eo tempore, quo corpus graue cadit, numerentur 6. vibratio­
nes tripedalis funependuli;

haud dubiè motus ille durauit &longs;ex minutis
&longs;ecundis; igitur &longs;i præcogno&longs;catur quantum &longs;patij percurratur deor&longs;um,
dum fluit vnum &longs;ecundum minutum, quod &longs;it.v.g.

&longs;patium pedum 18 6/7
hoc po&longs;ito, quadrentur tempora &longs;cilicet, & 6. habeo 1. & 36. iam facio
regulam trium, &longs;i 1.dat.

18 6/7 quid dabunt 36. & habeo 619. pedes mi­
nus 1/2.

Ob&longs;eruabis autem dictum fui&longs;&longs;e à me &longs;uprà funependulum tripedale
peragere &longs;uam integram vibrationem tempore vnius &longs;ecundi minuti;
quod certè, vt ait eruditus Mer&longs;ennus, &longs;æpiùs ob&longs;eruatum e&longs;t;

hæc autem
e&longs;t ob&longs;eruatio Mer&longs;enni, quam habet in Bali&longs;t. prop.15.eamque &longs;æpiùs,
vt ip&longs;e ait, iteratam:

igitur nongenta &longs;ecunda; igitur cum &longs;ingulæ vibrationes
æquali tempore peragantur &longs;ingulis &longs;ecundis minutis re&longs;pondent.
Inde in&longs;ignem difficultatem educit idem auctor;

cum enim in per­
pendiculari deor&longs;um percurrantur 12. pedes tempore vnius &longs;ecundi mi­
nuti, & 48. tempore duorum &longs;ecundorum, quod multis ob&longs;eruationibus
comprobatum e&longs;t;

certè tempore &longs;emi&longs;ecundi minuti 3. tantùm pedes
confici nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t;

igitur eo tempore, quo radius tripedalis percurritur,
totus etiam percurritur quadrantis arcus, qui e&longs;t 4 3/7;

igitur maior e&longs;t
motus in arcu, quàm in perpendiculari, quod dici non pote&longs;t; cùm ne
æqualis quidem &longs;it.

Ad &longs;oluendum hunc nodum &longs;upponendum e&longs;t vibrationes minores
citiùs peragi, quàm maiores;
quod etiam ibidem ob&longs;eruat idem auctor;

igitur non e&longs;t dubium, quin longè plures vibrationes fiant, quàm fierent
&longs;i omnes e&longs;&longs;ent æquales arcui quadrantis;

&longs;i enim numeres minores dum
alius numerat maiores;

cum numerabis 10. ille vix 9. habebit, & &longs;i
omnes maiores e&longs;&longs;ent æquales primæ integræ, dum habes 9. vix haberet
8. itaque non re&longs;pondent &longs;ingulæ vibrationes æquales primæ integræ
&longs;ingulis &longs;ecundis minutis; &longs;ed ferè &longs;ingulis plùs 16. vel 17. minutis
tertiis.

Quare eo tempore, quo percurritur arcus quadrantis funependuli tri­
pedalis non percurruntur in perpendiculo 6. pedes;

v.g. in figura Lem.3.percurruntur DT
dupla radij ID, eo tempore, quo percurritur DP;

&longs;ed DP percurritur
tardiùs, quàm arcus DKP;
igitur DKP citiùs quàm DT;

præterea
non percurruntur tantùm in perpendiculo eodem tempore pedes &longs;patij
4 5/7, vel vndecim, &longs;i radius con&longs;tat 7. pedibus, vt voluit idem auctor l. 2.
de cau&longs;is &longs;onorum Prop. 27. Cor. 3. quia &longs;i radius habet 3. arcus
quadrantis habet 4 5/7. &longs;i radius habet 7. arcus quadrantis habet 11.
&longs;ed eodem tempore conficitur maius &longs;patium in perpendiculo, quàm in
arcu, cuius ratio con&longs;tat clari&longs;&longs;imè ex dictis, quia dum mobile mouea­
tur in perpendiculo &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus nouum impetum æqualem pri­
mo producit, in arcu verò minorem;
igitur minor e&longs;t motus;

igitur non percurruntur 11. tantùm in perpendiculo eo tempore
quo 11. percurruntur in arcu; quantum verò &longs;patium in perpendiculo
percurratur eo tempore, quo arcus quadrantis dati conficitur, determi­
nabimus infrà.

Denique ob&longs;eruabis, ex hoc etiam po&longs;&longs;e concludi omnes vibrationes
eiu&longs;dem funependuli non e&longs;&longs;e æquè diuturnas;

nam reuerà &longs;i æquè diu­
turnæ e&longs;&longs;ent, & nongentæ numeratæ e&longs;&longs;ent &longs;patio 15. minutorum;

haud
dubiè &longs;ingulæ &longs;ingulis &longs;ecundis minutis re&longs;ponderent; igitur eo tempore,
quo tres &longs;patij pedes decurrerentur in perpendiculo, in quadrantis arcu
4. 3/7 conficerentur, quod fieri non pote&longs;t.
Theorema 14.

In a&longs;cen&longs;u vibrationis funependuli de&longs;truitur impetus; patet, quia de&longs;init
motus;
igitur & impetus, ne &longs;it fru&longs;trà;

præterea applicatum e&longs;t princi­
pium de&longs;tructionis impetus;

igitur de&longs;truitur; antecedens ex dicendis
infra clari&longs;&longs;imum euadet.

De&longs;truitur autem impetus propter impetum innatum, qui &longs;ingulis in­
&longs;tantibus contranititur;
ille verò &longs;ur&longs;um, ex quo determinatio mixta oritur;

vnde ali­
quid impetus de&longs;truitur, ne &longs;it fru&longs;trà; idem pror&longs;us dicendum e&longs;t in a&longs;­
cen&longs;u per arcum.
Theorema 15.

Singulis in&longs;tantibus inæqualiter de&longs;truitur impetus in a&longs;cen&longs;u illo vibratio­
nis; prob.

quia &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus mutatur determinatio, id e&longs;t ratio
plani inclinati;

nam quodlibet punctum arcus, vt &longs;æpè dictum e&longs;t, facit
planum inclinatum diuer&longs;um;

igitur lineæ vtriu&longs;que determinationis
faciunt diuer&longs;um angulum;
Theorema 16.

impetus qui de&longs;truitur in H, e&longs;t ad impetum qui de&longs;truitur in per­
pendiculari &longs;ur&longs;um (&longs;uppo&longs;ito &longs;cilicet tempore) vt &longs;inus HC ad &longs;inum HA;

nam de&longs;truitur in ea ratione, iuxta quam de&longs;trueretur in plano inclinato
EH;

&longs;ed in planis inclinatis iuxta prædictam rationem impetum de&longs;trui
demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t &longs;uo loco;

adde quod impetus innatus determinat mo­
bile ad lineam deor&longs;um HG, alius verò ad lineam HM;

igitur de&longs;truitur
&longs;ubduplus impetus, quia e&longs;t fru&longs;trà;
&longs;ed HC e&longs;t &longs;ubdupla HA:

&longs;ed
motus per HE e&longs;t ad motum per AD vt HE ad AE, vel vt HC ad HA;

igitur illa vis, quæ retrahit mobile per HE e&longs;t ad eam, qua retrahitur
per AD vt HC ad HA;

&longs;ed in eadem proportione de&longs;truitur impetus,
quo mobile fertur &longs;ur&longs;um, in qua retrahitur deor&longs;um;

igitur impetus de­
&longs;tructus in H e&longs;t ad de&longs;tructum in perpendiculo vt HC ad HA; ergo
vt &longs;inus rectus arcus inferioris e&longs;t ad &longs;inum totum.
Dictum e&longs;t eodem tempore;

nam minori tempore minùs impetus de­
&longs;truitur, plùs verò maiori;

alioquin vitio&longs;a e&longs;&longs;et proportio,
& comparatio; idem dico de impetu producto, quod de de&longs;tructo.
Corollarium.

Inde colliges in eadem proportione minùs impetus de&longs;trui in a&longs;cen&longs;u
per planum inclinatum, quâ minùs producitur in de&longs;cen&longs;u.
Theorema 17.

Totus impetus qui concurrit ad de&longs;cen&longs;um funependuli, non concurrit ad
a&longs;cen&longs;um, prob.

quia impetus innatus non concurrit ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, vt
con&longs;tat ex dictis alibi; &longs;ed hic concurrit ad de&longs;cen&longs;um.
Theorema 18.

Aliquis etiam gradus impetus concurrit ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, qui non concurrit
ad de&longs;cen&longs;um, probatur, quia vltimo in&longs;tanti de&longs;cen&longs;us aliquid impetus
noui producitur quantumuis minimi, quia &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus motus
deor&longs;um aliquid impetus accedit;

&longs;ed ille impetus non concurrit ad mo­
tum deor&longs;um;

quia cum primo illo in&longs;tanti, quo e&longs;t, non concurrat ad
motum, cumque illud in&longs;tans &longs;it vltimum motus deor&longs;um;

certè ad mo­
tum deor&longs;um non concurrit, &longs;ed ad motum &longs;ur&longs;um concurrit, nam pri­
mo in&longs;tanti, quo e&longs;t, exigit motum pro &longs;equenti; e&longs;t autem &longs;equens
in&longs;tans primum a&longs;cen&longs;us.
Theorema 19.

A&longs;cen&longs;us funependuli non e&longs;t æqualis de&longs;cen&longs;ui: patet experientiâ; ratio
e&longs;t manife&longs;ta;

quia impetus innatus non concurrit ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, licèt ad
de&longs;cen&longs;um concurrat;

nec dicas impetus gradum vltimum non concur­
rere etiam ad de&longs;cen&longs;um, licèt concurrat ad a&longs;cen&longs;um;

nec enim e&longs;t pa­
ritas;

quia impetus innatus, &longs;eu primus gradus e&longs;t perfecti&longs;&longs;imus omnium
productorum;

vltimus verò imperfecti&longs;&longs;imus, tùm quia producitur mi­
nori tempore, tùm quia producitur in plano inclinati&longs;&longs;imo; igitur &longs;i
comparetur cum primo, pro nullo ferè haberi deber impetus.
Corollarium.

Hinc manife&longs;ta ratio, cur funependulum po&longs;t vibrationem de&longs;cen&longs;us
non perueniat in a&longs;cen&longs;u ad tantam altitudinem;

nec e&longs;t quod aliqui di­
cant aëra interceptum efficere, ne ad æqualem altitudinem a&longs;cendat,
cùm aër non minùs re&longs;i&longs;tat de&longs;cen&longs;ui, quàm a&longs;cen&longs;ui; quod quomodo
fiat, iam alibi explicuimus.
Theorema 20.

Maioris vibrationis a&longs;cen&longs;us imminuitur in maiori proportione, quàm mi­
noris;

certa experientia, cuius ratio e&longs;t, quia in arcu &longs;uperiore plùs im­
petus de&longs;truitur, in inferiore minùs;

igitur plùs &longs;patij detrahitur maiori
vibrationi, quàm minori, &longs;cilicet in a&longs;cen&longs;u;

&longs;it enim in eadem figura pla­
num inclinatum DO, & verticale DA;

igitur &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus minùs impetus
in DO de&longs;truitur, quàm in DA;
vnde maius &longs;patium conficitur;

e&longs;t enim
DO maior DA:
ita pror&longs;us accidit in arcu a&longs;cen&longs;us funependuli;

&longs;it enim
arcus a&longs;cen&longs;us DH æqualis arcui de&longs;cen&longs;us oppo&longs;iti;

certè tantillùm im­
petus de&longs;truetur;
igitur arcus a&longs;cen&longs;us ferè accedet ad A;

&longs;i vetò arcus
de&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;it æqualis DL, plùs impetus de&longs;truetur in a&longs;cen&longs;u; igitur ar­
cus a&longs;cen&longs;us habebit minorem proportionem ad DL, quàm prior ad DH,
& hæc e&longs;t veri&longs;&longs;ima ratio luculenti&longs;&longs;imi experimenti, quod ferè omnibus
notum e&longs;t.
Theorema 21.

Si proijciatur mobile per ip&longs;um perpendiculum DA cum eo impetu, quo
ex D feratur in A motu naturaliter retardato;

certè cum eodem impetu fere­
tur in O per DO, & per arcum DLO: probatur quia ex A in D, vel ex O
in D &longs;iue per chordam OD, &longs;iue per arcum OHD æqualis impetus ac­
quiritur per Lemma 11. &longs;ed cum eodem impetu, quo ex A fertur in D.
vel ex O in D motu naturaliter accelerato, ex D ferri pote&longs;t in A vel in
O:

dixi cum eodem impetu, ita vt tot gradus impetus concurrant ad a&longs;­
cen&longs;um, quot ad de&longs;cen&longs;um;

&longs;i enim aliquis gradus concurrens ad de&longs;­
cen&longs;um, non concurreret ad a&longs;cen&longs;um;

haud dubiè non perueniret mo­
bile ad eandem altitudinem; quod autem æquale &longs;patium re&longs;pondeat
a&longs;cen&longs;ui, & de&longs;cen&longs;ui &longs;uppo&longs;ito æquali impetu, iam demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t &longs;u­
prà l. 3. & 5. &longs;ed iam examinandæ &longs;unt proportiones huius de&longs;tructio­
nis impetus in maioribus, & minoribus vibrationibus.
Theorema 22.

fit cum punctum infimum D, &longs;itque in pendule ille impe­
tus, haud dubiè per arcum ferretur in a, ducatur aQ parallela AO;

haud
dubiè per arcum feretur in Q & per chordam DO perueniet in q;

denique &longs;i ferri tantùm po&longs;&longs;it illo impetu per DA in
G, feretur in 3 per DO, & in H per arcum;

quæ omnia con&longs;tant ex Th.
20. quia cum eodem impetu a&longs;cendit mobile ad eandem altitudinem
&longs;iue per ip&longs;um perpendiculum, &longs;iue per chordas, &longs;iue per arcus; ex hoc
confirmatur maximè Th.10. quia &longs;i diuidatur perpendiculum in partes
æquales ductis parallelis AO, arcus ita diuidetur, vt &longs;uperior arcus &longs;it
minor.
v.g. diuidatur DA in B æqualiter bifariam;

igitur cùm eo tantùm impetu, quo in perpendiculo acquireretur in
a&longs;cen&longs;u DB &longs;ubduplum DA, in arcu acquiretur DL, quæ e&longs;t 2/3 totius D­
O; igitur minores vibrationes minùs imminuuntur in a&longs;cen&longs;u, quàm
maiores.
Theorema 23.

Hinc tam facilè vibratur funependulum per minimum arcum, v. g. cum
primo impetu, quo a&longs;cenderet ex D in C vel in 3. a&longs;cendit in H; quia &longs;cilicet
cum eo impetu, quo minimum ferè &longs;patium acquirit in perpendiculo,
notabile &longs;atis &longs;patium decurrit in arcu.
Theorema 24.
Hinc tamdiu durant minimæ illa vibrationes;

quia &longs;ingulæ minima por­
tione imminuuntur, & maiores è contrariò tam citò decurtantur;

cuius re&longs;
non e&longs;t alia ratio præter eam, quam &longs;uprà adduximus, quæ rem ip&longs;am
euincit; e&longs;t tamen in&longs;ignis difficultas, quam paulò po&longs;t di&longs;cutiemus in
&longs;equenti Schol. Theorema 25.

Hinc ratio, cur minimo &longs;erè cur&longs;u funependulum etiam graui&longs;&longs;imum modi­
ca libratione vibretur;

pro quo diligenter ob&longs;eruandum e&longs;t, vt eo dumtaxat ordine an­
helitus repetatur, quo vibrationes fiunt, ita vt iam euntem molem à
tergo impellat; vnde accidet, vt repetito tandem anhelitu maiore motu
funependulum vibretur.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis primò maximam occurrere difficultatem contra ea, quæ
hactenus demon&longs;trauimus; &longs;it enim quadrans AIE, &longs;itque EA diui&longs;a
in 4. partes æquales.

certè
non a&longs;cendet in A, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis;

igitur a&longs;cendat in B, & ex B ite­
rum de&longs;cendat in E, redeatque ver&longs;us A;

haud dubiè perueniet tantùm
in C;

ita vt tantum detrahatur &longs;patij in hoc &longs;ecundo a&longs;cen&longs;u, quantum
detractum e&longs;t in primo: idem dico de tertio, quarto, &c.

ducantur BH,
CG, D F parallelæ AI;

cum &longs;patium eo modo decidatur ex area EI, quo
ex perpendiculo EA maiori vibrationi detrahitur IH, &longs;ecundæ minori
HG, tertiæ GF, quartæ FE; igitur plùs detrahitur minoribus, quàm
maioribus.

Re&longs;pondeo, maius &longs;patium percurri &longs;ur&longs;um maiore tempore, quàm
minus;

&longs;it enim EA con&longs;tans 36. &longs;patia iuxta nouam progre&longs;&longs;ionem
arithmeticam, &longs;intque 8. gradus impetus acqui&longs;iti in de&longs;cen&longs;u AE con­
iuncti cum innato:

primo in&longs;tanti, &longs;eu tempore percurrentur tantùm 7.
&longs;patia, de&longs;trueturque vnus gradus impetus, &longs;ecundo 6. de&longs;trueturque al­
ter gradus impetus; denique tertio 5. quatto 4. &c.

igitur 28. &longs;patia 7.
in&longs;tantibus; igitur non perueniet in A mobile, &longs;ed conficiet &longs;patium,
quod erit ad EA, vt 28. ad 36. porrò &longs;i cadat ex 28. acquiret 7. gradus
impetus præter innatum, quorum ope &longs;ecundo a&longs;cendet ad 21. tertio ad
15. quartò ad 10. quinto ad 6. &longs;extò ad 3. &longs;eptimo ad 1. igitur &longs;patium
quod amittit in a&longs;cen&longs;u continet 8. in &longs;ecundo 7. in tertio 6. in quarto
5. in quinto 4. in &longs;exto 3. in &longs;eptimo 2. igitur e&longs;t maxima inæqualitas,
quæ pari modo explicari pote&longs;t in progre&longs;&longs;ione Galilei.
Secundò, obijci pote&longs;t:

amitti tantùm &longs;patij &longs;ingulis temporibus,
quantum acquiritur primo tempore, vel in&longs;tanti, cum impetu innato: &longs;ed
cum primo ille velocitatis gradu vix intra multos annos conficeretur
modicum &longs;patium.

Re&longs;pondeo, &longs;i con&longs;ideretur tantùm illud &longs;patium,
quod acquiritur primo tempore cum impetu non impedito;

haud dubiè
in&longs;en&longs;ibile e&longs;t, & licèt infinitus ferè repetatur illud idem &longs;patium;

haud
dubiè in&longs;en&longs;ibile manet: vnde &longs;i a&longs;cen&longs;us fiat in 10000. in&longs;tantibus, to­
ties accipi debet illud ip&longs;um &longs;patium, ex quo modicum tantùm re&longs;ultat,
quod minuitur in &longs;ecundo a&longs;cen&longs;u, itemque in tertio, quarto, &c.

certè multùm impetus de&longs;truitur,
quod autem tendatur maximè in de&longs;cen&longs;u prædictus funis, con&longs;tat
multis experimentis &longs;i minor e&longs;t; nam reuerâ; &longs;i maior, e&longs;&longs;et multum re­
tardaret motum tùm aëris re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quæ etiam aliquid facit, licèt totus
hic effectus ab illa pendere non po&longs;&longs;it, vt aliqui volunt, tùm etiam partes
funis propiùs ad centrum accedentes, quæ citiùs de&longs;cendunt, &c.
Tertiò, &longs;unt tres determinationes in a&longs;cen&longs;u;

prima e&longs;t impetus pro­
ducti in de&longs;cen&longs;u determinati ad Tangentem; &longs;ecunda funis per &longs;uam li­
neam qua&longs;i retrahentis pendulum.

tertia ip&longs;ius impetus innati qua&longs;i tra­
hentis deor&longs;um idem pondus; atqui ex pugna trium determinationum in
eodem mobili de&longs;truitur multùm impetus, vt patet ex dictis alibi.

Quartò, cum eo impetu, cuius ope non po&longs;&longs;et corpus a&longs;cendere per
ip&longs;um perpendiculum EA, a&longs;cendit adhuc per arcum EI;

licèt enim cum
co impetu, quo fertur in F po&longs;&longs;it fieri in D, &longs;ed tardiori motu;

quod etiam euincitur
ex organis mechanicis, & planis inclinatis;

nam reuerà moueret aliquis
per planum tantillùm inclinatum maximam corporis molem, quam per
aliud planum inclinatius, & accedens propiùs ad verticale minimè mo­
uere po&longs;&longs;et;

cuius effectus alia ratio non e&longs;t, ni&longs;i quod impetus, qui im­
primitur mobili ad talem gradum velocitatis &longs;it determinatus; atqui in
perpendiculo eo motu moueri non pote&longs;t, vt con&longs;tat, &longs;ed in plano lon­
giore.

Quintò, hinc vera ratio, cur in &longs;uperiore arcu de&longs;truatur citò impe­
tus;
tardiùs verò in in inferiore;

quia, cùm Tangens cuiu&longs;libet puncti ar­
cus &longs;it eius planum, & hæc in arcu &longs;uperiore accedat propiùs ad perpen­
diculum; non mirum e&longs;t, &longs;i cum eo impetu per arcum &longs;uperiorem mo­
ueri non po&longs;&longs;it mobile cò non a&longs;cendat, cuius tantùm ope per inferio­
rem arcum a&longs;cendit.
Theorema 26.
Omnes vibrationes numerari non po&longs;&longs;unt;

&longs;i tamen de&longs;trueretur tantùm impetus in a&longs;cen&longs;u ab impetu
innato, nec ten&longs;io funis, triplex determinatio, re&longs;i&longs;tentia aëris, & diuer&longs;æ
partes funis, quarum minores vibrationes impediuntur quidquam fa­
cerent, cognita differentia prima vibrationis & &longs;ecunda, fortè cogno&longs;ci
po&longs;&longs;et numerus vibrationum cognito principio progre&longs;&longs;ionis;

quantus
verò &longs;it numerus vibrationum, quæ incipiunt à maiore, & quantus illa­
rum quæ incipiunt à minore etiam incertum e&longs;t, v.g. &longs;i funependulum
AD demittatur ex O, & deinde ex L;

certum e&longs;t quidem e&longs;&longs;e plures vi­
brationes cum demittitur ex O toto eo vibrationum numero, quæ re­
cen&longs;entur, donec perueniatur ad illam vibrationem, cuius a&longs;cen&longs;us con­
&longs;tat arcu DL;

nam deinceps æqualis erit numerus earum, quæ con&longs;e­
quentur, & earum, quarum prima demittitur ex L, vt patet;

quot verò
præcedant vibrationes antequam perueniatur ad illam, cuius a&longs;cen&longs;us
e&longs;t arcus DL; equidem aliqua ob&longs;eruatione affixo &longs;cilicet maiore qua­
drante parieti iu &longs;uos gradus di&longs;tributo cogno&longs;ci pote&longs;t, &longs;ed nunquam
&longs;atis acurata.

Itaque certum e&longs;t primò accelerari motum in de&longs;cen&longs;u, &c retardari
in a&longs;cen&longs;u.

Secundò, certum e&longs;t impetum nouum accedere in de&longs;cen&longs;u in &longs;ingu­
lis punctis arcus iuxta rationem &longs;inus recti arcus inferioris; in a&longs;cen&longs;u
verò imminui acqui&longs;itum impetum in eadem ratione, omi&longs;&longs;a ea parte
impetus, quæ de&longs;truitur tùm in a&longs;cen&longs;u tùm in de&longs;cen&longs;u propter ten&longs;io­
nem funis, & re&longs;i&longs;tentiam aëris.

Tertiò, certum e&longs;t, primum gradum impetus &longs;cilicet innatum concur­
rere ad de&longs;cen&longs;um;

&longs;ecus verò ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, & contra vltimum gradum
concurrere ad a&longs;cen&longs;um, &longs;ecus ad de&longs;cen&longs;um; &longs;ed hic vltimus gradus mi­
nimus e&longs;t, & pro nihilo reputandus.

Quartò, certum e&longs;t a&longs;cen&longs;um minorem e&longs;&longs;e de&longs;cen&longs;u, nec funependu­
lum ad eandem, vnde dimi&longs;&longs;um e&longs;t priùs, a&longs;cendere altitudinem.

Quintò, certum e&longs;t arcum de&longs;cen&longs;us maioris vibrationis habere ma­
iorem proportionem ad arcum a&longs;cen&longs;us, qui &longs;equitur, quàm habeat ar­
cus de&longs;cen&longs;us minoris vibrationis ad &longs;uum a&longs;cen&longs;um.

Sextò, certum e&longs;t non tantùm imminui arcum a&longs;cen&longs;us ab aëre ob&longs;i­
&longs;tente &longs;ed maximè ab impetu innato retrahente deor&longs;um funependulum;

tùm etiam maximè ab ip&longs;a ten&longs;ione funis, tùm ab ip&longs;o fune adducente
pondus; tùm denique à diuer&longs;is partibus funis, quæ dum ab aliis retinen­
tur, qua&longs;i cum illis pugnant, ex qua pugna &longs;equitur aliqua clades in
motu.

Septimò, certum e&longs;t acquiri æqualem impetum ex eadem altitudine
in motu deor&longs;um, &longs;iue per arcum, &longs;iue per chordam, &longs;iue per ip&longs;um per­
pendiculum inæquali tamen tempore; &longs;imiliter de&longs;trui æqualem im­
petum in a&longs;cen&longs;u, qui ad eandem altitudinem pertingit.

Octauò, certum e&longs;t eo tempore, quo de&longs;cendit mobile per arcum in
ip&longs;o perpendiculo acquirere &longs;patium maius ip&longs;o arcu, minus tamen du­
plo radij.

Nonò, certum e&longs;t, non accelerari motum per arcum in de&longs;cen&longs;u iuxta
proportionem numerorum 1.3.5.7. vt volunt aliqui;

quia hæc accele­
ratio ex ip&longs;o Galileo &longs;upponit principium illud, æqualibus temporibus
acquiruntur æqualis velocitatis momenta, &longs;ed inæqualia acquiruntur in
arcu; vt patet ex dictis;

multò minùs intenditur iuxta proportionem
arcuum qui &longs;ecantur à lineis ductis parallelis horizontali ab iis punctis
perpendiculi, in quibus &longs;ecatur iuxta hos numeros 1. 3. 5. 7. certum e&longs;t
etiam non retardari iuxta eandem proportionem in a&longs;cen&longs;u: quippe in
hoc in eadem proportione retardatur, qua in illo acceleratur.

Decimò, certum e&longs;t omnes vibrationes non po&longs;&longs;e numerari cuiu&longs;cum­
que longitudinis &longs;it ip&longs;um funependulum: immò hoc valdè e&longs;&longs;et inutile,
vt inutile e&longs;t no&longs;&longs;e numerum granorum arenæ maris.
Vndecimò, certum e&longs;t vibrationes minores citiùs ab&longs;olui, quàm maiores.

Duodecimò, certum e&longs;t tempora vibrationum funependulorum inæ­
qualium e&longs;&longs;e ferè, vt radices longitudinum, & longitudines, vt quadrata
temporum dixi: ferè, nec enim omninò res ita &longs;e habet.

Con&longs;tat ex iis quæ &longs;uprà diximus, ea omnia, quæ hactenus enumerata
&longs;unt, certa e&longs;&longs;e cum aliis plurimis &longs;uprà recen&longs;itis; &longs;unt etiam aliqua in­
nota.

Primò incertum fuit hactenus, in qua proportione temporum per­
curratur arcus:

Equidem certum e&longs;t in qua proportione velocitas cre&longs;cit,
vt &longs;uprà demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t; incertum, quænam &longs;it progre&longs;&longs;io &longs;patiorum
&longs;eu proportio motus in &longs;patio arcus, dato &longs;cilicet tempore &longs;en&longs;ibili.

Ob&longs;eruo tamen, &longs;i con&longs;ideretur hic motus in in&longs;tantibus, demitta­
túrque funependulum è &longs;ummo arcu, &longs;patium quod acquiritur primo in­
&longs;tanti e&longs;t ad &longs;patium, quod acquiritur &longs;ecundo, vt &longs;inus totus ad colle­
ctum ex &longs;inu toto & &longs;inu recto immediato arcus inferioris, qui proximè
accedit ad totum; e&longs;t autem ad &longs;patium, quod acquiritur tertio in&longs;tan­
ti, vt &longs;inus totus ad collectum ex &longs;inu toto & duobus &longs;inubus rectis im­
mediatis, atque ita deinceps.

ducatur DC, &longs;itque v.g.
trapezus DCBA ad triangulum ABE vt 2. ad.7.dico velocitatem, quæ
acquiritur in arcu AD, e&longs;&longs;e ad illam, quæ acquiritur in AE vt 2.ad 7. &
ad illam, quæ acquiritur in DE, vt 2.ad 5.&longs;ed in hoc motu tempora non
&longs;unt vt velocitates;

quia temporibus æqualibus non acquiruntur æqua­
les velocitatis gradus;

igitur nec &longs;patia vt temporum, &longs;eu velocitatum
quadrata; igitur incertum e&longs;t hactenus, in qua proportione temporum
percurrantur duo arcus dati in quadrante, & quæ proportio &longs;patiorum
re&longs;pondeat temporibus datis.

Secundò, incertum etiam hactenus in qua proportione percurratur
velociùs arcus, quàm chorda, & tardiùs, quàm radius in perpendiculo,
& quantum &longs;patium in eodem perpendiculo percurratur eo tempore,
quo totus arcus quadrantis peragitur.

Tertiò incertum e&longs;t, in qua proportione minor vibratio citiùs peraga­
tur, quàm maior;

licèt cogno&longs;ci po&longs;&longs;it in qua proportione peragantur ci­
tiùs duæ chordæ in&longs;criptæ arcui minori, quàm duæ in&longs;criptæ arcui maio­
ri; & licèt certum &longs;it omnes chordas &longs;eor&longs;im &longs;umptas æqualibus tem­
poribus decurri, & citiùs decurri duas eidem arcui in&longs;criptas, quàm &longs;o­
lam inferiorem.

Quartò incertum e&longs;t, in qua proportione imminuatur impetus tùm in
de&longs;cen&longs;u, tùm in a&longs;cen&longs;u, tùm propter re&longs;i&longs;tentiam aëris, tùm propter ten­
&longs;ionem chordæ, tùm ratione triplicis determinationis in &longs;ingulis pun­
ctis arcus;

licèt certum &longs;it quantum &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus detrahatur im­
petus in a&longs;cen&longs;u ab impetu innato retrahente pendulum deor&longs;um; incer­
tum e&longs;t tamen, quantus &longs;it ille impetus innatus.

Quintò, incertum e&longs;t in qua proportione a&longs;cen&longs;us primæ vibrationis
&longs;it minor de&longs;cen&longs;u eiu&longs;dem;

incertum etiam, in qua proportione a&longs;cen­
&longs;us &longs;ecundæ &longs;it minor a&longs;cen&longs;u prime;

incertum denique, in qua proportio­
ne plùs imminuatur a&longs;cen&longs;us maiorum vibrationum, quàm minorum; li­
cèt certum &longs;it plùs imminui.

Sextò, incertum e&longs;t, quot peragantur vibrationes dati funependulis
item quantus &longs;it arcus vltimæ vibrationis;

item in qua proportione ma­
ior &longs;it numerus vibrationum, quarum prima maior e&longs;t numero vibratio­
num, quarum prima minor e&longs;t; denique quot intercipiantur vibratio­
nes in differentia data duorum arcuum.

Hæc, quæ hactenus propo&longs;uimus in 6. vltimis capitibus, &longs;unt omninò
incerta, ita vt neque &longs;en&longs;u percipi po&longs;&longs;int, neque fuerit hactenus vllum
principium, per quod po&longs;sint demon&longs;trari; ni&longs;i fortè primum caput ex­
cipias, de quo infrà.

Primò dubium e&longs;t an numerus vibrationum funependuli maioris &longs;it
maior numero vibrationum funependuli minoris, po&longs;ito quòd primam
vtriu&longs;que vibratio &longs;it &longs;imilis.

Secundò dubium e&longs;t, an numerus vibrationum funependuli longio­
ris &longs;it æqualis numero vibrationum alterius minoris, po&longs;ito quòd prima
vtriu&longs;que ab eadem altitudine demittatur; vel po&longs;ito quòd arcus primæ
maioris funependuli &longs;it æqualis arcui primæ minoris.

Tertiò dubium e&longs;t, in qua proportione pendula materiæ grauiores
&longs;uas vibrationes citiùs peragant, quàm pendula materiæ leuioris;

item­
que dubium, quanto tempore citiùs extinguantur vibrationes penduli
materiæ leuioris, quàm grauioris:

licèt certum &longs;it citiùs ab&longs;olui vibra­
tiones funependuli materiæ leuioris, quàm grauioris; hæc &longs;unt dubia,
quæ breuiter di&longs;cutiemus in &longs;equentibus Theorematis.
Theorema 27.

Funependula longiora diutiùs vibrantur, quàm breuiora, &longs;i prima vtriu&longs;­
que vibratio &longs;it &longs;imilis;
experientia manife&longs;ta e&longs;t;

ratio etiam euidens,
quia vt &longs;e habent &longs;ingulæ vibrationes minoris ad &longs;ingulas maioris;

ita
omnes minoris &longs;e habent ad omnes maioris, vt patet;

&longs;ed &longs;ingulæ maio­
ris diutiùs durant, quàm &longs;ingulæ minoris;

igitur omnes maioris diutiùs
durant, quàm omnes minoris; igitur funependula longiora diutiùs vi­
brantur, &c.
Theorema 28.

Tot &longs;unt vibrationes maioris funependuli per &longs;e, quot &longs;unt minoris, po&longs;ito
quod vtriu&longs;que vibratio prima &longs;it &longs;imilis;

demon&longs;tratur, &longs;it enim fune­
pendulum maius AG, & minus AO &longs;ubquadruplum &longs;cilicet AG, demit­
tatur AG ex AD, & AO ex AB, impetus acqui&longs;itus in G per DG e&longs;t
æqualis acqui&longs;ito in perpendiculo AG;

& impetus acqui&longs;itus in O per
BO e&longs;t æqualis acqui&longs;ito in perpendiculo per AO;

&longs;ed acqui&longs;itus in per­
pendiculo AG e&longs;t duplus acqui&longs;iti in perpendiculo AO, vt con&longs;tat;

præterea impetus, qui de&longs;truitur in a&longs;cen&longs;u GK, e&longs;t æqualis acqui&longs;i­
to in de&longs;cen&longs;u DG, excepto primo gradu;

itemque de&longs;tructus in a&longs;cen&longs;u
OM æqualis acqui&longs;ito in de&longs;cen&longs;u BO;

igitur de&longs;tructus in a&longs;cen&longs;u GK
e&longs;t duplus de&longs;tructi in a&longs;cen&longs;u OM;

itaque po&longs;t de&longs;cen&longs;um BO a&longs;cendat
funependulum in N, ita vt a&longs;cen&longs;us ON &longs;it minor de&longs;cen&longs;u arcu NM:
quia &longs;cilicet ad a&longs;cen&longs;um non concurrit impetus innatus:

dico quòd po&longs;t
de&longs;cen&longs;um DG a&longs;cendet tantùm in H;

ita vt a&longs;cen&longs;us GH &longs;it minor de&longs;­
cen&longs;u toto arcu HK quadruplo MN:

porrò tempus a&longs;cen&longs;us per GK
e&longs;t duplum a&longs;cen&longs;us per OM;

& &longs;i concurreret impetus innatus, a&longs;cen­
&longs;us e&longs;&longs;et æqualis de&longs;cen&longs;ui per &longs;e;
igitur perueniret in K;

igitur, &longs;i æquali tempore non concurrat ad
a&longs;cen&longs;um GK;
certè ex a&longs;cen&longs;u detrahetur tantùm IK æqualis v.g. MN;
&longs;i verò duobus temporibus æqualibus non concurrat;

certè ex a&longs;cen&longs;u
detrahetur HK quadruplum MN;

ita &longs;i non concurrat duobus temporibus, deerit &longs;patium qua­
druplum illius quod dee&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i tantùm vno tempore non concurreret;
igitur a&longs;cen&longs;us maioris funependuli erit OH;

igitur OH, ON erunt vi­
brationes &longs;imiles;

igitur &longs;i de&longs;cendat AG ex H, & AO ex N, vibrationes
a&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;ecundi erunt adhuc &longs;imiles propter eandem rationem;

igitur
& vibrationes tertij a&longs;cen&longs;us, quarti, quinti, atque ita deinceps;

igitur tot
erunt vibrationes maioris, quot minoris per &longs;e, &longs;i prima vtriu&longs;que vi­
bratio &longs;it &longs;imilis: dixi per &longs;e; nam per accidens ratione funis ferè &longs;emper
accidit mutari i&longs;tum ordinem vibrationum.

cum GK &longs;it
quadruplum OM;

certè in &longs;ingulis punctis GK impetus de&longs;truitur &longs;ub­
duplus illius, qui in &longs;ingulis punctis OM de&longs;truitur; &longs;i enim æqualis;

igi­
tur impetus per GK e&longs;&longs;et quadruplus impetus per OM;

&longs;i minor &longs;ubdu­
plo v. g. &longs;ubquadruplus;

igitur impetus per GK e&longs;&longs;et æqualis impetui
per OM;
&longs;ed e&longs;t tantum duplus;

in duplo punctorum numero, æqualis, in quadruplo
punctorum numero, duplus;

de&longs;truitur autem in &longs;ingulis punctis GK
&longs;ubduplus; quia &longs;ubduplum tantùm tempus re&longs;pondet &longs;ingulis punctis G
K illius temporis, quod re&longs;pondet &longs;ingulis punctis OM.
Corollarium 1.

Primò colligo, &longs;olutionem primi dubij propo&longs;iti &longs;uprà, ita vt non iam
dubium, at certum omninò &longs;uper&longs;it.
Corollarium 2.

Secundò colligo, &longs;olutionem &longs;ecundi dubij, &longs;i enim funependulum P
G demittatur ex PR & AG ex AT;

haud dubiè plures erunt vibrationes
penduli PG, quàm AG;

quia tot e&longs;&longs;ent AG, quot PG, &longs;i AG demittere­
tur ex AD;

&longs;ed plures &longs;unt vibrationes funependuli AG demi&longs;&longs;i ex AD,
quàm eiu&longs;dem ex AT;

ergo plures funependuli PG demi&longs;&longs;i ex PR,
quàm AG demi&longs;&longs;i ex AT; vnde &longs;oluitur prima pars dubij &longs;ecundi,
Corollarium 3.
Tertiò colligo, &longs;olutionem &longs;ecundæ partis eiu&longs;dem dubij;

&longs;i enim A
O demittatur ex AB, & AG ex AS;
ita arcus GS &longs;it æqualis arcui OB;

certè erunt plures vibrationes AO, quàm AG, vt patet ex dictis; quod
&longs;pectat ad tertium dubium, illud ip&longs;um &longs;oluemus paulò pò&longs;t.
Corollarium. 4.

quia AV non a&longs;cenderet in AT, quod ip&longs;e &longs;up-
ponit;

atqui &longs;uprà demon&longs;trauimus a&longs;cen&longs;um minorem e&longs;&longs;e de&longs;cen&longs;u, non
tantùm propter re&longs;i&longs;tentiam aëris, vt vult ip&longs;e Galileus; &longs;ed propter prin­
cipium intrin&longs;ecum de&longs;tructiuum impetus acqui&longs;iti in de&longs;cen&longs;u, de quo
&longs;uprà.
Corollarium 5.

Quintò equidem, &longs;i AG demittatur ex AR, affixo clauo in P, non
modò &longs;egmentum PG a&longs;cendet in PR, verùm etiam altiùs a&longs;cendet ver­
&longs;us A; immò gyri plures erunt, &longs;i clauus affigatur propiùs ad punctum
G, qui certè gyri quò minores erunt, eò citiùs conficientur.
Corollarium 6.
Pote&longs;t determinari numerus i&longs;torum gyrorum;

&longs;it enim primò clauus
in P, &longs;int que APG æquales;

&longs;i AG po&longs;t de&longs;cen&longs;um KG a&longs;cenderet in
AD;

certè &longs;egmentum PG a&longs;cenderet per &longs;emicircumferentiam GR
A, in PA, ratio e&longs;t, quia pendulum G de&longs;cendent ex K;

&longs;ed ex hypothe&longs;i
Galilei &longs;i de&longs;cenderet ex Y a&longs;cenderet in R;

Ob&longs;eruabis primò iuxta no&longs;tram hypothe&longs;im, qua diximus pendulum
AG po&longs;t de&longs;cen&longs;um per KG non a&longs;cendere in D, vix po&longs;&longs;e cogno&longs;ci
affixo clauo, ad quod punctum circuli GRA ex G pendulum peruentu­
rum &longs;it;

&longs;ed plùs impetus de&longs;truitur in arcu GRZ, quàm in arcu
GF, vt patet ex dictis;

nam nullum e&longs;t punctum in arcu GF, in quo plùs
impetus de&longs;truatur, quàm in alio dato arcus GRZ;
itaque ducatur FD parallela AD:

dico quòd
perueniet pendulum in d;

quippe cum eodem impetu ad eandem altitu­
dinem a&longs;cenditur; quæ omnia certa &longs;unt.

Ob&longs;eruabis &longs;ecundò, &longs;i affigatur clauus in q, &longs;intque PqG æquales, ex
hypothe&longs;i Galilei;

pendulum G primò ex G perueniet in P, cum eo &longs;cili­
cet impetu, quo perueniet in T;

tùm deinde ex P per b redit in G aucto
&longs;cilicet impetu in de&longs;cen&longs;u P b G, & ex G iterum a&longs;cendit in P; atque ita
deinceps; quippe gyri perennes e&longs;&longs;ent, ni&longs;i tandem totum filum circa
clauum conuolueretur.
quia &longs;cilicet breuiores &longs;unt, &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt facilia;

ob­
&longs;eruabis tamen cum voluitur filum illud circa digitum pendulum, non
moueri motu circulari, &longs;ed &longs;pirali; vnde cùm motus mixtus &longs;it, in librum
&longs;equentem reiicimus.

quia a&longs;cen&longs;us GT & GD æquali &longs;e-
rè tempore peraguntur;
&longs;unt enim vibrationes eiu&longs;dem funependuli;
quippe licèt minor vibratio minore tempore fiat;

illud tamen &longs;en&longs;u di&longs;­
cerni non pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i in &longs;erie multarum vibrationum;

atqui GR perfici­
tur æquali tempore, &longs;iue pendulum de&longs;cendat ex V; &longs;iue ex Y;

acquiritur
enim æqualis impetus vtroque modo;

&longs;ed a&longs;cen&longs;us GR fieret æquali
tempore cum de&longs;cen&longs;u YG;

hic verò breuiore, quàm VG, vt patet; &longs;unt
enim numeri vibrationum, vt radices longitudinum.

Ob&longs;eruabis denique po&longs;&longs;e funependulum, PG &longs;olidum demitti ex A,
&longs;i tantillùm inclinctur; fed de hoc funependulorum genere agemus
infrà.
Theorema 29.
Funependulum in fine a&longs;cen&longs;us non quie&longs;cit vno in&longs;tanti;

quia numquam
ad perfectam æqualitatem peruenitur; quod eodem modo probatur,
quo &longs;uprà l. 3. e&longs;t enim par ratio.
Theorema 30.
Figura penduli multum facit ad motum vibrationis:

&longs;phærica omnium
ferè apti&longs;&longs;ima e&longs;t præter Conchoidem, & eam, quæ con&longs;taret ex duobus
conis in communi ba&longs;i coniunctis, vel in gemina pyramide; ratio con&longs;tat
ex cis, quæ diximus de motu naturali.
Theorema 31.
Funis multùm etiam facit;

omnium optimus e&longs;t tenui&longs;&longs;imus, qui &longs;ci­
licet faciliùs aëra &longs;ecat;

nec enim dubium e&longs;t, quin huic diui&longs;ioni re&longs;i&longs;tat
aër, cuius re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ analogiam videmus in aqua, quam funis oblongus
non ni&longs;i cum &longs;en&longs;ibili re&longs;i&longs;tentia diuidit, vt videre e&longs;t in iis funibus, qui­
bus ab equis naues trahuntur;
aliqui adhibent ductum auri filum;

vtrumque enim mo­
tum vibrationis retardat:

immò pendulum ip&longs;um non de&longs;criberet &longs;emi­
circulum; an verò &longs;emiellyp&longs;im vt volunt aliqui, definiemus &longs;uo loco,
cum de lineis motus.
Theorema 32.
Pondus funependuli multùm facit ad vibrationis motum;

&longs;i enim granu­
lum plumbeum appendatur, vix &longs;uperabit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam funis, qui vt vi­
bretur, optimè ten&longs;us e&longs;&longs;e debet; atqui notabili pondere tendi tantùm
pote&longs;t.
Theorema 33.

Materia funependuli multùm etiam facit ad vibrationis motum &longs;uppo&longs;ita
&longs;cilicet eadem figura;

quippe tam leuis e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;et materia, vt nec aëris
vim nec funis re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;uperaret:

hinc globus &longs;ubereus vel è &longs;ambu­
cea medulla con&longs;tans, tardiùs de&longs;cendit, quàm plumbeus;

habes apud
Mer&longs;ennum has proportiones;
&longs;ubereus verò minus 4/9 arcus quadrantis;

&longs;am­
buceus minus 6/7 cereus minus tribus digitis;
quod tamen percipi non pote&longs;t;

&longs;i enim dicam
&longs;upere&longs;&longs;e, vel dee&longs;&longs;e aliquid, vel &longs;patij, vel temporis, quod tamen &longs;en&longs;u
minimè percipiatur; quis e&longs;t qui contrarium probare po&longs;&longs;it.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis primò non e&longs;&longs;e omittendum, quod habet Galileus in dia­
logis, & facilè ex dictis colligi pote&longs;t, &longs;cilicet pendula diuer&longs;æ longitu­
dini sita po&longs;&longs;e componi, vt vnum vnicam vibrationem efficiat, dum aliud
percurrit 2. vel 3. &c.
alter verò vnum, pendulum ex illo duas percurret;

quia numeri
vibrationum &longs;unt, vt tempora;
hæc verò &longs;ubduplicata longitudinum;

&longs;i vero aliud funependulum &longs;it longum 9. pedes, conficiet
& alterum vnum hoc eodem tempore tres vibrationes;

&longs;i &longs;it aliud, 16.
pedes longum, & alterum vnum;

hec eodem tempore conficiet 4. vibra­
tiones, atque ita deinceps poteris habere quamlibet proportionem in
numeris vibrationum ex ip&longs;a combinationum regula; &longs;ed profectò non
magnam voluptatem ex hac qua&longs;i oculorum mu&longs;icâ percipies, &longs;altem
ego modicam percipere potui.

Ob&longs;eruabis &longs;ecundò, hactenus actum e&longs;&longs;e à nobis de primo funepen­
dulorum genere &longs;atis longa tractatione; iam ergo &longs;upere&longs;t, vt de aliis
agamus.
Theorema 34.
Pondus pendulum contorto fune gyros agit reciprocos in plano horizontali;

ratio petitur tantùm ex compre&longs;&longs;ione intorti funis, qui dum &longs;e &longs;e redu­
cit ad pri&longs;tinum &longs;tatum, pendulum pondus in gyros agit;

cum verò acce­
leretur motus, & nouus &longs;emper accedat impetus, pendulum ip&longs;um funi
etiam pri&longs;tino &longs;tatui re&longs;tituto qua&longs;i primam gratiam refert, cùm impe­
tum in eum refundat;

&longs;i enim funis &longs;olus ade&longs;&longs;et nullo pendulo pondere
ten&longs;us;
haud dubiè &longs;tatim quie&longs;ceret, vbi &longs;ublata e&longs;&longs;et compre&longs;&longs;io;

at verò
quia impetus ponderi pendulo impre&longs;&longs;us adhuc durat funem ip&longs;um in
contrariam partem intorquet; donec tandem po&longs;t multos gyros repeti­
tos pendulum pondus quie&longs;cat.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis plures e&longs;&longs;e huius funependuli motus affectiones, quæ certè
demon&longs;trari po&longs;&longs;unt; quia tamen cau&longs;a huius, qui &longs;equitur ex compre&longs;­
&longs;ione e&longs;t noua potentia motrix, quàm mediam vocamus, cuius mirifica
vis vix cogno&longs;ci pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i probè cogno&longs;catur ratio den&longs;i, rari, &c.

tra-
ctationem hanc in alium Tomum reiicimus, in quo fusè agemus de om­
nibus affectionibus huius potentiæ.
Theorema 35.

quarum cau&longs;a e&longs;t motus acceleratus
eiu&longs;dem potentiæ motricis mediæ; has quoque vibrationes remitti­
mus.
Theorema 36.

Funis ten&longs;us in vtraque extremitate affixus, &longs;i pul&longs;etur infinitas ferè tremu­
la&longs;que vibrationes hinc inde peragit; &longs;unt etiam mirabiles harum vibra­
tionum affectiones, quas multis Theorematis in eodem volumine pro­
&longs;equemur.
Diceret aliquis;

igitur in hoc tractatu omnia, quæ &longs;pectant ad motum
non habentur; Re&longs;pondeo, tractatum hunc e&longs;&longs;e poti&longs;&longs;imum in&longs;titutum
ad demon&longs;trandas omnes affectiones tùm motus grauium, tùm motus
impre&longs;&longs;i à principio extrin&longs;eco, intactis pror&longs;us iis motibus, qui &longs;unt vel
à potentia motrice animantium, in ip&longs;is dumtaxat animantibus, de qui­
bus agemus &longs;uo loco, quales &longs;unt progredi, currere, volare, notare, repe­
re, &c.

vel à leuitate corporum, &longs;i fortè aliquis motus e&longs;t à leuitate,
quod hîc non di&longs;cutio, &longs;ed remitto in librum de graui & leui;

vel de­
nique ab illa potentiâ mediâ, cui omnes motus ten&longs;orum; compre&longs;&longs;orum,
arcuum; reique tormentariæ tùm hydraulicæ, pneumaticæ, &c.

tribue­
mus:
de his certè motibus in hoc tractatu non agemus;

neque hæ cogno&longs;ci po&longs;&longs;int, ni&longs;i multa alia cogno&longs;cantur, vt certi&longs;&longs;i­
mum e&longs;t; minùs prudenter factum e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i de iis hoc loco di&longs;putatio
in&longs;titueretur.
Theorema 37.

E&longs;t aliud corporis libratilis genus &longs;i &longs;it v. g. corpus oblongum, grane,
& &longs;olidum AF in &longs;itu horizontali innixum plano verticali EBCD;

&longs;i
enim extremitas F attollatur per arcum FG circa centrum B;

haud du­
biè altera A deprimetur per arcum AI circa idem centrum B;

at &longs;tatim
G de&longs;cendet motu naturaliter accelerato in F, & propter acqui&longs;itum in
de&longs;cen&longs;u, de&longs;cendet infra horizontalem GF per arcum FH, circa cen­
trum C, & I a&longs;cendet in A, tùm in K, &longs;ed K &longs;tatim de&longs;cendet, atque ita
deinceps;

donec tandem po&longs;t multas vibrationes quie&longs;cat AF in &longs;itu
horizontali;

porrò G de&longs;cendit, quia GI non e&longs;t in æquilibrio, cùm
centrum grauitatis &longs;it in M; igitur BG, quæ e&longs;t longior BI, de&longs;cen­
det.
Corollarium 1.

Primò colligo, motum accelerari in de&longs;cen&longs;u GF, quia impetus acqui­
&longs;itus in G remanet adhuc in Q, & nouus acquiritur, vt &longs;æpe dictum e&longs;t.
Corollarium 2.

Secundò, impetum acqui&longs;itum in G e&longs;&longs;e minorem acqui&longs;ito in que &
acqui&longs;itum in Q minorem acqui&longs;ito in F; quia momentum in G e&longs;t ad
momentum in E, vt OB ad FB, vt &longs;uprà dictum e&longs;t multis locis.
Corollarium 3.

Tertiò colligo, e&longs;&longs;e inuer&longs;as rationes accelerationis in funependulo, &
in priori, quod vibratur in plano verticali: quippe in i&longs;to impetus ac­
qui&longs;itus in &longs;uperiore arcu e&longs;t maior acqui&longs;ito in inferiore, &longs;ecus in illo.
Corollarium. 4.

Quartò colligo, i&longs;tas vibrationes non e&longs;&longs;e perpetuas, quia &longs;ecunda e&longs;t
minor prima, & tertia minor &longs;ecunda, atque ita deinceps propter ratio­
nem, quam attulimus &longs;uprà.
Corollarium 5.

Quintò colligo, vibrationes minores fieri citiùs, quàm maiores, v. g.
QF quàm GF, quod multis con&longs;tat experimentis, & ratio e&longs;t manife&longs;ta;

quia QF &longs;it æqualis QG; certè QF accedit propiùs ad perpendicularem
quàm GQ;

igitur cùm &longs;it æqualis, breuiore tempore percurretur, quod
clari&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;t.
Corollarium 6.

Sextò colligo, ea&longs;dem vel &longs;imiles &longs;equi &longs;i AF &longs;u&longs;pendatur ex LN; e&longs;t
enim pror&longs;us eadem ratio.
Corollarium 7.

Septimò colligo, alia corpora etiam cubica, vel alterius figuræ plano
horizontali v. g. ip&longs;i &longs;olo incubantia, &longs;i tantillùm è &longs;uo &longs;itu remouean­
tur per &longs;imiles vibrationes &longs;e&longs;e in illum re&longs;tituere; immò ex minima
percu&longs;&longs;ione multis huiu&longs;modi vibrationibus percu&longs;&longs;um corpus contre­
mi&longs;cit.
Theorema 38.

Si corpus &longs;olidum pendulum circa punctum immobile ita voluatur, vt ex
verticali &longs;itu amoueatur;

haud dubiè de&longs;cendet, a&longs;cendetque per vibrationes
repetitas;

nam in vtroque genere
vibrationum primò acceleratur motus;

&longs;ecundò plùs initio, minùs ad fi­
nem vibrationis, tertiò non &longs;unt perpetuæ vibrationes;

quartò ad a&longs;cen­
&longs;um non concurrit impetus innatus; quintò, impetus de&longs;truitur cum ma­
iore proportione in maiore vibratione, quàm in minore, &c.

quæ vtri­
que generi &longs;unt communia.
Theorema 39.

Funependulum, & corpus oblongum eiu&longs;dem longitudinis non de&longs;cendunt
equè velociter, &longs;i ex eadem altitudine demi&longs;&longs;a circa centrum immobile vibrentur;

ratio e&longs;t, quia in pondere funependulo &longs;olum pondus E cen&longs;eri de­
bet cau&longs;a motus;
quippe, licèt funis aliquid conferat;

quia tamen tam
exilis e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t, vt vix quidquam addat póderis, pro nihilo computatur;

igitur totus motus e&longs;t ab ip&longs;o pondere pendulo; at verò in corpore ob­
longo AB, quod &longs;it v. g. parallelipedum, vel cylindricum, non tantùm e&longs;t
motus à puncto B, verùm etiam à punctis FE, &c.

cum enim punctum
F, v. g. &longs;i &longs;eor&longs;im &longs;umatur, percurrat arcum FG citiùs quàm punctum B
&longs;eor&longs;im arcum BC, certè punctum F, qua&longs;i deor&longs;um rapit punctum B igi­
tur totum corpus AB citiùs ab&longs;oluit &longs;uam vibrationem, quàm funepen­
dulum, quod erat probandum.
Theorema 40.

Vt &longs;u&longs;tineatur corpus oblongum AB, faciliùs &longs;u&longs;tinetur in B, quàm in P,
& in F, quàm in E, & in E quàm in H, atque ita deinceps (&longs;uppono autem,
quòd po&longs;&longs;it volui circa centrum A) ratio clara e&longs;t ex vecte, de quo &longs;uo
loco; immò licèt AB penderet tantùm vnam vnciam, po&longs;&longs;et aliquod
a&longs;&longs;ignari punctum iuxta A, in quo ab homine robu&longs;ti&longs;&longs;imo &longs;u&longs;tineri non
po&longs;&longs;et in &longs;itu horizontali AB.
Theorema 41.
hoc fuit iucundi&longs;&longs;imum Theorema, quod in lib. 1. demon&longs;trauimus;

ne­
que hîc repeto;

vnum tantùm addo valdè paradoxon in punctum G e&longs;&longs;e
maximum ictum, non tamen maximam vim, &longs;cilicet ad mouendum;

nam in D maior erit vis, quàm in G, & in I, quàm in D; erit tamen mi­
nor motus, &longs;eu minor impre&longs;&longs;io.
Theorema 42.

In maiori proportione de&longs;truitur impetus in a&longs;cen&longs;u vibrationis eiu&longs;dem
corporis oblongi, quam in a&longs;cen&longs;it vibrationis funependuli;

con&longs;tat certè cla­
ri&longs;&longs;imis experimentis;

ratio e&longs;t, quia plures partes impetus innati re&longs;i­
&longs;tunt; quippè impetus innatus funis tam paruus e&longs;t, vt pro nullo ha­
beatur.
Theorema 43.

Hinc &longs;unt pauciores vibrationes corporis oblongi, quàm funependuli, cum
&longs;inguli a&longs;cen&longs;us plùs impetus de&longs;truant in vibrationibus corporis ob­
longi, quàm funependuli:

Hinc citiùs quie&longs;cit corpus oblongum vibra­
tum, quàm funependulum;

licèt vtrumque ex eadem altitudine demitta­
tur; quod etiam multis experimentis comprobatur, & ratio patet ex
dictis.
Theorema 44.

Vibrationes minores corporis oblongi citiùs peraguntur, quàm minores; ex­
perientia certa e&longs;t, ratio verò eadem cum ea, quam explicuimus &longs;uprà
in funependulis.
Theorema 45.

Minùs producitur impetus in E, v.g. corporis oblongi, &longs;cilicet in de&longs;cen&longs;u,
quàm &longs;i AE &longs;eparata e&longs;&longs;et ab AB;

patet, plùs tamen producitur, quàm &longs;i
E deferretur à B, vt accidit in funependulis;
prima pars e&longs;t certa;

quia
corpus oblongum AE perficit citiùs &longs;uam vibrationem, quàm AB; &longs;ecun­
da etiam probatur, quia alioqui vibratio corporis oblongi, & vibratio
funependuli eiu&longs;dem longitudinis æquali tempore percurreretur.
Theorema 46.

Si punctum H e&longs;&longs;et nodus longè grauior reliquo AB, extremitas B percur­
reret citius arcum BC, quàm ip&longs;um perpendiculum;

quia &longs;cilicet impetus
nodi A &longs;eg mentum HB &longs;ecum abriperet;

immò po&longs;&longs;et ita componi corpus oblongum, vt punctum B tùm in
perpendiculo, tùm in arcu BC, æquè citò moueretur; multa haud
dubiè dicenda &longs;uper&longs;unt de hoc pendulorum genere, quæ
remittimus in appendicem, quam huic Tomo
&longs;ubnectimus.

LIBER SECVNDVS,
DE MOTV NATVRALI.

LIBER NONVS,
DE MOTV MIXTO EX RECTO, ET
Circulari, vel ex pluribus Circularibus.

MOTVS mixtus e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t vel ex recto,
& circulari, vel ex duobus rectis, &
circulari, vel ex duobus circularibus, &
recto, vel ex pluribus circularibus, at­
que ita deinceps: de iis acturus &longs;um in
hoc libro, reiectis tamen lineis i&longs;torum motuum in
Tomum &longs;equentem.
DEFINITIO 1.

MOtus mixtus ex circulari & recto ille e&longs;t, ad quem concurrit duplex
impetus, quorum vnus &longs;it determinatus ad motum rectum, & alius
ad circularem, vel vnus tantum impetus, ad cremam, & rectam lineam &longs;im
modo determinatus.
Hunc modum explicabimus infrà in Theorematis;

interea definitio,
&longs;atis clara e&longs;t mihi videtur: exemplum habes in rota, quæ in recto plano
voluitur.
Definitio 2.

Motus mixtus ex duobus circularibus e&longs;t, ad quem concurvit impetus, vel
vnicus, vel duplex ad duas lineas circulares determinatus;

&longs;imiliter de­
finiri pote&longs;t mixtus in duobus, & circulari; duobus circularibus & recto,
pluribus circularibus.

Sed quæ&longs;o, cum audis motum mixtum ex duobus, caue credas, duos
motus ine&longs;&longs;e eidem mobili; quod certè fieri non pote&longs;t, &longs;ed tantùm plu­
res impetus, vel vnicum ad diuer&longs;as lineas determinatum.
Axioma 1.

Illa partes mouentur velociùs, quæ tempore aquali maius &longs;patium acquirunt
tardiùs verò, que minus &longs;patium, clari&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;t, nec maiori indiget expli­
catione.
Axioma 2.

Cum vtraque determinatio motus ad eandem partem &longs;pectat, acquiritur
maius &longs;patium;

tum verò ad diuer&longs;as partes minus, at que ita prorata; hoc
etiam Axioma certum e&longs;t.
Hypothe&longs;is.

Rotæ circa idem centrum mobilis &longs;emicirculi oppo&longs;iti in partes contrarias
feruntur, motu &longs;cilicet orbis per arcus &longs;cilicet æquales;

nam anguli oppo&longs;iti
æquales &longs;unt; &longs;ed arcus &longs;unt vt anguli.
Po&longs;tulatum.
Liceat rotare orbem in plana &longs;uperficie, in conuexa, in concaua, in æquali.
inæquali, ita vt motus orbis conueniat cum motu centri, vel ab eo diuer&longs;us &longs;it.
Theorema 1.

Rota, quæ mouetur in &longs;uperficie plana, mouetur motu mixto ex recto centri
& circulari orbis;

&longs;it enim AQLZ incubans plano AD in quo rotatur,
&longs;itque AD recta æqualis arcui Aque certè po&longs;ito quod motus orbis &longs;it æ­
qualis motui centri, id e&longs;t po&longs;ito quod æqualibus temporibus &longs;egmentum
plani percurratur motu centri v.g. QE vel AD æquale arcui, qui circa
centrum O conuoluitur motu orbis, v.g. arcui AQ, quodlibet punctum
peripheriæ rotæ mouebitur motu mixto ex recto, & circulari v. g. pun­
ctum L motu centri fertur ver&longs;us V & motu orbis ver&longs;us Q; &longs;i enim
e&longs;&longs;et tantum motus centri ver&longs;us E, omnes partes mouerentur motu recto
v.g. L per rectam LV, A per rectam AD;

at cum &longs;imul &longs;it vterque motus, id e&longs;t vtraque
determinatio, certè vtraque confert de &longs;uo; igitur e&longs;t motus mixtus.
Theorema 2.

Vnicum tantùm punctum rotæ mouetur metu recto, &longs;cilicet centrum, cætera
per lineam curuam;

de centro con&longs;tat, quia cùm &longs;emper æqualiter di&longs;ter
à planis AD & LV, &longs;cilicet eodem radio OL, ON;

certè percurrit OE
parallelam vtrique; &longs;ed parallela vtrique e&longs;t recta, punctum verò L mo­
uetur per lineam curuam, vt con&longs;tabit ex illius de&longs;criptione, quàm tra­
demus infrà.
Theorema 4.

Si diuidatur arcus LQ in tres arcus aquales & planum AD in tres par­
tes æquales, pote&longs;t a&longs;&longs;ignari punctum, in quo &longs;it L decur&longs;o prime arcu LK;

&longs;i
enim e&longs;&longs;et tantùm centri, e&longs;&longs;et in m, &longs;i motus orbis e&longs;&longs;et in K;

igitur
&longs;it recta MI parallela LV, &longs;itque KI æqualis AB, vel L m;

haud dubiè erit
in I;
nec enim de&longs;cendet infra MI, vt con&longs;tat:

&longs;ic motus orbis dat LK,
vel MK motus centri L m vel KI;
igitur vterque &longs;imul LI vel KI:

&longs;i­
militer decur&longs;o arcu KH, punctum rotæ L erit in G;

nam motus orbis
dat LH, vel NH, vel motus centri AC vel LV; igitur &longs;i a&longs;&longs;umatur HG
æqualis LV, vterque motus dabit LIG.
Corollarium 1.

Hinc colligo, de&longs;criptionem lineæ, quam &longs;uo motu &longs;eu flux^u de&longs;cri­
bit punctum L, cuius infinita puncta a&longs;&longs;ignari po&longs;&longs;unt, &longs;i enim diuidatur
planum æquale arcui LQ in tot partes, in quot diuiditur arcus LQ, &
cuilibet &longs;inui recto arcus a&longs;&longs;umpti addatur &longs;egmentum plani con&longs;tans
tot partibus, quot partibus arcus aliis arcubus v.g.&longs;inui MK, KI æqua­
lis L m, &longs;inui NH, LV, denique &longs;inui toti OQ tota LY, habebuntur &longs;in­
gula puncta huius lineæ L, I, G, F quam rotatilem appellamus; quæ certè
eò acuratiùs de&longs;cribetur, quò plura eius puncta &longs;ignabuntur, id e&longs;t quò
diuidetur arcus LQ in plures arcus, & planum LV in plures partes.
Corollarium 2.

Linea quoque rotatilis puncti A de&longs;cribi pote&longs;t diui&longs;o arcu AZ in
tres arcus, & plano AD in 3. pattes;

&longs;int enim &longs;inus TX, Y p &longs;itque TS
æqualis AB, YR æqualis AG, & ZP æqualis AD;

nam motus orbis dat AT vel
XT motus centri AB; igitur TS.
Corollarium 3.

Hinc vides punctum L oppo&longs;itum puncto contactus ita moueri, vt
motus orbis addatur motui centri; punctum verò A ita mouetur, vt mo­
tus orbis detrahatur motui centri.
Corollarium 4.

Hinc etiam de&longs;cribi pote&longs;t linea, quam de&longs;cribit quodlibet punctum
interioris circuli v.g. punctum E;

de&longs;cribatur enim arcus quadrátis & 2.

Tertiò, quia omnia puncta circuli mouentur motu mixto ex recto,
& circulari, excepto centro, cùm tamen omnia puncta poligoni motu

num KD parallelum BC &longs;ecans hæc tria;

certè totum HFA conflatum ex omnibus ba&longs;ibus e&longs;t æ­

quia nec idem punctum minoris
rotæ pluribus &longs;ui plani re&longs;pondet, nec &longs;ingula &longs;ingulis re&longs;pondent, nec
etiam fiunt illi &longs;altus intactis finitis, vel infinitis vacuolis; immò talis e&longs;t

hypothe&longs;im punctorum mathematicorum.

12. Certum e&longs;t &longs;ecundò, vix etiam explicari po&longs;&longs;e iuxta hypothe&longs;im
partium proportionalium infinitarum actu;

quia contactus ip&longs;e globi, &
plani tam ob&longs;curè in hac hypothe&longs;i explicatur, vt etiam authores ip&longs;i,
qui huic &longs;ententiæ patrocinantur, vltrò a&longs;&longs;erant in&longs;eparabilem e&longs;&longs;e diffi­
cultatem;

quod enim dicunt contactum fieri in parte indeterminata,
ne&longs;cio an aliquis &longs;i non blandiens capere po&longs;&longs;it: nunquid enim contactus
e&longs;t determinatus qui realis e&longs;t, & &longs;ingularis, id e&longs;t hic & non alius?

nun­
quid e&longs;t aliquid, quod tangit ab omni, eo quod tangit, di&longs;tinctum?

quip­
pe tangere, & non tangere &longs;unt prædicata contradictoria; &longs;ed de his fusè
in Metaphy&longs;ica.

13. Adde quod, licèt contactus globi in plano explicari po&longs;&longs;et, &longs;upe­
re&longs;&longs;et tamen eadem difficultas; nam cùm nulla &longs;it pars, &longs;iue indetermina­
ta, &longs;iue determinata in plano BF, quæ &longs;it intacta, & cum eadem pars
arcus BD non re&longs;pondeat pluribus partibus plani BF, & cùm &longs;ingu­
læ partes arcus &longs;ingulis partibus non re&longs;pondeant (quæ omnia
con&longs;tant ex dictis) profectò eadem e&longs;t difficultas iuxta hypothe&longs;im par­
tium proportionalium infinitarum actu, quæ e&longs;t iuxta hypothe&longs;im pun­
ctorum mathematicorum finitorum, vel infinitorum.

14. His po&longs;itis, &longs;upere&longs;t tantùm vt &longs;oluatur hæc difficultas iuxta hy­
pothe&longs;im punctorum phy&longs;icorum, vel partium diui&longs;ibilium in infini­
tum potentiâ, cuius principia & difficultates in Metaphy&longs;ica di&longs;cu­
tiemus.

Dico ergo &longs;atis facilè iuxta hanc hypothe&longs;im explicari, & &longs;olui po&longs;&longs;e
nodum rotæ Ari&longs;totelicæ:

quippe punctum phy&longs;icum curuum tangit
punctum phy&longs;icum planum, &longs;ed non adæquatè;

quippè nullum curuum
adæquari pote&longs;t plano, &longs;eu cum plano conuenire, quod nemo Geometra
negare poterit:

quippe duæ quantitates po&longs;&longs;unt duobus modis con&longs;ide­
rari: Primò in ordine ad æqualitatem, vel inæqualitatem.

&longs;i primo modo, vna quantitas, vel dicitur alteri æqualis, vel inæ­
qualis;
&longs;i inæqualis, vel maior, vel minor;

&longs;i maior vel minor, dicitur
rationalis, vel irrationalis &longs;eu aloga; &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt vulgaria, paulò ob&longs;cu­
riora, quæ &longs;equuntur.

15. Si enim &longs;ecundo modo con&longs;iderentur, vel po&longs;&longs;unt commen&longs;urari,
vel non po&longs;&longs;unt;
&longs;i primum, &longs;unt nece&longs;&longs;ariò æquales;

&longs;i inæquales illæ &longs;unt
vel alogæ eædem quæ &longs;uprà, &longs;ic diagonalis comparata cum latere quadrati
e&longs;t aloga, hoc e&longs;t ita inæqualis, vt nulla &longs;it vtrique pars aliquota commu­
munis;

alogæ quidem in ordine ad commen&longs;urationem, non tamen in
ordines ad partes aliquotas;

&longs;ic maior arcus comparatus cum linea recta
&longs;ubdupla non e&longs;t alogus primo modo &longs;ed &longs;ecundo, id e&longs;t illa linea, quæ e&longs;t
&longs;ubdupla arcus, non pote&longs;t conuenire cum arcu toto, nec cum aliqua
eius parte;

&longs;ic angulus, quem faciunt duæ circumferentiæ, pote&longs;t quidem e&longs;&longs;e
&etail;qualis angulo dato rectilineo;

nunquam tamen cum eo conuenire po­
te&longs;t;

&longs;ic arcus æqualis rectæ, &longs;ic denique punctum curuum æquale puncto
plano;

licèt enim totum punctum tangatur ab alîo puncto, non tamen
adæquatè, quia exten&longs;io vnius e&longs;t aloga cum exten&longs;ione alterius;

analo­
giam habes in duobus Angelis;

quorum vnus figuram &longs;phæricam pedalem
induat, alter cubicam, & alter alterum tangat;

nam reuerâ totus Angelus
tangitur, quia caret partibus, non tamen adæquatè, vt certum e&longs;t;

immò
po&longs;&longs;et Angelus cuius e&longs;t figura &longs;phærica, ita duobus aliis, quorum e&longs;&longs;et
figura cubica adhærere, vt vtrique inadæquatè adhæreret v.g. Angelus A
punctis BC ita vt ip&longs;um punctum contactus e&longs;&longs;et in ip&longs;a qua&longs;i commi&longs;­
&longs;ura:

immò &longs;unt infiniti potentia huiu&longs;modi
inadæquatè diuer&longs;i;

vocetur autem contactus E centralis, &longs;eu medius; con­
tactus verò B extremus.
16. Nec A e&longs;t;

quòd aliqui ne&longs;cio quas partes viruales in angelo ex­
ten&longs;o agno&longs;cant, quæ certè à me concipi non po&longs;&longs;unt;

vnde fit &longs;ingulis inadæquatè coexten­
di; quod nemo negabit;

&longs;ed ne dici moremur in hac materia, quam hîc
ex profe&longs;&longs;o non tractamus;

cettum e&longs;t iuxta hanc hypothe&longs;im punctorum
phy&longs;icorum facilè explicari motum rotæ Ari&longs;totelicæ:

quippe dum pun­
ctum quod proximè accedit ad C in arcu CH incubat puncto plani C
E, quòd immediatè &longs;equitur C, idque centrali contactu punctum, quod
proximè &longs;equitur B in arcu BD, quem &longs;ubduplum CH &longs;uppono, tangit
punctum, quod &longs;equitur immediatè B in plano BF contactu extremo, id
e&longs;t commi&longs;&longs;ura puncti B & alterius contactu medio, tangit punctum plani
quod probatur;

quia punctum, quod immediatè &longs;equitur B in arcu BDC
quod vocabimus deinceps &longs;ecundum, tangit contactu tertium punctum
plani BF eo in&longs;tanti, quo tertium punctum arcus CH tangit contactu
medio tertium plani CE; igitur eo in&longs;tanti, quo &longs;ecundum CH tangit
contactu medio &longs;ecundum CE, &longs;ecundum BD tangit contactu extremo
primum BF, extremo inquam ratione puncti arcus, non ratione puncti
plani.

17. Si verò e&longs;&longs;et maior rota, eîu&longs;que contactus e&longs;&longs;et inter BC, e&longs;&longs;ent
alij contactus inadæquati, vt facilè intelligi pote&longs;t ex dictis, pote&longs;t au­
tem fieri, vt dixi, vt &longs;int plures contactus inadæquati etiam arcus CH,
ni&longs;i veloci&longs;&longs;imè moueatur ratione loci, id e&longs;t ni&longs;i punctum phy&longs;icum
mobile acquirat &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus punctum loci immediatum non
participans de priori;

quod certè pote&longs;t acquirere duplici motu, &longs;cilicet
vel recto vel mixto ex recto, & circulari; nec e&longs;t enim dubium, quin An­
gelus v. g. inducta figura &longs;phærica non po&longs;&longs;it volui circa &longs;e ip&longs;um velo­
ciùs, & velociùs in infinitum.

18. V. g.. angelus A pote&longs;t circa centrum mathematicum, id e&longs;t
imaginatum B immobile agi in orbem tardiùs, & tardiùs quidem, &longs;i vnum
orbem faciat pluribus, & pluribus in&longs;tantibus; velociùs verò, &longs;i pauciori­
bus;

quot verò in&longs;tantibus vnum integrum orbem peragat, &longs;i tempus
con&longs;tet finitis in&longs;tantibus;

exi&longs;timo primò, po&longs;&longs;e pluribus, & pluribus pe­
ragere quia tardiùs, & tardiùs in infinitum moueri pote&longs;t;

vt autem moueatur adhuc velociùs in infinitum; aget quidem &longs;in­
gulos orbes &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus, &longs;ed minoribus, &longs;eu breuioribus.
19. Ob&longs;eruabis Angelum A po&longs;&longs;e tribus modis moueri;

primò circa
centrum B immobile, vt iam dictum e&longs;t, idque velociùs, & tardiùs in in­
finitum, & hic motus e&longs;t perfectè circularis:

Secundò motu recto &longs;impli­
ci per lineas BE, IH, idque etiam tardiùs, & velociùs;

velociùs uerò &longs;i pauciora donec tandem vno in&longs;tanti circulus A
re&longs;pondeat F adæquatè, id e&longs;t acquirat locum immediatum non partici­
pantem, quod adhuc fiet velociùs, & velociùs in infinitum; quia pote&longs;t id
fieri per in&longs;tantia breuiora, & breuiora.

20. Tertiò pote&longs;t moueri motu mixto ex duobus præcedentibus, ita
vt qua&longs;i rotetur in plano IH, quod tribus modis fieri pote&longs;t:

primo &longs;i D
punctum &longs;cilicet re&longs;ponderet H;
&longs;ecundo, &longs;i aliud punctum inter DI tertio;

&longs;i aliquod inter DCI, primo pote&longs;t fieri, vel &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuè per contactus
inadæquatos, vel in in&longs;tanti, idem dico de &longs;ecundo, & tertio, donec
tandem eo motu tran&longs;eat in F, ita vt punctum F re&longs;pondeat H & circa B
totum orbem confecerit; &longs;ed de his plura cum de Angelis.

21. Porrò punctum B eo in&longs;tanti, quo &longs;ecundum CH tangit conta­
ctu medio, &longs;ecundum CE tangit extremo &longs;ecundum BF;

igitur &longs;imul
cum alio id e&longs;t cum &longs;ecundo BD;

&longs;i verò accipiatur quodlibet aliud pun­
ctum inter RC;

illud certè non tangit vllo modo ad primum BF eo in­
&longs;tanti, quo &longs;ecundum CH tangit contactu medio &longs;ecundum CE;

&longs;i ta­
men accipiatur aliquod punctum inter BA v.g. R; certè punctum R tan­
git &longs;olum &longs;ecundum RV, &longs;ed contactu, qui nec e&longs;t extremus, nec medius,
&longs;ed inter vtrumque, eo &longs;cilicet in&longs;tanti, quo &longs;ecundum CH tangit con­
tactu medio primum CE.

22. Ex his facilè intellegi pote&longs;t hic motus; quic &longs;cilicet idem punctum
rotæ minoris pote&longs;t re&longs;pondere diuer&longs;is punctis &longs;ui plani, &longs;ed diuer&longs;o
contactu, quod facilè explicatur, tùm per analogiam motus angelici, tùm
per analogiam partium curuarum rotæ exten&longs;arum.

Vnde ex &longs;uperiori­
bus re&longs;pon&longs;ionibus, duæ &longs;i rectè explicentur &longs;oluunt hunc nodum.

Tertia
verò omninò fal&longs;a e&longs;t;

nam primùm dici pote&longs;t fieri aliquos &longs;altus con­
tactuum inadæquatorum;

igitur plures contactus inadæquati inter extremum & me­
dium qua&longs;i omittuntur per &longs;altus; nullum e&longs;t tamen in&longs;tans, quod ali­
quo punctum plani non tangatur aliquo contactu, ab aliquo puncto ar­
cus, vel etiam à duobus in ip&longs;a commi&longs;&longs;ura, quæ commi&longs;&longs;ura ad in&longs;tar
puncti mathematici imaginarij concipi pote&longs;t.

23. Secundò dici pote&longs;t, quod idem punctum arcus BD tangat duo
puncta plani BF &longs;ed diuer&longs;o contactu; nec enim duo puncta plani tan­
guntur ab eodem puncto arcus contactu medio in ip&longs;o puncto arcus.

Tertiò denique dici non pote&longs;t &longs;ingula puncta BD &longs;ingulis punctis B
F re&longs;pondere, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis, atque ita ex iis, quæ hactenus diximus
&longs;ufficienter explicatus e&longs;t &longs;ecundus modus motus rotæ in plano.
Quod verò &longs;pectat ad tertium;

&longs;i minor globus centro G in eadem
figura moueatur, vt motus orbis &longs;it æqualis motui centri v.g. ex G mo­
ueatur in I, ex K perueniat in M, &longs;itque FM vel GI æqualis arcus FK,
& rota minor GF &longs;ecum rapiat maiorem GE;

haud dubiè motus orbis
maioris rotæ e&longs;t maior motu centri, vt patet; quippe eo tempore, quo re­
uoluitur arcus quadrantis, & centrum acquirit tantùm GI &longs;ubduplum
eiu&longs;dem arcus.
24. E&longs;t autem in hoc motu eadem difficultas;
atqui nihil horum dici po&longs;&longs;e videtur:
non primum, quia &longs;unt plura puncta EI quam EN:

non &longs;ecundum,
quia &longs;i duo puncta EI tangerent idem EN;

igitur duo FK tangerent
idem FM quod fal&longs;um e&longs;t, non denique tertium;

quia &longs;i punctum &longs;ecun­
dum FK tangat contactu tantum extremo primum FK, ita vt &longs;it conta­
ctus extremus in vtroque id e&longs;t in &longs;ecundo plani, & in &longs;ecundo arcus;
haud dubiè &longs;ecundus EI tangit &longs;ecundum EN contactu medio in pun­
cto arcus & extremo in puncto plani

25. Itaque hic motus explicari debet per diuer&longs;os contactas inadæ­
quatos; non pote&longs;t tamen fieri, quin minor rota &longs;uum motum componat
cum motu maioris, vt explicauimus abundè, cum de motu circulari, v.g.
non pote&longs;t minor rota ita moueri, vt acquirat quodlibet eius punctum
locum immediatè non participantem vno in&longs;tanti, &longs;i ex eo &longs;equatur aliud
punctum, vel eiu&longs;dem rotæ, vel alterius coniunctæ moueri velociùs, vt
con&longs;tat ex dictis.

26. Vides autem primò, motum maioris rotæ accedere propiùs ad cir­
cularem, cum mouetur hoc &longs;ecundo motus genere;

quia &longs;cilicet motus
centri &longs;i comparetur cum motu orbis maioris rotæ, minor e&longs;t;

igitur quo minor e&longs;t motus centri, & maior motus orbis, accedit ille
motus propiùs ad circularem, & è contrario quò maior e&longs;t motus centri,
vt accidit in &longs;ecundo genere motus, accedit propiùs ad motum rectum;
cum verò alter alteri æqualis e&longs;t motus mixtus, quem medium appellare
po&longs;&longs;umus.
27. Aliqua puncta maioris rotæ;

cuius motus à minori dirigitur re­
troëunt, &longs;cilicet, quæ accedunt propiùs ad punctum contactus E, v. g.
ip&longs;um E vbi centrum rotæ e&longs;t in KI regreditur in O:

immò regredi vi­
detur v&longs;que ad X, id e&longs;t, donec &longs;ecus lineam BM;

igitur cum arcus ZE
M, &longs;it &longs;ubduplus arcus ZIM, vt con&longs;tat, & cùm motus centri &longs;it &longs;ubduplus
motus orbis, etiam arcus, qui regreditur, e&longs;t &longs;ubduplus illius, qui non re­
greditur; &longs;ed motum centri &longs;equitur.

&longs;it IX 2/3 EN; deni­
que ip&longs;a YP æqualis EN.

28. Quartò, aliquod punctum nec progreditur, nec regreditur vno
in&longs;tanti, eo &longs;cilicet;

quo tantum detrahit motus orbis, quantum addit
motus centri, pote&longs;tque determinari punctum illud;

imò & proportiones
motus cuiu&longs;libet puncti; &longs;ed hæc ex po&longs;itis principiis facilè colligitur
operâ analytices.

Quintò punctum E mouetur velociùs, cum dirigitur motus â minori
rota, quàm punctum C, cum dirigitur motus à maiori;

quia motus orbis
multùm illud retroagit:
immò non mouetur tardi&longs;&longs;imè omnium;

&longs;ed pun­
ctum illud, quod nec progreditur, nec regreditur, &longs;ed modicùm vel a&longs;cen­
dit vel de&longs;cendit; &longs;unt autem duo huiu&longs;modi puncta, alterum in arcu I
E, alterum in YE.

29. Sextò denique ex his principis benè èxplicatur quomodo maior
vel minor rota, cuius motus ab alia minore dirigitur, moueri pote&longs;t;

nec
e&longs;t quod in his diutiùs immoremur, vt tandem interruptam no&longs;tro­
rum Theorematum &longs;eriem repetamus, &longs;unt enim plures alij motus mixti
non tantùm ex recto, & circulari, &longs;ed ex duobus & pluribus circularibus;
quorum omnium rationes ni&longs;i me veritas ip&longs;a fallit (quæ tamen falle­
re non pote&longs;t) ad &longs;ua principiæ phy&longs;ica reducemus.
Theorema 9.

Globus, qui de&longs;cendit deor&longs;um in plano inclinato, mouetur motu mix­
to ex recto centri, & circulari orbis;
cuius certè nulla pars a&longs;cendit, &longs;en regreditur;

e&longs;t enim
eadem illius ratio;

cur autem moueatur ille motu mixto, & non
recto &longs;implici:

ratio e&longs;t, quia propter primam illam inclinationem
tollitur eius æquilibrium;

cùm enim globus perfectus in aëre vibratus,
&longs;i nulla ad&longs;it inclinatio, &longs;it in perfecto æquilibrio, certè, &longs;i vel modica in­
clinatio accedat vel in C vel in D tolletur æquilibrium, quia illa incli­
natio idem præ&longs;tat quod pondus nouum additum; porrò huius inclinationis:
ratio ex eo petitur primò, quòd prius globus demittatur per planum
inclinatum, &longs;iue cadat ex ip&longs;a manu, &longs;iue ex alio plano v.g. ex recto vel
alio plano decliui.

Secundò ex eo, quòd priùs moueatur altera extremi­
tas putà C, quàm D;

igitur acquirit C plùs impetus motu naturaliter ac­
celerato;
igitur retinetur à puncto;

quòd licèt deinde moueatur, tardiùs
tamen mouetur;

igitur C vbi ad imum de&longs;cendit iterum videtur a&longs;cen­
dere tùm propter determinationem nouam;

tùm quia ab oppo&longs;ito pun­
cto de&longs;cendente qua&longs;i attollitur:

non dixi a&longs;cendere, &longs;ed tantùm videri
a&longs;cendere, quia reuerâ non a&longs;cendit;

alioquin aliquod punctum regrede­
retur, quod fal&longs;um e&longs;t; nec enim pote&longs;t a&longs;cendere, ni&longs;i regrediatur, vt
con&longs;tat.
Theorema 10.
Hinc non de&longs;truitur ille impetus ab impetu innato, vt fit in funependulis;
quia &longs;cilicet de&longs;truitur tantùm ab innato in a&longs;cen&longs;u;

&longs;itque OF perpendicularis deor&longs;um, quæ
percurritur ab eodem centro O motu centri;

&longs;itque motus orbis ab L
in que intelligatur autem planium AI 6;

certè punctum A, quod perinde
&longs;e habet, atque &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et punctum contactus, de&longs;cribit lineam ARP ergo
non a&longs;cendit; igitur non de&longs;truitur impetus productus ab impetu in­
nato.
Scholium.
Ob&longs;eruabis 1°ree;.

1. Non tantum accelerari motum centri, &longs;ed etiam motum orbis, vt
patet experientiâ in globo de&longs;cendente per decliue planum.

3. Si globus non de&longs;cendat in plano declini &longs;ed in libero aëre po&longs;t
primam librationem motus orbis non cre&longs;cit;

quia omnes partes ten­
dere po&longs;&longs;unt deor&longs;um, nec ab vllo obice impediuntur; non e&longs;t autem
par ratio pro motu in plano decliui, vt patet.
4. Hinc motus orbis &longs;en&longs;im dece&longs;cit, &longs;ed omninò in&longs;en&longs;ibiliter;
quia non de&longs;truitur ab impetu innato, vt iam dictum e&longs;t;

nec enim &longs;ic
motus circularis e&longs;t contrarius motui recto;

quippe modò centrum
grauitatis globi feratur motu recto, hoc &longs;atis e&longs;&longs;e videtur, &longs;iue partes mo­
tu circulari ferantur: circa idem centrum, &longs;iue omnes motu recto per
lineas parallelas ferantur:

ratio à priori e&longs;t, quia in tantum vnus impe­
tus de&longs;truit alium in eadem parte mobilis, in quantum impeditur ab eo
eius motus deor&longs;um totius globi nullo modo impeditur ab illo motu
circulari, quia globus æquè citò de&longs;cendit vno, atque alio motu, vt con­
&longs;tat mille experientiæ.
Theorema 11.

Si corporis grauis altera extremitas &longs;it grauior demittaturque in eo &longs;itu,
in quo &longs;it parallelum horizonti;

haud dubiè extremitas grauior præit motu
mixto;

quia illa extremitas faciliùs medij re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;uperat, igitur
præire debet;
igitur motu mixto;

illa tamen tardiùs de&longs;cendit, quàm
de&longs;cenderet, &longs;i à leuiore e&longs;&longs;et &longs;eparata;

leuior verò velociùs, quàm &longs;i e&longs;­
&longs;et &longs;olitaria; quod autem non &longs;it alia ratio, patet poti&longs;&longs;imum ex eo, quòd
plumbum ita demi&longs;&longs;um, vt funis præeat, tandem funem a&longs;&longs;equitur, & tan­
dem à tergo relinquit.
Corollarium 1.

Hinc petenda e&longs;t vera ratio illius phœnomeni, quod iam &longs;uprà l. 3.
indicauimus, &longs;cilicet &longs;agittam plùs temporis ponere in de&longs;cen&longs;u, quàm
in a&longs;cen&longs;u minoremque infligere ictum, quàm leuius lignum, & multò
leuior penna cu&longs;pidis ferreæ motum retardat.
Corollarium 2.

Si altera extremitas &longs;agittæ plumis in&longs;truatur, licèt proijciatur motu
violento &longs;ur&longs;um extremitas ferro armata præit plumis à tergo relictis;

ratio e&longs;t, quia aër fortiùs re&longs;i&longs;tit pluuis, quàm ferro, vel ligno; igitur ca­
rum motum retardat.
Corollarium 3.

Hinc &longs;agitta pennis atton&longs;is fertur in incertum, & &longs;copum fallit, cui
fuerat de&longs;tinata;
quia licèt lignum minore vi polleat, quàm ferrum;

vix
tamen &longs;en&longs;ibilis e&longs;t differentia;

adde quod minima deflexio, vel decli­
natio ad retrò agendum ferrum &longs;ufficit; corpus enim facilè mouetur mo­
tu mixto ex recto, & circulari.
Corollarium. 4.
cuius rei analogiam habes in nauis gubernaculo;

e&longs;t enim
ad in&longs;tar quadruplicis claui motum dirigentis;

quîppe inclinari non
pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i multum aëris pellant alæ illæ chartaceæ: In &longs;agitta aliquid
&longs;imile habes.
Corollarium 5.

Hinc &longs;i euibretur iaculum illud per horizontalem v.g. circa pro­
prium axem conuoluitur;

&longs;ed
cum eo motum mixtum componit, de quo paulò pò&longs;t; nunc tantùm &longs;uf­
ficiat attigi&longs;&longs;e veri&longs;&longs;imam rationem illorum gyrorum.
Corollarium 6.

Simile phœnomenum habes in illis volatilibus calamis, qui multis
copiam ludi faciunt;

nam primò tignea illa, vel o&longs;&longs;ea theca, cui com-
mittuntur plumæ, plumas ip&longs;as præit propter rationem prædictam;

nam
aëra faciliùs diuidit;
&longs;ecundò vertiginem illam habet, de qua &longs;uprà;

quia
aër qua&longs;i reuerberat, torquetque plumas; de hoc motu paulò pò&longs;t agemus.
Theorema 12.

vt con&longs;tat ex iis, quæ diximus de globo deor&longs;um cadente hoc
genere motus; &longs;unt tamen hîc multa ob&longs;eruanda.

Primò omnes partes
globi initio moueri, &longs;ed inæqualiter, cùm tamen aliqua pars cylindri non
moueatur.
Sit enim cylindrus AC ita innixus B, vt liberè moueri po&longs;&longs;it;
haud dubiè, cùm non &longs;it æquilibrium, &longs;egmentum BC præualebit;

igitur
circa centrum B extremitas C de&longs;cendet per arcum CD, & A per arcum
AE; donec tandem punctum B moueatur per rectam BF, &longs;eu per aliam
proximè accedentem, &longs;i.
tantillùm à plano BF repellatur;

punctum verò
C motu mixto ex recto deor&longs;um, & circulari circa B;

ea tamen lege, vt
motus orbis nullo modo acceleretur, &longs;ed tantùm motus centri; igitur
hic motus con&longs;tat ex motu centri accelerato, & motu orbis qua&longs;i æqua­
bili, cuius linea de&longs;cribi pote&longs;t, vt videbimus l. 12. dixi, ferè æquabilem,
quia aliquid de&longs;truitur &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus ratione nouæ determinatio­
nis, vt diximus &longs;uprà cum de motu circulari, &longs;ed parùm pro nihilo repu­
tatur.
Scholium.

e&longs;&longs;e plures huius motus mixti &longs;pecies.

ex motu centri & motu orbis æquali.

nore.

Theorema 13.

Cum cylindrus proijcitur &longs;ur&longs;um it a vt aliquod punctum rectà feratur, cir­
ca quod voluitur cylindrus,

est motus mixtus ex recto centri, & circulari orbis,
pro quo non e&longs;t noua difficultas; nam e&longs;t pror&longs;us eadem ratio, ni&longs;i
quod primò debet priùs imprimi motus rectus omnibus partibus erecto
cylindro tùm vbi &longs;eparatur à manu circulariis.

Secundò centrum pote&longs;t
accedere propiùs ad &longs;ummam extremitatem vel ad imam.

Tertiò, a&longs;cendit
eò altiùs cylindrus, quò centrum motus orbis accedit propiùs ad &longs;um­
mam extremitatem.

Quartò, pote&longs;t extremitas ima impelli duobus mo­
dis:
primò &longs;i retrò agitur, &longs;ecundò &longs;i antè;

&longs;ed quia hæc omnia perti­
nent ad diuer&longs;os oblongæ ha&longs;tæ motus iucundaque militaris illius exer­
citationis phœnomena, quorum omnium rationem in &longs;ingulari Theo­
remate afferemus; eò totam rem i&longs;tam remittimus.
Theorema 14.

Quando globus, &longs;eu rota voluitur in &longs;uperficie curua immobili, omnes eius
partes mouentur motu mixto ex duobus circularibus, &longs;cilicet ex motu circula­
ri centri, & circulari orbis, e&longs;t enim motus centri circularis &longs;i voluatur
globus in orbe, hoc e&longs;t in &longs;uperficie curua;

porrò hæc &longs;uperficies vel e&longs;t
conuexa, vel concaua, vel e&longs;t circuli maioris, vel minoris;

itemque &longs;i con­
caua vel e&longs;t circuli æqualis, vel maioris, vel minoris; igitur &longs;unt 6. nouæ
combinationes, quæ &longs;i ducantur in 27. habebis 162. &longs;ed quia, &longs;i e&longs;t con­
caua minoris, vel æqualis, non pote&longs;t globus in ea rotari.

Hinc &longs;unt tan­
tùm 4. legitimæ combinationes nouæ, quæ &longs;i ducantur in 27, habebis
108; &longs;ed iam &longs;eor&longs;im rem i&longs;tam con&longs;ideremus.

culari, de&longs;cribitque circulum radio AC, &longs;cilicet duplum circuli immobi­

Theorema 16.

Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena, quæ in &longs;uperficie curua circuli

&longs;it enim &longs;uperficies curua BF radius AB, &longs;itque rota

igitur M tanget C, O tan­
get D, & B tandem tanget F; igitur mouetur hæc rota motu mixto ex
duobus circularibus.

Primò, &longs;ignari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia puncta huius lineæ v. g. MIHF
per quæ ducenda e&longs;t linea curua, cuius etiam affectiones aliàs demon­
