ratio­
nem iam bis attulimus;

quia &longs;cilicet maior e&longs;t motus, cum motus centri

rectilineo, quàm motus rotæ &longs;uperioris; quia BF, quæ e&longs;t &longs;uperficies ma­

porrò minor

candum e&longs;t per contactus inadæquatos; tunc enim motus centri longè

mo motu mixto ex motu centri, & motu orbis;

vnde omnia puncta

&longs;i minor dirigatur à maiore, puncta minoris dextror&longs;um mouentur
tùm &longs;ini&longs;trorum; contra verò &longs;i maior dirigatur à minore, puncta maio­
ris mouentur &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um, tùm dextror&longs;um, quæ omnia ex dictis facilè
intelligi po&longs;&longs;unt, & explicari.

Octauò, præterea puncta radij RC a&longs;&longs;umpta, quæ propiùs ad extre­
mitatem C accedunt, de&longs;cribunt lineam, quæ propiùs accedit ad rectam;

quæ verò accedunt propiùs ad centrum P, de&longs;cribunt lineam magis cur­
uam;
idem de punctis in radio PA;

nam e&longs;t eadem ratio, quæ omnia ex
dictis con&longs;tant;

an fortè cùm punctum C de&longs;cribat rectam, punctum P
circulum, & quæ propiùs accedunt ad C minùs curuam, quæ propiùs
ad P magis curuam; &longs;ed tractatu &longs;equenti omnes i&longs;tas lineas explica­
bimus.
Nonò, &longs;i &longs;uperficies &longs;it minoris circuli quàm dupli;

certè punctum C,
v.g. non de&longs;cribet rectum CK, &longs;ed aliam curuam &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um; &longs;i verò
&longs;it maioris circuli quàm dupli, de&longs;cribet aliam curuam dextror&longs;um, quæ
omnia con&longs;tant ex dictis.
Corollarium.

Non videntur omittenda aliqua Corollaria Cyclomètrica, quæ ex di­
ctis &longs;ua &longs;ponte na&longs;ci videntur;

nam primò &longs;emicirculus AQG e&longs;t æqua­
lis triangulo mixto ex arcubus GC, & GA, & recta AC; quia quadrans
AGC e&longs;t æqualis circulo A9.CB, vt patet.

Secundò, omnes radij eodem modo &longs;ecantur à circulo v.g. AC, AD.
AE: &longs;unt enim CVE w, D4.æquales, item C 3. T, VE9. &c.

Tertiò, omnes arcus intercepti inter radios &longs;unt æquales v.g. DY, C 4.
T4. E4. GF, F9.9 d.

Quartò, præterea arcus à puncto contactus maioris, & dupli circuli
v&longs;que ad quemlibet radium &longs;unt æquales, v.g. G9, A & GC, G9. d GD,
G9. & GE, GF, & GC, tùm FR, & FC, F b, & FD, F w & FE, tùm ET,
& EC, E 4. & ED; denique DV, DC.

Quintò, triangula illa mixta ex duplici arcu æquali maioris, & minoris
circuli, & altero latere recto, &longs;unt æqualia &longs;ectionibus minoribus circuli,
quarum arcus æquales &longs;unt prioribus minoris circuli, &longs;ic triangulum
mixtum ex arcubus GC, G9. A, & recta AE e&longs;t æquale &longs;emicirculo G9.
A;

mixtun verò ex arcubus FC, FR, & recta RC, e&longs;t æquale &longs;ectioni VA
vel E9. A, mixtum ex arcubus ET, EC & recta, æquale e&longs;t &longs;ectioni TA
vel 9. d A; denique mixtum ex arcu DC, DV, & recta CV e&longs;t æquale
&longs;ectioni RA.

Sextò &longs;ubtracto ex prædictis triangulis alio triangulo mixto per da­
tum radium quemcumque, &longs;ubtrahitur portio æqualis ex &longs;emicirculo
minore, & re&longs;iduum æquale e&longs;t re&longs;iduo v.g.ex triangulo mixto G9. AC
G ducto radio AF, detrahitur triangulum mixtum GF r, ex &longs;emicir­
culo A9. C, detrahitur portio æqualis 7. A;

igitur re&longs;iduum &longs;emicirculi
e&longs;t æquale re&longs;iduo trianguli mixti;

deinde ducto radio AC detrahitur
triangulo mixto prædicto aliud mixtum minus GE9. ex &longs;emicirculo A
9. C detrahitur portio A9. æqualis detracto; igitur Trapezus re&longs;iduus, E
9. A 7. E, e&longs;t æqualis triangulo mixto CA9. C. idem dico de aliis.

Septimò, cùm &longs;ector AFG &longs;it æqualis quadranti AP9. &longs;ectio ACZ,
e&longs;t maior quadrante prædicto triangulo mixto GCF vel &longs;ectiore 7. A;

atqui &longs;ectio ACZ habet arcum 135. & A 7. arcum 90. igitur &longs;ectio ar­
cus 135. e&longs;t æqualis quadranti plus &longs;ectione arcus;

igitur triangulum A
7.4.A e&longs;t æquale quadranti; triangulum verò mixtum GCA e&longs;t æquale
quadranti, minùs prædicta &longs;ectione arcus 90.

hinc vtrumque &longs;imul &longs;umptum detracta &longs;cilicet duplici
portione A 7.9. TA e&longs;t æquale quadrato in&longs;cripto, & duplex illa &longs;ectio

G; quod facilè geometricè demon&longs;tratur;
&longs;it enim circulus centro B;
&longs;int duæ diametri, GE, AC, quibus in 4. quadrantes diuidatur circulus;
tùm a&longs;&longs;umatur arcus GF, æqualis FC, & CD;

ducantur rectæ AD, AF, GF,
IF:

dico triangulum mixtum ex rectis AF, FG, & arcu GA, e&longs;&longs;e æquale
quadranti, quod demon&longs;tro;

triangula KAL, KFG &longs;unt æquiangula, quia
anguli K vtrinque &longs;unt æquales:

&longs;ed DAF, & AFG, &longs;u&longs;tinent æquales ar­

igitur &longs;unt æquales;

igitur tantum additur,
quantum tollitur; igitur prædictum triangulum e&longs;t æquale quadranti.

hinc lulu­

hinc

hinc &longs;i

&longs;ed de his &longs;atis, quæ tantùm indi­

Theorema 19.

Si ita moueatur cylindrus per quamcunque lineam, vt eius axis moueatur
motu recto, totu&longs;que cylindrus circa axem motu circulari moueatur, motus
mixtus e&longs;t, cuius diuer&longs;a &longs;unt phœnomena.
Primò, axis mouetur tantùm motu recto;

aliæ verò partes motu mixto
&longs;it enim cylindrus CH, cuius axis &longs;it AB, circa quem moueatur cylin­
drus motu circulari, & qui per eandem lineam AB indefinitè produ­
ctam mouetur; certè punctum C, v.g. mouetur motu mixto ex motu cen­
tri A, vel axis AB, & motus orbis.

Secundò, punctum C mouetur motu &longs;piræ; nam &longs;i tantùm motu orbis
moueretur, decur&longs;o &longs;emicirculo peruenire in L, F, N, &c.

igitur &longs;i eo
tempore, quo C decurrit motu centri, &longs;emicirculum CD;

punctum axis
A decurrit AK;

haud dubiè punctum C erit in E, tùm in F, tùm in G, tùm
in T; &longs;ed hic motus &longs;piralis e&longs;t, vt con&longs;tat.

Tertiò, omnia puncta peripheriæ CD mouentur æquali motu; quia
&longs;cilicet æqualem motum centri, & orbis participant.

Quartò, &longs;i motus centri vel axis &longs;it minor, frequentiores &longs;unt Helices
v.g. &longs;i eo tempore, quo C decurrit &longs;emicirculum CD, A decurreret tan­
tùm AR, C perueniret tantùm in Q, mox in I, atque ita deinceps moue­
retur per frequentiores &longs;piras; &longs;i verò motus axis &longs;it maior, &longs;piræ erunt
rariores, vt patet, v.g. &longs;i eo tempore, quo C motu centri decurrit &longs;emi­
circulum CD, punctum A decurrit AL, punctum C decurret &longs;piram C
M, mox MT, &c.
vnde minore motu mouentur, quàm C vel D;

igitur
axis AB tardi&longs;&longs;imo motu mouentur;

partes verò &longs;uperficiei cylindri
veloci&longs;&longs;imè; aliarum verò partium, quæ accedunt propiùs ad periphæ­
riam, velociùs.
quæ propiùs ad centrum, tardiùs:

hoc motu mouentur alæ
auium;

quæ directo volatu tendunt per lineam rectam, vt grues; nam
quælibet pars alæ motum axis habet, & orbis.
Theorema 20.

Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena calami volatilis &longs;it enim calamus
&longs;eu cylindrus DA, in altera extremitate D ita excauatus, vt duæ pennæ
BD, CE in&longs;eri po&longs;&longs;int eo ferè modo, quo vides.

Primò, mouetur axis FA motu recto; reliquæ verò partes motu mix­
to ex recto axis, & circulari orbis eo modo, quo diximus de cylindro
in &longs;uperiore Theoremate.

Secundò, &longs;emper calamus DA præit, &longs;cilicet ip&longs;a ba&longs;is A, & &longs;equun­
tur pennæ;
ratio e&longs;t, quia pennîs re&longs;i&longs;tit fortiùs aër, vt pater;

igitur earum
vim faciliùs &longs;uperat;

hinc &longs;emper retinentur à tergo, nec alia ratio e&longs;&longs;e
pote&longs;t;

præ&longs;ertim cùm pennæ ita &longs;int compo&longs;itæ propter diuaricationem,
vt multum aëra verberent;

quod autem pennis maximè re&longs;i&longs;tat aër, patet
ex auium volatu;
imò ex ip&longs;o plumarum de&longs;cen&longs;u;

idem dico de fa&longs;ciis illis tran&longs;uer&longs;ariis, quibus iunguntur equites;
idem de militaribus &longs;ignis, &longs;eu vexillis.

Tertiò, hinc ratio motus recti calami, quia, cùm &longs;emper præeat,
eundem &longs;itum &longs;eruat, penna&longs;que ip&longs;as qua&longs;i reluctantes trahit, &longs;untque
ip&longs;æ ad in&longs;tar claui, qui puppim regit.

Quartò, cum plumæ ita deuaricatæ qua&longs;i à reflante aëra pellantur &longs;e­
quitur nece&longs;&longs;ario motus orbis circa axem calami DA;

quippe hîc motus
facilis e&longs;t;

&longs;ic enim voluitur vectis &longs;eu cylindrus, quotie&longs;cumque ab altera
tremitate pellitur;

igitur cum pellantur D & C; quid mirum &longs;i totus ca­
lamus cum ip&longs;is pennis conuertatur.

Quintò, hinc motus calami e&longs;t mixtus ex recto axis, & circulari or­
bis;
igitur &longs;piralis e&longs;t;

&longs;piræ autem maiores &longs;unt, vel minores pro diuer&longs;a
di&longs;tantia partium ab axe AF, qui debet cen&longs;eri productus v&longs;que ad G;

nam partes, quæ longiùs di&longs;tant ab axe, maiores &longs;piras decurrunt; aliæ
verò minores; porrò &longs;piræ ip&longs;æ eò frequentiores &longs;unt, quò motus orbis
velocior e&longs;t, & contrà rariores, quò tardior.
Sextò, &longs;i &longs;it tantùm vnica penna, calamus non mouetur hoc motu;
quia vix aër verberatur;

adde quod in eam partem, quæ caret penna im­
pul&longs;us nece&longs;&longs;ariò inclinatur; idem accidit cum altera penna fracta e&longs;t,
vel minus aptè diuaricata.

Septimò, in cam partem conuertitur, &longs;eu &longs;piras agit, in quam pennæ
ip&longs;æ detorquentur;

alioquin non e&longs;&longs;et, cur potiùs in vnam, quàm in aliam
&longs;uos agerent orbes;

igitur ita diuaricantur pennæ, vt earum plana &longs;ibi in­
uicem &longs;int obliqua;

cuius rei ratio prædicta clari&longs;&longs;ima cùm &longs;it; non e&longs;t
quod amplius de hac re laboremus.
Octauò, &longs;i pennæ di&longs;tractiones &longs;unt, & maximè diuaricatæ;

motus
axis e&longs;t tardior; ratio e&longs;t, quia in eo &longs;tatu multum aëra pellunt, &longs;eu venti­
lant, à quo retinentur.

Nonò, &longs;i di&longs;tractiores &longs;unt, motus orbis e&longs;t etiam tardior, &longs;untque
rariores &longs;piræ;

ratio e&longs;t eadem, quia cùm motus orbis e&longs;t maior, etiam
plùs aëris vertigo illa &longs;ecum abripit;

hinc maior e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia; vnde
ob&longs;eruabis, vt motus orbis minùs impediatur, ita pennas e&longs;&longs;e componen­
das, vt aëra &longs;ua qua&longs;i acie cæ&longs;im diuidant, ne &longs;i pellant tota &longs;ua &longs;uperficie,
maior &longs;it re&longs;i&longs;tentia.

Decimò, &longs;i demum plùs æquo &longs;int diuaricatæ, ita vt angulum obtu&longs;i&longs;­
&longs;imum faciant, ce&longs;&longs;at omninò motus orbis propter maiorem re&longs;i&longs;tentiam,
quæ vertiginem illam impedit.

Vndecimò, ita pennæ aptari debent, vt &longs;en&longs;im inflexæ à radice DE
ver&longs;us apices BC afflatum aëris diuer&longs;um excipiant, & di&longs;&longs;imilem: vnde
accidit, vt partes ip&longs;æ, quæ retardantur, & maiore vi pollent in vertigi­
nem agantur, in eam &longs;cilicet partem, in quam aliqua inclinatio conducit
&longs;ic globus retentus à corpore oppo&longs;ito in orbem agitur propter rationem
prædictam, ne ille impetus &longs;it fru&longs;trà, qui adhuc &longs;upere&longs;t.

Hinc vides
motum orbis non imprimi calamo à pennis, &longs;ed pennis à calamo;

qui
cùm ab illis retardetur, ne aliquid impetus &longs;it fru&longs;trà, &longs;upplet motu cir­
culari, quod recto difficiliori propter re&longs;i&longs;tentiam orbis con&longs;equi non
pote&longs;t;

determinatur quidem motus circularis in talem partem ab ip&longs;a
pennarum deflexione;
non tamen imprimitur:

hinc &longs;i fortè in via pen­
næ ex &longs;ua theca decidant, calamus ip&longs;e &longs;ine nouo impul&longs;u longiùs &longs;pa­
tium conficito; tribuit enim motui recto non impedito, quod circulari,
vel &longs;pirali, &longs;i pennæ ade&longs;&longs;ent tribueret.

Duodecimò, &longs;i pennæ contractiores &longs;unt, & angulum acutiorem fa­
ciant, calamus velociùs mouetur motu axis;

ratio e&longs;t, quia re&longs;i&longs;tentia mi-
nùs retardat;
&longs;unt enim pauciores partes, quæ valde obliquè cadunt:

hinc minor e&longs;t appul&longs;us, quod clarum e&longs;t; hinc, vt calamus velociùs per­
gat, con&longs;tringuntur pennæ.
ratio e&longs;t, quia minor orbis citiùs perficitur:

adde
quod minus aëris huic motui re&longs;i&longs;tit;

vnde vides ita e&longs;&longs;e aptandas pen­
nas, vt re&longs;i&longs;tentia aëris inæqualis cau&longs;et illam vertiginem, quæ tamen
tanta e&longs;&longs;e non debet; alioquin ip&longs;um motum orbis omninò impediret,
vt diximus n.

Decimoquartò, denique &longs;i plùs æquo contractæ &longs;unt, e&longs;&longs;et motus or­
bis; quippe modica e&longs;t aëris re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quæ ad motum illum non &longs;ufficit,
licèt &longs;emper &longs;int aliqui gyri, &longs;ed rariores.
Decimoquintò, tres aliquando, aliquando duæ in&longs;eruntur pennæ;

e&longs;t
enim eadem vertiginis cau&longs;a, imò quatuor in&longs;eri po&longs;&longs;ent; &longs;unt enim qua&longs;i
totidem claui, qui dirigunt illum motum.

Decimo&longs;extò, &longs;i pennæ delicatioribus pilis tenera lanugine ve&longs;tian­
tur, tardiùs mouetur calamus vtroque motu; quia vix aëra penetrare po&longs;­
&longs;unt delicatiores molliore&longs;que pili.

Decimo&longs;eptimò, &longs;i proiicitur &longs;ur&longs;um, de&longs;cendatque deor&longs;um rectà, e&longs;t
motus mixtus ex recto & circulari;
ex quo motu fit linea mixta ex Parabola & Helice;

&longs;it enim cylin­
drus CH, cuius motus &longs;piralis &longs;it CEFGT mixtus ex recto CT, & cir­
culari orbis CD; &longs;it etiam mixtus LTQ ex accelerato LM, & æquabili
MQ certè &longs;i addatur LQ circulus &longs;eu &longs;pira CEF, &c.

&longs;itque RC æqua­
lis IE, & VT æqualis NG, habebitur &longs;pira mixta LCSVQ

Decimooctauò, &longs;i pennæ latiores &longs;unt, &longs;eu maiorem habent &longs;uperfi­
ciem, minùs aptæ &longs;unt ad vtrumque motum, &longs;cilicet axis, & centri; quia
aër plùs æquo re&longs;i&longs;tit, nam plures illius pelluntur partes.

Decimononò, &longs;i verò contractiores &longs;unt, etiam minùs aptæ videntur:
quippe aëra facilè diuidunt.

Vige&longs;imò, &longs;i breuiores, certi&longs;&longs;imus e&longs;t motus orbis; quia minor circu­
lus citiùs perficitur.

Vige&longs;imoprimò, &longs;i longiores, è contrario: adde quod ab axis leuioris
motu, dirigi vix po&longs;&longs;unt.

Vige&longs;imo&longs;ecundò, &longs;i altera pennarum &longs;it fracta, e&longs;&longs;et motus orbis; quia
&longs;egmentum fractum aliarum partium motum non &longs;equitur, vt patet.
Vige&longs;imotertiò, &longs;i calamus &longs;it leuior, ineptus e&longs;t;

quia re&longs;i&longs;tentiam
pennarum non &longs;uperat; quippe contra reflantis aëris vim, calami præua­
lens impetus leuiores pennas &longs;ecum abripere debet.

Vige&longs;imoquartò, &longs;i longior &longs;it calamus, minùs aptus e&longs;t; quia &longs;cilicet
plures partes impetus quæ in&longs;unt grauiori calamo nullo negotio re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiam aëris, & retardationem pennarum &longs;uperant.
Vige&longs;imoquintò, &longs;i longior &longs;it calamus, minùs aptus e&longs;t;

tùm quia gra-
uior e&longs;t, tùm quia difficiliùs conuertitur, vt &longs;emper præeat; e&longs;t enim ma­
ior re&longs;i&longs;tentia ad conuertendum longius corpus, vt patet.

Vige&longs;imo&longs;extò, &longs;i breuior & leuior, ineptus e&longs;t propter rationem alla­
tam;

nam &longs;i breui&longs;&longs;imus &longs;it, eius tamen grauitatis, quæ &longs;ufficiat ad &longs;upe­
randam aëris vim, apti&longs;&longs;imus cen&longs;eri debet: hinc aliquando globulus per­
foratus calami vicem gerit.

Vige&longs;imo&longs;eptimò, extremitas calami, quæ præit, debet e&longs;&longs;e paulò maior,
& qua&longs;i nodo armata, vt &longs;cilicet faciliùs præire po&longs;&longs;it, ne alia extremitas
qua&longs;i reluctetur; igitur ad in&longs;tar clauæ calamus componi debet.

Vige&longs;imooctauò, in vacuo nulla pror&longs;us e&longs;&longs;et vertigo huius volatilis
calami;
quia nulla e&longs;&longs;et aëris re&longs;i&longs;tentia; &longs;ed de his &longs;atis.
Theorema 21.
Cuncta phœnomena teli &longs;eu iaculi volatilis explicari po&longs;&longs;unt:

huius teli
figuram habes rudiore manu adumbratam; hîc habes.

cu&longs;pis e&longs;t C, du­
plex clauus &longs;eu quadruplex BGDABE, ex aliqua leuiore materia
con&longs;tans v.g. ex charta duplicata, vel pennis, hoc po&longs;ito.
Primò, cu&longs;pis C po&longs;t eiaculationem &longs;emper præit;

ratio e&longs;t, quia
alæ illæ leuiores à tergo &longs;equuntur; minùs enim aëris vim frangere
queunt.
Secundò, in eo &longs;tatu &longs;emper remanet iaculum;

quia non pote&longs;t &longs;ur&longs;um
attolli extremitas B, nec deor&longs;um deprimi;
quia ala ABE impedit;

nec
etiam dextror&longs;um, vel &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um inclinari;
quia ala BGD prohibet;

igitur &longs;i nec &longs;ur&longs;um, neque deor&longs;um, nec &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um, nec extror&longs;um
inclinari pote&longs;t; haud dubiè in eodem &longs;itu remanebit.
Tertiò, citi&longs;&longs;imo motu fertur hoc iaculi genus;
quia nihil prohibet;
quippe aër facilè diuiditur ab ip&longs;o iaculo CB;

tùm deinde ab ip&longs;is alis
cæ&longs;im qua&longs;i &longs;ecatur acie dumtaxat, nunquam &longs;uperficie oppo&longs;ita; adde
quod, aër facilè fluit per 4. illas cauitates BGFE, DGFA, &c.

&longs;emper
enim aëri opponitur acies anguli; &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt facilia.
Quartò, non agitur in vertiginem hoc iaculum;

quia &longs;cilicet non e&longs;t
tanta aëris re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quantam e&longs;&longs;e oportet;

adde quod nulla e&longs;t alarum
inflexio, quæ faciat inæqualem re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, vt in calamo volatili;

igitur
e&longs;t tantùm motus axis; vbi tamen vibratur per horizontalem, vel incli­
natam, mouetur motu mixto ex duobus rectis, de quo iam aliàs.

Quintò, huc reuoca &longs;agittas, quæ tribus in&longs;tructæ pennis eundem
&longs;emper retinent &longs;itum in motu, vt ferrum &longs;eu mucro præeat; vnde vides
eumdem &longs;emper &longs;equi effectum, &longs;iue tres &longs;int alæ, &longs;iue quatuor.

Sextò, huc reuoca minima illa &longs;picula &longs;picâ in&longs;tructa, quæ per tubum
pneumaticum pueri flatu eiaculantur;

nam cu&longs;pis &longs;emper præit, quia
motus alterius extremitatis leuiore &longs;pica retardatur; &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt fa­
cilia.
Theorema 22.

Explicatur etiam motus illius, qua&longs;i velaris moletrinæ, qua pueri curren­
tes &longs;æpi&longs;&longs;imè ludum; cuius figuram hîc habes; nam eo tempore,
quo DA fertur per ip&longs;um D, BC cum &longs;uis velus vertitur circa DA.
Primò, hinc e&longs;t motus mixtus, & recto axis DA & circulari CB.

Secundò, hinc e&longs;t motus perfectè &longs;piralis, nec enim differt à motu cy­
lindri; de quo &longs;uprà.

Tertiò, &longs;piræ &longs;unt frequentiores, quò motus e&longs;t velocior motu centri
A, maiores è contrario.

Quartò, debet con&longs;tare debet CB ex leui&longs;&longs;ima materia; alioquin non
mouebitur motu orbis.

Quintò, debet facilè po&longs;&longs;e moueri circa A; alioquin vis illa reflantis
aëris, quæ CB motum circularem imprimit, non &longs;ufficeret.
Sextò, ideo BC mouetur circa A;

quia cum vela C & B polleant mul­
tum aëra, maior e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia;

hinc propter modicam inclinationem
axis DA aër in &longs;uperficies C & B obliquè incidens illas impellit; &longs;ed
quia axis BA re&longs;i&longs;tit nece&longs;&longs;ariò circa A, motu circulari cientur.
Theorema 23.

Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnes motus ponderis, &longs;eu plumei à tergo valuarum fu­
nependuli, cuius vi valuæ ip&longs;a claudantur, v.g.&longs;it fores AE quarum va­
rum e&longs;t AF; &longs;it funis CDG, cuius extremitas immobiliter affixa &longs;it C,
pondus appen&longs;um &longs;it G, cuius vi &longs;eu motu fores ip&longs;æ clauduntur.

Primò, certum e&longs;t pondus G non moueri motu recto; quia cum ip­
&longs;o rectangulo AE mouetur circa axem immobilem AB.

Secundò, certum e&longs;t non moueri motu purè circulari, qui mouetur
per lineam GD.

Tertiò, certum e&longs;t rectangulum A moueri motu purè circulari, vt pa­
tet; ita vt DE &longs;uo motu de&longs;cribat cylindrum, cuius radius &longs;eu &longs;emidia­
meter ba&longs;is e&longs;t BE.

Quartò, certum e&longs;t, quodlibet punctum huius rectanguli de&longs;­
cribere circulum, maiorem &longs;cilicet vel minorem pro diuer&longs;a di&longs;tan­
tia ab axe AB, v. g. punctum D de&longs;cribit circulum, cuius radius
e&longs;t DA, punctum verò I de&longs;cribit circulum, cuius radius e&longs;t HI.
Quintò, certum e&longs;t pondus G moueri motu mixto ex circulari forium.
& recto deor&longs;um.

haud dubiè mouebitur per AD; igitur hic motus e&longs;t &longs;piralis, nec e&longs;t
alia difficultas.
Theorema 24.

Quando voluitur funis circa cylindrum, vel axem, mouetur motu
&longs;pirali, &longs;ed diuer&longs;o à prioribus;

&longs;unt enim veræ &longs;piræ ad in&longs;tar &longs;apien­
tia in diuer&longs;a volumina contorti;

&longs;ic funis circa digitum &longs;æpè
rotatur.;
e&longs;t enim motus mixtus ex diuer&longs;is circularibus:

quippè
in &longs;ingulis punctis e&longs;t diuer&longs;a determinatio ad nouum circulum, quia
e&longs;t nouus radius, quia continuò radius huius vertiginis imminuitur;
porrò duobus modis pote&longs;t funis circa axem vel cylindrum conuolui.
Primò, &longs;i &longs;emper circa eundem cylindri circulum voluatur;

tunc autem
facit veras &longs;piras, vt vides in A. Secundò, &longs;i circa diuer&longs;os eiu&longs;dem axis
circulos, vel potius diuer&longs;a eiu&longs;dem axis puncta voluatur, & hic e&longs;t mo­
tus &longs;piralis conicus, vt vides in cono FDE;

&longs;i enim totus conus
moueatur motu axis recto, quodlibet punctum &longs;uperficiei coni mouetur
motu &longs;pirali cylindrico, excepto dumtaxat ip&longs;o vertice; hoc denique
motu mouerentur &longs;ingula puncta baculi ED, qui in conum rotaretur à
vertice E eo tempore, quo rotans ip&longs;e per rectam EG moueretur.
Theorema 25.
Similiter po&longs;&longs;unt explicari motus &longs;pirales &longs;phærici, quos habes in;

hic au­
tem motus duplex e&longs;t;

&longs;ecundus mixtus ex duobus circularibus, &longs;cilicet ex circulari
circa axem KL, & circulari per arcum IL, v.g. &longs;i punctum eo tempore
voluatur circa axem KL per arcum IO, quo fertur per arcum IL vnde
habes in hac figura tres motus &longs;pirales, quorum &longs;inguli con&longs;tant ex circu­
lari circa axem KL;

&longs;piralis conicus per rectam IL, & &longs;piralis &longs;phæricus
per arcum IPL;

hinc duo primi con&longs;tant ex circulari, & recto; certius
verò ex duobus circularibus.

Denique pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e &longs;piralis concoidicus qualem vides in i&longs;que du­
plex;
primò &longs;i vertatur conois circa axem SV;

&longs;ecundò, &longs;i vertatur circa
axem XZ:
quippe hoc modo &longs;piræ erunt maiores;

&longs;unt quoque &longs;inguli
triplicis generis;

e&longs;t enim vel parabolicus, vel ellipticus, vel hyperboli­
cus; porrò, qui dicunt motus cœle&longs;tes e&longs;&longs;e &longs;pirales, viderint an &longs;int cy­
lindrici vel &longs;phærici, vel conici, vel elliptici &c.

omitto &longs;piralem in pla­
no, mixtum &longs;cilicet ex circulari & recto, cuius &longs;chema habes Th.24. tùm
L 5. Th.79. de quo etiam aliàs, cum de lineis motus.
Theorema 26.

Cum taleola &longs;upra planum rectilineum ita repit, vt etiam circa propriu&mtail;
centrum voluatur, est motus mixtus ex recto & circulari;

neque hic motus
diuer&longs;us e&longs;t à motu rotæ in plano, &longs;it enim taleola centro A, circa quod
vertitur dum centrum A repit motu recto per rectam AD, perinde &longs;e
habet, atque &longs;i rota in plano BE vel CF rotaretur;

tunc enim punctum H eodem motu
moueretur, quo alia puncta peripheriæ huius rotæ;

punctum verò I eo
modo quo I in radio BA, dum rota mouetur, quod &longs;uprà fusè explicui-
mus; denique ita moueri pote&longs;t taleola, vt primò B moueatur motu or­
bis ver&longs;us.

Secundò, ver&longs;us K; Tertiò, vt motus centri &longs;it maior vel minor
motu orbis.
Quartò, vt &longs;it æqualis.

de­
&longs;cribent autem duæ extremitates A & D lineas rotatiles diuer&longs;as; hic au­
tem motus diuer&longs;us erit pro diuer&longs;a coniugatione motus orbis, & mo­
tus centri, cùm hic po&longs;&longs;it e&longs;&longs;e vel maior, vel minor motu orbis, vel
æqualis,
Theorema 27.
Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena motus globi.

Primò, ita globus rotatur aliquando in plano, vt motus orbis de&longs;cri­
bat circulos perpendiculariter incubantes plano;

&longs;ic vulgò proijcitur
globus, nec differt hic motus à motu rotæ in plano; e&longs;t enim mixtus ex
recto centri & circulari orbis.

Secundò, ita rotatur aliquandò, vt &longs;it &longs;emper idem punctum contactus,
& motus orbis de&longs;cribat circulos parallelos plano in quo rotatur; non
differt etiam hic motus à motu rotæ, quæ in plano verticali rotaretur.

Tertiò, ita rotatur, vt motus orbis de&longs;cribat circulos inclinatos plùs,
vel minùs;

non differt autem hic motus à motu rotæ, quæ in plano in­
clinato rotaretur; mutatur autem continue punctum contactus in 1°ree;.
motu.

Porrò, &longs;æpiùs ob&longs;eruabis i&longs;tos motus globi in aqua, in qua &longs;cilicet fa­
cilè circa centrum voluitur per quodcunque planum.

Quartò, ita mouetur vt con&longs;tet hic motus ex duobus qua&longs;i circulari­
bus, & ex recto;

quando &longs;cilicet inflectitur ita motus centri, vt mouea­
tur centrum per lineam curuam;
dixi curuam; non verò circularem;

quia non habet centrum motus purè circularem, &longs;ed mixtum ex
recto & circulari;

exemplum habes clari&longs;&longs;imum in illo deflexu
globi, qui valdè familiaris e&longs;t iis, qui trunculorum ludum exercent;
quippe tantillùm detorquetur circa horizontalem, ex qua declinatione
&longs;equitur motus mixtus ex tribus, &longs;cilicet ex motu orbis in circulo hori­
zontali, ex motu orbis in verticali, & motu centri recto.

Quintò, ita proijcitur globus aliquandò, vt motus centri &longs;it contrarius
motui orbis; tunc autem vel &longs;i&longs;tit globus, vel etiam redit, cum motus or­
bis inten&longs;ior e&longs;t, de quo iam &longs;uprà.

Sextò, cum proijcitur &longs;ur&longs;um per lineam perpendicularem, ita vt non
modò motus centri, verùm etiam motus orbis imprimatur, mouetur mo­
tu mixto ex recto centri & circulari orbis, nec differt hic motus à motu
rotæ in plano recto, idem dico de de&longs;cen&longs;u & de iactu circuli ferrei vel
lignei.

Septimò, cum proijcitur globus per inclinatam, mouetur motu mixto
ex tribus &longs;cilicet ex recto violento centri, ex naturali deor&longs;um & ex cir­
culari orbis, e&longs;tque idem motus, qui e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i globus rotaretur in plano
curuo ferè parabolico;

quippe centrum de&longs;cribit hanc lineam; &longs;ed linea
centri e&longs;t &longs;emper parallela plano, in quo rotatur globus.
hic motus &longs;imilis e&longs;t priori;

quippe centrum de&longs;cribit ferè Pa­
rabolam; hinc facilis methodus de&longs;cribendæ Parabolæ ex iactu globuli
atramento tincti, quam etiam tradit Galileus.

Nonò, &longs;i globi alterum hemi&longs;phærium &longs;it grauius, cum rotatur in recto
plano, deflectit in cam partem quam &longs;pectat hemi&longs;phærium grauius;

porrò mouetur centrum motu curuo qui aliquando accedit propiùs
ad circularem;

huc etiam reuoca motum parop&longs;idis rotulæ, quæ in mul­
tos agitur gyros & &longs;piras; quia præualet portio grauior, eóque detorquet
centrum motus.

Decimò, hinc quod iucundum e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i huiu&longs;modi globum in datum
&longs;copum proijceres;
haud dubiè alium feriret;

igitur vt &longs;copum &longs;ignatum
tangas, aliò collimare debes;

quæ vel e&longs;t &longs;pira, vel circulus, vel alia curua, iuxta diuer&longs;am con­
iugationem motum; illa autem facilè haberi pote&longs;t ex dictis &longs;uprà.

Vndecimo, &longs;i in plano recto ita rotetur cylindrus, vt &longs;inguli circuli
paralleli ba&longs;i rotentur æqualiter, &longs;inguli circuli mouentur motu mixto
ex recto centri, & circulari orbis, e&longs;tque hic motus &longs;imilis motui rotæ
in plano recto, de quo &longs;uprà.

Duodecimò, &longs;i verò ita rotetur, vt altera eius extremitas velociore
motu feratur, e&longs;t alius motus mixtus ex curuo axis & circulari orbis,
dixi curuum axis; quia non e&longs;t nece&longs;&longs;ariò circularis.

Decimotertiò, cum rotatur conus, mouetur motu mixto ex curuo axis
& circulari orbis, hic motus &longs;atis communis e&longs;t; eius porrò ratio e&longs;t;

quia cùm &longs;inguli circuli &longs;uperficiei coni ita rotentur, vt motus orbis &longs;u
æqualis motui centri; certè cùm &longs;int omnes inæquales, &longs;patium decur­
runt.
Hinc vertex retrò relinquitur à ba&longs;i;

hinc ba&longs;is nece&longs;&longs;ariò retor­
quetur;
dixi autem curuum axis;

quippe centrum ba&longs;is non mouetur
motu purè circulari; nam tantillùm verticem promouet, quia motus
eius centri maximè iuuatur à motu eius orbis, qui longè maior e&longs;t.

Decimoquartò, huc demum reuoca gyros illarum pyxidum, quarum
margines oppo&longs;iti &longs;unt circuli inæquales; quippe &longs;unt veluti fru&longs;ta co­
ni, cuius angulus verticis e&longs;t valde acutus.
Theorema 28.
Morus di&longs;ci facilè explicari potest;;

e&longs;t enim planum circulare, cuius
centrum de&longs;cribit ferè Parabolam;

vnde eius motus e&longs;t mixtus ex para­
bolico centri, & circulari orbis in circulo horizontali;

igitur motus cen­
tri con&longs;tat ex duobus rectis, &longs;cilicet ex violento, & naturali deor&longs;um;
porrò e&longs;t idem motus qui e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i circulus verticali parallelus rotaretur
in linea parabolica de&longs;cripta in plano horizontali.

Ob&longs;eruo autem primò motum orbis di&longs;ci e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;e maiorem motu
centri, vel minorem, vel ip&longs;i æqualem; quod quomodo fieri po&longs;&longs;it, fusè
&longs;uprà explicuimus.

Secundò, &longs;i altera eius portio &longs;it grauior motus orbis, non e&longs;t idem
cum centro di&longs;ci, vt patet; præualet enim portio grauior, &longs;ed propiùs
accedit ad portionem grauiorem.

Tertiò, hinc cùm di&longs;cus cadit in terram, re&longs;itit altera eius portio, &longs;ci­
licet leuior;

quia cùm de&longs;cribat maiorem circulum orbis, maiorem im­
petum habet; hinc conuertitur di&longs;cus.
Quartò, imprimitur motus orbis in ip&longs;o iactu;

quia &longs;cilicet vna pars
mouetur, antequam alia di&longs;cedat è manu proijcientis; vnde &longs;equitur
nece&longs;&longs;ariò motus orbis.
Theorema 29.
Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena longioris ha&longs;tæ vel &longs;ari&longs;&longs;æ.

Primò, &longs;it ha&longs;ta in plano horizontali BG; &longs;i motu &longs;implici attollatur
extremitas B, mouebitur per arcum BA circa centrum G.

Tertiò, &longs;i extremitas G non adducatur &longs;ed B per aliquam Tangentem
arcus BA euibretur pro diuer&longs;a Tangente diuer&longs;us erit motus, &longs;i v.g.per
Tangentem BH punctum D a&longs;&longs;urget per DE, igitur G redibit in C, B
verò &longs;patium compo&longs;itum ex tota v. g. & eius &longs;ubdupla BC;

e&longs;t autem
hic motus mixtus ex recto centri D & circulari orbis;

&longs;i verò extremi­
tas B euibretur per Tangentem HL & D, vel E per EK; haud dubiè ex­
tremitas G minùs retroagetur, & acquiret dextror&longs;um maius &longs;patium.
Quartò, &longs;i nullo modo adducatur centrum D, vel extremitas G;

Quintò, &longs;i ita euibretur ha&longs;ta, vt tantillùm adducatur centrum motus
circularis, &longs;cilicet D;

haud dubiè altera extremitas G cadere poterit in
B, id e&longs;t peruenire ad manum ludentis;

&longs;i verò plùs æquo adducatur,
manum ludentis fallet, &longs;eu præteribit;

&longs;i denique minùs adducatur, por­
rigi manum oportet, vt extremitates G excipiat: porrò hic motus e&longs;t
mixtus ex tribus, &longs;cilicet ex duobus rectis centri, & circulari orbis.

Sextò, ita poterit adduci centrum D, & &longs;imul euibrari B, vt ha&longs;tæ me­
dium C facto &longs;emicircuitu in dextram erectam cadat, quadretque ad in­
&longs;tar iaculi mi&longs;&longs;ilis, cuius mucro deor&longs;um vergens prædæ plagam inten­
tat; hoc ludi genus o&longs;tentationem Hi&longs;panicam vulgò vocant.

Septimò, erigitur ha&longs;ta, &longs;i extremitas G tantillùm eleuata cum altera
oppo&longs;ita B, tùm &longs;tatim B deprimatur;

vnde accidit ip&longs;am G noua acce&longs;­
&longs;ione impetus &longs;ur&longs;um promoueri;

quippe &longs;i deprimatur B circa aliquod
centrum, attollitur G;
igitur maiore tempore;

igitur &longs;en&longs;im ab ip&longs;a manu maior in illam
deriuatur impetus; denique vt deinde maiore quoque arcu extremitas B
deprimatur, remoueaturque, & con&longs;equenter oppo&longs;ita G magis attolla­
tur, & accedat.
Octauò, duobus aliis modis erigitur ha&longs;ta è &longs;itu horizontali.
Primò, conuer&longs;o intror&longs;um brachio;

eleuatur enim extremitas G.
& deprimitur illicò B;
vnde minore conatu deinde attollitur;

minus e&longs;t
enim momentum vectis;

&longs;it enim vectis in &longs;itu horizontali LN, &longs;itque
eius momentum vt LN;

certè &longs;i attollatur in LO, eius momentum erit
tantùm vt LM;

hinc facilè eleuatur pertica po&longs;t aliquam inclinationem
&longs;ur&longs;um; &longs;ecundus modus, cum torquetur extrin&longs;ecus brachium, pro quo
e&longs;t eadem pror&longs;us ratio.
Nonò, erigitur adhuc duobus modis ha&longs;ta.
Primò, intorto extrin&longs;ecus brachio, detortoque.

Secundò, contorte
intror&longs;um reductóque traiecto &longs;ub ha&longs;tam capite; e&longs;t autem eadem ra­
tio, quæ &longs;uprà.

Decimò, cum erecta ha&longs;ta &longs;ur&longs;um ita proijcitur, vt po&longs;t circuitum pot
medium truncum excipiatur, mouetur motu mixto ex recto centri, &
circulari orbis; quod duobus modis fieri pote&longs;t.

Primò, &longs;i extremitas quæ
tenetur manu, retrò agatur, vbi priùs &longs;ur&longs;um tota ha&longs;ta impul&longs;a e&longs;t; quip­
pe ex eo duplici motu centri, & orbis &longs;equetur conuer&longs;io ha&longs;tæ, & is
de&longs;cen&longs;us in quo commodè per medium truncum excipi po&longs;&longs;it.
Secundò.

hoc eodem motu mouebitur, eritque &longs;imile phœnomenum, &longs;i extremitas,
quæ tenetur manu impul&longs;a primò &longs;ur&longs;um cum tota ha&longs;ta, tùm deinde
antè pellatur, ita vt extremitas oppo&longs;ita retrò agatur.

Vndecimò, motus orbis pote&longs;t aliquando e&longs;&longs;e maior, aliquando minor,
pro diuer&longs;o &longs;cilicet impul&longs;u:
idem dico de motu centri;

imò po&longs;&longs;et
e&longs;&longs;e tantus motus centri, vt conuer&longs;io ha&longs;tæ perfici non po&longs;&longs;et;

e&longs;t au­
tem motus centri velocior initio in a&longs;cen&longs;u, & tardior in fine; & contrà
tardior initio de&longs;cen&longs;us, & in fine velocior, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis l.2. & 3.

Duodecimò, cum motus centri modicus e&longs;t, parùm a&longs;&longs;urgit ha&longs;ta, &
licèt morus orbis &longs;it maximus vix integram conuer&longs;ionem perficere
pote&longs;t; cum verò motus centri maximus e&longs;t, & motus orbis modicus,
etiam &longs;uam conuer&longs;ionem non perficit, &longs;ed altiùs a&longs;&longs;urgit mucro.

Decimotertiò, centrum motus orbis non videtur e&longs;&longs;e aliud ab ip&longs;is
3/4 ver&longs;us mucronem, vt iam &longs;æpe indicauimus: porrò ni&longs;i hoc centrum
motus orbis retroagatur tantillùm, id e&longs;t 1/4 longitudinis ha&longs;tæ, non po­
terit excipi per medium truncum, ni&longs;i maius producatur.

Decimoquartò, pote&longs;t centrum orbis, vel plùs æquo retrò agi, vel ante
pelli, vt con&longs;tat;

vnde tota ferè indu&longs;tria po&longs;ita e&longs;t in temperando illius
motu recto;

denique non e&longs;t omittendum etiam ha&longs;tam eratam &longs;olo
nixam &longs;ur&longs;um intorto pugno ita proijci po&longs;&longs;e, vt po&longs;t circuitum excipia­
tur, nec e&longs;t noua difficultas; communicatur enim primò motus centri
rectus, tùm motus orbis, immò, &longs;i &longs;it breuior, etiam geminos circuitus
facit, antequam iu&longs;ta manu excipiatur.

Decimoquintò, extremitas, quæ manu tenetur velociùs deinde moue­
tur.
Primò, patet experientia.
Secundò, maius &longs;patium conficit;

ratio e&longs;t,
quia mouetur circa centrum maiore &longs;emidiametro, quas con&longs;tat 1/4 totius
ha&longs;tæ, quod vt faciliùs videatur, &longs;it ha&longs;ta AE, quæ pellatur &longs;ur&longs;um mo­
tu recto CE, &longs;itque motus orbis circa centrum C;

vbi verò C peruenit
in D, A peruenit in L, & D in I;

vbi verò C peruenit in E, A peruenit in
G & D rediit in D;
vides quanta &longs;it differentia motus;

nam eo tempore,
quo A decurrit &longs;patium AKL, D decurrit tantùm DHI;

quænam por­
rò &longs;it hæc figura;

certè &longs;i non e&longs;t Ellip&longs;is, propiùs ad illam accedit:
idem dico de de&longs;cen&longs;u ha&longs;tæ, quod dictum e&longs;t de a&longs;cen&longs;u.
Decimo&longs;extò, duobus aliis modis pote&longs;t ha&longs;ta in aëre conuerti;

primò, &longs;i
mucro agatur retrò, vtraque manu admota alteri extremitati:

hic autem
modus differt à prioribus, quod in illis motus centri rectus præcedat
motum orbis; in hoc verò vterque &longs;imul incipiat.

Secundò, &longs;i primò in
humeris liberetur ha&longs;ta, tùm &longs;ur&longs;um euibretur; &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt facilia.

Decimo&longs;eptimò, ad ha&longs;tam reuocabis baculum rotatum ab altera ex­
tremitate; &longs;it enim baculus AE rotatus circa extremitatem A, tùm &longs;ta­
tim demi&longs;&longs;us.

Primò, E po&longs;t &longs;emicirculum peruenit in A. Secundò, E im­
primitur maior impetus, vt patet: hinc tertiò mouetur velocius.

Quartò,
A non de&longs;cendit infra AE, po&longs;t quam demi&longs;&longs;us e&longs;t baculus, vt pater ex­
perientiâ; ratio e&longs;t, quia E per tangentem EL determinata impedit, ne
A deor&longs;um tendat.
Quintò, E per arcum EG non mouetur;

alioquin A
e&longs;&longs;et immobilis:

præterea F. non mouetur motu circulari, ni&longs;i retineatur
in A;

&longs;ed non retinetur; igitur non mouetur per EG. Sextò, non moue­

quæ minùs habent impetus.

Septimò, mouetur E per lineam curuam, quæ
accedit ad ellip&longs;im, &longs;cilicet per EHA;
A verò a&longs;&longs;urgit &longs;upra AE;

ratio
huius motus petitur ex eo quod, neque per EF, neque per arcum EG
mouetur extremitas E; igitur per curuam de vtraque participan­
tem.

quia &longs;cilicet illa pars, quæ maiorem impetum habet, qua&longs;i retrò
agitur ab alia, quæ minorem habet, non quidem motu purè circulari;
alioqui omninò retineretur ab alia extremitate, &longs;ed alio mixto, quia non
omninò retinetur.

&longs;i enim æqualitas e&longs;t in motu omnium
partium, mouentur omnes motu recto;

&longs;i verò motus &longs;ingularum &longs;unt
vt radij, motus e&longs;t purè circularis; &longs;i verò e&longs;t alia inæqualitas, erit
mixtus, qui magis accedet ad circularem, quò maior erit inæqualitas, &
magis ad rectum, quò minor erit.

Vige&longs;imò, hinc qui ludunt trunculis illis lu&longs;oriis inuer&longs;o tamen mo­
re, quod &longs;æpè hic fit, quo &longs;cilicet non globus in trunculos, &longs;ed trunculi
in globum proijciantur, arripiunt trunculum ip&longs;um per medium trun­
cum, vt &longs;cilicet æqualem impetum &longs;ingulis partibus imprimant; vnde
&longs;equitur motus rectus, & ex motu recto vniformis trunculi ca&longs;us, ne &longs;i
altera extremitas ante aliam &longs;olum tangat, &longs;tatim re&longs;iliat alia per ali­
quot gyros, & à &longs;copo di&longs;cedat.
Vige&longs;imoprimò, mouetur baculus proiectus eo modo, de quo num.

18.
circa aliquod centrum, quod tribus quartis tribuimus ver&longs;us eam ex­

guntur.

minùs deflectit glo­

hinc, &longs;i etiam per imum pedem directo ictu verberentur, plùs re&longs;i­
&longs;tunt, quia minor e&longs;t vectis, 4°ree;.

hinc &longs;tatim à recta via globus deflectit,

&longs;i obliquè globus feriat trunculum, qua&longs;i lambendo, parùm declinat

6. cum &longs;ic obliquè
decutitur trunculus, hic decu&longs;&longs;us deinde alios decutit;

quia ex obliquo
ictu cra&longs;&longs;ioris pedis agitur in vertiginem circa verticem ad in&longs;tar coni,
de quo &longs;uprà; & cum maiorem gyrum de&longs;cribit, vix vnquam accidit, vt

7°ree;.

aliqui tradunt artem, qua nouem trunculi decuti po&longs;&longs;unt,
quod multis modis præ&longs;tari pote&longs;t, &longs;ed ad rem præ&longs;entem non &longs;pe­
ctat.
Vige&longs;imotertiò, e&longs;t etiam aliud ludi genus, quo pueri ru&longs;ticani ludunt;

e&longs;t autem minimum parallelipedum gemino mucrone hinc inde in&longs;tru­
ctum, vel cuius vtraque extremitas e&longs;t emarginata, vel ad in&longs;tar fu&longs;i in

&longs;tatim a&longs;&longs;urgit.

Sit enim primò parallelipedum emarginatum AD in­
cubans &longs;olo EC;

&longs;i ro&longs;trum A baculo percutiatur, deprimitur A circa
centrum E, & attollitur D maiore quidem arcu; igitur maiore impe­
tu, qui quia non retinetur omninò non mouetur circulari motu D,
&longs;ed curuo mixto circa centrum E, quod ab extremitate D tantillùm
eleuatur.

Secundò, ex hoc phœnomeno manife&longs;tè confirmatur, quod
diximus &longs;uprà de baculo num.

17. quod &longs;cilicet a&longs;&longs;urgat extremitas illa,
quæ manu tenetur &longs;upra horizontalem.

&longs;i percutiatur baculo ED in C, a&longs;&longs;urget propter
eandem rationem motu mixto;

nam primò circa centrum F deprimi­
tur C, & attollitur B;

B quidem velociore motu, vt patet; igitur &longs;ecum
attollit extremitatem oppo&longs;itam C motu mixto propter rationem iam
&longs;uprà allatam.
Vige&longs;imoquartò, AB &longs;i baculus in aëre libratus perpendiculariter.

v. g. percutiatur altero baculo ED. Primò, in centro grauitatis C
baculi AB, mouebitur AB motu recto;

ratio e&longs;t, quia omnes partes mo­
uentur æqualiter; igitur motu recto.

quia ED producit maximum impetum & to­
tum; e&longs;t enim C centrum grauitatis impetus totius ED, & centrum gra­
uitatis corporis impedientis AB. Tertiò, hinc &longs;i ED feriat in puncto G,
non erit tantus iactus licèt AB proijciatur motu recto.

Quartò, &longs;i
percutiatur in F, non mouebitur motu recto, vt con&longs;tat experientiâ;
quippe maior impetus producetur in extremitate B, quàm in A;

quia
non impedietur totus, vt patet: quippe extremitas B faciliùs cedit.

Sextò, quo punctum ictus accedet propiùs ad extremitatem B, minor
erit motus centri, maiorque motus circularis, & con&longs;equenter minor
iactus, & contrà, quò punctum ictus accedet propiùs ad centrum C.
Septimò, &longs;unt 6. ictuum combinationes in hoc ca&longs;u;

nam vel ictus
cadet in centrum grauitatis C baculi AB vel extra; &longs;i primum, tribus
modis id fieri pote&longs;t.

&longs;i verò &longs;ecundum ii&longs;dem tribus mo­
dis fieri pote&longs;t, &longs;ed de his &longs;atis; &longs;upere&longs;t tantùm, ni fallor, vt ea phœno­
mena, quæ in tudiaria gladiatura ob&longs;eruari po&longs;&longs;unt, eorumque cau&longs;as
explicemus, &longs;ed illud præ&longs;tabimus in lib. &longs;equenti.
Theorema 13.
Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena turbinis &longs;en trochi circumacti:

Tur­
binum puerilium duo &longs;unt genera: primum e&longs;t eorum, qui ferro mu­
niuntur, qui certè diuer&longs;æ &longs;unt figuræ, &longs;phæricæ, conicæ &c.

communi­
ter tamen fiunt iuxta figuram cordis, vt vides in A.

Secundum e&longs;t eo­
rum, qui ferro carent, quorum &longs;unt etiam diuer&longs;æ figuræ, communior e&longs;t
conois, vt vides in

Primò, circumagitur vel &longs;cutica vt B, vel funiculo intorto vt A:
vtriu&longs;que ratio eadem e&longs;t; cùm enim circumuolutus funiculus reduci­
tur, haud dubiè trochum ip&longs;um in orbem agit.

Secundò, cum mouetur trochus circa axem CD immobilem, e&longs;t mo­
tus purè circularis.

Tertiò, cùm mouetur circa axem mobilem motu recto, e&longs;t motus mix­
tus ex recto & circulari &longs;imilis motui rotæ; cum verò mouetur axis in
orbem, mouetur motu mixto ex duobus circularibus, & hic e&longs;t motus
veri&longs;&longs;imus turbinationis.

Quartò, cau&longs;a motus orbis e&longs;t prima reductio &longs;cuticæ, &longs;eu funiculi,
quæ circumagit turbinem;

adducit quidem funiculus, cuius altera extremitas etiam
adducitur;

expellitur verò trochus, cum verbere adigitur: &longs;ed de his
paulò pò&longs;t.

Quintò, ideò trochus mouetur motu orbis, &longs;eu motu circulari, quia
impetus contrarii &longs;imul imprimuntur, v.g.in fig.B imprimitur impetus E
per artum EHF, & F per arcum FGE:

vndè &longs;equitur nece&longs;&longs;ariò motus
circularis; hinc digitis in contrarias partes explo&longs;is turbo in orbem
agitur.

Sextò, diu durat i&longs;te motus circularis turbinis, quia non de&longs;truitur
ab impetu contrario grauitationis, vt iam diximus alibi, &longs;ed tantùm ab
affrictu ad planum illud, in quo vertitur, & à noua determinatione, quæ
&longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus ponitur, quæ pro nihilo ferè haberi debet; hinc quò
vertex turbinis, politior e&longs;t, & planum in quo &longs;uos gyros agit, læuiga­
tius, diutiùs durat eius motus.

Septimò, aliquando dormire dicitur turbo cum celerrimè mouetur,
defixo &longs;cilicet axe in eodem loco, & &longs;itu, ratio petitur ex eo quòd ver­
tex certè componitur cum ip&longs;o plano factâ &longs;ibi veluti in&longs;en&longs;ibili apo­
theca &longs;eu fo&longs;&longs;ula, cuius tenuis margo impedit motum centri; igitur mo­
tus orbis vnicus e&longs;t, igitur maior.

Octauò, verbere adigitur trochus, ip&longs;ique imprimitur primò motus
orbis, quia lora illa &longs;cuticæ trocho aduoluta, vbi deinde explicantur, tro­
chum ip&longs;um circumagunt:

&longs;ecundò motus centri, quia eadem lora ad in­
&longs;tar fundæ qua&longs;i trochum explodunt;

&longs;ic plerumque accidit adhiberi lora,
vt longiùs ligneus orbis proijciatur;

quippe dum explicantur lora, du­
plex ille motus nece&longs;&longs;ariò imprimitur;

primus quidem, quia explicari
non po&longs;&longs;unt, ni&longs;i trochus circumagatur;

adde quod diutiùs manet potentia applicata;
hinc maior effectus, analogiam habes in funda.
porrò duobus modis explicatur funiculus;

primò enim adducitur, &longs;eu retrahitur, ex quo accidit, vt motus centri
determinetur in eandem partem;

&longs;ecundò non adducitur, &longs;ed tantùm
altera extremitas retinetur; vnde fit, vt motus centri nullus ferè &longs;it.

Decimò, motus centri circularis in cam &longs;emper e&longs;t partem, in quam
exterior turbinis portio motu orbis conuoluitur;

v.g. turbo B mouetur
motu orbis per arcum EHF;

igitur motu circulari centri vel axis moue­
bitur per DK, &longs;i &longs;upponatur erectus perpendiculariter in plano LDK;

ratio e&longs;t, quia circularis axis determinatur à circulari orbis; igitur vter­
que fit in eandem partem.

Vndecimò, diuer&longs;a &longs;cabrities plani in quo circumagitur turbo mul­
tùm immutat turbinationis modum; tunc enim vel diuer&longs;a plani incli­
natî ratio, vel diuer&longs;æ qua&longs;i fo&longs;&longs;ulæ, vel in&longs;en&longs;ibiles &longs;copuli turbinem eò
&longs;æpe adigunt, quo impre&longs;&longs;i motus indoles minimè ferret.

Duodecimò, licèt imprimatur motus rectus axi per adductionem, vel
emi&longs;&longs;ionem funiculi, non tamen mouetur axis motu recto; quia hic mo­
tus rectus ab ip&longs;o motu orbis immutatur, ita vt ex vtroque motus fiat
mixtus, ip&longs;eque adeò axis motu qua&longs;i &longs;pirali, reliquæ verò partes inæ­
quali motu circumagantur.

Decimotertiò, quando axis mouetur motu circulari, pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e circu­
lus, quem de&longs;cribit maior vel minor;

&longs;i verò axis de&longs;cribit
circulum æqualem ba&longs;i, &longs;itque numerus circulorum vtriu&longs;que motus æ­
qualis, de&longs;cribit quodlibet punctum periphæriæ ba&longs;is lineam nouam,
cuius &longs;chema hic habes, &longs;it enim circulus, quem de&longs;cribit punctum
axis, quod e&longs;t centrum ba&longs;is &longs;upremæ trochi, AHKque &longs;itque ba&longs;is ip&longs;a
circulus EDBC;

hoc po&longs;ito moueatur centrum A per circulum AHK
Q, cum erit in G, erit in F, cum in H erit in D, cum in D, erit in L; &c.

igitur punctum periphæriæ ba&longs;is E de&longs;cribit &longs;uo motu lineam curuam
EFADLMPCAE, quæ &longs;uas habet proprietates, de quibus &longs;uo loco.

Decimoquartò, ob&longs;eruas, ni&longs;i fallor, mirabilem huius motus analo­
giam;

&longs;it enim centrum circuli, qui circa alium immobilem conuertitur,
decurrat circulum duplò maiorem, de&longs;cribit lineam cordis, de qua &longs;uprà,
&longs;i maiorem duplo (eâ tamen lege vt centrum, & orbis æquali tempore
&longs;uum circulum decurrant) de&longs;cribitur linea, quæ accedit propiùs ad cir­
culum;

cùm enim
nullus e&longs;t omninò centri circulus, tunc ambo circuli imperfecti in vnum
perfectum coëunt; &longs;i verò circulus centri &longs;it minor duplò, &longs;ed maior æquali,
minor erit &longs;uperior illa figura EFA, &c.

donec tandem vbi circulus cen­
tri e&longs;t duplus circuli orbis vnica tantùm figura de&longs;cribatur, &longs;cilicet linea
cordis.

Sed de his omnibus fusè &longs;uo loco; &longs;unt enim mirificæ harum
linearum proprietates.
Decimoquintò, &longs;altitat initio proiectus turbo;

ratio e&longs;t, quia motus
centri maior e&longs;t;

igitur ob maiorem affrictum &longs;æpiùs re&longs;ilit; quod pro­
fectò non accideret, &longs;i planum læuigati&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;&longs;et, & ferreus mucro
politi&longs;&longs;imus hinc &longs;tatim primus ille ardor deferue&longs;cit, & miliùs turbi­
natur.

Decimo&longs;extò, antequam quie&longs;cat turbo, inclinatur, &longs;uo&longs;que orbes agit
inclinato qua&longs;i corpore, & obliquo axe;

ratio e&longs;t, quia vel axis &longs;eu ferreus
mucro tantillùm abe&longs;t à grauitatis centro, vel aliquis plani &longs;copulus, vel
decliuis plaga turbinem ip&longs;um inclinat; agit tamen adhuc aliquot obli­
quos gyros propter vim prioris impetus, quæ &longs;en&longs;im à grauitatione tur­
binis frangitur, & tandem omninò &longs;uperatur.

Decimo&longs;eptimò, hinc, vbi terrarum tangit depre&longs;&longs;us turbo, ad in&longs;tar
rotæ deindæ rotatur; ratio e&longs;t, quia multus adhuc remanet impetus ad
motum orbis determinatus, qui vbi tangitur, &longs;olum trochum ip&longs;um cum
centro ad in&longs;tar rotæ præcipitem agit.

Decimooctauò, hinc vides naturam maximè gaudere motu recto qui
paulò ante turbini erecto minimè concedebatur; cur enim in vnam po­
tiùs partem, quàm in aliam?

Decimononò, ad turbinem reuoco cubum illum, &longs;uis numeris vel
characteribus in&longs;tructum, & duobus hinc inde in &longs;uprema, & ima facie,
qua&longs;i paxillis, vel communi axe munitum, cuius figuram hîc habes; vol­
uitur enim hic cubus circa &longs;uum axem, neque e&longs;t noua difficultas.

Vige&longs;imò, huc etiam reuoca fu&longs;um, qui dum turbinatim ver&longs;atur, di­
uer&longs;is etiam motibus moueri pote&longs;t &longs;ur&longs;um, deor&longs;um, dextror&longs;um, &longs;ini­
&longs;tror&longs;um, ïta vt in eo mira motuum varietas ob&longs;eruari po&longs;&longs;it.

Vige&longs;imoprimò, reuocabis quoque motum parop&longs;idis, dum digito
qua&longs;i flagellatur; e&longs;t enim quoddam turbinationis genus, cuius ratio
facilis e&longs;t, & con&longs;tat ex dictis.
Theorema 31.
Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt phœnomena motus Excentricorum;

&longs;it circulus ALK
M centro E;

&longs;it alius excentricus ACOD centro B, circa quod mouea­
tur punctum A v.g. motu orbis;

Primò, nulla erit inæqualitàs motus, &longs;ed
tantùm videbitur e&longs;&longs;e;

nam punctum A, in quo &longs;it a&longs;trum po&longs;t decur&longs;um
quadrantem;
videbitur in N;

igitur videbitur tantùm confeci&longs;&longs;e arcum A
N minorem quadrante;
hinc motus ab A ad C indicabitur tardior;

at ve­
AC ad O videbitur velocior;

quia credetur confeci&longs;&longs;e arcum maiorem
NK, æquali &longs;cilicet tempore, quo AN;

hinc ab A ad C, id e&longs;t ab apogæo
dicitur e&longs;&longs;e tardior; vel ocior verò AC ad I, id e&longs;t ad perigæum, &longs;ed hæc
&longs;unt facilia, & communia, per quæ explicantur anomaliæ, & inæquali­
tates &longs;impliciores motuum cæle&longs;tium.

Secundò, &longs;i voluatur circulus radio AE circa centrum E, nec &longs;it vllus
motus circa centrum B; haud dubiè omnes partes excentrici ADOC
mouebuntur motu circulari &longs;ed inæquali, vt patet.

Tertiò, &longs;i &longs;it motus circularis circa vtrumque centrum; certè centrum
B circumagetur per circellum BGHF, punctum verò A excentrici
de&longs;cribet hanc lineam APIQBSIRA, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis Th. 30.
num.

Quartò, hine in &longs;ingulis circuitionibus videretur facere duas, & pe­
rigæum videretur ver&longs;us eam partem, ver&longs;us quam videretur apogæum.

cur&longs;i, velociùs tamen decurri viderentur;

nam in A videretur moueri

concentricis;

Po&longs;&longs;unt explicari omnia phœnomena Epiciclorum.

quibus fusè agemus &longs;uo loco.

LIBER DECIMVS,
DE DIVERSIS MOTIONVM, VEL
imprimendi motus rationibus.

HACTENVS explicauimus naturam cau­
&longs;æ formalis motus, ide&longs;t impetus in
libro primo: proprietates motus natu­
ralis &longs;ecundo: tertio violenti affectio­
nes;
quarto mixti ex pluribus rectis:

quinto motum in diuer&longs;is planis con&longs;iderauimus;
&longs;exto reflexum; &longs;eptimo circularem; octauo fune­
pendulorum vibrationes; nono mixtum ex circulari,
quæ omnia &longs;pectant, vel ad cau&longs;am formalem, vel
ad principium intrin&longs;ecum, vel ad modum etiam
intrin&longs;ecum, vel ad &longs;patium, &c.

iam verò con&longs;i­
deramus diuer&longs;os modos, quibus impetus imprimi
pote&longs;t; pote&longs;t enim mobile proijci, pelli, trahi, percuti,
premi, &longs;u&longs;tineri, tornari, &c.

de quibus omnibus iam
nobis, hoc decimo libro agendum videtur, vt dein­
de vndecimo de organis motus, & duodecimo de li­
neis tandem agamus.
DEFINITIO I.

IMpre&longs;&longs;io e&longs;t productio impetus in exteriore mobili, vel ni&longs;us ad illam.
Explicatione multa non indiget hæc definitio;

at­
qui vnus impetus illud ip&longs;um præ&longs;tare pote&longs;t, vr con&longs;tat ex dictis, toto,
lib. 1. additum e&longs;t, vel ni&longs;us ad illam, vt producitur impetus in omni
pul&longs;ione, nec in omni percu&longs;&longs;ione;

cum enim quis pellit ingentem rupem
&longs;eu percutit pugno; nullum certè producit impetum, ni&longs;i aliqua pars
auolet, quæ omnia con&longs;tant ex dictis l.1.
Definitio 2.

Re&longs;i&longs;tentia mobilis e&longs;t illa ratio, que mobili ine&longs;t, cuius vi vel motum omnem
ip&longs;um mobile ab applicata potentia renuit vel tardiorem tantum permittit.
Quid verò &longs;it illa ratio, & in quo po&longs;ita &longs;it explicabimus infrà;

re&longs;i&longs;tere autem motui, e&longs;t vel totum impedire motum vel
eius partem, per quid autem re&longs;i&longs;tat, & propter quid dicemus infrà: &longs;atis
e&longs;t dixi&longs;&longs;e, quid &longs;it re&longs;i&longs;tere & re&longs;i&longs;tentia.
Hypothe&longs;is.

Lapis 20. librarum difficiliùs proijcitur, vel &longs;u&longs;tinetur ab eadem po­
tentiâ, quàm lapis vnius libræ; hypothe&longs;is certa e&longs;t.

Axiomata nulla præmittemus cum Theoremata lib. 1. demon&longs;trata
&longs;ufficiant.
Theorema 1.
Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena &longs;u&longs;tentationis.

Primò, vt manus &longs;u&longs;tineat pondus in &longs;itu horizontali producit in &longs;e
impetum;

quia, cùm brachium libero motu librari po&longs;&longs;it, &longs;uo pondere
de&longs;cenderet, ni&longs;i aliquod re&longs;i&longs;teret;
&longs;ed ip&longs;um brachium non re&longs;i&longs;tit;

igi­
tur aliquid quod brachio ine&longs;t; igitur impetus.

Secundò, impetus, quem ip&longs;a potentia motrix in brachio producit,
non e&longs;t maior impetu grauitationis ip&longs;ius brachij;

quia alioquin præua­
leret; igitur brachium a&longs;cenderet, contra hypothe&longs;im.
Tertiò, ille impetus non e&longs;t etiam minor;

quia alioqui impetus gra­
uitationis præualeret; igitur brachium de&longs;cenderet, contra hypo­
the&longs;im.

Quartò, hinc &longs;equitur e&longs;&longs;e æqualem, cùm &longs;it per n.1.nec &longs;it maior per
2.nec minor per 3. &longs;equitur nece&longs;&longs;ariò e&longs;&longs;e æqualem.

Quintò, &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus impetus productus priore in&longs;tanti de­
&longs;truitur; probatur, quia quotie&longs;cumque ad lineas oppo&longs;itas ex diame­
tro determinantur duo impetus æquales, de&longs;truuntur, &longs;i de&longs;trui po&longs;&longs;unt
per Theorema 123.lib.1. at verò impetus innatus de&longs;trui non pote&longs;t, per
Theorema 77. libro 2. igitur de&longs;truitur productus à potentia mo­
trice.

Sextò, propter molliores partes organi, v. g. mu&longs;culorum, neruo­
rum, impetus naturalis aliquem &longs;emper effectum &longs;ortitur, com­
pre&longs;&longs;ionis, diui&longs;ionis, ten&longs;ionis:

ratio e&longs;t, quia anima non produ-
cit impetum in omnibus immediatè; vt patet;

alioquin etiam re&longs;ectis
neruis brachij po&longs;&longs;et brachium moueri;

quemad­
modum enim, cum aliquod pondus humeris incubat, vel manui; &longs;en­
tio ponderis vim, cuius effectus rationem afferemus paulò pò&longs;t, ita
pror&longs;us partes, quæ immediatè ab anima impetum non accipiunt, alias
deprimunt.

Septimò, &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus anima producit impetum in organo;
quia &longs;ingulis de&longs;truitur per num.

5. igitur cùm re&longs;i&longs;tat continuò graui­
tationi, tùm ip&longs;ius organi, tùm partium coniunctarum cum organo,
&longs;iue &longs;int animatæ, &longs;iue inanimes, debet ade&longs;&longs;e cau&longs;a huius re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ;
igitur nouus impetus, cùm prior de&longs;truatur.

igitur aliquæ partes habent impetum ab impetu ip&longs;ius
organi:

&longs;ecundò eodem pror&longs;us modo moueo vnguem, quo lapil­
lum;

&longs;ed lapillus, quem moueo manu, non accipiet impetum imme­
diatè ab anima, &longs;ed ab organo, vel potiùs ab impetu organi; igitur nec
vnguis, nec aliæ partes, quæ non &longs;unt organum motus, licèt cum eo
coniunctæ &longs;int.

Nonò, cum verò organum non mouetur.v.g.manus quantumuis ex­
ten&longs;a, vel erecta, non producit impetum in aliis partibus coniun­
ctis, licèt animatis; probatur primò, fru&longs;trà produceretur, cùm
impediri po&longs;&longs;it earum motus deor&longs;um &longs;ine impetu, alioquin men&longs;a,
quæ &longs;u&longs;tinet pondus, produceret in eo impetum, quod e&longs;t ridicu­
lum.

Secundò, quia &longs;i impetus organi producit impetum in partibus
vnitis, quo eas qua&longs;i reducit &longs;ur&longs;um;

Decimò, cum manus &longs;u&longs;tinet aliquod pondus immobiliter, non
producit in eo impetum;

Primò, quia, &longs;i non producitur impe­
tus in alijs partibus vnitis, licèt animatis, multò minùs in alijs;

Secundò, quia eodem modo &longs;u&longs;tinetur pondus à manu, quo ab alio
corpore inanimo, v. g. à men&longs;a;

&longs;ed hæc non producit impetum in
pondere, quod &longs;u&longs;tinet, vt dicam paulò pò&longs;t;

Tertiò, quia fru&longs;trà pro­
duceretur;

quia modò manus &longs;u&longs;tinens &longs;tet immobilis; haud dubiè etiam
&longs;ublato omni extrin&longs;eco impetu à pondere adhuc &longs;u&longs;tinebitur.
Dices;
igitur fru&longs;trà produceretur impetus in manu;

Re&longs;p. negando
quia ni&longs;i potentia motrix produceret impetum in manu, ab ip&longs;o pon­
dere deprimeretur; igitur non e&longs;t fru&longs;trà omninò ille impetus.
Dices, non habet motum;
igitur e&longs;t fru&longs;trà;

&longs;cilicet grauitatio, & motus, vt aliàs iam in­
dicauimus;

&longs;imiliter impetus productus à potentia motrice, in &longs;uo or­
gano habere pote&longs;t duplicem effectum;
primus e&longs;t motus;

&longs;ecundus e&longs;t
ni&longs;us &longs;eu conatus oppo&longs;itus extrin&longs;eco motui;

quemadmodum enim in­
natus &longs;emper habet motum, ni&longs;i impediatur ab alio corpore, ita & im­
petus organi potentiæ motricis, nec e&longs;t magna difficultas; immò cla­
ri&longs;&longs;ima vtriu&longs;que potentiæ analogia.

Vndecimò, hinc benè explicatur, quomodo defatigetur ten&longs;um bra­
&longs;iue coniunctum &longs;iue coniunctum;

&longs;it cum extrin&longs;eco pondere, &longs;iue cum pro­
pria tantùm grauitate;

quia partes aliquæ tendunt deor&longs;um, aliæ verò &longs;ur­
&longs;um;
hinc &longs;emper fit aliqua ten&longs;io; igitur aliqua diui&longs;io;

igitur
pondus producit impetum in manu & neruis; alioquin nulla e&longs;&longs;et ten­
&longs;io, neque compre&longs;&longs;io.

Duodecimò, hinc benè colligo non produci impetum à potentia mo­
trice in toto organo;

quia &longs;i hoc e&longs;&longs;et, omnes partes &longs;tarent immobili­
ter;

e&longs;&longs;et enim hic impetus æqualis impetui grauitationis, tùm organi,
tùm ponderis;
tùm aliarum partium, cum organo coniunctarum;

igitur
nulla e&longs;&longs;et defatigatio; quia tam facilè anima produceret impetum,

immò po&longs;&longs;e­

quod ab&longs;urdum e&longs;t;

at cùm in omnibus partibus potentia motrix non pro­

certè deor&longs;um tendunt, motu naturaliter

Decimotertiò, quando pondus &longs;u&longs;tinetur à plano immobili, v. g. à
men&longs;a, non producitur in eo impetus &longs;ur&longs;um à men&longs;a; quia impetus

impetus &longs;ur&longs;um in men&longs;a, vt patet.
quod reuera ferè &longs;emper accidit;

&longs;ic tandem po&longs;t multos an­
nos trabs lignea incubanti ponderi cedit;

quod certè fit vel in-
&longs;en&longs;ibili motu vel per &longs;eparationem aliquarum partium;

cum enim da­
to quocumque motu, dari po&longs;&longs;it tardior; certè pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e continuus
motus, quo per centum annos, vix latus vnguis acquiratur, quod nemo
Philo&longs;ophus mirabitur, qui naturam motus circularis probè intelle­
xerit.

Decimoquintò, brachium omninò explicatum difficiliùs &longs;u&longs;tinet
pondus, quam contractum;

quia maius e&longs;t explicati momentum, vt pa­
tet; e&longs;t enim qua&longs;i longior vectis circa extremum humerum rotatus.
Obijceret aliquis, contra ea quæ diximus num.

14. &longs;it globulus libram
pendens incubans men&longs;æ 99. librarum;

haud dubiè qui men&longs;am pon­
derat, centum librarum pondus &longs;u&longs;tinet; igitur globulus producit in
men&longs;a impetum.

Re&longs;p. neg. con&longs;eque nam ideò &longs;entitur pondus 100. li­
brarum; quia vtrumque pondus grauitatione communi in &longs;uppo&longs;itam
