v.g. 1°ree;.quod &longs;pectat ad proportionem ictuum ratione puncti contactus,
de qua idem dicendum e&longs;t, quod &longs;uprà dictum e&longs;t Th. 15. num.

25.
2°ree;.quod &longs;pectat ad lineam motus, per quam pila impacta impellit aliam,
de qua lib.1. Th.50. 51. 52.& alibi pa&longs;&longs;im.
3°ree;.

quod &longs;pectat ad reflexio­
nem, de qua fusè lib.6. à Th.62. ad 75.
Theorema 17.
Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena emi&longs;&longs;ionum, quæ fiunt cum percu&longs;&longs;ione.

Primò, &longs;it percu&longs;&longs;io minoris Tudiculæ v.g. eo maior e&longs;t, quò Tudi­
cula maior e&longs;t; rationem iam attulimus &longs;uprà num.5.Th.16.

Secundò, quo Tudicula longior e&longs;t, maior ictus, & emi&longs;&longs;io; quia
&longs;cilicet diutiùs potentia manet applicata, quia brachium longiùs extens
pote&longs;t, vt diximus numero 4. Th.16.

Tertiò, quod &longs;pectat ad &longs;ecundum ictum, idem pror&longs;us dicendum e&longs;t
quod dictum e&longs;t Theoremate &longs;uperiore num.9.

Quartò, quod &longs;pectat ad Tudiculam maiorem, iam &longs;uprà explicuimus
cuncta illius phœnomena, cum de malleo: certum e&longs;t enim primò ma­
iorem à maiore ictum infligi, cæteris partibus, quàm à minore propter
prædictum rationem.

Secundò, certum e&longs;t longitudinem manubrij fle­
xibilitatem, inæqualitatem, materiem, duritiem mallei, æqualitatem ba&longs;is
&c.
multùm conferre ad maiorem cùm ictus.

Tertiò certum e&longs;t mino­
rem globum, in quem impingitur Tudicula, citiùs moueri, inaiorem tar­
diùs, cæteris paribus.

Quartò, globus maior in alium impactus Tudiculâ
maiorem ictum infligit, vt con&longs;tat experientiâ; ratî;

e&longs;t, quia tardiùs
mouetur;

igitur diutiùs applicatur: Equidem globus proiectus in alium
fortiorem ictum infligit ex duplici capite, vt dicam infrà.
1°ree;.

Quia ma­
iorem impetum à potentia diutiùs applicata.2°ree;.Quia diutiùs applicatur
globo in quem impingitur; at verò quando impingitur Tudiculâ maiore,
ex duplici quoque capite cre&longs;cit ictus.1°ree;.quia globus globo diutiùs ma­
net applicatus, cùm tardior motus dicat plùs temporis.
2°ree;.

quia malleus
tardiorem motum imprimis globo;

igitur diutiùs manet applicatus: e&longs;t
enim hæc abta lex agentium, vt longiore tempore maior effectus produ­
catur, minor verò minore, reliqua ex dictis facilè intelligentur.
Theorema 18.
Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia phœnomena emi&longs;&longs;ionum, quæ fiunt per iactum.
Primò, Iactus duobus modis fieri pote&longs;t: primò brachio:

&longs;ecundò,
aliquo organo;

e&longs;t autem multiplex organi genus, de quo infrà; omitto
enim iactum illum, qui fit pede mini&longs;tro, cuius eadem e&longs;t ratio, quæ
brachij.
Secundò, iactu lapidis maioris, maior ictus infligitur;

vtrumque certè, quia tardiùs mouetur, ergo tardiùs &longs;epara­
tur à manu; ergo etiam in&longs;tans contactus maius e&longs;t.

Tertiò, hinc proportio ictuum &longs;atis facilè ex dictis &longs;uprà determinari
pote&longs;t;

&longs;i verò habeatur ratio
contactus, ictus &longs;unt vt motus permutando, &longs;uppo&longs;ito æquali impetu;

ratio &longs;ubduplicata e&longs;t 2/1 motus A e&longs;t
vt velocitas;

igitur e&longs;t ad motum B, vt 1/2. permutetur, erit 2/1 componatur
vtraque ratio, eritque ratio 4/1;

igitur ictus lapidis &longs;unt vt pondera; quæ
omnia con&longs;tant ex dictis &longs;uprà.

Quartò, leui&longs;&longs;imi lapides vix iaciuntur ad modicam di&longs;tantiam v. g.
granula &longs;abuli; ratio e&longs;t, 1°ree;.

quia accipiunt minùs impetus, quia citiùs
&longs;eparantur à iaciente manu, vt patet.
2°ree;.

quia mouetur initio velociùs in
aëre;

igitur &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus plùs impetus de&longs;truitur, vt con&longs;tat; nam
in maiori &longs;patio aëris e&longs;t maior re&longs;i&longs;tentia.

3°ree;.quia cùm aër perpetuo
motu agitetur, vt certum e&longs;t, in leuiori corpore impetum imprimit; igi­
tur aliam &longs;i&longs;tit vel deflectit.

4°ree;.quia manu non pote&longs;t rectè prehendi ia­
ciendus lapillus &c.

Quintò, grauior lapis ad modicam tantùm di&longs;tantiam iacitur; ratio
e&longs;t 1°ree;.quia producitur remi&longs;&longs;ior impetus, cùm &longs;cilicet pluribus partibus
&longs;ubiecti di&longs;tribuatur.

2°ree;.quia impetus grauitationis citiùs de&longs;truit impe­
tum extrin&longs;ecus aduenientem.

Sextò, figura corporis iacti multùm confert ad iactum, quia ratione
figuræ pote&longs;t aër plùs, vel minùs re&longs;i&longs;tere:

hinc figura circularis depre&longs;­
&longs;ior apti&longs;&longs;ima e&longs;t ad iactum;

quia minor e&longs;t aëris re&longs;i&longs;tentia, qualis e&longs;t
figura lenticularis:

hinc &longs;cabri corporis, qualis e&longs;t tophus, iactus e&longs;t
difficilior;

quia &longs;cilicet aër &longs;alebris illis, vel a&longs;peritatibus interceptus
magis re&longs;i&longs;tit: hinc &longs;ibilus propter colli&longs;ionem aëris &c.
Septimò, iacitur lapis multis modis 1°ree;.
rotato infrà brachio extento:
&longs;ic vulgò iaciuntur grauiora &longs;axa;

ad iactum autem conferunt vires po­
tentiæ, brachium longiùs, longior arcus, Tangens, per quam emittitur di­
mi&longs;&longs;um &longs;axum, quæ debet facere cum horizontali angulum grad.45. ma­
nus &longs;imul explicata;

&longs;i enim vna pars ante aliam dimittatur, retinetur
iactus, vt vulgò dicitur, figura, & moles lapidis;

&longs;i enim maior e&longs;t, non
procul emittitur præuia brachij gyratio, quia impetus augetur: denique
impre&longs;&longs;us toti corpori impetus, quæ omnia mirificè maiorem iactum ef­
ficiunt, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis &longs;uprà.

2°ree;.iacitur lapis rotato quidem deor&longs;um
brachio, &longs;ed non &longs;iue aliqua eiu&longs;dem brachij contractione, & aliquot
gyris: &longs;ic vulgò iaciuntur &longs;axa minora, tuncque præ&longs;ertim contentis ner­
uis toti corpori impetus accedit, qui deinde ad augendam iactum in
ip&longs;um brachium qua&longs;i refunditur.3°ree;.

iacitur lapis negligenti qua&longs;i ni&longs;u,
&longs;eu reiectione circumacta manu horizonti parallela, & contracto tan­
tillùm brachio.
4°ree;.

additur aliquando deflexio vel declinatio iactui
præ&longs;ertim in ludo trunculorum, præ&longs;ertim cùm trunculorum lineæ ad­
uer&longs;æ omninò & directæ iacienti re&longs;pondens.

5°ree;.denique, iacitur &longs;axum
rotato &longs;upra brachio implicatis gyris, qui reuerâ iactus augetur ex ii&longs;­
dem omninò capitibus; de quibus iam &longs;uprà, quorum omnium cau&longs;æ &
rationes parent manife&longs;tæ ex dictis.

Octauò, corporis iacti impetus de&longs;truitur &longs;en&longs;im, tùm ab impetu nati­
uo ab occur&longs;u aliorum corporum;

hinc in plano a&longs;periore citiùs rota­
tus globus &longs;i&longs;tit; quæ certè omnia &longs;unt facilia.

Nonò, eiaculatio e&longs;t iactus &longs;eu vibratio alicuius mi&longs;&longs;ilis oblongi, qua­
le e&longs;t iaculum vel telum, pro qua non e&longs;t difficultas;

fit enim porrecto
antè per &longs;uperiorem arcum brachio; infligetur autem maior ictus, cum
1°ree;.

iaculum e&longs;t maius, propter eandem rationem quam &longs;uprà attulimus
pro &longs;ari&longs;&longs;a.2°ree;.cum directus e&longs;t ictus;

pote&longs;t autem e&longs;&longs;e obliquus, vel quia
in planum cadit obliquè, licèt non declinet telum à &longs;ua linea, vel quia à
&longs;ua linea declinat, quæ cadit alioquin perpendiculariter in planum, vel
denique ex vtroque capite: omitto alia capita, quæ maiorem vim ictui
conciliant, de quibus &longs;uprà num.7. 3°ree;.

multùm facit ad maiorem ictum
concitatus in eam partem equus, in quam vibratur telum; hinc equites
antiquioris militiæ telis & iaculis pugnabant.
Decimò, iactus fieri pote&longs;t multiplici organo ejaculatorio, 1°ree;.

&longs;ypho­
ne, 2°ree;.fi&longs;tula tormentaris, 3°ree;.arcu, 4°ree;.funda, 5°ree;.

reticulo pilari vel cla­
uula denique infinita e&longs;t ferè organorum huiu&longs;modi &longs;uppellex;

quod &longs;pectat ad &longs;yphonem, quo aquam vel
globulos ejaculari &longs;olemus, non e&longs;t dubium quin illa ejaculatio &longs;it effe­
ctus compre&longs;&longs;ionis, de qua etiam, Tomo &longs;equenti; igitur &longs;uper&longs;unt tan­
tùm duo prædictorum organorum genera, &longs;cilicet funda & pilaris cla­
uula.

Vndecimò, funda vulgare e&longs;t organum iactus, cuius phœnomena fa­
cilè explicari po&longs;&longs;unt.1°ree;.

rotatur vt maiorem impetum acquirat ad mo­
tus reticulo lapis, 2°ree;.quò longior e&longs;t funda, longiùs lapis abigitur, quia
diutiùs manet applicatus, cùm maiorem arcum decurrat, 3°ree;.lapis in reti­
culo fundæ retinetur; quia cùm per Tangentem lineam &longs;ingulis in&longs;tanti­
bus determinetur, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis &longs;uprà, impeditur & retinetur à re­
ticulo, per quod Tangens illa duci tantùm pote&longs;t, e&longs;t eadem ratio, quæ
orbis rotati, de quo Th.3.num.10. 4°ree;.

hinc demi&longs;&longs;o altero fundæ funi­
culo lapis iacitur, quia nihil e&longs;t à quo retineri ampliùs queat.
5°ree;.

quò
maior e&longs;t lapis cæteris paribus, tardiùs rotatur funda, at maior impetus
lapidi imprimitur; quia diutiùs manet applicatus.
6°ree;.

tenditur conti­
nuò rota, quantumuis rotetur; quia &longs;cilicet non quidem à pondere
lapidis, &longs;ed ab eius impetu ad Tangentem determinato eò trahitur.

Septimò, quod autem ad Tangentem continuò determinetur linea mo­
tus, patet ex dictis, cum de motu circulari.

Octauò, longi&longs;&longs;imus erit ia­
ctus, &longs;i Tangens, ad quam motus lapidis determinatur, eo in&longs;tanti, quo
demittitur faciat angulum 45. grad. cum horizontali.

Nonò, vt rectè
collimetur, &longs;eu dirigatur lapis ad propo&longs;itum &longs;copum, egregium artifi­
cium e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t; quod totum in eo po&longs;itum e&longs;t, vt inueniatur illa Tan­
gens, quæ ducitur ad &longs;copum.

Decimò, ad fundam reuocari pote&longs;t, li­
nea illa fi&longs;&longs;i baculi furca, cui &longs;i lapis in&longs;eratur, facilè deinde emittitur;
&longs;it enim linea furca AB;

&longs;it lapis in&longs;ertus B, &longs;i rotetur maximo ni&longs;u furca
AB circa centrum A, vel circa centrum humeri;

haud dubiè lapis B
cum aliquo impetu di&longs;cedet: ratio e&longs;t, quia cùm &longs;tatim retineatur furca
impre&longs;&longs;a priùs maxima impetus vi, tùm lapidi tùm furcæ, &longs;uperat vis
illa impetus, quæ lapidi ine&longs;t, modicam illam &longs;trictionem fi&longs;&longs;æ rimæ,
nec e&longs;t alia difficultas.

Vndecimò, ad fundam reuocabis vibrationes arietis, Tudiculæ, æris
campani, & omnium funependulorum, quas &longs;uis vibrationibus aliquod
corpus eiaculantur, vel ictum infligunt.

Duodecimò, claua pilaris, &longs;eu reticulum notum e&longs;t omnibus or­
ganum, cuius phœnomena clari&longs;&longs;ima &longs;unt.

Primò, reticulo longiùs
emittitur pila, quàm clauiculâ, propter ten&longs;ionem & reditum chordarum.
Secundò, quò longiùs e&longs;t clauulæ manubrium, longiùs abigitur pila.
Tertiò, vt &longs;u&longs;tineatur ictus breui manubrio, reticulo opus e&longs;t.

Quartò,
auer&longs;a manu impacto reticulo, pila longiùs emittitur.

Quintò, quò &longs;unt
ten&longs;iores chordæ reticuli, maior e&longs;t ictus.

Sextò, hinc recens reticulum
veteri, & iam attrito præferri debet; hinc ille chordarum &longs;onus.

haud dubiè, &longs;i mo­
ueatur motu recto, maximum ictum infliget in C;

&longs;i verò motu circu­
lari circa E e&longs;t aliud centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, de quo infrà;

&longs;i tamen reticu­
lum propter ten&longs;ionem chordarum, quæ maximum addit momentum in
centro reticuli, erit ferè maximus ictus in linea AD, &longs;iue &longs;it reticulum,
&longs;iue &longs;it clauula, debet fieri contactus; alioqui &longs;i in F, v.g. fieret declina­
ret planum clauulæ, vt patet.

Nonò, cra&longs;&longs;itudo clauulæ multùm facit ad
augendam vim ictus; e&longs;t enim eadem pror&longs;us ratio, quæ mallei.

Decimò,
firmitas, & qua&longs;i ten&longs;io carpi multùm facit ad ictum;

præ&longs;ertim cùm pila
retorquetur; quia &longs;cilicet ratione vectis ferè circa extremitatem manu­
brij pellitur clauula ab immi&longs;&longs;a pilâ.

Vndecimò, vt &longs;it maior ictus, ali­
quo tempore reticulum comitatur pilam, adhæretque à tergo:

ratio e&longs;t,
quia potentia manet diutiùs applicata: vide alia, quæ pertinent ad de­
flexionem pilæ, & reflexionem lib.6. de motu reflexo à Th.75. ad 81.
Theorema 19.

Aliæ &longs;unt plurimæ motionum &longs;pecies, quas in hoc Theoremate exponi­
mus.
Primò, occurrit pre&longs;&longs;io, & dilatatio:

premitur corpus ab impetu
impre&longs;&longs;o à circumferentia ad centrum;

&longs;ic premitur aër, & aqua intra
vas;

dilatatur verò per impetum à centro ad circumferentiam; &longs;ed mira­
biles &longs;unt pre&longs;&longs;ionis & dilatationis effectus, qui propterea librum &longs;ingu­
larem de&longs;iderant.
Secundò, intru&longs;io, & extru&longs;io:
illa e&longs;t impul&longs;io intror&longs;um;

hæc verò
extror&longs;um:
vtraque fit vt plurimùm cum pre&longs;&longs;ione;

&longs;ic defigîtur clauus;
vi mallei;
&longs;ic excluditur alius:

ad intru&longs;ionem & extru&longs;ionem reuocari
pote&longs;t ductus auri, vel argenti, vel alterius ductilis materiæ; &longs;ed hunc
rei ductilis &longs;tatum Tomo quinto explicabimus cum alijs corporeum &longs;ta­
tibus.

Tertiò, di&longs;po&longs;itio fit per eiaculationem, vel minimarum partium, quæ
&longs;imul omnes vno iactu demittuntur manu;

&longs;it plura grana tritici vel
arenæ iaciuntur, vel alicuius corporis, cuius partes &longs;eparantur in ip&longs;o
iactu; cur verò vna per hanc lineam, alia per aliam feratur, determi­
natur vel à concur&longs;u cum alia parte, vel à &longs;itu, quem &longs;ingulæ in iacien­
tis manu habebant priùs, vel ab ordine, quo &longs;ingulæ proce&longs;&longs;erunt.
Quartò, adductio ad tractionem reuocari pote&longs;t;

&longs;unt tamen plures
illius modi;
vel enim per meram tractionem;

&longs;ic adducitur clauus, vel
truncus, vel per circuitionem &longs;implicem, &longs;ic adducitur rotati baculi ex­
tremitas; vel per circuitionem mixtam:

&longs;ic adducitur extremitas funis
flagelli; vel cum aliquo iactu;

&longs;ic adducitur pulmentum vt in va&longs;e
optimè commi&longs;ceatur v.g. &longs;ic coqui adducunt frixum & inuertunt, por­
recto tantillùm, tùm deinde rotato &longs;artaginis manubrio:

&longs;i enim e&longs;&longs;et
vera rotatio, frixum per Tangentem erit; at verò propter motum rectum
po&longs;t inuer&longs;ionem ab ip&longs;a &longs;artagine minimè recedit.
Quintò, ventilatio e&longs;t motio, quâ frumentum excernitur vanno;

van­
nus circuli e&longs;t vulgare &longs;atis frumentarium organum duabus an&longs;is in&longs;tru­
ctum, quibus vibratur tùm in aduer&longs;am partem, vt ip&longs;o &longs;uccu&longs;&longs;u paleæ,
ari&longs;tæ, & aliæ fe&longs;tucæ auolent;

tùm dextror&longs;um &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;umque libratur
vt leuior materia extet;
triticum enim grauius e&longs;t;

igitur deor&longs;um ten­
dit; palea verò &longs;ur&longs;um;

ideo verò attollitur, &longs;ub&longs;ultatque triticum in van­
no, quia po&longs;t impre&longs;&longs;um impetum per vibrationem &longs;ur&longs;um, manus ip&longs;a
deor&longs;um cum aliquo impetu truditur, in quo non e&longs;t difficultas, alio
verò motu qua&longs;i recto repit frumentum in vanni aluo, quia per addu­
ctionem vanni impul&longs;æ priùs &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um frumentum in eam partem
adhuc propter priorem impetum fertur; &longs;ic cum nauis illicò &longs;i&longs;tit in
potu, qui &longs;unt in ea & portum a&longs;piciunt, proni cadunt, de quo iam
&longs;uprà.

Sextò, remigatio fit pellendo, trahendoque, de qua iam &longs;uprà Th. 6.
16.longior & latior remus maiorem vim aquæ impellit;

faciliùs mouetur, &longs;i
aduer&longs;o flumine feratur nauis:

ratio e&longs;t, quia aqua pul&longs;a ver&longs;us eam
partem, in quam fluit minùs re&longs;i&longs;tit, quando eundem remum tractant,
ille plus confert, qui ad extremitatem propiùs accedit; ratio clara e&longs;t:
&longs;ed de re nautica aliàs; vide interim locum citatum.

e&longs;t etiam eadem ratio
fracturæ eadem ten&longs;ionis, vel inflexionis; per quid verò corpus ip&longs;um
&longs;it vel friabile, vel fragile, vel flexibile, fusè explicamus Tomo
quinto.
Octauò, &longs;uccu&longs;&longs;us e&longs;t impetus impre&longs;&longs;us repetito frequenti ni&longs;u;

&longs;ic
vulgò &longs;uccutiuntur arbores, vt fructus maturi cadant;

excuti verò ali­
quid dicitur, cum impetus vi ab alio &longs;eparatur;

&longs;ic excuti dicuntur den­
tes; &longs;ic excutitur malleo marmoris fragmentum, &c.

in quo non e&longs;t
difficultas;

nam quoties maior e&longs;t vis impetus, quàm implicationis par­
tium, vel vnionis, tunc aliqua pars auolat ab ictu:

denique ca&longs;us alicuius
corporis facilè intelligi pote&longs;t;

periculo&longs;ior e&longs;t altioris hominis, quàm
pu&longs;illi:

hinc animalcula cadentia vix quidquam detrimenti à
ca&longs;u accipiunt:

præterea ictus grauior e&longs;t, &longs;i quis cadat in eam partem,
ver&longs;us quam &longs;ummo ni&longs;u fertur;

quia impetus grauitatis augetur ab alio
impre&longs;&longs;o:

deinde pars illa corporis, quæ ca&longs;u altitudine multùm auget
vel imminuit grauitatem ictus, vt certum e&longs;t;

immò corpus illud, cui
alliditur:
hinc caput in marmor impactum graui&longs;&longs;imum ictum refert:
hinc franguntur o&longs;&longs;a facilè modico ictu, &longs;i vtrimque &longs;u&longs;tineantur;

in medio vero ab&longs;it fulcrum: &longs;ed hæc pertinent ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam corporum,
de qua Tomo &longs;equenti,

Nonò, explo&longs;io fit, cum aliquid emittitur, vel cum aliquo &longs;trepitu,
vt glans è fi&longs;tula, vel per continuam pre&longs;&longs;ionem digitorum;

&longs;ic nucleus
cera&longs;i vulgo exploditur à pueris:

Ratio e&longs;t, quia propter vliginem nu­
clei recenter extracti digiti in eius &longs;uperficie conuexa facilè repunt;

hinc
aucto &longs;emper impetu, & nouo etiam addito ex porrecto brachio pro­
cul exploditur: &longs;ic omnia lubrica è manibus facilè elabuntur, vt &longs;æpè
pi&longs;ces, &c.

Decimò, re&longs;i&longs;tentia corporum procedit tum ex impenetrabilitate
tùm ex duritie, tùm ex den&longs;itate;

nos verò hos &longs;tatus alio Tomo expli­
cabimus;
e&longs;t autem duplex re&longs;i&longs;tentia;

prima e&longs;t formalis, quæ in eo
po&longs;ita e&longs;t, quod non corpus impediat motum alterius, non per aliquid
contrarium, quod in eo producat, &longs;ed vel per &longs;uam impenetrabilitatem,
vel per &longs;uam duritiem, vel per &longs;uam molem;

nam inde oritur noua de­
terminatio, vt alibi explicuimus, vel denique per &longs;uam grauitationem,
&c, &longs;ecunda e&longs;t actiua, vt cum imum corpus imprimit alteri impetum;
&longs;ed hæc facilè ex dictis intelligi po&longs;&longs;unt.
Vndecimò, omitto varias motiones corporis humani.

Primò, motum
progre&longs;&longs;iuum &longs;iue fiat cur&longs;u, &longs;iue lentiore gradu: quippè tùm coxæ
mouentur motu mixto ex duobus circularibus.
& crura ex tribus.

Se-
cundò, &longs;altum.
Tertiò, luctum.

Quartò, chorum, &longs;eu numero&longs;am &longs;alta­
tionem.

Quintò denique aliorum animalium motus, qui reuerâ huius
loci e&longs;&longs;e non po&longs;&longs;unt; nam perfectam mu&longs;culorum, atque adeo totius
fabricæ corporis humani cognitionem &longs;upponunt, quam trademus &longs;uo
loco, cum de homine, addemu&longs;que alios motus v.g. re&longs;pirationis, &longs;ter­
nutationis, tu&longs;&longs;is, &longs;ingultus, o&longs;citationis, ri&longs;us, fletus, fi&longs;toles, & dia&longs;to­
les, &c.
quorum omnium veri&longs;&longs;imas cau&longs;as afferemus;

omitto etiam
cau&longs;as phy&longs;icas motuum cœle&longs;tium, quas certè, ni&longs;i me veritas fallit,
Tomo &longs;equenti demon&longs;trabimus per &longs;implici&longs;&longs;ima principia, cum aliquo
&longs;altem rei a&longs;tronomicæ incremento: denique omitto alios motus, qui
certæ materiæ affiguntur v.g.æ&longs;tus maris, libræ motus, fluuiorum fluxus,
ventorum vis, fluminis ira, magnetis virtus, & electri, &c.

de quibus
&longs;uo loco: quippe hoc loco con&longs;ideramus tantùm motiones, quatenus
certæ materiæ copulantur.
Theorema 20.

Explicari po&longs;&longs;unt &longs;ingulares aquarum motus, quod tantum hîc breuiter
præ&longs;tabimus:

itaque primò, aqua fluit cum plano decliui, quod liquo­
ris proprium e&longs;t;

ideo verò fluit, quia cum vna pars alteri extare non
po&longs;&longs;it; nec enim leuior e&longs;t, deor&longs;um fluit, de quo aliàs fusè.

Secundò, &longs;tillatim cadit, quia &longs;cilicet colligitur in &longs;phærulas, quæ
tandem proprio pondere deor&longs;um eunt; cur verò in &longs;phærulas torne­
tur, veri&longs;&longs;imam rationem dabimus &longs;uo loco.

Tertiò, &longs;tillicidium facilè re&longs;i&longs;tit, quia &longs;cilicet aquæ partes, quæ tan­
tùm modico glutine continentur, diuelluntur facilè, & repercu&longs;&longs;u illo,
præ&longs;ertim &longs;i à corpore duriore fiat, in omnem partem eunt.

Quartò, a&longs;per&longs;io aquæ valdè familiaris e&longs;t, quod &longs;cilicet vi iàctus mi­
nutim emittatur aqua, in quo non e&longs;t vlla difficultas; nam aqua facilè
diuiditur.

Quintò, aqua diluit facilè tùm alios liquores; quia facilè mi&longs;cetur
tùm corpora &longs;pongio&longs;a, quorum poros, & cauitates facilè &longs;ubit.

Sextò, abluit corpora, quibus &longs;cilicet facilè adhæret, & denique cum
&longs;ordibus exprimitur.

Septimò, aqua fluit, quæ &longs;cilicet in minuti&longs;&longs;imas particulas di&longs;tincta
&longs;en&longs;im lique&longs;cente vapore in terram cadit.
Octauò, infunditur ex vno &longs;cilicet va&longs;e in aliud;

affunditur, &longs;ubiectis
&longs;cilicet manibus; effunditur, &longs;cilicet ex &longs;uo va&longs;e.
Nonò, exundat &longs;æpiùs v. g. fluuius alueo;

&longs;ic palus etiam & mare
re&longs;tagnant propter nimiam aquarum copiam: hinc &longs;æpè terram in­
undat.
Decimò, libratur &longs;æpiùs in &longs;uo va&longs;e v.g. in latiore cratere;

nam facilè
a&longs;cendit per planum modicè inclinatum, reditque per diuer&longs;as vices; fa­
ciliùs tamen in latiori, quàm in angu&longs;tiore calice.

Vndecimò, fluctuat, cum &longs;cilicet eius &longs;uperficies agitatur ventorum
vi; e&longs;t enim aqua corpus facilè mobile.

Duodecimò, cri&longs;patur, cum &longs;cilicet vel leuior e&longs;t afflatus, vel tremu­
lo &longs;uccutitur motu vas illud, in quo continetur.

Decimotertiò, in circulos agitur, cum aliquod corpus immergitur
quia tantundem aquæ attollitur &longs;en&longs;im;

quod quia extare non pote&longs;t, in
orbem &longs;uperficiei reliquæ coextenditur: hinc continuò illius circuli,
tantillùm extantis decre&longs;cit tumor.

Decimoquartò, facilè mi&longs;cetur cum aqua; quia facilè partes aquæ mi­
nimo &longs;cilicet impetu diuiduntur.

Decimoquintò, feruet aqua calore; quia &longs;cilicet partes calidiores
in vaporem conuer&longs;æ retentæ in bullis &longs;ur&longs;um eas attollunt in &longs;pu­
mam.

Decimo&longs;extò, &longs;altitat aqua, cum &longs;cilicet aluei fundum e&longs;t paulò a&longs;pe­
rius: ratio clari&longs;&longs;ima e&longs;t, quia à &longs;axis occurrentibus repercutitur.

Decimo&longs;eptimò, agit verticem &longs;æpius, cum &longs;cilicet tractu re&longs;pondet
profundiori, vel cum repellitur à littore, remo, &c.
Decimooctauò, agitatur facilè &longs;eu baculo, &longs;eu libratione va&longs;is:

&longs;ed
hæc tantùm breuiter indica&longs;&longs;e &longs;ufficiat, quæ alibi &longs;uis locis fusè omninò
explicabimus: atque hæc de diuer&longs;is motionibus &longs;int &longs;atis.

APPENDIX PRIMA
PHYSICOMATHEMATICA,
De centro percu&longs;sionis.

in quo certè
opere non &longs;ine maxima laude præ­
&longs;tanti&longs;&longs;imi Mathematici de&longs;udarunt,
&longs;cilicet Archimedes, Commandinus, Lucas Vale­
rius, Steuinus, Guldinus, Galileus paucis:

&longs;ed du­
plex aliud centrum con&longs;iderari pote&longs;t;

primum di­
citur centrum impre&longs;&longs;ionis: vtrumque pror&longs;us inta­
ctum aliis doctâ paucarum licèt propo&longs;itionum co­
ronâ, vel peripheria in hac appendice corona­
mus.
DEFINITIO I.

CEntrum grauitatis e&longs;t punctum, quod omnia grauitatis momenta æqua­
liter dirimit.

Clara e&longs;t definitio; centrum enim grauitatis e&longs;t illud punctum, ex
quo pendulum corpus per quamlibet lineam &longs;eruat æquilibrium.
Definitio 2.

Centrum impre&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t illud, per quod, &longs;i ducatur planum vtrimque, di­
rimit æqualem impetum.
Hæc etiam clara e&longs;t;

con&longs;ideratur autem impetus non modò ratione
inten&longs;ionis verùm etiam exten&longs;ionis; debet etiam accipi punctum illud
in linea motus.
Definitio 3.

Centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t punctum illud corporis impacti in quo &longs;i contactus
fiat, maximus ictus infligitur.
Definitio 4.
Linea directionis e&longs;t linea motus centri grauitatis.
Po&longs;itiones 1.
Centrum grauitatis dirigit linea motus aliorum punctorum.
Po&longs;itiones 2.

Si percu&longs;&longs;io ita fiat, vt totus impetus corporis impacti impediatur maxi­
ma e&longs;t.
Po&longs;itiones 3.
Momenta &longs;unt, vt di&longs;tantiæ.
Po&longs;itiones 4.

Omnes partes corporis, quod mouetur motu recto, mouentur æqua­
liter.
Po&longs;itiones 5.

Corpus graue &longs;u&longs;tinetur in æquilibrio, cum &longs;u&longs;tinetur in linea dire­
ctionis.
Po&longs;itiones 6.

Centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t in illa linea, quæ dirimit vtrimque momenta, tùm
ratione impetus, tùm ratione di&longs;tantiæ.
Po&longs;itiones 7.

Si pondera inæqualia &longs;unt in æquilibrio, di&longs;tantiæ &longs;unt, vt pondera per­
mutando; vel collectio di&longs;tantiarum e&longs;t ad maiorem, vt collectio ponderum ad
alterum pondus, quod maius est, &c.
Po&longs;itiones 8.

Maximus ictus infligitur in linea directionis, per &longs;e, vt con&longs;tat ex
po&longs;.5.6.2.
Theorema 1.

Centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis lineæ mobilis motu recto e&longs;t idem cum centro graui­
tatis eiu&longs;dem.

Sit enim linea AC, horizonti parallela, v.g. quæ cadat perpendi­
culariter;

&longs;it eius centrum grauitatis B, quod &longs;cilicet vtrimque æqua­
liter di&longs;tat ab AC;
centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t in B. Probatur;

quia cùm
in B impediatur totus impetus;

quippe neutrum &longs;egmentum præualere
pote&longs;t; e&longs;t enim vtrimque æqualis impetus, per po&longs;it.

3. 4. certè maxi­
ma percu&longs;&longs;io e&longs;t in B, per po&longs;it.2. igitur e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis per
def.5. igitur centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t idem cum centro grauitatis, quod
erat dem.
Corollarium 1.

Hinc quatuor centra concurrunt in idem punctum, &longs;cilicet magni­
tudinis, grauitatis, impre&longs;&longs;ionis, & percu&longs;&longs;ionis.
Corollarium 2.

Idem pror&longs;us dicendum e&longs;t de Rectangulo, Parallelogrammate, Cir­
culo, Ellip&longs;i, Cylindro, Pri&longs;mate, Parallelipedo, Sphæra, &c.

in quibus
po&longs;ito motu recto, hæc quatuor centra in eodem plano, immò & linea
reperiuntur.
Theorema 2.

Si planum triangulare cadat motu recto deor&longs;um, v.g. horizonti paralle­
lum, centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t idem cum centro grauitatis eiu&longs;dem.
Sit enim triangulare planum FBH, cuius centrum grauitatis &longs;it I:
dico e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

quia, cùm &longs;it æqualis motus, & impetus
omnium partium plani, &longs;i &longs;u&longs;tineatur in I, &longs;tat in æquilibrio, per def.1.
igitur totus impetus impeditur; igitur e&longs;t maxima percu&longs;&longs;io, per
Po&longs;. 2.
Scholium.
Ob&longs;eruabis punctum I po&longs;&longs;e haberi duobus modis;

Primò, &longs;i ducatur
FC diuidens æqualiter HB;

diuidit etiam æqualiter GA, & omnes alias
parallelas HB;
igitur in FC e&longs;t centrum grauitatis:

&longs;imiliter ducatur
HD diuidens æqualiter FB, centrum grauitatis erit etiam in HD;

igi­
tur in communi puncto I. Secundò, ita diuidatur FH in G, vt FG &longs;it
dupla GH, ducaturque GA:

&longs;imiliter ducatur KE diuidens HB eodem
modo, punctum communis &longs;ectionis I e&longs;t centrum grauitatis;

quippe
duo triangula DIC, FIH &longs;unt proportionalia;

igitur vt DC ad FH,
ita DI ad IH, &longs;ed DC e&longs;t &longs;ubdupla FH;
igitur DI &longs;ubdupla IH:

&longs;imi­
liter IC &longs;ubdupla IF;

igitur GH &longs;ubdupla GF; igitur inuentum e&longs;t
centrum grauitatis, quod erat faciendum.
Theorema 3.

Si planum triangulare cadat parallelum lineæ verticali, v. g. in &longs;itu FH
B, ita vt FH &longs;it parallela horizonti, centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t in G;

cùm
enim GA ducatur per centrum grauitatis I, &longs;itque parallela HB, e&longs;t
linea directionis, per def.4. igitur &longs;i &longs;u&longs;tineatur in G, &longs;tabit in æquili­
brio, per p.5. igitur totus impetus impeditur, vt patet; igitur e&longs;t maxi­
ma percu&longs;&longs;io per p.

2. igitur centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t G, quod erat de­
mon&longs;t.
Corollarium 1.

Hinc corpus &longs;olidum ex multis huiu&longs;modi triangulis æqualibus qua&longs;i
conflatum, idem pror&longs;us percu&longs;&longs;ionis centrum habet; &longs;iue cadat lineæ

Corollarium 2.
Hinc etiam ad Mechanicam reduci pote&longs;t inuentio praxis prædictæ;
&longs;it enim triangulum AGD;
diuidatur AD in tres partes in BC;

du­
cantur BI, CH, parallelæ DG, itemque IE, HF parallelæ AD;

&longs;u&longs;ti­
neaturque prædictum planum erectum in C, &longs;tabit in æquilibrio;

cùm
enim momenta ponderum æqualium &longs;int vt di&longs;tantiæ, rectangulo CE

& æquedi&longs;tans IKD, triangulo demum GHE, triangulum &longs;ubduplum
AIB, cuius momentum adæquat momentum alterius dupli GHB; quia
di&longs;tantia e&longs;t dupla.
Theorema 4.
Si Pyramis, cuius axis &longs;it parallela horizonti, cadat deor&longs;um;

e&longs;t autem centrum
grauitatis illud punctum, quod ita axem diuidit, vt &longs;egmentum ver&longs;us
ba&longs;im &longs;it &longs;ubtriplum alterius ver&longs;us verticem, quod multi hactenus de­

enim conus ENI, &longs;it axis AI diui&longs;us in 4. partes æquales BCD, pa­
rallelus horizonti, &longs;u&longs;tineatur in M, &longs;tabit in æquilibrio.
Theorema 5.

Si quodlibet aliud planum, vel corpus, deor&longs;um cadat, motu recto, cen­
trum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t in linea directionis;

quod eodem modo probatur, quo
&longs;uprà:

quodnam verò &longs;it centrum grauitatis omnium corporum, plano­
rum, figurarum, hîc non di&longs;putamus; con&longs;ulantur authores citati, quibus
addatur La Faille, qui egregiè centrum grauitatis partium circuli, &
Eclip&longs;is demon&longs;trauit.
Theorema 6.

Si linea circa centrum immobile mobilis, voluatur, centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis
non e&longs;t centrum grauitatis;

&longs;it enim linea AD, quæ voluatur circa cen­
trum A;

diuidatur bifariam in G, punctum G e&longs;t centrum grauitatis: vt
con&longs;tat;

non tamen e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, quia in &longs;egmento GD e&longs;t
quidem æquale momentum ratione di&longs;tantiæ, &longs;ed maius ratione impe­
tus; quippe GD mouetur velociùs, quàm GA vt certum e&longs;t.
Theorema 7.

In hac eadem hypothe&longs;i centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis non e&longs;t idem cum centro im­
pre&longs;&longs;ionis;

diuidatur enim AD in M, ita vt AM, &longs;it media propor­
tionalis inter AG, & AD;

certè M e&longs;t centrum impre&longs;&longs;ionis, vt de­
mon&longs;tratum e&longs;t lib. 1.non tamen e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

quia &longs;eg­
mentum MA habet quidem æqualem impetum cum &longs;egmento MD;

ha­
bet tamen maius momentum, quia maiorem habet di&longs;tantiam; igitur
non erit æquilibrium in M.
Theorema 8.

Si diuidatur AD in tres partes æquales, &longs;it que ID 1/3 centrum percu&longs;&longs;io­
nis erit in I;

demon&longs;tratur, quia impetus puncti G e&longs;t ad impetum pun­

vt arcus EG, ad arcum BD;
&longs;it autem DC æqualis DB;

ducatur
AC, triangulum ACD erit æquale &longs;ectori ADB, vt con&longs;tat; impetus in

atqui &longs;i hoc e&longs;&longs;et, centrum grauitatis

Colligo primò, ex dictis in hac hypothe&longs;i tria centra &longs;eparari.

Secundò &longs;i nullum e&longs;&longs;et momentum ratione di&longs;tantiæ, centrum per­

bilis;

idem e&longs;&longs;e cum centro percu&longs;&longs;ionis trianguli, &longs;eu plani triangula­

v.g. &longs;it rectangulum CF, rotatum circa C

AF, e&longs;&longs;et in E, &longs;i &longs;ola CH, e&longs;&longs;et in K, &longs;i &longs;ola BG, e&longs;&longs;et in I, per Th. 8.

Primò, &longs;i rotetur circa CH, eodem modo inuenietur centrum per­

diuidatur in tres

eadem ratio, quæ &longs;uprà;

rectangulo circa CA; quia e&longs;t æqualis impetus.

Si triangulum BIG voluatur circa CA, in quam BH cadit perpendi­

triangulum GBI de&longs;cribit, vt &longs;ic loquar, &longs;ectorem cylindri;

pyramis quadrilatera; &longs;ed pyramidis centrum grauitatis e&longs;t D, per
