cunei cen­
trum grauitatis idem e&longs;t, quod trianguli HKD, per Corol. 1. Th.3.igi­
tur e&longs;t in linea directionis MF.ita vt IM &longs;it 1/3 totius ID, per Th 3. py­
ramidis verò centrum grauitatis e&longs;t in linea NG, ita vt IN &longs;it 1/4 totius
ID, per Th.4. igitur &longs;i e&longs;t NM ad ML, vt &longs;olidum ABDC ad pyra­
midem AHD, id e&longs;t vt 1.ad 2. certè NI, & NL erunt æquales;

&longs;ed IN
e&longs;t 1/4 totius ID; igitur IL 1/2 ergo L dirimit æqualiter ID, quod erat
demon&longs;tr.
&longs;it ID 12.IN 3.IM 4. IL 6.
Theorema 13.

Si voluatur &longs;ector circa axem parallelum &longs;ubten&longs;æ, determinari pote&longs;t cen­
trum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, dato centro grauitatis &longs;ectoris, quod tantum hactenus in­
uentum e&longs;t ex &longs;uppo&longs;ita circuli quadratura:

&longs;it enim &longs;ector AKHM, &longs;ub­
ten&longs;a KM;

ergo e&longs;t inter FG, v.g. in R, ita vt AH &longs;it ad AR vt arcus
MHK ad 2/3 &longs;ubten&longs;æ MK;
id e&longs;t ad MP;

vt demon&longs;trat La Faille Prop.
34. pote&longs;t etiam haberi centrum grauitatis &longs;egmenti circuli;

&longs;it enim
&longs;egmentum FCHI cuius centrum &longs;it B;

&longs;int BC. BI. BH. diuidens æ-
qualiter CI;
&longs;itque D centrum grauitatis trianguli BCI;

&longs;it E centrum
grauitatis &longs;ectoris BCHI, &longs;itque vt &longs;ectio FCHI, ad triangulum BEI,
ita DE ad EG, vel vt &longs;ectio ad &longs;ectorem, ita DE ad DG; G e&longs;t centrum
grauitatis &longs;ectionis, per p.7.

diuidatur IM
in N, ita vt IN &longs;it ad NM, vt &longs;egmentum cylindri GEFDCB, ad
pyramidem AEDCB; certè N e&longs;t centrum grauitatis &longs;olidi AEFDCHB,
per p.7. igitur N e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis &longs;ectoris circumacti.
Theorema 14.

Si &longs;ector AKHM voluatur circa Tangentem NHL, determinari
pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis eodem modo;

nam a&longs;&longs;umi pote&longs;t cuneus, vt &longs;uprà,
cuius ba&longs;is &longs;it &longs;egmentum cylindri;
tùm pyramis cum eadem ba&longs;i;

tùm in­
ueniri centrum grauitatis vtriu&longs;que;

tùm detracta pyramide ex cuneo,
haberi re&longs;iduum &longs;olidum, cuius centrum grauitatis inuenietur, iuxta pr&etail;­
dictam praxim; quippe hoc erit centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis quæ&longs;itum.
Theorema 15.

Si voluatur triangulum FBH circa FM, in quam cadit HF perpen­
diculariter:

&longs;i a&longs;&longs;umatur NH 1/4 FI, ducaturque NP parallela HB, &longs;e­
cans FC in O, dico punctum O e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis; quod eodem modo
probatur quo &longs;uprà Th.11.
Theorema 16.

Si voluatur quodlibet triangulum circa angulum rectum, determinari pe­
test centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;
&longs;it enim triangulum ABC;

aliæ duæ ip&longs;is æquales AFCG,
perpendicularis in AC;
tùm FG connectantur;

eleueturque Trapezus
AG, donec AF, CG incubent perpendiculariter plano ABC;

denique
à B ducantur rectæ ad omnia puncta Trapezi erecti, habebitur pyramis,
cuius centrum grauitatis, dabit centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis quæ&longs;itum, per Th.
11. quod vt fiat, inueniatur centrum grauitatis Trapezi AG, modo di­
cto, ducta &longs;cilicet FC, a&longs;&longs;umptoque I centro grauitatis trianguli FGC
& L centro grauitatis trianguli FAC;

&longs;i enim ducatur LI, &longs;itque LI
ad LP, vt Trapezium AG, ad triangulum FGC;
porrò &longs;i ducatur perpendicularis PO;

tùm BO habebi-
tur orthogonium POB; denique a&longs;&longs;umatur OR 1/4 totius OB, R erit
centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis trianguli ACB per Th. 11.
Corollarium.

Hinc colligo quid dicendum &longs;it de rectangulo ita rotato, vt diagona­
lis cadat perpendiculariter in axem, circa quem rotatur;

&longs;it enim re­
ctangulum CF, cuius diagonalis AIA, axis circa quem voluitur BR, in­
ueniantur centra percu&longs;&longs;ionis vtriu&longs;que trianguli &longs;eor&longs;im AFH, ACH,
rotati circa axem BR per Th. 16. connectantur rectâ, in hac erit cen­
trum percu&longs;&longs;ionis totius rectanguli;

cù di&longs;tantiæ à centro communi
&longs;int vt pyramides permutando per p.7. vt con&longs;tat ex dictis; ex quibus
etiam &longs;atis intelligetur quid de alijs planis, tùm regularibus, tùm irre­
gularibus dicendum &longs;it, cù &longs;cilicet po&longs;&longs;int in triangula diuidi.
Theorema 17.

Si voluatur triangulare planum parallelum circulo, in quo voluitur, deter­
minari pote&longs;t eius centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

&longs;it enim triangulum AFH, quod
ita voluatur, vt extremitas H de&longs;cribat arcum HS, & F arcum FR;

certè
F mouetur velociùs quàm H iuxta rationem AF ad AH;

&longs;it ergo FM æ­
qualis FA, & HN æqualis HA;
habebitur pyramis;
haud dubiè D e&longs;t centrum grauitatis huius;

&longs;it linea directionis
DC;
quippe punctum D mouetur per Tangentem:

quod etiam de alijs
punctis dictum e&longs;to;

e&longs;t enim hæc ratio motus circularis; igitur maximus
ictus erit in C per p.
8. igitur C e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis.
Corollarium 1.

Collige perinde &longs;e habere motum puncti F, atque &longs;i ip&longs;i incumberet
linea FM, & puncto H, HN.
Corollarium 2.

Præterea centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis aliquando e&longs;&longs;e extra rectam AH, cum
&longs;cilicet angulus circa, quem voluitur e&longs;t minùs acutus, &longs;it enim trian­
gulum AGL quod voluatur circa A, &longs;itque centrum grauitatis Trapezij
E, de quo &longs;uprà;

ducantur EC, AC, &longs;it CB 1/4 AC, ducatur linea dire­
ctionis BI; vides I e&longs;&longs;e extra AL.
Corollarium 3.
Præterea o&longs;tendi po&longs;&longs;e longè faciliùs totam rem i&longs;tam;

&longs;it enim tri­
angulum ABD;
ducatur HBG æqualis BA, perpendicularis in BD;
diuidatur AD bifariam æqualiter in L;

a&longs;&longs;umatur DE æqualis DL,
rùm ducantur HL, GE;

inueniatur centrum grauitatis C, Trapezij H
LEG;

ducatur AC, cuius KC &longs;it 1/4 ducatur KD perpendicularis in
AC, punctum D e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

quippe &longs;i vertatur Trapezus
HE, circa axem BD, donec AD cadat in illum perpendiculariter, &longs;it-
que &longs;ectio communis BD; certè habebitur ba&longs;is pyramidis, cuius axis
erit AC, quæ omnia con&longs;tant.
Theorema 18.

Determinari pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis in latere orthogonij &longs;ubten&longs;o angulo
recto;

&longs;it enim AGB, latu&longs;que &longs;ubten&longs;um angulo recto AB, &longs;it Trape­
zus KD, eo modo quo diximus, cuius centrum grauitatis &longs;it H, ducatur
AH, a&longs;&longs;umatur IH 1/4:

AH, ducatur IM perpendicularis in AH: dico
punctum M e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, quod demon&longs;tratur per Theo­
rema 17.
Theorema 19.

Si voluatur triangulum prædictum, circa angulum rectum, determinari
pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

&longs;it enim triangulum ABH, quod voluatur
circa centrum B;
motus puncti A e&longs;t ad motum H, vt BA, ad BH;

&longs;it ergo
Trapezus MG, cuius latus ML &longs;it æquale AB, & GI æquale BH;

erit
pyramis, eo modo, quo diximus &longs;uprà;

&longs;it autem D centrum grauitatis
ba&longs;is, &longs;eu Trapezij, & AD axis;
&longs;it KD 1/4 BD;

&longs;it denique KE perpen­
dicularis in DB: dico punctum E e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, quod co­
dem modo demon&longs;tratur, quo &longs;uprà.
Corollarium.

Hinc colligo primò, de omni triangulo idem pror&longs;us dicendum e&longs;&longs;e,
e&longs;t enim eadem ratio, vt con&longs;ideranti patebit.

Secundò, &longs;i voluatur circa punctum aliquod lateris, po&longs;&longs;e determinari
centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;
&longs;it enim triangulum ABC;

hinc Trapezus DPOX, id e&longs;t
ba&longs;is pyramidis, cuius axis e&longs;t MG, & centrum grauitatis K:

&longs;imiliter
habetur Trapezus DRNX;

id e&longs;t ba&longs;is alterius pyramidis, cuius axis e&longs;t
MV, & centrum grauitatis H;

fiat autem vt vtraque pyramis ad eam, cuius
axis e&longs;t MG, ita tota HK, ad HI;

dico I e&longs;&longs;e centrum commune graui­
tatis;

ducatur IL perpendicularis in IM; dico L e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;­
&longs;ionis quæ&longs;itum.

Tertiò, &longs;i voluatur circa aliud punctum, res eodem modo &longs;uc­
cedet.

Quartò, &longs;i &longs;it &longs;olidum ad in&longs;tar cunei, con&longs;tans &longs;cilicet ex multis pla­
nis triangularibus, quæ probè inter &longs;e conueniant; idem etiam accidet,
quæ omnia ex &longs;uprà dictis clari&longs;&longs;ima efficiuntur.
Quintò, &longs;i &longs;it triangulum EAD, fig.

quod ita voluatur circa centrum
A, vt latus AE, modò accedat ad CB, modò recedat;

igitur RN linea di­
rectionis in&longs;tanti percu&longs;&longs;ionis; &longs;i verò producatur AS in G, &longs;intque I &
M centra grauitatis pyramidum ducanturque IF, MF perpendiculares
in AI. AM, centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis erit F, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis.
Theorema 20.

Sectoris minoris quadrante determinari pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, cum
&longs;cilicet voluitur in plano, cui eiu&longs;dem planum e&longs;t parallelum;

&longs;it enim
quadrans BAI;

v.g. ducta &longs;it Tangens ZT, diui&longs;a bi­
fariam in C, puncto &longs;cilicet contactus, quæ tandiu voluatur circa CA,
dum &longs;ecet arcum ad angulos rectos:
idem fiat in alijs punctis arcus;

de­
nique ad extremitates Tangentium ducantur vtrimque à centro A rectæ,
& habebitur prædicta pyramis mixta, cuius centrum grauitatis inuen­
tum dabit centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

ducatur BI, tùm AC diuidens BI bifariam
in E, centrum grauitatis e&longs;t in AC;
a&longs;&longs;umatur GE 1/4 totius AE;

certè G
e&longs;t centrum grauitatis pyramidis ABEI;

&longs;it autem D centrum grauitatis
reliqui &longs;olidi BEIC, &longs;itque vt hoc &longs;olidum ad pyramidem ABEI, ita
GF ad FD: dico F e&longs;&longs;e centrum grauitatis per p.

7. ducatur FK perpen­
dicularis in AC, K e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis per Th.17.
Corollarium.
Colligo primò;
prædictam pyramidem mixtam e&longs;&longs; 2/3 &longs;ectoris cylindrj;

&longs;ed hic conus e&longs;t 1/3 cylindri, &longs;ub
eadem ba&longs;i, & altitudine;

igitur &longs;olidum, quod &longs;upere&longs;t, continet 2/3 cy­
lindri &longs;ub altitudine CZ, & ba&longs;i BPVI;

&longs;ed cauum BAI de quo &longs;uprà
e&longs;t 1/3 totius; igitur reliquum continet 2/3 &longs;ectoris cylindri BA, &longs;ub alti­
tudine CT.

Secundò colligo, &longs;i a&longs;&longs;umatur &longs;emicirculus PBI momentum quadran­
tis PBA, æquale e&longs;&longs;e momento quadrantis IA b, vt con&longs;tat; nam I, per
IM, idem præ&longs;tat quod P, per PQ, & S per SR, idem quod L,
per LV, &c.

Tertiò, &longs;i voluatur tantùm triangulum ABI, ducaturque GX per­
pendicularis in AC punctum X erit centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis; quid mirum
igitur, &longs;i addito &longs;egmento BCIE, &longs;it in K?

Quartò, &longs;i quadrans AI b trahat deor&longs;um adducto filo ex K, certè in
K erit centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, vt con&longs;tat.

Quintò, &longs;i vterque quadrans BI b A &longs;imul cadat, centrum percu&longs;&longs;io­
nis erit in K, &longs;ed duplò maior ictus.

Sexto, &longs;i &longs;emicirculus APBI cadar, centrum etiam percu&longs;&longs;ionis erit
in K, quia quadrans PBA æquiualet quadranti A b I.

Septimò, &longs;i a&longs;&longs;umatur &longs;ector maior quadrante, &longs;ed minor &longs;emicirculo,
v.g. ASBI, &longs;it BAC æqualis BAS;

inueniatur centrum grauitatis BA
C eodem modo, quo inuentum e&longs;t centrum F quadrantís rotati:

&longs;imili­
ter inueniatur centrum grauitatis TAI rotati;

connectantur rectâ hæc
duo centra inuenta, &longs;itque vt duplum BAC ad CAI, ita &longs;egmentum
connectentïs centra, quod terminatur in centro CAI ad aliud &longs;egmen­
tum; punctum diuidens &longs;egmenta erit centrum grauitatis quæ&longs;itum, à
quo &longs;i ducatur perpendicularis, eo modo, quo diximus, hæc dabit cen­
trum percu&longs;&longs;ionis.

Octauò, &longs;i a&longs;&longs;umatur &longs;ector maior &longs;emicirculo, v.g. AVBL, eodem
modo procedendum e&longs;t; quippe PAV æquiualet CAB, & IAL æquiua­
let CAI, & BAP æquiualet BAI, nec e&longs;t noua difficultas.

Nonò, hinc &longs;i circulus integer circa centrum voluatur, centrum per­
cu&longs;&longs;ionis erit in K, &longs;ed ictu quadruplo ictus inflicti à quadrante.
Theorema 21.

Si rotetur circulus circa punctum circumferentia vel circa Tangentem,
determinari pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

&longs;it enim centro B, ANCP, rota­
tus circa TA, in quam diameter AC cadit perpendiculariter;

a&longs;&longs;umatur
RC 1/3 AC:

dico R e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis; quia motus C e&longs;t ad mo­
tum R, vt CF ad RH, & ad motum B, vt CF ad BL, &c.

igitur perinde
&longs;e habet planum ANCP, atque &longs;i &longs;emicylindrus ACF ip&longs;i incubaret,
vt patet, &longs;ed centrum grauitatis huius &longs;olidi e&longs;t X in quo CL & FB de­
cu&longs;&longs;antur;

&longs;ed vt demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t &longs;uprà, &longs;i ducatur HXR, RC e&longs;t 2/3
totius AC; igitur R e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis.
Corollarium.
Primò colligo, &longs;i &longs;egmentum circuli voluatur:

&longs;imiliter haberi pote&longs;t
centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, inuento &longs;cilicet centro grauitatis ba&longs;is vtriu&longs;que
v.g. &longs;i &longs;egmentum OAQ voluatur circa TA, inueniri debet centrum
grauitatis eiu&longs;dem & ad illud à puncto H recta ducenda;

itemque in­
ueniendum e&longs;t centrum grauitatis &longs;egmenti Ellip&longs;eos HAI, & ad illud
à puncto R ducenda recta; nam vtriu&longs;que decu&longs;&longs;ationis punctum dabit
centrum grauitatis huius &longs;olidi, ex qua &longs;i ducatur perpendicularis in AR,
extremitas dabit centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis.

Secundò, &longs;i voluatur circulus CNAH circa PN, habebitur centrum
percu&longs;&longs;ionis eodem modo, inuentis &longs;cilicet centris grauitatis &longs;emicir­
culi PNC, & &longs;emiellip&longs;eos, cuius altera &longs;emidiameter &longs;it BF, altera BP,
vt con&longs;tat ex dictis,
Theorema 22.

&longs;it enim circulus ACFG, centro B, qui voluatur circa cen­
trum A;

motus puncti F e&longs;t ad motum puncti B, vt recta AF ad rectam
AD, & ad motum puncti C, vt AF ad AC;
idem dico de alis punctis;

&longs;it EH æqualis AF, diui&longs;a bifariam in F, quæ tandiu voluatur, donec
&longs;ecet arcum CFG ad angulos rectos; idem pror&longs;us fiat in aliis punctis
peripheriæ, a&longs;&longs;umptis &longs;cilicet lineis æqualibus &longs;ubten&longs;is arcuum, v.g. in
puncto D, a&longs;&longs;umpta linea æquali AD, in puncto C, a&longs;&longs;umpta æquali AC,
&c.

&longs;it etiam altitudo KR,
æqualis prædictæ diametro KI, &longs;it KR diui&longs;a bifariam in L, &longs;itque pla­
num IL &longs;ecans cylindrum, itemque alterum LP, vtraque &longs;ectio Ellip&longs;is
e&longs;t, vt patet;

ac proinde habetur &longs;olidum quæ&longs;itum LIP con&longs;tans gemi­
na ba&longs;i LI. & LP Elliptica, & reliqua circumferentià cylindricâ, cuius
centrum grauitatis e&longs;t in N, id e&longs;t in puncto decu&longs;&longs;ationis rectarum PM,
IS, quæ diuidunt ILPL bifariam æqualiter, e&longs;t autem NO 1/3 totius
LO, per Sch. Th.2. hoc po&longs;ito &longs;it XF 1/3 totius AF: dico e&longs;&longs;e centrum
percu&longs;&longs;ionis quæ&longs;itum circuli ACFG rotati circa A, quia perinde &longs;e
habet, atque &longs;i puncto X incubaret prædictum &longs;olidum ellipticocylindri­
cum, cuius X e&longs;&longs;et centrum grauitatis.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis primò, in plano ACFG, vt punctum X &longs;it centrum per­
cu&longs;&longs;ionis, incidendam e&longs;&longs;e &longs;triam quamdam, &longs;eu rimam, quæ termi­
netur in X.

Secundò, idem e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis rectæ AF, quæ voluitur
circa A, &longs;iue &longs;it &longs;implex linea, &longs;iue diameter circuli.
Theorema 23.

Si voluatur rectangulum parallelum orbi in quo voluitur determinari po­
test centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis;

itemque centrum H, trianguli ADF, per Th. 17.
tùm ducta IH, diuidatur bifariam in K;

ducatur AK, tùm GK perpen­
dicularis in AK: dico G e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, per po&longs;.7.& Theo­
rema 17.
Corollarium.

Colligo ex his facilè po&longs;&longs;e determinari centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis in alijs
figuris planis; quia diuidi po&longs;&longs;unt in plura triangula.
Theorema 24.
Pote&longs;t determinari centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis &longs;olidi trium facierum ABDE;

vt demon&longs;tretur centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis pyramidis, & pri&longs;matis, præmitti
debuit hoc &longs;olidum;

&longs;it enim &longs;olidum priori &longs;imile, A.M. G.C. motus
puncti M, e&longs;t ad motum puncti G, vt recta BM ad rectam BG;

igitur &longs;it
NK ad OH, vt BM ad BG;

certè perinde &longs;e habet punctum M, atque
&longs;i NMK incubaret, non quidem per MG, &longs;ed per lineam perpendicu­
larem ductam in BM, vt patet ex dictis:

idem dico de puncto G, quod
perinde &longs;e habet, atque &longs;i incubaret OGH;

ducantur AP, CI centrum grauitatis &longs;olidi ACIKNP
re&longs;pondet per lineam directionis puncto E, ita vt EG &longs;it 1/3 GB per Co­
roll.1. Th.3.&longs;i autem a&longs;&longs;umatur FG 1/4 totius BG, &longs;itque linea QFX,
& ex puncto F &longs;u&longs;tineatur vtraque pyramis AOPN, & CIHK, erit
perfectum æquilibrium per Th. 4. igitur &longs;it FE ad ED, vt &longs;olidum
ACHKNO ad vtramque pyramidem AOPN, CIHK, certè pun­
ctum D erit centrum grauitatis &longs;olidi ACHKNO, per p.7. a&longs;&longs;umatur
GL æqualis GD;

ducatur BL, hæc e&longs;t axis vt patet, modò GM &longs;it æqua­
lis GB;
&longs;i enim inæqualis e&longs;t, &longs;it GL ad GM, vt GD ad GB:

præterea
ducatur DR parallela GM;

denique ducatur perpendicularis FR in B
L;

dico F e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, vt patet ex dictis &longs;uprà, præ&longs;ertim in
Th. 17. & alibi pa&longs;&longs;im, ne toties eadem repetere cogar ad nau&longs;eam;
quamquam enim hæc &longs;atis noua &longs;unt, illa tamen indicanda potiùs, quàm
fusè tractanda e&longs;&longs;e putaui.
Theorema 25.

Pote&longs;t determinari centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis pyramidis, cum voluitur circa
verticem;

&longs;it enim &longs;olidum, de quo &longs;uprà ABCGM, fitque aliud &longs;oli­
dum ABCHKMNOG, cuius axis &longs;it BL & centrum grauitatis R,
hoc ip&longs;um e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis &longs;olidi ABCGM, ducta &longs;cilicet RF,
per Th.24. iam verò &longs;i ex &longs;olido ACIKNP, detrahatur prædictum
&longs;olidum ABCGM, &longs;upere&longs;t vtrimque integra pyramis, &longs;cilicet CMK
IG, & AMNPG, cuius axis communis erit eadem BL, vt patet;

itaque
a&longs;&longs;umatur LY 1/4 LB, Y re&longs;pondebit centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis &longs;olidi ACIK
NP per Corol.4. Th.19. igitur &longs;it vt vtraque pyramis ANPG, & AK
IG, ad reliquum &longs;olidum ABCGM, ita RY, ad YZ;

dico Z e&longs;&longs;e cen­
trum percu&longs;&longs;ionis vtriu&longs;que pyramidis, ductâ &longs;cilicet perpendiculari
Z d, vt con&longs;tat ex dictis; quare in axe pyramidis a&longs;&longs;umatur æqualis BZ,
& habebitur intentum.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis primò, &longs;olidum integrum AKNPI e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ubduplum pri&longs;­
matis eiu&longs;dem altitudinis & ba&longs;is NI; pyramidem verò CMI e&longs;&longs;e 1/6
eiu&longs;dem pri&longs;matis, ergo vtramque æqualem 1/3 igitur &longs;olidum ABCGM
1/6. igitur æquale alteri pyramidum, igitur RY duplam e&longs;&longs;e YZ.

Secundò, ob&longs;eruabis punctum Z dici po&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis in­
terius, à quo deinde &longs;i ducatur recta Z d perpendicularis in BL, termi­
nabitur in d, quod dici pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis exterius.

Tertiò, ob&longs;eruabis, centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis exterius aliquando e&longs;&longs;e in
ip&longs;a facie, &longs;eu linea BG, cum &longs;cilicet angulus MPG e&longs;t valdè acutus,
aliquando e&longs;&longs;e extra &longs;uperficiem corporis, v. g. in d, cum &longs;cilicet an­
gulus MBG e&longs;t obtu&longs;ior, quod iam &longs;uprà ob&longs;eruatum e&longs;t, cum de trian­
gulo Cor.2. Th.17.
Theorema 26.
Pote&longs;t determinari centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis parallelipedi;

&longs;it enim paralle­
lipedum MF quod voluatur circa MK;

&longs;it rectangulum LE &longs;ecans bifa­
riam æqualiter parallelipedum;

centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis erit in plano re­
ctanguli LE;
ducatur LE, diagonalis;

pote&longs;t
etiam determinari, &longs;i voluatur circa AC, vel circa PR, nam perinde
&longs;e habet prædictum parallelipedum, atque ip&longs;um rectangulum; hoc verò
atque ip&longs;um triangulum, in quo nulla pror&longs;us e&longs;t difficultas.

Pote&longs;t etiam determinari centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis cunei, id e&longs;t &longs;emipa­
rallelipedi, &longs;iue circa MK, &longs;ine circa IG voluatur; quæ omnia pa­
tent ex dictis.
Theorema 27.

Determinari pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis &longs;olidi ABDE, &longs;i voluatur circa
axem IDH;

nam motus puncti C e&longs;t ad motum puncti E, vt DC ad
DE, vel vt BN æqualis DC ad LK æqualem ED;

mouentur enim AC
B æquali motu;

itaque perinde &longs;e habet prædictum &longs;olidum in ordine
ad percu&longs;&longs;ionem, atque &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et &longs;olidum BMKLD;

duca­
tur SR perpendicularis in RD: dico S e&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis exte­
rius quæ&longs;itum, quod eodem modo probatur, quo &longs;uprà.
Corollarium.

Primò colligo inde, vbi &longs;it centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis cylindri, &longs;iue volua­
tur circa Tangentem ba&longs;is, &longs;iue circa diametrum eiu&longs;dem; nam idem de
cylindro dicendum e&longs;t, quod de parallelipedo dictum e&longs;t Th.26.

Secundò colligo, centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis coni; quippe vt &longs;e habet pyra­
mis ad pri&longs;ma, ita &longs;e habet conus ad cylindrum.

Tertiò, colligo centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis Pyramidis quando voluitur cir­
ca latus ba&longs;is per Th.27.

Quartò, colligo centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis cylindri; cum voluitur circa
Tangentem parallelum axi per Th.22.

Quintò, colligo centrum grauitatis pri&longs;matis, &longs;iue voluatur circa la­
tus ba&longs;is;
tunc enim idem pror&longs;us dicendum e&longs;t, quod de parallelipedo;

&longs;iue circa lineam parallelam axi; tunc enim centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis co­
gno&longs;citur ex centro percu&longs;&longs;ionis ba&longs;is cognito, &longs;i voluatur in circulo &longs;uo
plano parallelo per Cor. Th.22.

Sextò denique, colligo centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis cuiu&longs;libet alterius
&longs;olidi, planis rectilineis contenti, quod &longs;cilicet in pyramides diui­
di pote&longs;t.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis non dee&longs;&longs;e fortè aliquos, quibus centrum grauitatis Py­
ramidos difficile inuentu videatur;

quare in eorum gratiam facilem de­
mon&longs;trationem &longs;ubijcio;

&longs;it enim pyramis EFBA, cuius ba&longs;is &longs;it trian­
gularis EFB;

quippe axis e&longs;t recta
ducta à vertice ad centrum grauitatis ba&longs;is oppo&longs;itæ;

ducatur AC, diui­
dens BF bifariam æqualiter;

a&longs;&longs;umatur GC, 1/3 AC, ducatur EG, hæc
e&longs;t axis, vt patet ex dictis;

&longs;ed ML e&longs;t 1/4 totius LH, quod
&longs;ic demon&longs;tro;
triangula PIM, OLM &longs;unt æquiangula;

igitur propor­
tionalia;
itemque duo HIN, & HKO;

igitur vt HK ad KO, ita HI ad
IN;
&longs;ed HI continet 2/4 HK, per hypothe&longs;im;
igitur IN continet 2/3 KO;
igitur IN e&longs;t æqualis LO;

igitur vt IP e&longs;t ad LO, ita PM ad ML; &longs;ed
PI e&longs;t ad LO vt 2. 2/3 ad 8. id e&longs;t vt 3. ad 9. nam &longs;it OK 12. IN æqualis
LO e&longs;t 8.igitur PM e&longs;t ad ML, vt 3. ad 9. vel vt 1. ad 3. igitur &longs;it HL
12. PL erit 4. igitur PM 1. ML 3. igitur ML e&longs;t 1/4 LH, quod erat
demon&longs;trandum.

Si verò pyramidos ba&longs;is &longs;it quadrilatera, vel polygona, diuidi pote&longs;t in
plures, quarum ba&longs;is &longs;it trilatera; quare in omni pyramide facilè de­
mon&longs;tratur centrum grauitatis ita dirimere axem, vt &longs;egmentum ver&longs;us
ba&longs;im &longs;it 1/4 totius.
Theorema 28.

Determinari pote&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis coni mixti, cuius ba&longs;is &longs;it portio
&longs;uperficiei &longs;phæræ, cuius centrum &longs;it in apice coni;

igitur vt &longs;e habet di&longs;tantia inter centrum vel
apicem trianguli, circa quem voluitur, & centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis eiu&longs;dem
ad di&longs;tantiam inter eo&longs;dem terminos in cono recto, ita &longs;e habet di&longs;tan­
tia inter eo&longs;dem terminos in &longs;ectore, ad di&longs;tantiam inter eo&longs;dem termi­
nos in prædicto cono mixto;

&longs;ed cogno&longs;cuntur ex dictis &longs;uprà tres pri­
mi termini huius proportionis; igitur cogno&longs;ci pote&longs;t quartus, igitur
determinari centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, quod erat demon&longs;trandum.
Corollarium.

Colligo primò, ex his facilè cogno&longs;ci po&longs;&longs;e centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis &longs;e­
ctoris &longs;phæræ, nam vt &longs;e habet conus rectus ad pyramidem, ita &longs;e habes
prædictus conus mixtus ad &longs;ectorem, &longs;ub eodem &longs;cilicet angulo.

Colligo &longs;ecundò, etiam po&longs;&longs;e cogno&longs;ci centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis eiu&longs;dem
&longs;ectoris circumacti, non tantùm circa centrum &longs;phæræ, &longs;ed circa radium;

immò gemini &longs;ectoris coniuncti, &longs;eu quartæ partis &longs;phæræ, ex quo etiam
&longs;equitur determinatio centri grauitatis Hemi&longs;phærij, atque adeo totius
&longs;phæræ; quæ omnia pendent ex dictis &longs;uprà.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis &longs;upere&longs;&longs;e innumeras ferè corporum rationes, v.g.&longs;phæram
ex dato puncto &longs;uperficiei libratam, tùm elliptica &longs;olida, parabolica, hy­
perbolica, &c.

quorum centra percu&longs;&longs;ionis determinari po&longs;&longs;unt; &longs;ed ab­
&longs;tineo, tùm quia cum multam mathe&longs;im de&longs;iderent, vix habent aliquem
in phy&longs;ica locum, tùm quia plura excerpere non potui, ex innumeris pe­
nè, quæ apud &longs;e no&longs;ter Philo&longs;ophus habet.
Theorema 29.
Theorema 30.

quia centrum percu&longs;­
&longs;ionis prædictæ lineæ di&longs;tat 2/3 ab altera extremitate immobili per Th.8.
atqui centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis in hoc motu circulari dirigit motum aliorum
punctorum;
quia defungitur munere centri grauitatis, vt patet ex dictis;
nec enim alterum &longs;egmentorum præualet;

&longs;ed in hoc ca&longs;u e&longs;&longs;et ad in&longs;tar funependuli, in quo
non habetur vlla ratio fili, &longs;ed ponderis appen&longs;i; igitur eius vibratio e&longs;t
æquediuturna cum vibratione prædicti funependuli quod erat demon­
&longs;trandum.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis, ex hoc vno certi&longs;&longs;imo principio egregium experimentum
mirificè comprobari; nempè &longs;æpiùs compertum e&longs;t innumeris ferè expe­
rimentis, tùm ab erudito Mer&longs;enno, tùm à no&longs;tro Philo&longs;opho longitu­
dinem funependuli i&longs;ochroni cum cylindro continere 2/3 cylindri.
Theorema 31.

Si voluatur planum rectangulum circa alterum laterum, funependulum
i&longs;ochronum continet duas tertias; probatur eodem modo; nam perinde &longs;e
habet illud planum, atque &longs;i multæ lineæ parallelæ &longs;imul volueren­
tur.
Theorema 32.

Si voluatur planum triangulare circa angulum, eo modo quo diximus in
Th.11. funependulum i&longs;ochronum continet 3/4 axis prædicti trianguli; quia in
1/4 e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis per Th. 11.
Theorema 33.

Si voluatur prædictum planum circa ba&longs;im eo modo, quo dictum e&longs;t Th.12.
funependulum i&longs;ochronum continet 1/2 eiu&longs;dem axis; quod eodem modo de­
mon&longs;tratur per Th.12.
Corollarium.

Colligo primò, cuilibet &longs;ectori funependulum i&longs;ochronum po&longs;&longs;e a&longs;&longs;i­
gnari, quia cuiu&longs;libet &longs;ectoris, qui voluitur circa angulum, eo modo
quo diximus Th.13. centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis determinatum e&longs;t.

Colligo &longs;ecundò, &longs;i rotetur planum circulare, eo modo quo diximus
Th.21. funependuli i&longs;ochroni longitudinem continere 2/3 diametri eiu&longs;­
dem circuli, quia ibi e&longs;t centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis eiu&longs;dem circuli, per
Th. 21.

Colligo tertiò, &longs;i rotetur planum circulare circa diametrum, etiam
po&longs;&longs;e determinari ex centro percu&longs;&longs;ionis inuento, longitudinem fune­
penduli i&longs;ochroni, vt patet ex dictis.
Theorema 34.

Quando voluitur planum triangulare parallelum plano in quo voluitur,
determinari pote&longs;t longitudo funependuli i&longs;ochroni; &longs;it enim AFH, cuius
centrum extrin&longs;ecum percu&longs;&longs;ionis fit C, longitudo funependuli i&longs;ochro­
ni erit AC, quod eodem modo demon&longs;tratur.
Corollarium.

Colligo primò, etiam determinari po&longs;&longs;e, quando ita voluitur vt latus
in quo fit percu&longs;&longs;io &longs;u&longs;tineat angulum rectum, v.g. triangulum AGB
circumactum circa A, habet centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis in M; igitur AM e&longs;t
longitudo funependuli i&longs;ochroni.
Secundò, &longs;i voluatur circa angulum rectum;

v.g. triangulum ABH
circa B, centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t in E; igitur BE e&longs;t longitudo funepen­
duli i&longs;ochroni.

Tertiò, aliquando longitudo prædicta e&longs;t minor latere, in quo fit
percu&longs;&longs;io, vt patet in exemplis adductis;

aliquando e&longs;t æqualis, vt in
triangulo ABD volutum circa A, nam centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis e&longs;t D;

igi­
tur longitudo funependuli i&longs;ochroni e&longs;t AD;

aliquando e&longs;t maior, vt
videre e&longs;t in triangulo ALG, quod voluitur circa A; nam longitudo fu­
nependuli i&longs;ochroni e&longs;t AI, quæ e&longs;t maior AL.

Quartò, &longs;i coniungantur duo triangula v.g. EAS. ADS. voluan­
turque &longs;imul circa A, eo modo quo diximus &longs;cilicet parallela plano, in
quo voluuntur, longitudo i&longs;ochroni funependuli erit AF, po&longs;ito quòd
F &longs;it centrum percu&longs;&longs;ionis, vt dictum e&longs;t &longs;uprà Corol. 5. Th.19.

Quintò, hinc vides rationem egregij experimenti, quod &longs;æpè Doctus
Mer&longs;ennus propo&longs;uit, &longs;cilicet longitudinem funependuli i&longs;ochroni e&longs;&longs;e
ferè quadruplam perpendicularis ductæ in ba&longs;im trianguli I&longs;o&longs;celis, li­
brati circa angulum verticis 150.grad.

quod certè ad veritatem tam pro­
pè accedit ex geometrica calculatione, vt nullum pror&longs;us di&longs;crimen
e&longs;&longs;e videatur, methodus huius calculationis facilis e&longs;t, & à mediocri
Logi&longs;ta haberi pote&longs;t.

Sextò, hinc etiam habetur longitudo funependuli i&longs;ochroni, &longs;i vol­
uatur planum circulare parallelum plano, in quo voluitur, continet
enim 2/3 diametri circuli, qui voluitur; vt patet ex Th. 22. idem dico de
quolibet &longs;ectore, qui eodem modo voluatur.
Theorema 35.

quia inuento centro percu&longs;&longs;ionis extrin&longs;eco,
habetur prædicta longitudo; idem dico de cono mixto, &longs;ectore &longs;olido,
&c.
per Th.28. & Coroll.
Corollarium.

Hinc colligo primò ex dato centro percu&longs;&longs;ionis extrin&longs;eco, dari &longs;tatim
longitudinem funependuli i&longs;ochroni, & vici&longs;&longs;im.

Secundò, data quacunque longitudine funependuli i&longs;ochroni, v. g.
tripla perpendicularis, cadentis in ba&longs;im trianguli i&longs;o&longs;celis, dari po&longs;&longs;e
triangulum, cuius libratio &longs;it æquediuturna, &longs;ed hæc breuiter indica&longs;&longs;e
&longs;ufficiat.
APPENDIX SECVNDA.

DE PRINCIPIO PHYSICOSTATICO,
ad mouenda ingentia pondera.

DVo &longs;unt in Statica, quæ demon&longs;trationem de&longs;idera­
re po&longs;&longs;unt; Primum e&longs;t, quod &longs;pectat ad proportio­
nes potentiarum, ponderum, re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, motuum,
temporum, di&longs;tantiarum, &c.

Secundum pertinet
ad cau&longs;as Phy&longs;icas huiu&longs;modi effectuum, qui cùm &longs;int
naturales, & &longs;en&longs;ibiles, &longs;ua cau&longs;a carere non po&longs;&longs;unt.

Primum &longs;anè quod ad Mathe&longs;im attinet egregiè præ­
&longs;titerunt hactenus docti&longs;&longs;imi viri Vbaldus, Steuinus, Galileus, &c.
ita vt nihil amplius de&longs;iderari po&longs;&longs;it;

Secundum tamen quod iuris phy­
&longs;ici e&longs;t, vix, ac ne vix quidem delibatum inuenio; quare ad huius libri
calcem principium Phy&longs;ico&longs;taticum breuiter explicandum &longs;u&longs;cipio, per
quod duntaxat illi omnes mirifici effectus ad &longs;uas cau&longs;as reducantur,
quod ni&longs;i fallor huic tractatui dee&longs;&longs;e videtur.
AXIOMA 1.

AB eadem potentiâ faciliùs producitur in eodem mobili minor motus,
quam maior.

Hoc Axioma manife&longs;tum redditur ex ijs, quæ pa&longs;&longs;im habentur in lib.
1. de impetu;
quippe motus ex duplici tantùm capite minor e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t;

primò, ex eo quòd &longs;ingulis partibus mobilis pauciores partes impetus
in&longs;int;
&longs;ecundò ex eo quòd imperfectior impetus mobili imprimatur;

atqui ex vtroque capite faciliùs producit ut minor motus; quia faciliùs
imprimitur minor, vel imperfectior impetus, nempe minore ni&longs;u agit
potentia.
Axioma 2.

Quò maiore tempore datum &longs;patium percurritur, eò minor e&longs;t motus, id e&longs;t
tardior, vt patet ex dictis l.1.
Axioma 3.

Quò minus &longs;patium decurritur dato tempore minor, & tardior e&longs;t motus;
hoc etiam con&longs;tat ex eadem dem.
Axioma 4.
Maiore tempore potentia applicata &longs;i &longs;emper agit, plus agit.
Quid clarius?
Axioma 5.
Pondus alteri æquale illud mouere tantum non pote&longs;t motu æquali;

cur
enim pondus A mouebit B potiùs quàm B. A: quod certum e&longs;t.
Axioma 6.
Pondus alteri æquale mouere pote&longs;t illud motu minore;
Axioma 7.

Pondus minus pote&longs;t mouere maius motu minore, &longs;i maior &longs;it proportio mo­
tuum, quàm ponderum, v.g. pondus duarum librarum quod mouetur
motu vt 3.pote&longs;t mouere pondus 4.librarum motu vt 1.vt patet ex dictis.
Axioma 8.

Eò faciliùs mouetur pondus per inclinatam, quàm per ip&longs;um perpendicu­
lum, quò inclinata maior e&longs;t perpendiculo; vt patet ex ijs, quæ dicta &longs;unt l.5.
de planis inclinatis.
Axioma 9.

Pondus maius mouet tantùm minus motu maiore, cum e&longs;t maior proportio
ponderum quàm motuum, vt patet.
Problema vniuer&longs;ali&longs;&longs;imum.

Mouere quodcumque pondus à qualibet applicata potentia moueatur motu
minore, ita vt &longs;it maior proportio motuum, quàm ponderum, per Ax. 7.
Coroll. vniuer&longs;ali&longs;&longs;imum.

Hinc colligo, in eo tantùm po&longs;itam e&longs;&longs;e indu&longs;triam, qua po&longs;&longs;int
pondera moueri, vt minore, & minore motu moueantur; igitur, qua
proportione imminues motum, eâdem maius pondus mouebis.
Theorema 1.

Æqualia pondera æquali vtrimque brachio libræ appen&longs;a &longs;unt in æquilibrio
per Ax.5.
Theorema 2.

In æqualia pondera inæquali brachio librata faciunt æquilibrium &longs;i &longs;it ea­
dem proportio brachiorum quæ ponderum permutando;

quia e&longs;t eadem pro­
portio motuum, quæ brachiorum, vt patet; igitur &longs;unt in æquilibrio nec
enim minus pondus attolli pote&longs;t à maiori per Ax.9.nec maius à mino­
re per Ax.7. igitur &longs;unt in æquilibrio.
Corollarium.
Hinc collige omnes rationes, quæ &longs;pectant ad libram;

hinc vulgare
illud dictum mechanicum: Si pondera &longs;int vt di&longs;tantiæ, &longs;unt in æqui­
librio.

Hinc coniugari po&longs;&longs;unt infinitis modis pondera, & di&longs;tantiæ, quorum
omnium rationes compo&longs;itæ ob&longs;eruari debent.

Hinc etiam obliqua libra, & inclinata, &longs;i &longs;upponantur brachia adin­
&longs;tar lineæ indiui&longs;ibilis facit æquilibrium.
Theorema 3.

Ideo facilè ingens pondus attollitur vecte, quia mouetur motu minore iux­
ta eandem rationem, de quo &longs;uprà;

cùm enim &longs;upponatur in vecte pun­
ctum immobile, quod certo nititur fulcro;

nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t vtrimque moueri
&longs;egmenta vectis motu circulari, eoque inæquali;
quia &longs;unt inæqualia;

igi­
tur altero minore; & hæc e&longs;t prima ratio imminuendi motus.
Corollarium.

Hinc datum quodcunque pondus attollitur vecte; hinc quò &longs;egmen­
tum, quod à fulcro porrigitur ver&longs;us pondus quod attollitur e&longs;t breuius,
eò maius pondus attolli pote&longs;t.

Hinc vectis per Tangentem &longs;emper attolli debet, vt maiorem præ&longs;tet
effectum, vt con&longs;tat ex ijs, quæ diximus l.4.
Theorema 4.

Ideo facilè attollitur ingens pondus trochlea, quia mouetur motu minor&etail;,
vt manife&longs;tum e&longs;t;

e&longs;t autem minor motus in ea proportione, in qua lon­
gitudo funis adducti &longs;uperat altitudinem &longs;patij decur&longs;i à pondere, quod
attollitur; mirabile &longs;anè inuentum, &longs;i quod aliud.
Corollarium.
Hinc, &longs;i funis adducatur deor&longs;um, vnica rotula non iuuat potentiam;

quia longitudo funis adducti e&longs;t æqualis altitudini &longs;patij decur&longs;i à pon­
dere;
&longs;i verò adducatur &longs;ur&longs;um vnica rotula duplicat potentiam;

quia lon­
gitudo prædicta funis adducti e&longs;t dupla prædictæ altitudinis;

igitur mo­
tus ponderis a&longs;cendentis e&longs;t &longs;ubduplus;

igitur duplum pondus eadem po­
tentia attollet, vel idem pondus &longs;ubdupla per Ax. 1. &longs;i verò &longs;int duæ ro­
tulæ adducaturque deor&longs;um, duplum etiam pondus attollet eadem po­
tentia;

quia longitudo funis adducti e&longs;t dupla altitudinis; ex his reliqua
de trochlea facilè intelligentur,
Scholium.

Equidem demon&longs;trari pote&longs;t aliter à debili potentia &longs;u&longs;tineri po&longs;&longs;e
ingens pondus operâ trochleæ;

quia &longs;cilicet pluribus di&longs;tribuitur &longs;u&longs;ti­
nendi munus, vt clarum e&longs;t;

quod verò &longs;pectat ad motum, vnum tantùm
e&longs;t illius principium, &longs;cilicet potentia, quæ trahit; licèt enim clauus, cui
affigitur altera extremitas funis po&longs;&longs;it &longs;u&longs;tinere, non tamen mouere.

Hinc demum ratio, cur &longs;i multiplicentur funes, & orbiculi ingens-
etiam pondus perexiguis fu&longs;ciculis &longs;u&longs;tineri po&longs;&longs;it;

quia pluribus di&longs;tri­
buitur: hinc, &longs;i plura e&longs;&longs;ent araneæ fila, maximum &longs;axum &longs;u&longs;tinere po&longs;&longs;ent.
Theorema 5.

Ideo mouetur ingens pondus operâ axis, vel &longs;uculæ; quia &longs;cilicet imminuitur
matus, vt clarum e&longs;t.
Corollarium.

Hinc, quò minor e&longs;t diameter axis, maius pondus attollitur &longs;eu mo­
uetur;

quia cùm circulorum peripheriæ &longs;int vt &longs;emidiametri, quò minor
e&longs;t diameter axis cui aduoluitur funis ductarius, e&longs;t minor motus;

igi­
tur maius pondus attollitur;

igitur &longs;i longitudo vectis &longs;it dupla &longs;emidia­
metri &longs;uculæ, duplum pondus attollitur; &longs;i tripla, triplum, &c.
Huc reuoca terebraś, & manubria, &c.
Theorema 6.

Ideo cochlea mouet ingens pondus; quia imminuit motum, vt videre e&longs;t
in torcularibus, in quibus Helicis opera ingens pri&longs;ma attollitur.
Corollarium.
Theorema 7.
Ideò tantæ &longs;unt cunei vires, quia motum imminuit.
Corollarium.

Hinc quò angulus cunei e&longs;t acutior, maius pondus attollitur eius ope­
râ; hinc proportiones omnes demon&longs;trari po&longs;&longs;unt, hinc cuneus ad angu­
lum 45. & &longs;uprà non iuuat potentiam, &longs;ecus infrà, ad cuneum reuoca
clauos & gladios.
Theorema 8.

Ideo rotis denticulatis mouetur ingens pondus; quia imminuitur motus,
vt clarum e&longs;t.
Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis huius organi operâ imminui po&longs;&longs;e motum in infinitum,
atque ad eo maius &longs;emper pondus, & maius in infinitum attolli po&longs;&longs;e.
Corollarium.

Ex his facilè colliges ad mouenda pondera in eo tantùm po&longs;itam e&longs;&longs;e
indu&longs;triam, vt motus imminuatur, & vnicum illud e&longs;&longs;e principium phy­
&longs;icomechanicum.
Theorema 9.

Vt pondus attollatur adhiberi pote&longs;t alia indu&longs;tria &longs;cilicet plani inclinati, in
quo faciliùs pondus attollitur, quàm in verticali, de quo iam &longs;uprà in lib. 5.Scholium.

Ob&longs;eruabis autem, organum mechanicum adhiberi po&longs;&longs;e ad mouen-
dum pondus per omne planum, in plano horizontali facillimè ingens
pondus moueri pote&longs;t; præ&longs;ertim &longs;i plani &longs;cabrities non impediat motum.

Hinc modico organo ingentem nauim facilè mouebat Archimedes,
quam &longs;ine organo tota ciuitas non mouere poterat.
Quæres, quot &longs;int potentiæ mechanicæ?

Re&longs;p. quinque hactenus
numeratas e&longs;&longs;e, quæ &longs;unt, vectis, trochlea, axis, cuneus, cochlea; addi
po&longs;&longs;unt rotæ denticulatæ.
APPENDIX TERTIA.

DE PRINCIPIO PHYSICO­
mechanico impre&longs;sionis.

NON ago hîc de impre&longs;&longs;ione, quæ fit operâ pulueris tormen­
tarij, vel nerui ten&longs;i, vel aëris compre&longs;&longs;i; nec enim e&longs;t huius­
loci, &longs;ed de illâ, quæ fit operâ alterius potentiæ motricis.
Iniactu duo tantùm con&longs;iderari debent:

Primum e&longs;t po­
tentia, &longs;ecundum linea directionis, quod &longs;pectat ad primum,
commune e&longs;t iactui & percu&longs;&longs;ioni; de &longs;ecundo iam &longs;uprà dictum e&longs;t lib.4.
vbi diximus maximum iactum fieri ad angulum &longs;emirectum.
Principium vniuer&longs;ali&longs;&longs;imum.

Quò diutius potentia manet applicata maior e&longs;t impre&longs;&longs;io; veritas huius
axiomatis certi&longs;&longs;ima e&longs;t, & con&longs;tat ex Ax.13. l.1.n.4. ad hoc autem reuo­
cari po&longs;&longs;unt omnia organa, quæ potentia motrix adhibet ad motum im­
primendum.
Corollaria.
1. Hinc diu rotatum brachium maiorem ictum infligit;

hinc rotatum
pendulum fune plumbum forti&longs;&longs;imè ferit;

hinc fundæ iactus potentior;
hinc longior funda longiorem iactum præ&longs;tat, &c.

2. Hinc pertica longior, quæ diu vibratur propter maiorem arcum
validum ictum incutit; adde fu&longs;tem, flagellum, longum mallei manubrium.

3. Hinc corpus diu cadens deor&longs;um grauius ferit; hinc aries ille,
cuius ca&longs;us pali figuntur.
4. Hinc maius &longs;axum, vel grauior &longs;udes maiorem ictum infligit.
5. Hinc trochus ductario funiculo vibratus celerrimè agitur;

hinc
etiam plani orbes explicata, & exporrecta zona procul abiguntur; quia
&longs;cilicet potentia diu manet applicata.

6. Hinc antiquus aries diu vibratus, ita verberabat muros, vt &longs;tatim
di&longs;ijceret propter eandem rationem.

7. Hinc demum antiquæ illæ machinæ, quarum opera ingentia &longs;axa
iaciebantur; hæc & innumera propemodum alia ex eodem principio
con&longs;equuntur.
APPENDIX QVARTA.

DE PRINCIPIO PHYSICO
Rationis duplicatæ Phy&longs;icæ.

VIx credi pote&longs;t quam multis effectibus naturalibus hæc
duplicata ratio affigatur, aliquos cur&longs;im indicabo vt ve­
rum germanumque illius principium &longs;tatuatur.

1. In motu recto naturaliter accelerato, decur&longs;a &longs;patia
&longs;unt in ratione duplicata temporum, id e&longs;t vt temporum
quadrata; dixi in motu recto, tùm eo, qui fit deor&longs;um in perpendiculo,
tùm eo, qui fit in plano inclinato.

2. Si iaciantur lapides inæqualis ponderis à potentia toto ni&longs;u agente
& eodem arcu, lapides &longs;unt in ratione duplicata inflictorum ictuum.

3. Si impingantur &longs;udes inæquales eodem brachiorum arcu, pondera
&longs;unt in ratione duplicata ictuum.

4. Si malleus impingatur diuer&longs;o arcu ab eadem potentia, arcus &longs;unt
in ratione duplicata ictuum.

5. Si ex tubis erectis eiu&longs;dem cauitatis æqualique foramine fluat aqua,
longitudines tuborum &longs;unt in ratione duplicata quantitatum aquæ, quæ
ex tubis æquali tempore fluunt.

6. Similiter &longs;i ex &longs;iphonibus fluat aqua æquali foramine, longitudines
&longs;iphonum &longs;unt in ratione duplicata quantitatum aquæ, &c.
vt &longs;uprà.

7. Si chordæ ten&longs;æ eiu&longs;dem longitudinis appendantur inæqualia pon­
dera, hæc &longs;unt in ratione duplicata &longs;onorum in ratione acuti & grauis.

8. Si chordæ ten&longs;æ &longs;int eiu&longs;dem longitudinis & diuer&longs;æ cra&longs;&longs;itiei, ba­
&longs;es &longs;unt in ratione duplicata &longs;onorum permutando.

9. Lumen ita propagatur vt lumina propagata &longs;ub eodem angulo, &
cono &longs;int in ratione duplicata di&longs;tantiarum permutando.

10. Idem dico pror&longs;us de propagatione &longs;onorum, immò au&longs;im dicere
toti rei &longs;onorum familiari&longs;&longs;imam e&longs;&longs;e hanc rationem duplicatam.

11. In funependulis res e&longs;t clari&longs;&longs;ima; nam longitudines &longs;unt in ratio­
ne duplicata temporum quibus vibrationes perficiuntur.

12. Non e&longs;t omittendum quod in humana voce ob&longs;eruatur pro ratio­
ne grauis & acuti, &longs;cilicet ni&longs;us e&longs;&longs;e in ratione duplicata &longs;onorum.

Omitto
infinita ferè alia quæ huic rationi duplicatæ &longs;ub&longs;unt, &longs;ed iam principia
phy&longs;ica his effectibus quibus ine&longs;t hæc ratio duplicata, tribuamus.

Primum caput & vndecimum hoc principio nituntur, eadem cau&longs;a
æquali tempore æqualem effectum producit vnde illud; corpus graue
æqualibus temporibus æqualia acquirit velocitatis momenta, de quo lib.
2. Ex hoc principio demon&longs;trauimus in partibus temporis &longs;en&longs;ibilibus
&longs;patia e&longs;&longs;e temporum quadrata.

Secundum & tertium hoc principio nituntur, motus impre&longs;&longs;i diuer&longs;is
corporibus ab eadem potentia æquali tempore &longs;unt vt corpora permu­
tando v.g.motus impre&longs;&longs;us corpori vnius libræ e&longs;t ad motum impre&longs;&longs;um
corpori quatuor librarum vt 4.ad 1.æquali &longs;cilicet tempore quod clarum
e&longs;t, igitur graue 4.librarum decurrit tantùm quartam partem arcus, igitur
&longs;ecundo tempore æquali decurrit tres alias partes, vide qu&etail; diximus l.10.

Quartum nititur hoc principio &longs;patia &longs;unt quadrata temporum, ve­
locitates &longs;unt vt tempora, ictus vt velocitates.
Quintum, &longs;extum, &longs;eptimum habent hoc commune principium:

eadem
e&longs;t proportio effectuum quæ cau&longs;arum;

quippe cau&longs;a quæ aquam excu­
dit e&longs;t pondus &longs;uperimpo&longs;itum, igitur cum imprimat motum pluribus
partibus, velociorem imprimit &longs;ingulis, igitur ex duplici capite cre&longs;cit
effectus, &longs;cilicet ex maiore quantitate aquæ & ex velociore motu; &longs;it enim
v.g.maior tubus quadruplus alterius cau&longs;a e&longs;t quadrupla, igitur duplam
quantitatem aquæ extrudet æquali tempore, quia duplo velociore motu.

nam extrudere æqualem quantitatem duplo velociore motu e&longs;t effectus
duplus; igitur duplam quantitatem extrudere duplo velociore motu e&longs;t
effectus quadruplus, igitur e&longs;t eadem proportio cau&longs;&ecedil; quæ effectus.

De &longs;i­
phone idem dictum e&longs;to, præ&longs;tat enim eundem effectum trahendo, quem
tubus aquæ pellendo, denique vnica vibratio chordæ ten&longs;æ duplo velo­
cior e&longs;t effectus duplus, igitur duæ duplo velociores effectus quadruplus.

igitur &longs;i huic appendatur pon­
dus quadruplum &longs;onum edet duplo acutiorem; igitur ba&longs;es &longs;unt vt qua­
drata &longs;onorum.

Nonum, & decimum nituntur hoc principio, lumen minus e&longs;t in ea
proportione in qua plus di&longs;trahitur; igitur lumina &longs;unt vt ba&longs;es permu­
tando, &longs;ed ba&longs;es &longs;unt in ratione duplicata di&longs;tantiarum, idem dico de &longs;ono.
Duodecimum denique idem principium habet cum &longs;eptimo:

vis enim
illa &longs;eu ni&longs;us quo adducitur arteria æquiualet ponderi; &longs;ed de his &longs;atis.
Schol. quod pertinet ad reflexionem.

igitur redit nece&longs;&longs;ariò per lineam ductam à puncto contactus per
idem centrum quod fal&longs;um e&longs;t vt patet; igitur e&longs;t alia cau&longs;a huius motus
&longs;cilicet præuius impetus.

Quidam etiam volunt hunc impetum produci ab ip&longs;o corpore re­
flectente quod tamen ab&longs;urdum e&longs;t, alioquin per eandem lineam ductam
à puncto contactus per centrum globi fieret reflexio, &longs;ic enim globus
tantùm impelli pote&longs;t, vt demon&longs;tratum e&longs;t lib.1. &longs;ed de his fatis.
Schol. pag. 217. num.8.

Ob&longs;eruabis primò, fœdatam e&longs;&longs;e pulcherrimam demon&longs;trationem quæ
habetur loco citato innumeris propemodum mendis, qua &longs;cilicet pro­
batur omnium inclinatarum, quæ ab eodem horizontalis puncto ad
idem perpendiculum ducuntur, cam quæ e&longs;t ad angulum 45. grad. bre­
ui&longs;&longs;imo tempore decurri;

ducantur BC.BR.BM. dico BC breuiore tempore quàm B
R, BM, percurri, quod breuiter demon&longs;tro:

ducatur AH perpendicula­
ris in BC, &longs;itque vt BH ad BI, ita BI ad BC;

certè BH & AC æquali
tempore percurruntur; &longs;it autem tempus quo percurritur BH, vel AC
vt.
BH;

pore percurruntur;

quam CE, igitur BR quam BC, &longs;imiliter ducatur BM ad angulum ABM

igitur QM e&longs;t dupla QB,
igitur maior EC;
igitur maiore tempore percurritur;

&longs;ed BM & QM
æquali tempore decurruntur; igitur BM maiore tempore, quam BC
quod erat demon&longs;trandum.

Ob&longs;eruabis &longs;ecundò BM & BR æquali tempore decurri, vnde quod
&longs;anè mirificum e&longs;t, &longs;i pariter vtrimque cre&longs;cat, & decre&longs;cat angulus in
puncto B, &longs;upra & infra BC, æquali tempore percurrentur duo plana in­
clinata; v.g.angulus RBA detrahit angulo ABC angulum CBR 15.grad.
& angulus ABM addit angulum CBM 15.grad.

motus per BR & B

Ob&longs;eruabis tertiò rationem à priori inde e&longs;&longs;e ducendam;

quod cum
perpendiculum &longs;eu diagonalis quæ &longs;u&longs;tinet angulum rectum &longs;it regula
temporis quo decurritur omnis inclinata, diagonalis quadrati &longs;it om­
nium aliarum minima in rectangulis quorum minus latus &longs;it maius &longs;e­
midiagonali quadrati, in eodem &longs;cilicet perpendiculo;

v.g. &longs;it diagona­
lis EC, &longs;int latera quadrati EBC, ducatur infra BA quælibet recta, v.g.
BR, & in BR ducatur perpendicularis BY, certè YR e&longs;t maior EC,

&longs;ed collectum ex extremis inæqualibus, e&longs;t &longs;emper maius

&longs;i verò &longs;unt inæqualia, media proportiona­
lis e&longs;t &longs;unicorda circuli, cuius diameter e&longs;t æqualis collecto; igitur col­
lectum i&longs;tud e&longs;t maius priore, &longs;ed hæc &longs;unt &longs;atis clara.
